What fact-check ?: My son , works public servant Central government , got one box face mask public restricted two per week .
Explanation: All public officials of the central government whose duty are not related to disease control are not allowed to apply for official face masks.

What fact-check ?: Singapore government said confirmed case . 12 prostitute . As result , many clients quarantine .
Explanation: According to the Singapore health ministry, case no. 12 showed symptoms during the family trip in Singapore. The department hasn't released the occupation of case no. 12.

What fact-check ?: Multiple allegations around coronavirus produced China .
Explanation: The alleged connection between tha spies is fictional. No scientific evidence shows the virus is produced as a bioweapon.

What fact-check ?: A post say `` hair weave lace fronts manufactured China may contain coronavirus . ”
Explanation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.

What fact-check ?: An information man allegedly selling medical masks 80 denars bus owned Skopje Public Transportation Enterprise .
Explanation: After a short investigation, it was found out that the photo has already been posted on other sites, such as the Facebook page of the site 3minute.net, where the photo was posted on 25 February. According to the status, the photo was taken in the town of Craiova, Romania, and not in Skopje, North Macedonia.

What fact-check ?: Kuwait Boycotted The Products The Saudi Almarai Company
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar found it fake.

What fact-check ?: Holding breath lets check coronavirus .
Explanation: Infected people can still be able to hold their breath for 20 seconds.

What fact-check ?: Video showing Chinese officials detaining infected citizen , refused checked .
Explanation: The video does not show a real event, but an exercise.

What fact-check ?: A text post instructions `` Lithuanian doctor '' , giving advice potentially infected coronavirus
Link to the original piece: No link (posts deleted after debunking the claim)
Explanation: Text post is a false one since instructions to stay at home if infected were not given out by any authorities, some of the "facts" about the disease were straight up made up.

What fact-check ?: Health authorities say shaving beard protect form CoV .
Explanation: It's a 2017 graphic regarding how to wear tight fitting masks for professionals.

What fact-check ?: Airport Karachi suspends international arrivals coronavirus epidemic .
Explanation: Pakistan's civil aviation authority confirmed international arrivals weren't cancelled at the time; photo corresponds with one that has circulated about flight suspended at the airport in march 2019

What fact-check ?: Holding breath test COVID-19 .
Explanation: WHO and other health experts said there is no evidence to support this claim.

What fact-check ?: Chloroquine cures CoV .
Explanation: Chloroquine showed signs on CoV according to a Chinese publication but it s not considered as a cure.

What fact-check ?: The WHO says coronavirus might spread via food .
Explanation: The WHO has no hints so far that infections with coronavirus via food are possible.

What fact-check ?: This video person infected coronavirus detained police real , it´s drill .
Explanation: This video of a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police is not real, it´s a drill. It was shot last February 21 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.

What fact-check ?: A case coronavirus Argentine province Santiago del Estero confirmed
Explanation: There are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Argentina at this date.

What fact-check ?: A case coronavirus Argentine province Chaco confirmed
Explanation: There are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Argentina at this date.

What fact-check ?: Argentinian doctor discovered vaccine coronavirus Spain
Explanation: Is false that an argentinian doctor discovered a vaccine against coronavirus in Spain. The men shown in a photo attached with the message is an actor. The World Health Organization informed that "there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat".

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus reproducing warm places .
Explanation: Other coronaviruses has started to die over 56°C but there are no studies about Covid-2019.

What fact-check ?: Bleach chlorine useful clean avoid coronavirus .
Explanation: WHO confirms bleach and other desinfects might work to kill the virus.

What fact-check ?: Lectures suspended University Sevilla due coronavirus .
Explanation: The University has made a statement saying that the document that has been shared is false.

What fact-check ?: A new case coronavirus Sacedón ( Guadalajara , Mexico ) .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: An article El Pais says possible case coronavirus hospital Gregorio Marañón , Spain .
Explanation: El País hasn't published that article and the typography doesnt't match.

What fact-check ?: An aritcle El Pais says ther case coronavirus School Architects Madrid .
Explanation: El País hasn't published that article.

What fact-check ?: First case coronavirus Alcalá de Henares ( Madrid ) .
Explanation: One screenshot shows a false article done with an app that lets you create these fake contents and the other one shows an article that HAS NOT been published by El Mundo newspaper.

What fact-check ?: A brothel 86 customers put quarantine prostitute tested positive coronavirus .
Explanation: It was a "satirical" content.

What fact-check ?: Sevilla 's university suspended classes coronavirus ( February 27th )
Explanation: The institution denied it on its Twitter account.

What fact-check ?: A monkey infected coronavirus photo .
Explanation: The photo is a capture of a video taken at least two months before the first symtoms of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Doctor Gerardo Dovakin found vaccine agains coronavirus .
Explanation: He is actually an actor, not a doctor.

What fact-check ?: Iran ’ deputy Health Minister : This year 13,200 flu cases caused death 108 people . Our population fourth US ’ . Last year 28 million flu cases resulted 16k deaths . Yet nobody restricting travel .
Explanation: Flu’s death rate in the US is less than 0.1% and moreover deputy minister’s comparison of flu and COVID-19 is misleading.

What fact-check ?: The cover Tintin book titled `` Tintin Wuhan '' shows character standing old Chinese market wearing special suits , people wearing masks .
Explanation: This is a doctored image that is made of frames from two different Tintin books.

What fact-check ?: French far right leader Marine Le Pen says EU n't anything outbreak
Explanation: The EU has activated the civil protection mechanism, launched aid program, mobilizes funds for research and called for more international cooperation and coordination.

What fact-check ?: Lysol Products Can Kill Novel coronavirus .
Explanation: While Lysol products are advertised to kill 99.9% of bacteria and viruses, including coronavirus, the company is referring to previous strains of the virus. There is no known cure for the novel (or new) coronavirus strain.

What fact-check ?: Honduras 's first confirmed case traveled Taiwan earlier , means severe community transmission Taiwan .
Explanation: As to Feb. 27., 2020, Honduras had zero confirmed case of COVID-19. A Taiwanese traveler had once suspected infection, but she has tested negative afterward.

What fact-check ?: Taiwan severe community transmission . Many people died .
Explanation: As to Feb. 27, there is no evidence indicating the Taiwan government has hidden real COVID-19 figures or information. The Taiwan Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) has a daily press conference to update the latest confirmed case number and has been considered reasonably transparent.

What fact-check ?: The outbreak Taiwan control . President Tsai ordered burn corpse front presidential office .
Explanation: It's a picture of a self-immolation incident in 2015 in front of the presidential office.

What fact-check ?: Iranian clerics wearing masks outbreak .
Explanation: The photo is old-dated and manipulated. It was taken in the funeral of Kasem Sulemani.

What fact-check ?: Drinking water every 10 minutes send virus stomach kill .
Explanation: Digestive system can not stop the respiratory system's work and the course of infection.

What fact-check ?: WHO Has Issued Advisory Against Buying Of Holi Colors From coronavirus-Hit China .
Explanation: WHO hasn’t issued advisory against buying of Holi colors from coronavirus-hit China. The viral post is fake.

What fact-check ?: ” America vaccinating cattle coronavirus years , yet news tells ’ new gunna kill go buy mask . ”
Explanation: The vaccine for cattle won’t help humans, and won’t protect against this new form of coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Post says `` blood test coronavirus costs $ 3,200 . ”
Explanation: The CDC isn’t charging for coronavirus testing but patients could be stuck with associated costs, such as a trip to the emergency room. In Florida, a man who worried he was infected initially faced a $3,270 bill even though he never received a coronavirus test.

What fact-check ?: Post says starting March travel outside United States ’ allowed back country “ due high risk coronavirus . ”
Explanation: As of March 6, there is currently no mandate that states Americans are barred from returning to the U.S. from anywhere overseas.

What fact-check ?: `` Akira ’ 1988 movie apocalyptic event taking place months Tokyo 2020 Olympics , showing ( World Health Organization ) advising Japan postpone Olympics pandemic risk '' .
Explanation: The movie does not feature a pandemic of any sort. The WHO is never mentioned in the movie.

What fact-check ?: Iran Bury coronavirus ' Dead In Iraq , Or The Video From The Najaf Cemetery .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: A video of the burial of Iranians who were infected with COVID-19 in Al-Ahwaz cemetery. The same video was also published as a leak from the Najaf cemetery to bury a person who had died after being infected with the COVID-19. The video is old from 2019, and it is for burying a person named Mohamed Nasri who died of CCHF in Al-Ahwaz in 2019.

What fact-check ?: False Translation Infects football player Alexis Sanchez With coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar checked the news and confirmed its falsehood.

What fact-check ?: A claim circulating social media messaging apps says keeping throat moist wash coronavirus stomach virus die .
Explanation: Both the World Health Organization (WHO) and doctor Norberto Francisco, chief of clinical trials and research at the Lung Center of the Philippines, say that drinking water will not prevent a coronavirus infection.

What fact-check ?: Ministry Economy Finance South Korea pharmaceutical companies secret meeting .
Explanation: There was no meeting.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed thousands times Facebook Twitter alongside claim shows bodies removed hospital Iran novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video has circulated in reports since at least August 2019 about a funeral procession for pilgrims who died during the annual Islamic pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia's Grand Mosque.

What fact-check ?: Eat herbs , curmin , like people India , safe COVID-19 well .
Explanation: No scientific proof of this observation and hypothesis on its relation.

What fact-check ?: A video showing chaos shop , claiming people panicking first confirmed case coronavirus Lithuania .
Link to the original piece: No link (videos deleted after debunking the claim)
Explanation: The video was made in May 2018 in Romania, during a sale at a supermarket.

What fact-check ?: Doctors Japan advise people drink water every 15 minutes prevent infection .
Explanation: WHO says drinking water does not prevent novel coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Vitamin helps CoV .
Explanation: Health experts told AFP there is insufficient science to definitively say vitamin D can protect from the viral epidemic.

What fact-check ?: Elections years United States coincide major disease outbreaks .
Explanation: Several years of discovery or the associated spread of a disease do not match election years, national and international health organizations said.

What fact-check ?: Cambodian Prime Minister CoV .
Explanation: 2017 photo of the PM, treated for something else.

What fact-check ?: Beef meat best vaccine CoV .
Explanation: No study shows this.

What fact-check ?: The German government made `` secret plan '' coronavirus 2012 foretold pandemic .
Explanation: There is no secret plan but a public risk assessment of the German government on 2012 that contained a hypothetical epidemic of a fictional coronavirus named Modi-SARS.

What fact-check ?: A Twitter page claimed shaving facial hair ensures safety COVID-19 , attributing message CDC .
Explanation: Results from our research show that the message from Today.ng's article is a misappropriation of a 2017 NOISH publication; a notification directed at workers using respirators in carrying out their tasks. It has nothing to do with preventing the spread of coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Video roof full bats claim source coronavirus .
Explanation: Recorded in Florida en 2011, not China.

What fact-check ?: Summer temperatures make coronavirus disappear .
Explanation: We don't know enough yet about the coronavirus to know if this will happen.

What fact-check ?: `` Spanish newspaper ABC reports two possible COVID-19 cases Gines Benecazón ( Seville , Spain ) .
Explanation: ABC has not published that article

What fact-check ?: A man gas mask supermarket Lugo ( Galicia , Spain ) .
Explanation: The picture was taken in Austria, not Spain.

What fact-check ?: The wife Chinese shop owner Totana ( Murcia , Spain ) coronavirus .
Explanation: It was not the case.

What fact-check ?: Autorities implement temperature tests travelers China .
Explanation: There is no evidence those tests are precise enough to detect inffectes peoble that have no fever

What fact-check ?: Video person infected coronavirus detained police .
Explanation: This video of a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police is not real, it´s a drill. It was shot last February 21 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.

What fact-check ?: A man gas mask supermarket Lugo ( Galicia , Spain ) .
Explanation: The picture was taken in Austria, not Spain.

What fact-check ?: Barcelona 's council issued notification new focus two neighborhoods .
Explanation: The council denied on its Twitter account.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus patients China caught officials highway .
Explanation: The video in the post is the video of a ‘Mock drill’. The China SWAT team in the video is ‘practising’ to deal with coronavirus patients.

What fact-check ?: Chinese police use fishing net arrest man high fever .
Explanation: The video shows a police training exercise.

What fact-check ?: The wife Chinese shop owner Totana ( Murcia ) coronavirus .
Explanation: She did not have the virus.

What fact-check ?: Clients brothel Spanish city Valencia quarantined one employees tested positive coronavirus .
Explanation: It is a humorous article.

What fact-check ?: Florida Man Arrested For Robbery Using Cough As A Weapon .
Explanation: Image was created using prank generator site.

What fact-check ?: Is Jackie Chan really quarantined Corona Virus ?
Explanation: Jackie Chan has stated that he was not quarantined.

What fact-check ?: A post says `` poll finds 38 % Americans Say They Will Not Drink Corona Beer Because Virus . ''
Explanation: The poll was conducted by a PR firm. The firm did not release full details about the poll.

What fact-check ?: “ The coronavirus made Mississippi lady caught ’ around nobody means airborne . That means wind blows direction ’ also . ”
Explanation: According to the CDC and Mississippi, there were no confirmed COVID-19 cases in the state at this time. Researchers believe the disease is mainly spread person to person.

What fact-check ?: “ Every election year disease ” ... SARS 2004 ; avian flu 2008 ; swine flu 2010 ; MERS 2012 ; Ebola 2014 2018 ; Zika 2016 coronavirus 2020 .
Explanation: Most of these diseases were discovered and spread before the election years and were minimally mentioned during campaigns. SARS, avian flu and MERS had virtually no effect on the U.S. during election years.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 big flu .
Explanation: It is far too soon to make such assumptions. Statistics of the first months of the pandemia show that it is not just a genuine virus.

What fact-check ?: It better shave beard avoid infected coronavirus .
Explanation: Unless you are in contact with people infected by the virus for your work, there is no need to shave your beard.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus patients China caught officials highway .
Explanation: The video in the post is the video of a ‘Mock drill’. The China SWAT team in the video is ‘practising’ to deal with coronavirus patients.

What fact-check ?: CDC Recommends Men Shave Their Beards To Protect Against coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim is based on a Centers for Disease Control chart created in 2017 to advise medical workers on the best practices for wearing "filtering facepiece respirators" during contact with viral patients. It was not intended for the general public - nor specifically for preventing the spread of coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Doctors Recommend Carbon Filter Face Masks To Prevent coronavirus Spread .
Explanation: Videos falsely claims that doctors are recommending carbon filter masks as a way to protect families, although the FDA and CDC both concluded that they are not effective for children and are not recommended for home use. The videos are used to sell the masks to people concerned about the coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: Russia announces closure airspace suspension incoming outgoing flights China .
Explanation: Russian government had imposed some temporary and partial ban on the movement of Chinese nationals. All Russian airlines, with the exception of national airline Aeroflot (AFLT.MM), stopped flying to China from Jan. 31. Small airline Ikar will also continue flights between Moscow and China. All planes arriving from China will be sent to a separate terminal in the Moscow Sheremetyevo airport. Aeroflot reduced the frequency of flights to Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou until Feb. 29.

What fact-check ?: Taiwanese president former president infected . The former president died .
Explanation: The imagines of screenshots of news outlets and official documents are either doctored or forged. As to the date, the claim appeared online, President Tsai had a public speech at 228 memorial event.

What fact-check ?: Police China started killing COVID-19 patients , killing 25,000 far .
Explanation: None of the four clips spliced together shows cops “shooting” COVID-19 patients. In fact, one of the clips is actually of a road crash. Another one features not the sound of gunshots, but the explosion of Lunar New Year Fireworks in the background.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 came Chinese people eating human babies , supposedly get good skin .
Who said/posted it?: Netizen's post in an FB group
Explanation: The netizen’s claim about COVID-19 coming from eating babies is false and baseless. The photos used are also all over a decade old, some of which show a Chinese man "eating babies" as a protest art in 2000.

What fact-check ?: A video says Vatican confirmed Pope Francis two aides tested positive coronavirus .
Explanation: The Vatican has denied the stories, saying the pope has a “slight illness.”

What fact-check ?: Post says President Barack Obama “ waited six months call swine flu emergency thousands died . ”
Explanation: The Obama administration declared swine flu, or H1N1, a public health emergency six weeks before H1N1 was declared a pandemic. No H1N1 deaths had yet been recorded in the United States.

What fact-check ?: The Vatican confirmed Pope Francis two aides tested positive coronavirus .
Explanation: The Vatican denied allegations that Pope Francis contracted the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

What fact-check ?: Pope Francis diagnosed coronavirus .
Explanation: The pontiff was tested after having symptons of flew and had the result negative to covid-19.

What fact-check ?: Indonesia provided 1000 free tickets nationals return home abroad .
Explanation: Foreign Ministry dismissed the reports as a hoax.

What fact-check ?: This video alleged panicked shoppers storming supermarket amid coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video was in fact filmed in Germany in 2011, nearly a decade before the coronavirus pandemic broke out.

What fact-check ?: Four patients infected virus hospitalized Sri Lanka .
Explanation: Only two suspect patients were hospitalized and both later tested negative.

What fact-check ?: Pope Francis And Two Aides Tested Positive coronavirus .
Explanation: No official Vatican communication confirms this.

What fact-check ?: “ Florida hospital reports coronavirus ‘ infestation ’ multiple confirmed patients . ”

Explanation: The image was posted by a self-described parody account.

What fact-check ?: “ Shands Hospital Gainesville Florida confirmed first case coronavirus . ”
Explanation: As of March 2, 2020, the CDC has confirmed two cases of COVID-19 in Florida. Shands Hospital in Gainesville, Florida, has not confirmed a coronavirus case.

What fact-check ?: Post says one died coronavirus United States .
Explanation: As of March 3, nine people have died from the coronavirus in the United States. The first death was on March 1.

What fact-check ?: Post says coronavirus “ simply common cold . ”
Explanation: The 2019 coronavirus is part of a family of viruses that produce illnesses ranging from the common cold to more critical diseases such as SARS or MERS, but is a new virus that had not been previously identified.

What fact-check ?: This video shot mall Germany pandemia .
Explanation: It has been filmed years before the pandemia.

What fact-check ?: The Vatican Confirms That Pope Francis Was Infected With coronavirus .

What fact-check ?: Beware `` ฝนเหลือง '' - Yellow rain ( Agent Orange ) coming storm China . It brings chemical virus .
Explanation: Yellow rain is not a real rain, it's how to call an chemical weapon in the past. Even a storm is coming, it's unable to bring virus from China to Thailand.

What fact-check ?: Outbreak COVID-19 worldwide fake , fatality rate low epidemic , WHO admitted causing SARS outbreak 2003 .
Explanation: Thousands of confirmed cases around the globe, virus confirmed in multiple labs, fatality rate greater than that of some of pandemics in the 20th century.

What fact-check ?: This photo shows brothel Europe people quarantined .

What fact-check ?: These 7 'evil ' things COVID-19 'afraid ' .

What fact-check ?: Twitter users said Adutwumwaa Bitters cures coronavirus .
Explanation: Adumtwumwaa Bitters does not cure coronavirus. Producers of the medicine, Adumtwumwaa Herbal Industries Limited, have emphatically stated that their product cannot and does not cure the deadly virus. The World Health Organization (WHO) says there’s no cure, vaccine or specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat coronavirus at the moment.

What fact-check ?: Constant sex kills coronavirus .
Explanation: Sex cannot kill or cure coronavirus, the science does not add up. Rather such close contact with an infected person will expose the partner to the disease.

What fact-check ?: Viral picture message Nigeria suggests former president Obasanjo said coronavirus Nigeria minister health lied .
Explanation: President Obasanjo's spokesperson, Kehinde Akinyemi refuted allegations attributed to Baba; a moniker often used to describe the former head of state. Additionally, Dubawa initiated a google reverse image search, which revealed that the "Fox News writer" (the source) used the image out of context.

What fact-check ?: A bovine coronavirus vaccine , cattle , proof novel coronavirus n't `` new '' evidence `` much media controls people . ''

What fact-check ?: Quotes Sen. Lindsey Graham saying President Trump “ probably knows medicine specifically viruses so-called scientists NIH CDC . ”

What fact-check ?: “ Coronavirus Hoax : Fake Virus Pandemic Fabricated Cover-Up Global Outbreak 5G Syndrome . ”

What fact-check ?: Sensationalist news alleged case North Korea person allegedly shot local authorities violated quarantine rule went public restroom .
Explanation: Due to the complete state control over the information and news in North Korea, the true and complete picture of the coronavirus there will probably never be captured. All claims about covid- 19 in North Korea cannot be verified or confirmed, and external sources can only speculate about the true picture within the country's borders. That alone is enough to conclude that all news coming from North Korea should be taken with reservations, including the unconfirmed info that the country has executed the first person infected with covid-19.

What fact-check ?: People queing outside ALDI supermarket Germany , buy food fear Cov .

What fact-check ?: The Simpsons predicted coronavirus outbreak .

What fact-check ?: Vinegar effective alcohol-based hand sanitizers killing novel coronavirus .
Explanation: Vinegar is not effective as a hand sanitizer. Its effects on breaking up the fat protection around viruses are very limited. Meanwhile, alcohol and soap are very effective on breaking up this protection

What fact-check ?: A health expert surmised SARS-Cov2 virus might spread Nigeria due hot temperature .
Explanation: Warmer air holds more moisture; thus preventing airborne viruses from travelling as far as they would in dry air. Still, the jury’s out on whether or not SARS-Cov2 will be resistant or vulnerable to hot temperature.

What fact-check ?: Drinking hot water prevents COVID-19
Explanation: This information is false, health authorities do not recognize hot water as a preventive measure and experts point out that it could be counterproductive.

What fact-check ?: CDC recommends men shave beards protect coronavirus .
Explanation: A 2017 CDC infographic shows how facial hair could interfere with respirator masks. The graphic is unrelated to coronavirus protection and the CDC has not recommended people should shave their beards to ward off the virus.

What fact-check ?: An audio clip circulating Facebook claiming Kenya recorded 63 cases COVID-19 .
Explanation: An audio clip claiming that Kenya has recorded 63 cases of novel coronavirus has been edited and taken out of context. The clip was part of a training exercise by the Ministry of Health to prepare for a likely outbreak ahead of the opening of a quarantine center in Nairobi.

What fact-check ?: A study published two Chinese research institutions suggested human semen cure COVID-19 .

What fact-check ?: Spices ward Corona Virus

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus transmitted imported goods

A viral video denounces that the Pirbright Institute, of the United Kingdom, created that year the virus that causes COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: European Health Organization ( EHO ) announced eating beaf cure coronavirus .

Explanation: The Lebanese Ministry of Education and Higher Education has announced the end of the school year for all different levels of education, after the outbreak of COVID-19 and the appearance of several cases. The mentioned circular is false and baseless.

What fact-check ?: Gaza Strip Is coronavirus Free .

What fact-check ?: Rapper Eminem contacted coronavirus .

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus bioweapon USA , says German politician Wolfgang Gedeon parliament speech .

What fact-check ?: Trump ’ effort blame Obama sluggish coronavirus testing .
Explanation: Trump is looking for scapegoats to excuse his administration’s sluggish efforts to expand testing. But he cannot blame Obama. There was no “Obama rule,” just draft guidance that never took effect and was withdrawn before Trump took office.

What fact-check ?: The media group Globo published photo dead Lampedusa shipwreck victims COVID-19 .
Explanation: The image shared along with the pieces of disinformation shows coffins of immigrants killed in the tragedy that occurred on the island of Lampedusa in 2013, but Aos Fatos found no evidence that the Globo group used the record outside its original context. G1, a site that belongs to Globo, even denied a piece of misinformation that circulated in March and attributed the same image of coffins to the pandemic.

What fact-check ?: The first coronavirus case North Macedonia well known fashion designer .
Explanation: Due to the mass dissemination of the misinformation, Pandeva (the designer) addressed the public through a video message posted on her Facebook profile and denied that she was ill.

What fact-check ?: Monkeys stealing food hospital South Africa .
Explanation: The video was taken before the COVID-19 crisis in a different part of the country.

What fact-check ?: A Shaheen Bagh protestor India claimed coronavirus .
Explanation: BOOM contacted hospitals in Delhi and confirmed that no Shaheen Bagh protestor had tested positive for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: 80 clients brothel put quarentine due coronavirus .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Viral claims propogating UNICEF Message About coronavirus .
Explanation: Mr. Jeremy Sprigge, Communication Specialist of UNICEF Sri Lanka confirmed that “these messages are NOT UNICEF statements and henceforth FALSE” and that an official communication regarding the same would be published via UNICEF’s social media channels.

What fact-check ?: Runny nose coughing sputum suggest one COVID-19 . They symptoms COVID-19 .
Explanation: In the advisories issued by WHO, it can be seen that ‘runny nose’ and ‘sputum production’ are also symptoms of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Precautionary measures suggested UNICEF .
Explanation: The viral message was not issued by the UNICEF. Some of the measures suggested in the message contradict the WHO’S view on COVID-19. Also, some have no scientific evidence.

What fact-check ?: Medical book states coronavirus common cold .
Explanation: COVID-19 is more dangerous than the common cold.

What fact-check ?: Does France underestimate outbreak ?
Explanation: On social networks, many users claim that the number of coronavirus cases in France is underestimated, because there are fewer tests in France than elsewhere. But this international comparison is not really relevant.

What fact-check ?: A confidential governmental document proves government decided postpone local elections France outbreak .
Explanation: This document is a fake. The government didn't take this decision.

What fact-check ?: Donating Plasma Or Blood Is Free Testing For The coronavirus .
Explanation: Currently the test for coronavirus is free.

What fact-check ?: Novel coronavirus 99.7 survival rate .
Explanation: The CDC did not confirm this, and the user did not offer any citations for clarification of this fact.

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus Test Does Costs $ 3,200 .
Explanation: Patients will not incur costs when tested by the CDC.

What fact-check ?: Chinese government killing people refuse evacuated .
Explanation: Video is an edit from four videos taken out of context.

What fact-check ?: A herbal tea cure symptoms coronavirus , even bioterrorism weapon .
Explanation: A so-called "doctor" in nanotechnology and antivaccine Venezuelan activist said coronavirus can be cured by electromagnetism and/or this herbal tea. He also claimed he cured presidente Chávez from cancer but then died because he didn´t follow his treatment. This is false.

What fact-check ?: A patent shared claim COVID-19 old .
Explanation: The patent is related to SARS, not COVID-19

What fact-check ?: No work several regions Spain due coronavirus .
Explanation: It's a joke. When you click on the link it takes you to a picture of a monkey.

What fact-check ?: 86 clients brothel quarentine prostituted tested positive coronavirus .
Explanation: It was a satire from a web of humour shared as real news.

What fact-check ?: Two Chinese nationals Kenya killed allegedly escaping quarantine Nairobi Airport .
Explanation: Reports that two Chinese nationals in Kenya have been killed over COVID-19 panic are false.

What fact-check ?: Every election year disease ; coronavirus contagion factor 2 ; coronavirus cure rate 99.7 % 50 infects .
Explanation: Every year in the U.S. is an election year, if taking into account midterm elections as well as presidential elections, and contrary to the claim, not every election year has had a disease outbreak, as implied in the claim. In addition, the transmissibility of the coronavirus, represented by the “basic reproduction number”, is still under study. Currently, the basic reproduction numbers reported for the virus causing COVID-19 range between around 2 to more than 6.

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus outbreak actually caused virus , 5G technology .
Explanation: There is no causal link between COVID-19 and 5G technology. The cause of the disease has been definitively identified in scientific studies as a novel coronavirus. 5G technology uses low-energy radio waves, which do not damage DNA or cells unlike ionizing radiation.

What fact-check ?: Shanghai Government Officially Recommends Vitamin C COVID-19 .
Who said/posted it?: Andrew W. Saul, Orthomolecular Medicine News Service
Explanation: Intravenous high-dose vitamin C has been used to treat patients with COVID-19 in certain Chinese hospitals, but it has not been recommended by the Shanghai government as claimed. The OMNS article also cherry-picks the treatment’s potential benefits from two reports, leaving out the potential side effects, including nausea and kidney stones, and failing to mention contraindications for pregnant women and individuals with cancer and other medical conditions.

What fact-check ?: There anti-Chinese protest Italy due COVID-19 .
Explanation: The demonstration was to an anti-Fascist event to commemorate the victim of racism, Valerio Verbano. It was filmed on Feb. 22 in Rome.

What fact-check ?: Unicef recommandations : coronavirus large size cell diameter 400-500 micro reason mask prevents entry need use pharmacists trade muzzles . The virus settle air grounded , transmitted air .
Explanation: The message is miselading and has the potential to cause fear amid the outbreak of coronavirus in India.

What fact-check ?: WHO Has Issued Advisory Against Buying Of Holi Colors From coronavirus-Hit China
Explanation: WHO hasn’t issued advisory against buying of Holi colors from coronavirus-hit China. The viral post is fake.

What fact-check ?: Says Donald Trump tweeted , “ Corona vaccine Israel ! Stock market ! Economy even stronger ! Besides US , Israel best inventions : Judaism , olives . Wonderful vaccine , stop Corona DEAD around world . Can ’ make vaccines bombed , possible without peace I created Israel ! ”
Explanation: Donald Trump didn’t tweet this.

What fact-check ?: Precautionary measures suggested UNICEF .
Explanation: The viral message was not issued by the UNICEF. Some of the measures suggested in the message contradict the WHO’S view on COVID-19. Also, some have no scientific evidence.

What fact-check ?: The Success An Egyptian Serum In Treating coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: China has officially announced the success of the Egyptian Serum to cure COVID-19. The Egyptian Ministry of Health denied the news.

What fact-check ?: Crown prince Abu Dhabi Mohammed bin Zayed Infected With coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar has verified the prosecution and is likely to be false, as there is no official news so far about bin Zayed's infection with the virus.

What fact-check ?: Four Cases coronavirus Were Reported In The West Bank .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: 4 cases of COVID-19 were recorded among tourists in Beit Jala in the West Bank. Misbar checked the news and found that Ma'an News Agency had modified it with another news entitled "coronavirus In Bethlehem and The Ministry of Health Is Calling For Calm and Waiting For Instructions."

What fact-check ?: In Kuwait , He Sneezed During Friday Sermon , And The Worshipers Expelled Him .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Video showing how worshipers in Kuwait expelled a sneezing man during Friday sermon, for fear that he might have COVID-19. The video is misleading because it is old and have been circulationing before the appearance of the virus.

Countries: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
What fact-check ?: The vaccine new coronavirus created disease appeared ; three persons recently arrived China Sarajevo Canton medical supervision brought COVID-19 Sarajevo .
Explanation: The British National Health System and the World Health Organization report that there is currently no vaccine for COVID-19 and the vaccine is currently being developed. Also, at the time of the disputed news release about the three patients in Sarajevo infected with COVID-19, there was no confirmation of a coronavirus positive finding in the three patients, and for several days thereafter results were found to be negative.

What fact-check ?: Test coronavirus costs US $ 3,000 United States .
Explanation: The only tests approved by FDA and CDC in US were provided freely. What may cost for people looking for testing are secondary costs such as hospitalization or medical consultation.

What fact-check ?: Claim photos show dogs killed China part efforts combat COVID-19 .
Explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the post to be partly false. While there are media reports concerning pets being killed in China because of fears over the spread of COVID-19, they remain unverified and have been denied by authorities. The photos accompanying the Facebook post are unrelated to COVID-19. It is true that World Health Organization’s advice is there is no evidence that companion animals/pets can be infected with COVID-19 despite a single case in Hong Kong of a dog testing “weak positive”.

What fact-check ?: A Facebook post saying people died infected novel coronavirus ca n't receive mortuary care .
Who said/posted it?: A Facebook user that described herself as an independent journalist. She quoted a "source" in her Facebook post. This quote was misleading.
Explanation: The HCSP (Haut conseil de la santé publique) told AFP not every mortuary care is forbidden for dead people who got infected by the novel coronavirus : embalming is forbidden but mortuary basic care can still be processed (with additionnal precautions).

What fact-check ?: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer influence results breathalyzer test .
Explanation: Spreading alcohol-based hand sanitizer does not affect the breathalizer test.

What fact-check ?: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited Muslims understand Muslims contracting COVID-19 .
Explanation: BOOM found that the viral video is a combination of three clips of Xi Jinping visiting the northwest region of China in 2016.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus test costs US $ 3,000 US .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Aaj Tak channel telecasted program said drinking alcohol smoking weed cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: Aaj Tak channel did not telecast any program that said drinking alcohol or weed can cure COVID-19. The posted photos are taken from their fact-check episode. In the episode, they debunk the claim and conclude that neither a peg of alcohol nor weed can cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Mayor Of Buffalo Told People To Evacuate Due To coronavirus Outbreak
Explanation: The mayor denied this claim when he responded to a Facebook post spreading the misinformation.

What fact-check ?: CDC Published Sponsored Facebook Post Asking For Help With `` Escaped '' coronavirus Patient
Explanation: The post was created by a fake CDC account.

What fact-check ?: Two local celebrities Argentine infected coronavirus
Explanation: Fake twitter accounts claimed they had contracted the virus. The celebrities denied the disinformation.

What fact-check ?: A case coronavirus confirmed Cali Colombia , video shows doctors treating patients bus station .
Explanation: Video shows a drill organized by Cali's transportation authority, to prepare in case coronavirus arrives in the city.

What fact-check ?: A case coronavirus confirmed Sincelejo Colombia .
Explanation: There is a possible case in Sincelejo which hasn't been confirmed.

What fact-check ?: Work suspension Ecuador due coronavirus since Monday 09/03/2020 .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp message suggests holding breath 10 seconds drink water every 15 minutes effective methods fighting coronavirus .
Explanation: There are no medical and scientifical evidences of this.

What fact-check ?: Medical Center El Cachorro ( Sevilla ) closed due possible coronavirus infected person .
Explanation: Medical center in El Cachorro (Sevilla) wasn't closed due to possible coronavirus infected person. Emergencies official channel of Sevilla denies it.

What fact-check ?: Medical report Hospital General Universitario Santa Lucía de Cartagena ( Murcia ) ifrom person possible coronavirus .
Explanation: The medical report is not actual, ist from the past, and another kind of coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: It designed virus ordered laboratories Christine Lagarde IMF , said `` Old people live long risk global economy . We must something , urgently '' .
Explanation: There is no proof that the quote atrtibutted to Lagarde was said by her. It probably comes from a part of an IMF inform.

What fact-check ?: Increasing border controls stop coronavirus spreading .
Explanation: Neither WHO or CDC estimate that closing frontieres will stop the coronavirus

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp message suggests holding breath 10 seconds drink water every 15 minutes effective methods fighting coronavirus .
Explanation: No scientific proof.

What fact-check ?: Emirates suspended flights Johannesburg South Africa announced first case novel coronavirus .
Explanation: A statement claiming that Emirates has suspended flights to Johannesburg due to coronavirus is fake.

What fact-check ?: Consumption Pig Causes Corona COVID-19 Virus Entry Indonesia
Explanation: COVID-19 spreads in Indonesia because there are Indonesian citizens who have contact with foreign citizens who have previously been exposed to the Corona 2019 virus. So far, research results show that pigs only carry one virus that can be transmitted to humans, namely the H1N1 virus that causes swine flu.

What fact-check ?: Turks gon na infected COVID-19 due genes .
Explanation: The distrubution of the ACE2 protein, possible COVID-19 receptor among nations is not clear. Referred antropologist was a Nazi and classified people by measuring the body parts; not by genetic analysis.

What fact-check ?: A COVID-19 case diagnosed Yedikule Hospital , Istanbul .
Explanation: The lab report is old-dated and shows other mild coronaviruses were found in the case

What fact-check ?: Girl infected coronavirus found dead apartment Delhi .
Explanation: Contrary to the claim, the incident in the post does not pertain to a coronavirus case in Delhi but is related to the death of a 22-year-old woman in Tamil Nadu’s Chettipedu.

What fact-check ?: A television news report US biotech company viewed thousands times Facebook alongside claim company successfully created vaccine novel coronavirus , COVID-19 , within `` three hours '' .
Explanation: The US biotech company said the vaccine still requires human testing and will not be made available until at least the end of 2020.

What fact-check ?: Bloggers say Nancy Pelosi delayed coronavirus funding “ Dems could campaign . ”
Explanation: President Donald Trump signed an $8.3 billion emergency spending bill to address the coronavirus on March 6. There is no evidence House Speaker Nancy Pelosi delayed the bill solely to run political ads.

What fact-check ?: If coronavirus gets mouth , `` drinking water liquids WASH esophagus stomach . Once tummy ... stomach ACID kill virus . ''
Explanation: There is no evidence that drinking water helps to prevent coronavirus infection. Health officials and media outlets have debunked the claim.

What fact-check ?: “ Anybody wants test ( coronavirus ) get test . ”
Explanation: The CDC says health care providers are the ones who decide whether someone gets tested for coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Pope Francis contacted coronavirus .
Explanation: The Vatican confirms Pope Francis has not contracted coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Qatar Shed Iranian Fruits For Fear coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the incident, and did not find any official country data on the disposal of any Iranian fruit on the market.

What fact-check ?: China Did Not Apologize Muslims In A Song .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Fake Translation.

What fact-check ?: Consuming coloidal silver prevent treat novel coronavirus .
Explanation: US regulators say consuming silver is not safe for use against any disease.

What fact-check ?: An image shared multiple posts Facebook Twitter alongside claim shows China administering `` world 's first new coronavirus vaccine '' global outbreak novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The photos in this image have circulated in reports about China testing a potential COVID-19 vaccine.

What fact-check ?: Smoking prevents getting infected coronavirus .
Explanation: The WHO says smoking does not protect a person from COVID-19 infection and warns it can actually cause health conditions that increase the risk of severe coronavirus illness.

What fact-check ?: Photos purporting show collapse temporary hospital Wuhan .
Explanation: The photos show the collapse of a hotel in Quanzhou, south of Shanghai, where people infected with the novel coronavirus were in quarantine.

What fact-check ?: Telangana Ministry India distributed homeopathic tablets claimed prevent COVID-19 .
Explanation: BOOM could not find any scientific evidence supporting theory that arsenicum album prevents coronavirus- Follow up to AYUSH story.

What fact-check ?: Cocaine Cures COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is still no vaccine or medical treatment available or discovered for COVID-19. Cocaine certainly is not a cure for coronavirus as it is a stimulant and addictive drug.

What fact-check ?: Exposing Parviz Nouri Sayha , claims made medicine coronavirus .
Explanation: Our investigations show that almost everything this person, who calls himself “professor” claims is fake and unfounded. Even his resume and bibliography is filled with fabricated items

What fact-check ?: Is true people ca n't use right withdrawal work outbreak ?
Explanation: French labor law experts think that the risk of being infected with the virus at work can be a reason to refuse going back to work in some cases, but not all.

What fact-check ?: Did coronavirus mutated became agressive ?
Explanation: Chinese scientists discovered that this coronavirus has taken two different types. They suggest that the second type could be more aggressive. But this is only a theory, never tested in lab and French scientists consider that there no really important mutation of the virus yet.

What fact-check ?: As Of March 7 , 2020 , Tanzania And Zambia Had Confirmed First Cases Of coronavirus .
Explanation: At the time, the MP said there were no reported cases in Tanzania. WHO also didn't confirm cases at the time in either country.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus patients caught highways China .
Explanation: The video is not about the coronavirus patients being caught, but of the training and mock drill given to the Swat team in China.

What fact-check ?: Quarantine video allegedly different cities Turkey .
Explanation: The video is from Sakarya, not Istanbul and the patient was isolated on inspection, not diagnosis. No case in Turkey so far.

What fact-check ?: An image shared multiple posts Facebook Twitter alongside claim shows China administering `` world 's first new coronavirus vaccine '' global outbreak novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is misleading; the photos in this image have circulated in reports about China testing a potential COVID-19 vaccine.

What fact-check ?: A video purporting show panic-stricken travellers infected novel coronavirus airport Senegal shared hundreds times Facebook .
Explanation: These images are actually taken from a security exercise simulating a hostage-taking at Dakar airport in November 2019.

What fact-check ?: A Facebook post shared 25,000 times features image letter purportedly US hospital recommending people drink alcohol help reduce risks novel coronavirus infection .
Explanation: Saint Luke’s Hospital in Kansas City did not issue the letter, according to its staff.

What fact-check ?: “ More people died knowing Hillary ” coronavirus .
Explanation: It’s obviously nonsense to compare Clinton in any way with a global virus outbreak that has killed thousands.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed thousands times multiple Facebook posts claim shows Koran distributed people China lifted `` ban '' Islamic holy text following outbreak novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video has circulated online since at least 2013 in reports about people receiving copies of the Bible in China.

What fact-check ?: Graphics social media cards supposedly international body United Nations Children 's Fund ( Unicef ) contain tips information prevent combat coronavirus outbreak disease causes , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The graphics and the tips are not from Unicef.

What fact-check ?: Research Saint Luke 's Hospital Kansas City found consuming alcoholic beverages may reduce risk infection coronavirus . Vodka recommended drink .
Explanation: The hospital dismissed the claim as false. Further, the World Health Organization (WHO) does not recommend alcohol consumption to prevent the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: “ U.S . hospitals preparing 96 million coronavirus infections nearly half million deaths , leaked documents reveal . ”
Explanation: An infectious disease expert presenting to the American Hospital Association estimated there could be as many as 96 million cases of COVID-19 in the U.S. in a year. But there is no indication that hospitals are preparing, covertly, for an outbreak of that magnitude, as this headline suggests.

What fact-check ?: An Egyptian Writer Predicted The New coronavirus Six Years Ago .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The Egyptian writer, Dr. Ahmed Khaled Tawfiq, foretold the novel coronavirus, and published in his book "Shorbet Hajj Dawood" in 2014, an article about the presence of the virus in Egypt. Misbar has verified the news, which is misleading.

What fact-check ?: Was Vietnam first country contain develop quick test SARS COVID-19 ?
Explanation: The claims that Vietnam was the first country to contain SARS and developed a quick test kit are mostly legit. We’re not sure where the claim that WHO says it takes four years to develop a test kit comes from. But that appears to not be accurate.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 caused 5G .
Explanation: The link between 5G and COVID-19 is never explained in the video and it does not hold any scientific value.

What fact-check ?: This photo purports show novel coronavirus .
Explanation: The photo is a magnified photo of a weevil.

Countries: Australia, India, South Africa, Ivory Coast
What fact-check ?: Drinking warm water lemon protects agains novel coronavirus .
Explanation: Health experts say there is no proof that this is effective in preventing the disease.

What fact-check ?: Hot air application hairdryer face heat nostrils sinus kills Novel coronavirus .
Explanation: Fact Crescendo found the above-mentioned post to be False. Hot air application through a hairdryer on the face to heat up nostrils will not kill the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: States Are Imposing Mandatory Leave And Statewide School Closures Due To coronavirus .
Explanation: Though schools have closed since this announcement, at the time of its original posting, it was not true.

What fact-check ?: The Colombian government closing border Venezuela , even though said 're going
Explanation: At the time of the fact-check the government had not closed the border. But it did so a few days later.

What fact-check ?: A person fainted Cali 's bus terminal COVID-19 .
Explanation: It's a photoshopped image.

What fact-check ?: The mayor Buga , Valle del Cauca , said : `` I invite people Buga keep calm live day last ''
Explanation: He never said this.

What fact-check ?: A post shared repeatedly multiple posts Facebook , Twitter Whatsapp claims regional government India recommended juice bitter gourd , vegetable often used traditional medicine , effective treatment novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; Indian authorities dismissed the claim, calling it “absolutely false”; health experts said there is no evidence the vegetable is an effective remedy for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein Talking About coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Fabricated Video of Former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein Talking About coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: SARS-CoV-2 killed 37 degrees Celsius .
Explanation: There is no confirmed information on what temperatures are dangerous to the virus. Local medical institutions confirmed to have no data on the issue.

What fact-check ?: Anti-malaria drug Chloroquine definitive cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: A study found the molecule showed 'apparent efficacy' in treating the disease, trials are still ongoing.

What fact-check ?: Costco recalls toilet paper 's infected coronavirus .
Explanation: The notice is not authentic, according to a statement from the wholesaler, and the brand of bath tissue in question is not listed on official recall websites.

What fact-check ?: Donating blood US get novel coronavirus test .
Explanation: The two organizations who collect the vast majority of blood in US said they were not testing for COVID-19

What fact-check ?: Employer covered part poster virus prevention advised people stay home sick .
Explanation: The part that was covered up on the poster advises people to avoid large gatherings.

What fact-check ?: Authorities Philippines seize fake cigarettes spreading coronavirus .
Explanation: Video shows Phillippine customs seizing cigarettes in May 2018.

What fact-check ?: Video claiming show hotel collapsing Chinese city Quanzhou used coronavirus quarantine facility .
Explanation: The video has circulated online since at least April 2017 about a hotel demolition in China’s Jiangsu province.

What fact-check ?: Video shows reciting Namaaz Quran treatment pandemic COVID-19 .
Explanation: BOOM looked at the video and found several indications about it being a 'Viral Test', Aaj Tak's show where it debunks false claims.

What fact-check ?: UNICEF advises certain set steps follow coronavirus .
Explanation: UNICEF has not released this advisory and most of the claims are not scientificlly backed.

What fact-check ?: Hundreds Italian families running away virus Africa .
Explanation: We have no proof of this assertion.

What fact-check ?: Availability kit coronavirus self-diagnosis Italy .
Explanation: On March 9th there was no legal kit for doing coronavirus self-diagnosis. Only governament authorities are authorized to do it.

What fact-check ?: Availability kit coronavirus self-diagnosis .
Explanation: A Facebook advertisement selling surgical masks links to a webpage where they sell also a kit for coronavirus self-diagnosis. On March 9th there was no legal kit for doing coronavirus self-diagnosis. Only governament authorities are authorized to do it.

What fact-check ?: Hand sanitizer “ nothing coronavirus . ”
Explanation: CDC says hand sanitizers with 60% alcohol can be used to help prevent contracting and spreading the virus.

What fact-check ?: Aaj Tak telecasted news Chinese PM said , ‘ Reading Quran offering namaz cure COVID-19 ’ .
Explanation: It is a clipped video of Aaj Tak’s fact-check. In the full version, it can be seen that Aaj Tak has debunked the claim and concluded that no such statement was made by the Chinese PM.

What fact-check ?: Iran 's former president Mahmoud Ahmadinejad : It clear world mutated coronavirus produced lab , manufactured warfare stock houses biological war belonging world powers .
Explanation: This is absolutely baseless.

What fact-check ?: Did French Health minister underestimate risk contamination France ?
Explanation: The French Health minister really said that the risk of seeing the virus spreading in France was almost equal to zero, but it was at the very beginning of the outbreak in China and her statement was consistent with the datas she had.

What fact-check ?: Freshly Boiled Garlic Water Is A Cure For coronavirus .
Explanation: There is still no cure.

What fact-check ?: Department Of Homeland Security Officials Says Illegal Border Crossings May Spread coronavirus .
Explanation: No officials were quoted to confirm this. Headline is mainly the false part.

What fact-check ?: A NYC Man With Suspected coronavirus Drops Dead In The Middle Of The Street .
Explanation: Of the cases in NY at the time, there were no confirmed deaths.

What fact-check ?: Gang Madrid pretending doctors steal people 's houses .
Explanation: Neither the National Police nor the local police have any complaint about this issue in Madrid.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus caused mysterious vaccine activation distributed China chemtrails activated 5G .
Explanation: It is a combination of old conspiracy theories very popular on the internet.

What fact-check ?: Madrid 's government announced students make-up classes summer .
Explanation: Madrid's government hasn't announced the students will have to make-up classes during summer: the shared photo is fake.

What fact-check ?: EvAU 's exam going postponed June 18th Madrid .
Explanation: Madrid's government hasn't announced Evau's exams are going to be postpone: the viral imaged is a set up.

What fact-check ?: Spanish actress Cristina Pedroche promised show boob number coronavirus infections gets 1 thousand Spain .
Explanation: It is false, the quote comes from a satirical website.

What fact-check ?: The bill coronavirus test US 3.000 $ .
Explanation: CDC is not making people pay the test by now.

What fact-check ?: Viral claims propogating UNICEF Message About coronavirus .
Explanation: UNICEF denied the organization issued this images.

What fact-check ?: This Lysol desinfectant coronavirus shows virus new .
Explanation: The desinfectant refers to the other types of coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A doctor called Lupita Yamamoto Lupercio found coronavirus vaccine .
Explanation: The person in the picture is actually Sandra Oh, an actress from Grey's Anatomy. Also, there is no vaccine against coronavirus yet.

What fact-check ?: Secretary Health Mexico recommends taking vitamin C prevent coronavirus .
Explanation: The information was disseminated by a brand of nutritional products, but it is false that taking vitamin C is a preventive measure.

What fact-check ?: People Muslim community prohibited visiting Mecca Medina avoid outbreak coronavirus , people Sanatan religion playing Holi crematorium Kashi Vishwanath pyre .
Explanation: Mecca Medina of Saudi Arabia was neither closed due to fear of virus. To take some precautions, there was a ban on the arrival of travelers from few countries. On 5 March people were prevented from going inside because of sanitization.

What fact-check ?: Israeli scientists MIGAL Research Institute developed vaccine COVID-19 .
Explanation: Researchers at the MIGAL Institute in Israel have announced a breakthrough in research into the novel coronavirus, but they have not developed a vaccine as claimed.

What fact-check ?: One prostitute caught COVID-19 . Her 86 clients quarantined brothel Spain .
Explanation: The claim initially came from a fictional content outlet. Spanish government and mainstream media didn't release such a statement.

What fact-check ?: Pier Luigi Bersani : None confirmed cases related China . coronavirus might occured Italy China .
Explanation: In the interview, Bersani didn't say that the virus is originated from Italy. In contrast, he emphasized that the virus is from China. His point is to bring up the assumption that the virus came to Italy prior to the time WHO declared the emergency.

What fact-check ?: Prince United Arab Emirates Positive Infected Corona Virus Early March 2020
Explanation: The Prince of the United Arab Emirates, Mohamed bin Zayed, is still active and not quarantined. The Twitter account that first spread the false information has now been closed.

What fact-check ?: A COVID-19 case diagnosed Umraniye Hospital , Istanbul .
Explanation: There is no confirmed case in the hospital. Tests were negative. No case in Turkey so far.

What fact-check ?: Post says “ President Trump come contact potential coronavirus sufferer ! ”
Explanation: There is no evidence President Donald Trump came into direct contact with a coronavirus sufferer.

What fact-check ?: Post says `` exposed sun two hours '' kills 2019 coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no evidence that sun exposure kills the 2019 coronavirus. UNICEF has debunked a post that claims the organization said sunlight is effective against the virus.

What fact-check ?: “ ( Barack Obama ) set anti-pandemic programs 47 vulnerable countries way protect something like coronavirus , exactly . Do know Trump closed 37 ? ”
Explanation: News reports in early 2018 said the CDC was preparing to scale back its anti-pandemic programs in some countries because an early source of funding was running out and the agency didn’t expect to receive new money from the Trump administration.The spending bills that lawmakers ultimately passed provided more money for those CDC programs than Trump’s budget requests asked for.

What fact-check ?: The Department Health ( DOH ) reports fake cigarettes spread coronavirus reached Philippines .
Explanation: The DOH did not issue any advisory on the transmission of the coronavirus through fake cigarettes or that they have reached the Philippines.

What fact-check ?: “ An entire family ” Santolan , Pasig , “ confirmed infected ” 2019 novel coronavirus , according looked like breaking news graphic GMA News .
Explanation: Pasig City Mayor Vico Sotto called the graphic a “fake ‘GMA’ post.” Moreover, the social media team of GMA News said they did not release the “JUST IN” graphic that circulated online.

What fact-check ?: Chinese eating exotic animals cause 2019 novel coronavirus , shown photos shared Facebook .
Explanation: Some of the photos in the viral Facebook post were not taken in China. Moreover, as of Friday, March 13, there are still not enough studies available that confirm the source of the 2019 novel coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A second version coronavirus spreading far dangerous .
Explanation: Mutations of the virus exists, but it is uncorrect to claim that a "second version" would be far more dangerous.

What fact-check ?: This laboratory giving money people would agree infected coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 .
Explanation: This experiment is related with another coronavirus so it has no link with COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Says 80 % novel coronavirus cases `` mild . ''
Explanation: The website Information is Beautiful published a chart showing that 80.9% of novel coronavirus cases are "mild." But reports from the World Health Organization and the U.S. CDC found that mild cases account for 75-to-80% of all cases.

What fact-check ?: “ Coronavirus — 22 . Clintons — 39 . ”
Explanation: Conspiracies linking the Clintons to various deaths are longstanding and unsubstantiated. We’ve debunked a number of them. The novel coronavirus has killed thousands globally.

What fact-check ?: Arab medieval historian Abu Al-Hassan Al-Masoudi Predicted The Present Crises .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar verified several editions of the book Akhbar Alzaman, and did not find this text, which differs in the way he wrote poetry from the way Abu Hasan Almasoudi wrote his historical narration of Akhbar al-Zaman. Also, the number of pages in the largest editions did not exceed 280, so page number 365 does not exist as the fake posts claims, which was shared by dozens of pages and met with great interaction.

What fact-check ?: Turkish president Erdogan Revealed A Mask That Kills coronavirus In A Minute .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Erdogan announces Turkey's production of a smart mask, killing COVID-19 in less than a minute. Misbar investigated the story to find that it was not mentioned in any of the Turkish media.

What fact-check ?: Palestine , Egypt , Lebanon Have Succeeded In Developing coronavirus Cure .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar verified the news and found it fabricated, and it is circulated from time to time in the same formula, but with the change of the name of the country and the doctor.

What fact-check ?: Gargling `` Betadine '' kill germs reduce numbers throat go lungs , statement Eleni Jamarely , professor Infectious Diseases , claiming HIV transmitted easily new coronavirus spoon communion .
Who said/posted it?: Professor of Infectious Diseases, Eleni Jamarelu and greek news portal
Explanation: This is incorrect because, according to the CDC, HIV infection in such a case is possible only if a person has an open wound in the mouth. Also, gargling with Betadine is dangerous because it is not said which "Betadine" product you should gargle. There is a special "Betadine" mouthwash product, whose efficiency on the novel coronavirus has not been proven yet and which can cause allergies to some people. Any other type of Betadine product can have counter-effects.

What fact-check ?: Zinc Lozenges proved protection COVID-19 .
Explanation: No scientific proof of this observation and hypothesis on its relation.

What fact-check ?: The Mayor Skopje , Shilegov returned Madrid three days ago , government passed decree requiring passengers Spain tested coronavirus placed 14-day quarantine .
Explanation: Apart from the problematic photo, for which it is not possible to conclude when and where it was taken or who is on it,  the article also gives untrue information. Namely, the Government has not adopted a decree ordering all passengers who were in Spain to be tested for coronavirus and to be placed in a 14-day quarantine.

What fact-check ?: 200 new cases COVID-19 registered Lithuania . People `` cleansed bleach '' Vilnius international airport taken small tent-town nearby .
Explanation: 1 COVID-19 case is confirmed in Lithuania at this time. The has a English text photoshoped instead of the Lithuanian one. Officials claim there was no such "explosion" in cases and objective reality at the airport supports that.

What fact-check ?: Purported government advisory claiming list shopping malls hotels Phillippines department health advises visiting novel coronavirus epidemic .
Explanation: The claim is misleading; the Philippine Department of Health said the purported advisory is "fake”.

What fact-check ?: Senegal doctors come 'serum ' coronavirus .
Explanation: the Senegal govt has denied this, at present there is no treatment or vaccine against the novel coronavirus or COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Statement Professor Jean-Jacques Muyembe , one experts discovered Ebola , saying black skin `` efficient infected novel coronavirus '' .
Explanation: Professor Muyembe denied to AFP having said such a statement.

What fact-check ?: Video shows WHO official inappropriately touching female attendee briefing session China novel coronavirus outbreak Wuhan . Same video also used another claim man Australian politician .
Explanation:
Video was taken out of context. The man in the video is a 2006 Nobel Prize laureate in physics, Professor George Smoot, not someone from WHO or a politician.
The clip shows Smoot attending a business conference in Julu County in Hebei Province in China in June 2018 with his significant other who was having a sore back at the time.

What fact-check ?: Drinking hot tea prevent catching COVID-19 .
Explanation: Drinking hot tea has no effect on COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Tips coronavirus like holding breath drinking water .
Explanation: These tips don't prevent infection with coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Fake coronavirus pandemic cover-up `` 5G disease '' .
Explanation: There is no link whatsoever between 5G technology and spread of the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus actually chemtrail lungs .
Explanation: Chemtrail lungs do not exist as a condition.

What fact-check ?: First patient healed Algeria .
Explanation: The man is from Morocco and appears in a TV add for an hospital in Morocco.

What fact-check ?: Senegalese president government appears masks press conference .
Explanation: The picture is digitally edited to add the masks.

What fact-check ?: Do Americans pay 3000 4000 $ day containment ?
Explanation: Some Americans had to pay 3000 or 4000 $ after being contained in hospital.

What fact-check ?: Every U.S. election year disease outbreak .
Explanation: WHO data doesn't match the dates in the post, and many diseases originate outside the U.S.

What fact-check ?: 10,000 Deaths In Virus Outbreak Michigan , Washington , Idaho , North Dakota , Missouri , Mississippi .
Explanation: The CDC counted 25 deaths and 647 confirmed coronavirus cases in the United States as of March 10, 2020.

What fact-check ?: This video 'coronavirus patient ' persecuted press Mexico .
Explanation: The video was recorded on February 18 at the Instituto Nacional Cardiopulmonar, Tórax de Honduras.

What fact-check ?: Argentinian Health Minister said possibility coronavirus exists Argentina .
Explanation: In January, González García suggested that at that time "there is no possibility that there is coronavirus in Argentina", and that, if there was a case in the country, it would be imported, which actually happened.

What fact-check ?: Recommendations Dr. `` González Ayala '' circulating WhatsApp .
Explanation:
Dr. Silvia González Ayala denied that she was the author of the recommendations and said that she will file a criminal complaint.
Furthermore, the text has several false claims.

What fact-check ?: An audio circulating social media claiming 's coming Colombian scientist Rodolfo Llinás offering recommendations know `` infection '' COVID-19 coronavirus .
Explanation: Audio by Rodolfo Llinás with recommendations on the COVID-19 is false.

What fact-check ?: Thieves Palma ( Spain ) pretending doctors steal people 's houses .
Explanation: National and Local Police explained that there is no complaint that describes a similar case.

What fact-check ?: Gang Vitoria pretending doctors steal people 's houses .
Explanation: Local and regional Police said they have no complaints about assaults like that.

What fact-check ?: The head Coordinated Emergences , Fernando Simon , said better get coronavirus , later space hospitals .
Explanation: Simon didn't said that, it's is a satirical content shared as real.

What fact-check ?: Public broadcast RTVE published map coronavirus cases Spain fact map penis ' average size different regions .
Explanation: There is no evidence that RTVE published a map of coronavirus cases in Spain that in fact was a map of penis' average measure in different regions. The map was a map from El País about unemployment rate.

What fact-check ?: Classes cancelled Basque Country coronavirus .
Explanation: Classes were not cancelled in all Basque Country (at 10/03/20), just in to places: Vitoria and Labastida. It is a manipulated image using a media name.

What fact-check ?: Regional government Castilla-La Mancha announced Twitter closing schools April 1 .
Explanation: Regional government didn't announced that, it was a manipulated image.

What fact-check ?: Spanish Education minister , Isabel Celaá , wore purple latex gloves Women 's Day demonstration afraid coronavirus .
Explanation: It is something that other women an politicians did years before, when there was no coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Madrid ex-mayor Manuel Carmena coronavirus .
Explanation: Reported by a fake Twitter account pretending to be Spanish newspaper El País.

What fact-check ?: Madrid 's government announced students make-up classes summer .
Explanation: Madrid's government hasn't announced the students will have to make-up classes during summer: the shared photo is fake.

What fact-check ?: Galicia suspended classes coronavirus ( March 10th ) .
Explanation: Galicia did not suspended clases on March 10.

What fact-check ?: Empty supermarket Madrid measures announced coronavirus .
Explanation: The images were recorded in Chile, not in Spain.

What fact-check ?: Manuela Carmena , ex-mayor Madrid , got infected coronavirus .
Explanation: The tweet imitated El Pais official account and Más País denied she was infected.

What fact-check ?: Thieves Madrid pretending doctors steal people 's houses .
Explanation: National Police of Madrid explained that there is no complaint that describes a similar case. "The note was made by the president of a neighborhood association that saw similar events on television but in a country abroad, not in Spain, so it is a hoax," they say.

What fact-check ?: Madrid 's government announced students make-up classes summer .
Explanation: Madrid's government hasn't announced the students will have to make-up classes during summer: the shared photo is fake.

What fact-check ?: Audio WhatsApp head Cardiology Gregorio Marañón Hospital states moment uncontrolled coronavirus infection .
Explanation: It was denied by the hospital.

What fact-check ?: Holding breath 10sec determine COVID-19 drink water every 15 minutes .
Explanation: There are no medical and scientific evidences

What fact-check ?: Vitamin C warm water lemon effective ways preventing COVID-19 .
Explanation: Vitamin C has no know effect on the novel coronavirus, and neither does warm water with lemon.

What fact-check ?: The Italian department civil protection communicated since 16h March possibilty introduce bio-containment BSL-4
Explanation: The department of civil protection has never shared a public statement about the biocontainment BSL-4.

What fact-check ?: The Italian Ministry Interior ruled public statment police check people exit house .
Explanation: The Ministry of Interior has never shared any public statment about it.

What fact-check ?: Academia Sinica , Taiwan research institute developed antibodies rapid testing China representative WHO took credit .
Explanation: A Facebook page and YouTuber conducted this fake news. They tend to produce falsehoods against China.

What fact-check ?: A fighter aircraft crashed Tenjin , China . It failed defect China
Explanation: The video was an other inccident.

What fact-check ?: Tens thousand Korean asked expelling Chinese . The anti-Chinese bandwagon swept across world .
Explanation: It is the video of a rally to pressure the Korean president to resign on Feb. 22., not an anti-Chinese protest.

What fact-check ?: 37 died day NY ( March 10 ) .
Explanation: Translation was not correct. 37 new cases found in NY, not died.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 medicine found Ghana .
Explanation: The herbal product image was manipulated.

What fact-check ?: Tweet says Daniel Radcliffe coronavirus .
Explanation: A fake BBC Twitter account spread the claim before the tweet was removed and the account suspended from the platform.

What fact-check ?: Post says Harvard scientists say coronavirus “ spreading fast infect 70 % humanity year . ”
Explanation: An epidemiologist at Harvard University projects 40%-70% of adults could catch coronavirus in the coming year.

What fact-check ?: Many critics President Rodrigo Duterte slammed administration `` slashing '' P10 billion funds allocated Department Health ( DOH ) 2020 national budget .
Explanation: The National Expenditure Program (NEP), also known as "the President’s budget," initially proposed a lower budget for DOH for 2020 compared to 2019. This was eventually increased in the approved 2020 General Appropriations Act (GAA) or national budget after deliberations in Congress.

What fact-check ?: You kill coronavirus drinking hot drinks .
Explanation: Experts firmly refute such a claim.

What fact-check ?: Says monitor COVID-19 breath test .
Explanation: Holding your breath for 10 seconds isn’t a way to test that you don’t have COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A Prayer Group In The Squares Italy To Get Rid coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar verified the images circulated, and it was revealed that the prayers took place in Italy, although they were old, and some were published 11 years ago.

What fact-check ?: Sisi Raised The Numbers coronavirus Cases In Egypt , In The Hope Billions From The World Bank .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: "When I announced a $ 10 billion grant to the countries in which Coruna Virus was prevalent, President Sisi called me and confirmed 8,000 cases of infection in his country," the World Bank president said at a conference. Misbar checked the news and found it to be false. Returning to the official website of the World Bank, Misbar found that the World Bank announced an initial financing package worth $ 12 billion to tackle COVID-19 spread in more than 60 countries in the world.

Countries: North Macedonia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
What fact-check ?: A statement saying : `` 'Serbs ' lion 's genes ' protect coronavirus , unlike Italians 'weaker genes ' '' pulmonologist Branimir Nestorovic .
Explanation: Nestorovic claims that he did not say such a thing, nor did he think Serbs had superior genes, but only different ones, and that such a "statement" was filled by the tabloid.

What fact-check ?: While everybody busy coronavirus , authorities Görlitz , Germany , secretly brought asymlum seekers city .
Explanation: It was not a secret mission but the normal transfer of 23 asylum seekers from an initial reception site. This happens regularly.

What fact-check ?: Vitamin C kills viruses .
Explanation: There is no evidence that vitamin C can kill viruses or helps against COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: The Japanese Government gives 40 masks every household , free charge .
Explanation: It didn't happen.

What fact-check ?: Onion could applied cure COVID-19 , Spanish Flu 1918 .
Explanation: The story is unscientific and overclaim, it would be no vaccine had been used if it's true.

What fact-check ?: Unicef ​​advises eat ice cream reinforces infection new coronavirus .
