Explanation: Unicef has already denied this information in public, releasing an official statement explaining that this statement is a lie.

What fact-check ?: A Macedonian coronavirus patient , director Skin Clinic , wedding Secretary General Social Democratic Union Macedonia .
Explanation: It is easy to check whether the doctor was present at the wedding - a phone call to the Secretary General of SDSM is needed with the question of whether or not she was a guest at the wedding. She was not present.

What fact-check ?: A patient infected coronavirus killed drug dealers .
Explanation: The Facebook post saying a patient with coronavirus was shot by drug dealers in Rio de Janeiro was a prank.

What fact-check ?: Claim pic vegan food products left otherwise bare supermarket shelf related COVID-19 outbreak panic buying .
Explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be incorrectly linking the supermarket shelf image to the 2019/20 COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak. The image of a supermarket shelf full of vegan foods while the shelves either side remain empty has nothing to do with the COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak. It was originally taken in 2017 in the United States when Hurricane Harvey hit the southern state of Texas.

What fact-check ?: Chart compares COVID-19 longstanding diseases .
Explanation: The graphic is misleading and risks underplaying the danger of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, which is a new disease with a fast-rising mortality rate.

What fact-check ?: Imported second hand clothes Europe , Asia America could spread novel coronavirus Africa .
Explanation: Experts told AFP the novel coronavirus does not survive long enough outside the human body, and could not survive so long journeys.

What fact-check ?: Hold breath ten seconds check infected novel coronavirus .
Explanation: Only a test made by labs can detect the novel coronavirus, according to WHO and some experts interviewed by AFP.

What fact-check ?: Japanese doctors claim Drinking Water Every 15 Minute Prevent COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is no Japanese advisory issued regarding frequent consumption of water. World Health Organization has clarified , that drinking water will not prevent a coronavirus infection.

What fact-check ?: Muslim People China seeking refuge Islam reading Quran save COVID-19 .
Explanation: Fact Crescendo found the above post to be False. The video was in existence since the year 2013 which is way before the outbreak of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Anti-Malaria Drug Chloroquine Is A Cure For coronavirus .
Explanation: Anti- Malaria drug Chloroquine is not an authorized medicine to cure coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to prove that Chloroquine can be used to cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: No deaths COVID-19 Israel scientists discovered vaccine COVID-19 .
Explanation: Various vaccines proposed by Israel scientists and other researchers across the world are under development and are yet to be cleared for production and distribution. Israel’s MIGAL Research Institute is also in the process of producing a vaccine for COVID-19. According to WHO, as on 11 March 2020, there is no vaccine for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: AIIMS ( Indian medical institute ) team said Toddy medicinal properties cure coronavirus .
Explanation: AIIMS team has never said that Toddy has medicinal properties to cure coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Iran 's head judiciary : first centers volunteered suspend activities response coronavirus outbreak religious Institutions connected clergy .
Who said/posted it?: Iran's head of judiciary, Ebrahim Raiesi
Explanation: This is an outrageous claim and couldn't be farther from the truth. Weeks after the outbreak, holy shrines and mosques refused to close down.

What fact-check ?: Holding breath 10 seconds determine COVID-19 , drink water every 15 minutes .
Explanation: The article lists myths that go against WHO recommendations.

What fact-check ?: Panic scene Germany people rushing supermarket .
Explanation: The video is taken during the sales.

What fact-check ?: Demonstrations Chinese people Italy .
Explanation: Anti-fascist demonstration on February 22 in Roma.

What fact-check ?: Racist scene Chinese people metro Belgium .
Explanation: Vidéo is an excerpt of the Youtube channel "Would you react" with actors.

What fact-check ?: Why 's dangerous make hand sanitizer home .
Explanation: It's dangerous to create your own hand sanitizer at home but DIY videos dont' tell you that.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus found toilet paper .
Explanation: This was created by a prank generator, and the CDC did not include this as a way in which coronavirus spreads.

What fact-check ?: Gargling salt water vinegar kill virus .
Explanation: Pulmonologist debunked the memes, and CDC offers real advice about how to say safe.

What fact-check ?: Vitamin C lemon water prevent coronavirus .
Explanation:
There is no recommendation from the World Health Organization or scientific evidence to support this.
There is also no vaccine or medicine to prevent the disease yet.

What fact-check ?: Actor Daniel Radcliffe tested positive COVID-19 .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Quito second city highest probability infection .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: A case new coronavirus confirmed city Ibagué , Colombia .
Explanation: Health authorities had not confirmed the case and they were the only ones to be able to do so beacuse they are the ones who can test.

What fact-check ?: Malaga closes nurseries due coronavirus .
Explanation: It's a manipulated screenshot of a 'El Mundo' article.

What fact-check ?: Neuroscientist Rodolfo Llinás says last 10 seconds without coughing without discomfort means fibrosis lungs therefore coronavirus infection .
Explanation: Rodolfo Llinás claims that he has not said that and there is no evidence that these recommendations are effective.

What fact-check ?: Audio WhatsApp head Cardiology Gregorio Marañón Hospital states moment uncontrolled coronavirus infection .
Explanation: The public health authorities of the Community of Madrid have classified the audio that supposedly belongs to the head of Cardiology at the Gregorio Marañón Hospital as false.

What fact-check ?: Seven ambulance workers infected coronavirus Catalonia .
Explanation: Health ministry of Catalonia explained that there are no ambulance workers infected.

What fact-check ?: Neuroscientist Rodolfo Llinás says last 10 seconds without coughing without discomfort means fibrosis lungs therefore coronavirus infection .
Explanation: Rodolfo Llinás claims that he has not said that and there is no evidence that these recommendations are effective.

What fact-check ?: Pedro Sánchez medical team 14 people take care since coronavirus crisis .
Explanation: The medical team is in the presidential house since 1997, it has nothing to do with the COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: The virus dies high temperatures , teas fight COVID-19 , holding breath 10 seconds prove n't get coronavirus , drinking lot water stop coronavirus , mask avoid contagion , coronavirus die `` exposed sun '' .
Explanation: All of these recommendations are false, according to the WHO and medical experts.

What fact-check ?: Madrid going close borders due coronavirus .
Explanation: It is false and denied by the Spanish police on Twitter.

What fact-check ?: Are pools open Guatemala ? Can coronavirus transmited pool ?
Explanation: Pools were closed by the Swimming Federation of Guatemala to avoid infections.

What fact-check ?: `` Arsenic album-30 homeopathic medicine prevent coronavirus . Information given Ministry AYUSH . ''
Explanation: According to WHO, there is no evidence that any medicine can stop or cure the virus. The World Health Organization does not recommend any medication, including antibiotics, as a prevention or treatment of COVID-19. Meanwhile, the AYUSH Minister AYUSH Minister Mr. Padnaik also said that they never claimed that arsenic album 30 can cure coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Retirment benefits reduced 50 % April .
Explanation: The public statment was fake. The national social welfare institution has never shared that document.

What fact-check ?: A video claiming show coronavirus extracted man ’ upper lip .
Explanation: A video claiming to show a coronavirus being extracted for a man’s upper lip is of a botfly larva.

What fact-check ?: Uganda deport 19 passengers high-risk COVID-19 countries .
Who said/posted it?: Facebook post from a Kenyan user
Explanation: Ugandan authorities did not deport 19 passengers on a KLM flight from Amsterdam to Entebbe. The passengers did not show 'severe' flu-like symptoms.

What fact-check ?: American CDC admitted coronavirus originated USA . Many COVID-19 patients misdiagnosed coronavirus .
Explanation: It is another piece of false information based on the unfounded claim that the coronavirus came from the United States.

What fact-check ?: Water company : chlorine added Tap water prevent coronavirus . Let water rest two hours using .
Explanation: Water company didn't release any statement like this. They didn't add additional anti-coronavirus chemicals.

What fact-check ?: Indonesia Only Prohibits Migrants Iran , Italy , South Korea Allow Entry Chinese Citizens
Explanation: Restrictions on the entry of migrants from China have been done earlier by the government, namely on February 5, 2020. In addition to stopping flights to and from China, the government has also temporarily suspended the issuance of Visa and Arrival Visas for Chinese citizens.

What fact-check ?: Is COVID-19 Virus Prevention Information Really Originating UNICEF ?
Explanation: The post was not from UNICEF. UNICEF has denied this information circulating in a number of countries, including in Indonesia.

What fact-check ?: Cow Urine Feces Can Treat Corona Virus 2019
Explanation: Until now, there has been no health organization that states that there are drugs or vaccines to prevent and treat COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: The map shows first COVID-19 case diagnosed Kayseri , Turkey .
Explanation: The Johns Hopkins map shows the geographical centers of the countries, not the places in which case are diagnosed. Metadata shows the details.

What fact-check ?: UNICEF published health advices COVID-19 .
Explanation: UNICEF did not publish the text. The medical advices in the text are not scientific-based.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus dies temperature 26 – 27 degrees Celcius per UNICEF .
Explanation: The viral message on novel coronavirus is NOT issued by UNICEF.

What fact-check ?: Indian yogu guru Baba Ramdev infected coronavirus .
Explanation: An old picture of Ramdev from the year 2011 is being shared with a false caption. The picture was taken in Dehradun after the yoga guru broke his nine-day fast. He had been on a hunger strike demanding tougher a law against corruption and seeking the return of black money stashed abroad.

What fact-check ?: `` NYC man drops dead middle street — suspected coronavirus ! ”
Explanation: New York City Police say a man was taken to the hospital after falling and hitting his head. He was in stable condition and it was unrelated to coronavirus, according to police.

What fact-check ?: The health insurance industry “ agreed waive co-payments coronavirus treatments . ”
Explanation: Health insurance companies said they will waive costs for coronavirus tests, not treatment. A shortage in diagnostic supplies means that testing is limited.

What fact-check ?: “ MSNBC actually said air ‘ I hope enough people die coronavirus harms Trump ’ re-election . ’ ”
Explanation: MSNBC panelists compared former President George W. Bush’s response to Hurricane Katrina to President Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak, and speculated it could hurt his popularity.

What fact-check ?: China supplying Quran people read Coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: This is at least a seven-year-old video and has no relation to coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: `` The Eyes Darkness '' Predicted coronavirus Outbreak .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The Eyes of Darkness, published in 1981, predicts the emergence of the COVID-19. The author is already in the book's new edition talking about a biological weapon which is a virus called "Wuhan 400", originating from the same city in China. However, he did not mention COVID-19 or its main symptoms such as shortness of breath and high temperature.

What fact-check ?: A Picture The Chinese President In Wuhan Without A Mask .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The Chinese president in Wuhan, China, without wearing a mask. The image is old and has been posted on the official Chinese news agency Xinhua website since October 2018.

What fact-check ?: About thousand people wait enter Military Medical Academy ( VMA ) Belgrade examinations .
Who said/posted it?: Serbian news portal "Vecernje Novosti" and Twitter
Explanation: People came for routine check-ups and only their temperature was measured. Many people were only accompanying those who went for a check-up and were not allowed to enter thus causing queues outside.

What fact-check ?: A viral screenshot story allegedly published BBC claiming Ghana recorded first confirmed coronavirus case .
Explanation: It was denied by the BBC correspondent in Ghana and the Ghana Health Service. We found that the misinformers modified the HTML codes from the BBC website to create the false headline and story.

What fact-check ?: President Vucic 's claim none said coronavirus `` funniest '' virus .
Explanation: The video of renewed doctor claiming that coronavirus is the "funniest" virus exists and is available online.

What fact-check ?: Welfare ministry Region Lombardy said `` China lied us '' `` data provided Chinese government fake '' .
Explanation: The Welfare Ministry has never said that. He simply stated that COVID-19 is spreading faster than what forecasts suggested.

What fact-check ?: A doctor says coronavirus n't kill n't even cause common cold .
Explanation: The allegations shared by the doctor contradict official information from World Health Organization.

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus created laboratory biological weapon .
Explanation: The claims are based on the opinions of two men who are not virologists, but rather conspirationists.

What fact-check ?: Elderly people left die Italian hospital near Milan .
Explanation: Information was based on an audio message circulating via WhatsApp. The message was posted by "Il Giornale", which later retracted the message. Niguarda hospital released a statement claiming that the information was false.

What fact-check ?: Airports train stations Lithuania closed .
Explanation: The article used a statement by the government which claimed that schools are being closed. Authors of the misleading article added information about airports and train stations in a headlines but used the governments statement as main text.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 cured hot water baking soda .
Explanation: Mortality statistics indicate that seasonal flu is at least 60 times less deadly than COVID-19 (based on current data). Hot water and soda have no proven effects to help combat the novel coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Claim disease outbreaks pandemics correspond election years .
Explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found no correlation between election years and virus outbreaks. The outbreaks of SARS, Bird Flu and COVID-19 do not line up with the dates claimed in the post. In the case of Zika virus, the disease has had multiple outbreaks since 2014 in parts of Oceania and in Brazil. Bird Flu, MERS and Ebola have not been reported in Australia and have not been a significant feature of local political discussion or debate. Considering overseas elections, such as US presidential elections, there is also no consistent pattern of outbreaks occurring in election years.

What fact-check ?: Photo purportedly showing Tom Hanks holding volleyball , claiming hospital staff Australia gave tribute cheer quarantine .
Explanation: The image has been doctored using a 2015 photograph of Hanks and a stock photo of a hospital ward; the doctored photo emerged on a satirical website.

What fact-check ?: Infographic claiming coronavirus pandemic fits pattern viral outbreaks occur every 100 years .
Explanation: The infographic contains inaccurate information about historical viral outbreaks and ignores other epidemics that do not fit the assumed pattern; health experts told AFP that while certain viruses are seasonal in nature, there is no basis for the claim that viral outbreaks occur once every century.

What fact-check ?: Photos showing empty shelves supermarkets .
Explanation: The photos have circulated online since 2015.

What fact-check ?: This video purports show body bags virus victims Italy .
Explanation: It has previously circulated in media reports about people who died after contracting COVID-19 in Iran; a man recording the video can be heard stating that he is inside a mortuary in the Iranian city of Qom.

What fact-check ?: Warm drinks kill coronavirus , virus dies ambient temperature higher 26ºC , gargling warm water helps treating disease virus stays hands 10 minutes .
Explanation: None of this claims have any scientific support.

What fact-check ?: 3,500 italians potentially infected novel coronavirus arrived Brazil cruiseship
Explanation: The photo that has been shared with the misinformation piece is from the Costa Fascinosa cruise, and the company responsible for the vessel reported that all of its passengers in Brazil are from South America. The ship left Italy on November 17, 2019, has passed through France and Spain and has been on the Brazilian coast since December 2, two months before Italy confirmed its first coronavirus case.

What fact-check ?: The Brazilian government released additional money beneficiaries Bolsa Família , national conditional cash transfer programme .
Explanation: The Ministry of Citizenship, responsible for the program, denied on its social networks that there will be such a release and stated that it only announced the inclusion of 1.2 million families in Bolsa Família. In addition, messages circulating on WhatsApp with this misinformation (see here) bring links to fake websites.

What fact-check ?: News channels suggests drinking tulsi noni juice help prevent Novel coronavirus .
Explanation: A morphed screenshot of the news channel was used.

What fact-check ?: Iranians published report saying coronavirus biological warfare .
Explanation: There was no such report and claims about coronavirus being biological warfare have been already debunked.

What fact-check ?: Consuming onion salt followed glass water cure coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence to prove that onion, salt and water can be used to cure COVID-19. Also at present there is no cure for coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Consuming salt onion cure novel coronavirus .
Explanation: No research available on the topic also Sri Lankan health department officials have officialy dismissed the claim.

What fact-check ?: Most affected countries COVID-19 along 40-degree North latitude .
Explanation: 40-degree North latitude passes through some of the countries most affected by COVID-19 but does not pass through half of the locations given in the post. Also, it does not touch Wuhan (Hubei Province – where around 60% of all the positive cases are reported), which is at around 30-degree North latitude.

What fact-check ?: Indian President Ramnath Kovind pouring gaumutra ( cow urine ) globe prevent coronavirus .
Explanation: 2017 image falsely shared as President Ramnath Kovind pouring gaumutra on a globe to prevent coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A worker Prince hotel Mehdipatnam ( Hyderbad , India ) tested positive coronavirus .
Explanation: The message is fake. In Telangana state, till date, only one confirmed case of coronavirus is reported and the person who tested positive for the virus is a software engineer.

What fact-check ?: Drinking water garlic boiled cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is no evidence to support this claim.

What fact-check ?: OMS staff member spreading coronavirus purpose .
Explanation: The man is an astrophysician, and he is touching this lady because she is his girlfriend, and she is sick.

What fact-check ?: U.S. presidential election canceled due coronavirus .
Explanation: The federal government has made no such announcement about canceling the U.S. presidential election.

What fact-check ?: Australian Hospital Staff Rolled In A Wilson Volleyball To Keep Tom Hanks Company In Quarantine .
Explanation: This came from a satire website, and the photo in the story is old and unrelated to Tom Hank's illness.

What fact-check ?: A former controversial CIA officer said coronavirus made lab .
Explanation: The quote was pulled out of context and was mere speculation, not fact.

What fact-check ?: Mexicans call Mexican government get COVID-19 test home .
Explanation: The UIES line was enabled only for suspicious cases and not for the general population.

What fact-check ?: Argentine President Alberto Fernández said coronavirus dies 26 degrees celsius .
Who said/posted it?: Alberto Fernández (Argentine President) on Radio Mitre
Explanation:
The WHO maintains that the virus can be transmitted in all climatic areas and that "the virus is too new for us to know how a warmer climate could affect transmissibility".
According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is not yet known whether climate and temperature affect the spread of COVID-19. There is still no scientific consensus on the impact of room temperature on this particular virus.

What fact-check ?: Argentine President Alberto Fernández said `` WHO recomended drink hot drinks heat kills virus '' ( coronavirus )
Who said/posted it?: Alberto Fernández (Argentine President) on Radio Mitre
Explanation:
The organization did not issue any recommendation on the consumption of beverages for the prevention of coronavirus.
Experts deny this advice and even say that it could be harmful. This version circulates on social media and WhatsApp in Argentina and in other countries.

What fact-check ?: In Colombia , `` First Child registered Yair coronavirus Mosquera '' .
Explanation: "First Child registered as Yair coronavirus Mosquera". The screenshot of the alleged note from Caracol has been broadcast on social networks.

What fact-check ?: Hot lemon juice prevents coronavirus .
Explanation: It is false that hot lemon juice prevents coronavirus. The publication allegedly written by "Laila Ahmadi of China, Faculty of Medical Sciences, Zanjan University" is false and that university is not located in China.

What fact-check ?: KFC San Marino Shopping ( Guayaquil , Ecuador ) employee COVID-19 .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Jair Bolsonaro tested positive COVID-19 .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Policemen China chase COVID-19 subway station .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: UNICEF 's advice preventing COVID-19
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Jair Bolsonaro new coronavirus .
Explanation: Health authorities had not confirmed the case and they were the only ones to be able to do so beacuse they are the ones who can test. It was a clickbait.

What fact-check ?: Garlic heals new coronavirus .
Explanation: WHO said that there is no evidence that proves that garlic heals coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Viral audio WhatsApp doctor hospital Fundación Jiménez Díaz Madrid claims two young patinents bad condition coronavirus respirators intensive care units .
Explanation: In an internal cocument, the head of intensive care unit explains that the young patients have not patologies related to coronavirus. He also says that there are respiratories for all patients.

What fact-check ?: Zamora cancelled Holy week due coronavirus .
Explanation: It's a false article created on 12minutos, a site that lets you create "satirical" articles.

What fact-check ?: Catalonia , Valencia Aragon cancel classes schools , colleges universities coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: The article was not published by El País.

What fact-check ?: Tuit reports Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro tested positive coronavirus .
Explanation: Fake Twitter account pretending to be Folha de Sao Paolo.

What fact-check ?: Spain ex-King Juan Carlos I coronavirus .
Explanation: It was tweeted from a fake account pretending to be Spanish newspaper El País.

What fact-check ?: China announced sucess Egyptian serum form Dr. Hala , Health Minister Egypt , coronavirus .
Explanation: Egyptian Health Ministry denied it.

What fact-check ?: Podemos spokesman , Pablo Echenique , intensive care getting infected covid .
Explanation: The tweet imitated El Mundo's official account.

What fact-check ?: Education Ministry announces students passing actual course without making exams coronavirus .
Explanation: The education ministry issued another document that was manipulated.

What fact-check ?: Private health insurance public workers cover expenses related coronavirus .
Explanation: The statement published by Independent Union of the Tax Agency of Spain in March 12 is real but a more updated version of March 23, and the public institution (MUFACE), affirm that all its insured (public workers) have 100% coverage in expenses related to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Vitamin C protects spread coronavirus . Lemon hot water fights cancer . COVID-19 arises fusion genetic material snake bat .
Explanation: Any of these protect against the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: The smell tea tree oil kill coronavirus nostrils , according study Austrian university .
Explanation: It works in a lab, but there is no evidence to prove that smelling oil for 15 mins can kill coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Councilor Pen White-Chung said coronavirus USA based Chinese academic study .
Explanation: It is another piece of false information based on the unfounded claim that the coronavirus came from the United States. This one is more subtle and shared by China officails.

What fact-check ?: Trump admitted flu cases USA actually infected coronavirus .
Explanation: The video is a clip of Trump's speech, but the subtitle and caption are false.

What fact-check ?: Chinese people prayed Muslims due fear COVID-19 .
Explanation: The video is shared in 2019, June, before the outbreak.

What fact-check ?: Turmeric lemon cure coronavirus .
Explanation: Medical practitioners and even WHO has rubbished this claim and has said that there is no evidence to prove that turmeric and lemon can be used to cure coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Drinking water every 15 minutes protect getting coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no medical evidence to support the idea that drinking water every 15 minutes will help protect you from coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: You check coronavirus holding breath 10 seconds .
Explanation: There is no evidence to support the claim that holding your breath for several seconds is an effective way to test for coronavirus

What fact-check ?: A Video Chinese People Fighting Muslim Scriptures Not Get Infected Corona Virus ?
Explanation: The video has been circulating since 2014, before the Corona COVID-19 virus was first reported in late December 2019. The video of Christians in China opening their Bibles for the first time

What fact-check ?: Says Tom Hanks volleyball keep company ’ quarantined .
Explanation: The image of Tom Hanks apparently holding a Wilson volleyball during his COVID-19 quarantine comes from a satirical Australian website.

What fact-check ?: Of Trump administration ’ European travel restrictions exempt U.K. : “ Well , get Chunnel , ’ U.K . ”
Explanation: It isn’t that easy to get around the restrictions by taking a train linking England and France.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed hundreds thousands times Facebook , Twitter YouTube alongside claim shows shaman curing novel coronavirus patient Malaysia .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video has circulated online in posts about a hospital in Indonesia since at least October 2018, more than one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

What fact-check ?: A fake quote Vice President Leni Robredo suggesting `` inhale cough back '' prevent spread 2019 novel coronavirus .
Explanation: The Vice President did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. News5 said the graphic was edited using their template.

What fact-check ?: Says donate blood , “ HAVE test ” coronavirus .
Explanation: Blood donors don’t get a coronavirus test if they donate blood.

What fact-check ?: “ During 2009 swine flu outbreak , Biden made reckless comments unsupported science & experts . The Obama Admin clean mess & apologize ineptitude . ”
Explanation: During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden said he would advise his family against traveling in confined places and said when one person sneezes “it goes all the way through an aircraft.” Scientists say that’s not how germs spread. Biden’s comments were met with backlash and his spokesperson issued a clarification.

What fact-check ?: Donald Trump claims Joe Biden “ charge H1N1 Swine Flu epidemic killed thousands people . The response one worst record . Our response one best , fast action border closings & 78 % Approval Rating , highest record . His lowest ! ''
Explanation: Joe Biden was not in charge of the Obama administration’s H1N1 response. Trump overstated public confidence in his administration’s response to the coronavirus and downplayed confidence in the Obama administration’s response to H1N1.

What fact-check ?: Says Nancy Pelosi “ caught trying include abortion funding bill combat coronavirus . ”
Explanation: The U.S. House passed a measure that provides federal funds to people affected by the coronavirus. The bill covers reimbursement laboratory costs for COVID-19 testing. Some raised concerns that language was needed to specifically ensure abortion services weren’t eligible to receive funds. The language was amended by Democrats to limit reimbursements to COVID-19 expenses.

What fact-check ?: “ ‘ The Simpsons ' predicted Tom Hanks getting coronavirus 2007 . ”
Explanation: In the closing credits of “The Simpson Movie,” Hanks says: "This is Tom Hanks, saying, if you see me in person, leave me be." The movie is about an environmental crisis. There’s no reference to any kind of outbreak.

What fact-check ?: “ The CDC detain anyone fever — indefinitely . … Vaccination ( ) way people could get detention . ”
Explanation: In the United States, people can’t be quarantined for just having a fever; they have to be shown to have been exposed to one of a specific set of diseases. Most quarantines are done voluntarily, not by force of the government. And vaccination is not a ticket out of quarantine. Most quarantine decisions are up to states and localities, rather than the CDC.

What fact-check ?: Says COVID-19 came United States 2019 .
Explanation: The first confirmed COVID-19 case in the United States was reported on Jan. 20, 2020. The patient was a man who had recently returned to Washington state from Wuhan, China.

What fact-check ?: The new coronavirus dies temperature around 26-27 degrees Celsius .
Explanation: The virus doesn't die when the temperature is around 27-28 degrees Celsius.

What fact-check ?: Saint Luke ’ Hospital USA says consuming alcohol reduce risk COVID-19 .
Explanation: Saint Luke's Hospital hasn't released any such advisory.

What fact-check ?: Live stream infected foreigners coming Ukraine Italy , went viral .
Explanation: It turned out later that the people on that plane were not infected and some of the information by the speaker was lies.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus First Infection In Jeddah ..
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The first infection with COVID-19 in Jeddah, a woman from an Asian country showing symptoms of suspected coronavirus, and falling on a street. The Emirate of Makkah Province denied, on its Twitter account, what was circulated about the infection of a Chinese woman with the virus.

What fact-check ?: Novel coronavirus After 2600 Times Magnified .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The image is enlarged to show mites, not coronavirus.

Countries: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Greece
What fact-check ?: The virus overcome drinking hot water every 15 minutes , avoiding cold drinks ice cream , going sun kill virus , well `` self-diagnostic guideline '' , i.e . hold breath 10 seconds cough , choke , feel tension lungs cystic fibrosis lungs situation irreversible .
Explanation: All of this misinformation has nothing to do with the truth, because the virus not only enters the oral cavity but also the nose, so drinking hot water will not carry the virus to the stomach. Viruses are destroyed at higher temperatures than those normally tolerated by humans, and even sun exposure and body heat have no effect.

What fact-check ?: Prime Minister Ana Brnabic claimed number respirators state secret countries .
Explanation: Information about number of respirators is available in many countries.

What fact-check ?: A doctor North Macedonia states case new coronavirus conspiracy humanity conspiracy pharmaceutical industry profit , new coronavirus dangerous .
Explanation: By transmitting her words, the text goes against the recognized authorities and institutions, such as the World Health Organization, which has already declared a pandemic of the new coronavirus, and which speaks of high infectivity and serious complications in patients of different ages.

What fact-check ?: Cuba developed vaccine coronavirus .
Explanation: Cuba is working on a vaccine option, but is not ready for distribution; Facebook posts mention Inteferon Alfa2B, a medicine used against hepatitis.

What fact-check ?: Drinking tea hot water kills virus ; lemon slices warm water may save life ; 's recommended keep money sealed plastic bag ; conspiracy theory suggests China benefiting pandemic ; vinegar good cleaning hands .
Explanation: Coronavirus has already spread to countries with hot weather; water with lemons does not help prevention; WHO recommends washing your hands after touching your money; Asian markets have been operating in low marks because of the pandemic; WHO recommends using alcohol gel and soap to keep your hands free of germs.

What fact-check ?: YouTube video claims show mass animal killings linked coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: The pig footage dated back to 2018 and the poultry footage did not depict contamined animals.

What fact-check ?: A photo claimed Lithuanian town Mazeikiai cut rest country due outbreak COVID-19 .
Explanation: An original photo shows a sign that informs of a road maintanance project. Whereas the fake one claimed that a city is being cut off.

What fact-check ?: A facebook post claimed message Stanford hospital gives advice drink water every 15 minutes order prevent COVID-19
Explanation: A statement from the Stanford hospital distanced themselves from the fake message.

What fact-check ?: An image Facebook claimed hundreds infected people hidden Lithuanian hospitals , taken crematoriums .
Explanation: The original message was published by a prank generating Facebook account and repackaged to look as if it was real.

What fact-check ?: Claim notes `` uncle '' `` graduated master 's degree '' worked Shenzhen Hospital advice COVID-19 symptoms treatment .
Explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the post to contain a mixture of true and false claims. A runny nose, sputum, dry cough and pneumonia can be symptoms of COVID-19 however not everyone infected with the disease will have them. Disease expert Prof Collingnon says temperatures around 26 to 27 degrees C won’t kill the virus however UV light from the sun can be effective in drying out the virus. Understanding of how long COVID-19 survives on surfaces is limited, with the WHO referring to previous studies of other viruses to estimate a range of a few hours to a few days. Drinking warm water, avoiding iced drinks and gargling warm salt water are not treatments or preventions, according to Prof Cunningham, however staying hydrated is important and gargling may relieve sore throats. The timeline for progression of COVID-19 symptoms is partly accurate but not everyone will experience all of these symptoms or in that order. Prof Cunningham also said it was not accurate to say infection will happen first in the throat, as the delicate tissues behind the nose are more likely starting points.

What fact-check ?: Ancient herbal drink efffective remedy novel coronavirus .
Explanation: Experts advise against using herbal remedies to treat coronavirus

What fact-check ?: False COVID-19 hotline number shared Canada .
Explanation: 811 is not an official public health hotline in Ontario, and the provincial ministry of health is not organizing home visits, a spokeswoman told AFP.

What fact-check ?: Israel cases coronavirus developed cure .
Explanation: Official World Health Organization (WHO) data and Israeli media reports state at least 298 people have been confirmed to have contracted the disease as of March 16; Israel has implemented travel restrictions and closed businesses in response to the spread of COVID-19. Various countries have been working develop a vaccine for COVID-19 and WHO guidance currently states there is no "cure" for the virus to date.

What fact-check ?: Claim COVID-19 around long time , photo animal vaccine labeled `` coronavirus '' .
Explanation: The coronavirus affecting these animals is different from the virus that appeared a few months ago in China, for which there is no vaccine.

What fact-check ?: A photo showing full vegan supermarkets ' shelves , next empty ones , caption saying `` even time coronavirus , one wants eat vegan '' .
Explanation: The photo had been circulating on the Internet for two years and a half.

What fact-check ?: After closure schools France , president Emmanuel Macron announced classes next summer catch .
Who said/posted it?: Fake Twitter account of Emmanuel Macron
Explanation: Emmanuel Macron has not made such announces. It was published from a fake account.

What fact-check ?: Cuba developed coronavirus vaccine .
Who said/posted it?: Olho Aberto PR and other media
Explanation: Cuban medication has been used for treating COVID-19 in China, but it is not a vaccine and the substance has been discovered elsewhere.

What fact-check ?: Books Predicted The coronavirus Before happened .
Explanation: One book does have a close enough accurate representation, the second is a work of fiction.

What fact-check ?: India Announced Holidays 4 States .
Explanation: No such letter was issued by the government.

What fact-check ?: Israel USA come vaccine .
Explanation: Israel has found a vaccine with properties similar to COVID-19, San Diego had developed an algorithm.

What fact-check ?: Viral video suggests two cases coronavirus Ghana tested negative .
Explanation: The video is not new. It was part of a news item published by Citi TV on February 6, 2020, when two suspected cases tested negative.

What fact-check ?: Viral post suggests Dettol sanitizer kill coronavirus .
Explanation: Dettol has been tested on, and found to kill coronaviruses such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). However, the manufacturer of Dettol, Reckitt Benckiser Group plc(RB), says it has not yet tested its products on the novel coronavirus and could not confirm whether Dettol is effective against the new coronavirus strain.

What fact-check ?: A misleading chart spread Facebook , erroneously dubbing new coronavirus “ least deadly virus . ''
Explanation: The chart cites old data about coronavirus cases and deaths, and it contains an error that makes COVID-19 look less fatal than the 2009 H1N1 “swine flu” outbreak.

What fact-check ?: Indian Ministry Health Family Welfare issued office memorandum declaring compulsory holiday four Indian states .
Explanation: Ministry of Health India has denied any such notification.

What fact-check ?: The claim scientific paper published Nature 2015 , shows new virus developed labs .
Explanation: On the contrary, the authors state that viruses similar to SARS have been detected in populations of bats.

What fact-check ?: image showing italian doctors exhausted sleeping .
Explanation: Images that were used belong to a campaign in Mexico for healtworkers rights.

What fact-check ?: Propolis cures COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is no evidence to support this claim.

What fact-check ?: A secret invasion 40 thousand american troops immune COVID-19 ongoing Europe .
Explanation: A secret invasion of 40 thousand American troops on Europe is not happening.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 human made , American biological weapon
Explanation: Scientific reseach shows that the virus is not human made.

What fact-check ?: Croatian president tells people buy bulk least 2 weeks .
Explanation: The president did not say you should buy food to sustain you for two weeks.

What fact-check ?: People panicking COVID-19 case Dakar Airport .
Explanation: this footage has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic and was taken out of context from a Senegalese TV footage showing an exercise.

What fact-check ?: Picture showing Mecca totally empty .
Explanation: The picture is from a miniature designed by an artist.

What fact-check ?: Saddam Hussein explaining coronavirus .
Explanation: Sound has been edited. It's a video from 2003 where Saddam Hussein is talking about the USA/Irak war.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus scare began impeachment .
Explanation: the outbreak began in China in late 2019, and it led to the World Health Organization to declare a global health emergency on January 30, 2020, before the final impeachment vote.

What fact-check ?: Supermarkets recalling coronavirus-infected toilet paper .
Explanation: The CDC said that coronavirus is spread through respiratory droplets. No reports yet of toilet paper recalls.

What fact-check ?: Man pass along coronavirus infection WalMart Louisiana .
Explanation: The man in the photo who posted it admitted it was a joke.

What fact-check ?: NYC implement citywide quarantine .
Explanation: NY Mayor Bill de Blasio tweeted it was a false alarm.

What fact-check ?: A viral message listing false unrelated statements coronavirus falsely attributed United Nations International Children 's Emergency Fund ( UNICEF ) .
Explanation: No such advisory has been released by UNICEF. Nor much is known about novel coronavirus as it is a newly found coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Israel manufactured coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) vaccine
Explanation: According to Isreal, work at The Biological Institute is going on and it may take time. 50 of the most senior researchers and scientists are working hard to prepare a vaccine. The Image which is being circulated along with the claim is a reference image, available on shutterstock.

What fact-check ?: Holding breath without coughing tell COVID-19
Explanation: False, having difficulty breathing is a feature of any respiratory illness and not a sign of coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Healthy ministry sent email new coronavirus .
Explanation: Colombian Ministry of Health explained that the email was false.

What fact-check ?: Spanish Ministry Interior closing-off Madrid .
Explanation: The ministry of Interior has denied releasing that statement.

What fact-check ?: Drinking hot beverages prevents coronavirus infection .
Explanation: Fluid intake has nothing to do with the infection process.

What fact-check ?: Audio WhatsApp says doctor two nurses hospitalized ICU Terrassa ( Barcelona )
Explanation: The hospitals in Terrassa deny this situation.

What fact-check ?: Film 'coronavirus ' predicted current pandemic
Explanation: That's not the cover of the movie. The original name of the film in Korean is "Gamgi" (Cold), "Flu" in English, and it is translated into Spanish as "Virus".

What fact-check ?: They looking volunteers infected SARS-CoV-2 British laboratories 4,000 euros .
Explanation: Headlines shared on networks do not specify that they will inject other coronavirus strains, 0C43 and 229E.

What fact-check ?: Evo Morales ( ex-mandatary Bolivia ) COVID-19 .
Explanation: Morales continue his normal activities. Moreover, on march twelve he posted in his Twitter account. Also, other followers of the political party Movement to Socialism (MAS) did not refer about the health condition of the ex mandatary.

What fact-check ?: Zhong Nanshan : shower may cause coronavirus infection according cases Hong Kong Diamond Princess .
Explanation: Zhong said "sewer", but it was translated as shower in Chinese in one wechat account. Then Taiwanese media misunderstood as "shower" and interviewed Taiwanese officials and experts to command it.

What fact-check ?: The Minister Defense Japan posted tweet thank Taiwan donating 500,000 face masks .
Explanation: It is a fake tweet.

What fact-check ?: Asterix comics 1981 mentioned coronavirus , French people knew outbreak advance .
Explanation: Coronaviruses had been known for a while and are not only referring to COVID-19. 1981 Asterix comic books did not mention coronavirus. The issue from 2017 did refer to coronavirus, but it has nothing to do with the current outbreak.

What fact-check ?: A Turkish citizen Yozgat ate yogurt soap together get rid virus .
Explanation: The news first published in an parody site. There is no such a guy in Yozgat nor the doctors mentioned.

What fact-check ?: Central government announced blanket holiday schools/colleges 4 states India .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: The health service Ireland asking people stockpile food .
Explanation: The claim was untrue. The health service is not urging people to stockpile food - in fact, the opposite is true - and the supply chains in Ireland remain robust

What fact-check ?: Ireland going 'Status Red ' lockdown military patrolling streets .
Explanation: The claim was untrue. Ireland has not gone into lockdown

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 Breeds Rapidly In Toilet Paper .
Explanation: Post claiming COVID-19 breeds rapidly in toilet paper is fake. The post is taken from an unauthentic website.

What fact-check ?: Singapore checks Saliva Indonesian arrivals Changi Airport
Explanation: The COVID-19 swab test is only intended for tourists who have symptoms such as fever or other respiratory ailments.

What fact-check ?: A Twitter post claimed Christiano Ronaldo transforming string hotels hospitals ; aid fight COVID-19 .
Explanation: A spokesperson from the hotel denied the claim. Moreover, there is no such statement present on any of the footballer’s media accounts.

What fact-check ?: Advice coronavirus prevention remedies , allegedly Stanford Hospital .
Explanation: Almost every advice listed in the original and widely spread Facebook messages was false. Facebook did not label these messages as misinformation (neither in English nor in Dutch).

What fact-check ?: Staff Gold Coast Hospital Australia gifted volleyball Tom Hanks quarantine .
Explanation: The image has been morphed to claim that Tom Hanks was gifted a volleyball.

What fact-check ?: An infographic shared thousands times multiple Facebook posts claim shows nine-day timeline symptoms novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: This infographic is misleading; it was not distributed by an official health authority and health experts say COVID-19 symptoms vary in duration and severity.

What fact-check ?: A post shared 165,000 times Facebook includes video woman turning baby wipe face mask “ protect coronavirus . ”
Explanation: The company that sells the wipes says they should not be used in this way, and health experts also recommend caution.

What fact-check ?: Eleven coronavirus patients visited malls hotels Metro Manila part `` confidential list . ''
Explanation: The DOH has dismissed the message as fake. The malls and hotels in question have also not posted any advisories regarding possible infection.

What fact-check ?: A vaccine 2019 novel coronavirus found deaths due coronavirus .
Explanation: As of Friday morning, March 20, there is no vaccine or cure for the disease caused by the 2019 novel coronavirus and there have been 217,510 cases and 9,020 deaths, across 157 countries.

What fact-check ?: “ It ’ actually safest time fly . ”
Explanation: Older Americans and those with chronic conditions are advised to reconsider all travel plans to avoid COVID-19. The State Department is advising all citizens to reconsider travel abroad.

What fact-check ?: Drinking “ water lot gargling warm water & salt vinegar eliminates ” coronavirus .
Explanation: Neither drinking a lot of water, nor gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar, has been identified as working against the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: In South Florida “ children adults must remain homes ” due coronavirus .
Explanation: We looked at announcements from several major local governments in south Florida and found no complete lockdown announcements. Gov. Ron DeSantis closed bars and nightclubs statewide.

What fact-check ?: “ President Trump , COVID-19 coronavirus : U.S. cases 1,329 ; U.S. deaths , 38 ; panic level : mass hysteria . President Obama , H1N1 virus : U.S. cases , 60.8 million ; U.S. deaths , 12,469 ; panic level : totally chill . Do see media manipulate life . ”
Explanation: Numbers that suggest H1N1 was worse than COVID-19 are misleading. It’s too early to calculate how deadly the coronavirus will be, but there are signs it’s much worse.

What fact-check ?: Says New York Times exposed “ real reason behind coronavirus hype : Crash market harm Trump ’ re-election chances . ”
Explanation: There's no evidence the coronavirus was manufactured. The New York Times story referenced was an analysis of how current events may influence the election.

What fact-check ?: Sex helps prevent coronavirus .
Explanation: No proves that sex can help fighting the new coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Juventus player Paulo Dybala denies contracting coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Paulo Dybala, on his Twitter account, denied on March 13 that he had contracted the virus.

What fact-check ?: After Contracting coronavirus .. Did Tom Hanks Get Wilson 's Ball In Quarantine .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The original image is from an old video published in February 2015.

What fact-check ?: Aajtak news channel run news claiming consuming herbal plant `` Tulsi '' cure Coronavirus .
Explanation: WHO has not confirmed anything about Tulsi that it cures coronavirus. Aajtak channel has not run anything like that. The viral photo with channel logo is fake.

What fact-check ?: An article `` An Italian doctor working China gives advice avoiding infection '' .
Explanation: The article is filled with outdated, false and misleading advice on how to cure the virus. None of these have been officialy confirmed by WHO or any other relevant institution.

What fact-check ?: Drinking cold water , hot drinks alcohol protects coronavirus .
Explanation: None of these claims hold any medical value.

What fact-check ?: A photo claimed military vehicles combating COVID-19 Palermo , Italy .
Explanation: Sicilian media wrote that military was indeed driving through Palermo, but vehicles were comng back from a military exercise and had nothing to do with the virus as at the time there were a handful of confirmed COVID-19 cases in Sicily.

What fact-check ?: Gargling warm salt water vinegar prevents coronavirus infection .
Explanation: The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Report Cristiano Ronaldo convert hotels coronavirus hospitals .
Explanation: A spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate”; Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

What fact-check ?: 37.000 US soldiers entering EU everybody busy coronavirus , soldiers immune .
Explanation: The Nato exercise Defender Europe 20 is no secret exercise, there are only 29.000 US soldiers and media reported about it for months. Further, it was stopped because of the coronavirus outbreak - soldiers are not immune.

What fact-check ?: The University hospital Vienna found Ibuprofen speeds spreading coronavirus .
Explanation: The voice message tells an untrue story and it is not clear whether Ibuprofen can have a negative effect. There is no proof so far that if affects COVID-19 patients

What fact-check ?: A Facebook post suggests drinking lots water gargling warm water salt vinegar eliminates coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim has not been corroborated by any health institution. The WHO says there is currently no specific treatment, drug or vaccine for the COVID-19, although some home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms.

What fact-check ?: Quotes Finnish national health authorities 20th January 3rd March taken context .
Explanation: Currently, an image with the title "THL and coronavirus in the news" is being circulated in social media, gathering comments from the National Institute for Health and Welfare on coronavirus from January to March. The statements quoted by THL experts are quoted but appear to be largely inaccurate when removed from context. The list as a whole is deliberately misleading. Its purpose is to undermine the credibility of the responsible authority, THL, without providing it with verified information.

What fact-check ?: Corporations invented coronavirus .
Explanation: there is no evidence to support this claim.

What fact-check ?: Curfew Issued For Bossier City Due To coronavirus .
Explanation: The article itself says it's a joke and a prank.

What fact-check ?: CEO Resignations Are Linked To Global Conspiracy .
Explanation: Some CEOs have stepped down since coronavirus outbreak, but there's not evidence to suggest it's all linked to a global power issue.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus found crab legs .
Explanation: Image did not actually come out of real broadcast with typos, and came from an app that let people make their own stories.

What fact-check ?: Military streets Philadelphia preparing invoke martial law bring citizens FEMA camps .
Explanation: Lt. Col. Keith Hickox, the state public affairs officer said the information was false.

What fact-check ?: Article overstates threat coronavirus .
Explanation: The claims in the article are backed by science.

What fact-check ?: Drinking lots water gargling warm water salt vinegar eliminates novel coronavirus . Spread information save someone information .
Explanation: According to GMA news report, saline gargles or gargling with water and salt will provide no protection against or cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus acute respiratory disease (2019-nCoV ARD). The report also carried a statement by the Dr. Eric Domingo “I think this is a home remedy that has been followed for many, many generations and I don’t think there’s going to be any harm in doing it. Saline gargle has always been advocated to improve mostly symptoms of sore throat...I don’t think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus,” Domingo said.

What fact-check ?: Eating salt onion eliminate coronavirus .
Explanation: According to the World Health Organization , eating onions increases the immune system . But it has nothing to do with the treatment of coronovirus. In the investigation we found that no cure for this virus has yet been discovered.

What fact-check ?: Viral image differences cold , flu COVID-19 .
Explanation: The symptoms are not accurate.

What fact-check ?: Catalonia universities give course credits students clases suspended .
Explanation: Education ministry in Catalonia denied it.

What fact-check ?: Spanish home office issued statement announcing complete closure Madrid , Basque Country La Rioja .
Explanation: Home office denied the autentity of the document.

What fact-check ?: Felipe Gonzalez , ex-Prime minister Spain , says Spanish coalition government face covid crisis .
Explanation: The Twitter account is a parody.

What fact-check ?: The current coronavirus `` manufactured '' Wuhan .
Explanation: There is no scientifice reason to belive that.The international scientific community condemns conspiracy theories and recalls that the current coronavirus originated in wildlife.

What fact-check ?: There one hundred children infected COVID-19 main hospital Lima .
Explanation: Authorities denied the information of one hundred children infectec with the virus in that hospital, the main public facility for the treatment of children in Lima.

What fact-check ?: There one hundred children infected COVID-19 main hospital Lima .
Explanation: Authorities denied the information of one hundred children infectec with the virus in that hospital, the main public facility for the treatment of children in Lima.

What fact-check ?: An American soldier paid spread Sars-Cov-2 Europe .
Explanation: The man is the sheriff's deputy Rick Grimes, the main caracter of The Walking Dead and the picture is a tumbnail of the 1st episode of The Walking Dead.

What fact-check ?: Turkish President Erdoğan said curfew declare due COVID-19 .
Explanation: The clipping of the Hurriyet newspaper is manipulated. President Erdoğan's speech did not cover such a measure.

What fact-check ?: Two COVID-19 patients executed North Korea .
Explanation: Content belongs to a parody account. There is no declared COVID-19 case in North Korea.

What fact-check ?: Italian airforce 's airshow motivate public quarantine .
Explanation: The video is shared in 2019, september, before the outbreak. The plains do not belong to Italian army.

What fact-check ?: Ireland going go full lockdown .
Explanation: Despite two messages which were widely shared on WhatsApp, the country did not go into a full military lockdown with the army patrolling the streets. Shops have not been restricted in their opening hours and public transport has not been cancelled.

What fact-check ?: A Facebook post shared tens thousands times purportedly shows rail freight tanker “ COVID-19 ” stamped one side .
Explanation: The image has circulated globally but it is false, the tanker operating company said. And Railinc, a corporation that manages an industry-wide database, said there is no such mark as “COVID.”

What fact-check ?: A graphic shared thousands times Facebook claims gargling warm water salt vinegar eliminate novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Gargling salt water “ eliminates ” 2019 novel coronavirus .
Explanation: Local and international health authorities have said there is not enough study that proves gargling water with salt eliminates the novel coronavirus. To date, there is still no known cure for it.

What fact-check ?: Former senator Antonio Trillanes IV allegedly posted tweet saying President Rodrigo Duterte blame calamities country facing , including novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The tweet came from an account posing as Trillanes. Using his official Twitter account, the former senator explained how the username of the account is different from the one he’s using.

What fact-check ?: Astrologers predicted appearance coronavirus 2020 .
Explanation: Horoscopes and astro forecasts have no scientific basis.

What fact-check ?: “ Italy decided treat elderly virus . ”
Explanation: Italy, second only to China in the number of COVID-19 cases, hasn’t decided to stop treating elderly COVID-19 patients. But the elderly are a lower priority because they are less likely to survive, and hospitals are overwhelmed with coronavirus cases.

What fact-check ?: Says “ 45-minute period press conference ” coronavirus March 13 , 2020 , stock market set `` all-time record . ''
Explanation: The Dow had a record-high point increase on the day Trump declared a national emergency in response to coronavirus, with the surge accelerating during his late-afternoon news conference. But that followed a record point decrease the previous day. And it was followed by a sharp drop by the opening of the next trading day, which saw continued declines before closing.

What fact-check ?: After husband tested positive coronavirus , wife fled Bangalore Agra India .
Explanation: The woman went to her parents place in Agra on 9 March, while her husband was confirmed positive for coronavirus on 12 March. Also, she didn’t enter Bangalore city. Karnataka government has also clarified that the woman didn’t flee to her parents’ place.

What fact-check ?: French Fans Cheered With Joy When President Macron Announced Holiday To Fight coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the video and found it belonged to England fans during a football match between the Wales and England national teams.

What fact-check ?: Video From The German Government To Its Citizens About coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The video is old, and it was posted in 2010 by the University Hospitals Birmingham Hospital via its online platforms.

What fact-check ?: Leaving half onion home 'catch ' coronavirus prevent people getting .
Explanation: Onions are not a way to prevent the coronavirus from entering your home. The claim that onions can help prevent illness has been around since the 1930s.

What fact-check ?: Before reaching lungs , The coronavirus remains throat three four days time person begins cough sore throats . If drink lot water gargle warm water salt vinegar , remove virus .
Explanation: The WHO does not include among its recommendations drinking or gargling with any liquid as a prevention method. Also, that can damage the throat.

What fact-check ?: Drink water lot gargling warm water & salt vinegar eliminate virus .
Explanation: Whenever the virus get into your body, it infects to a cell, not just fall on a throat. Water can't clean the virus from an infected cell, and normally can't get to a respitory system where the virus stay.

What fact-check ?: A Cuban vaccine cured 1.500 people infected new coronavirus .
Explanation: There is still no vaccine available in the market, according to Health Authorities. Experts estimate that it will take about 18 months to develop and test a vaccine that can be used with safety in human beings.

What fact-check ?: A post says drink water lemon prevents new coronavirus .
Explanation: There’s no scientific evidence to support this theory. Health authorities have never made any recommendations regarding water and lemon. It’s not proved.

What fact-check ?: The Simpsons already predicted coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: It’s not true, because the images that are shown to illustrate this were manipulated and are not in accordance with the original images of the series.

What fact-check ?: Claim football star Cristiano Ronaldo converted hotel chain coronavirus hospitals .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: The novel coronavirus new .
Explanation: This is false; coronaviruses affecting cattle or canines differ from the new virus strain affecting humans, for which no vaccine exists.

What fact-check ?: Ugandan president announces postponement elections .
Explanation: The claim is false; an electoral commission official issued a flat denial, labelling the claim “nonsensical”.

What fact-check ?: This video purporting show coronavirus transmitted betwen people
Explanation: The claim is false; the video was produced by a regional hospital trust within the UK’s public healthcare system, the National Health Service (NHS), in May 2010 about how infections spread in hospitals.

What fact-check ?: In France , picture showing policemen spraying tear gas nurses text criticizing Macron 's treatment towards health employees .
Explanation: The picture is said to have been taken "yesterday", ie during the massive demonstrations in favor of the public health services, that took place in France, from March 2019. The picture was taken in 2010, before Macron was even president.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo convert hotels coronavirus hospitals .
Explanation: A spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate”; Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

What fact-check ?: China benefited financially new coronavirus
Explanation: Contrary to what the piece of misinformation suggests, the country's stock exchanges have suffered from the pandemic: two of its most important indices - the CSI 300, which brings together the largest companies in the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges, and the compound Shanghai - have fallen 8% and 0.94% since the beginning of the year. In addition, the coronavirus outbreak caused a reduction in economic activity in China, with a sharp drop in industrial production and retail sales and an increase in the unemployment rate in the first two months of 2020.

What fact-check ?: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals coronavirus Bioweapon .
Explanation: The story originated from a reddit thread which discusses horror stories inspired by true events.

What fact-check ?: Indian Daily Reports That Wife Of A Positive Patient Ran Away , comply authorities tested positive .
Explanation: The Indian daily misreported as the woman had not yet tested positive and she did not flee so as to not be tested.

What fact-check ?: Audio claiming India would put complete lockdown .
Explanation: The government rubbished claims of there being such a lockdown.

What fact-check ?: A video shows Italian doctor says nobody died coronavirus Italy , 's dangerous flu .
Explanation: The video is from February when there were only 11 deaths by coronavirus in Italy. It is not possible to say whether people with prior diseases die only because of the virus. But studies show that also healthy people died so far.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo turn hotels hospitals .
Explanation: Information was published without verification and was denied afterwards.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 arrived US train .
Explanation: The photo has been manipulated.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo turned hotels hospitals .
Explanation: The claim is false.

What fact-check ?: In Spain dozens people faced beatings shoves police prevented going mass pray COVID-19 .
Explanation: The video has nothing to do with the coronavirus, nor with the state of alert decreed in Spain. In fact, when the video was originally released on October 14 last year, there were still no reports of COVID-19 existing in the world.

What fact-check ?: European South American flights cause chaos Mexico Airport , due coronavirus .
Explanation: The video was recorded in December and is not related to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo transformed hotels hospitals COVID-19 patients .
Explanation: Cristiano Ronaldo did not say this and is not planning to do this.

What fact-check ?: A ship China anchored Santa Marta , Colombia .
Explanation: The Yuan Shun Hai ship is not anchored in Santa Marta is anchored and does not come from China.

What fact-check ?: Holding breath 10 seconds tell COVID-19 .
Explanation: This is not an approved method for testing.

What fact-check ?: There 30 cases COVID-19 Barranquilla , government hiding .
Explanation: At the time of publishing there were no confirmed cases.

What fact-check ?: Nostradamus predicted coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The text used as proof is not found on Nostradamus' writings.

What fact-check ?: State emergency begins Tuesday , 17th , according article 116 Constitution
Explanation: The text is from Spain.

What fact-check ?: Gargles hot water salt prevent COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is no scientific basis for this claim.

What fact-check ?: China successfully developes vaccine ready combat coronavirus .
Explanation: China announed the vaccine began clinical trial, not that it was developed successfully.

What fact-check ?: Lombardia , Italy , ask Cuba , China Venezuela send doctors .
Who said/posted it?: Said by Giulio Gallera, posted by many media and Twitter users, specially related to Maduro
Explanation: Gallera really said that but the next day he explained venezuelan doctors weren´t related to Maduro but to Piccola Venezia, a local Italian-venezuela NGO. China send doctors with no relations with him and was Cuba, and not him, which offers to help a week before his speech.

What fact-check ?: Left-wing Spanish politicians Irene Montero Pablo Iglesias private sanitarian services waiting front homes .
Explanation: Madrid's Health Department, the emergency medical service and PODEMOS say it is false.

What fact-check ?: A message chain claim message Stanford hospital gives advice frink water every 15 mintes order prevent COVID-19 .
Explanation: A statement from the Stanford hospital distanced themselves from the fake message.

What fact-check ?: Helicopter armed forces disinfects streets night .
Explanation: There is not such mesure of disinfectation.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo decided turn hotels free hospital .
Explanation: Cristiano Ronaldo has never decide to turn his hotels in to free hospitals.

What fact-check ?: Four young people hospitalised coronavirus exacerbated use ibuprofen .
Explanation: The message, which was widely shared, had no basis in fact. It did not match the description of any patients in the hospital in question, and it misrepresented the dangers of ibuprofen

What fact-check ?: “ Bill Gates told us coronavirus 2015 . ”
Explanation: In the 2015 TED talk featured in the video, he never actually uses the word coronavirus, nor does he mention COVID-19. But his comments do sound prescient. He talks about an epidemic and we’re now in the midst of a pandemic. People could be infected with COVID-19 and not show symptoms for days, if at all. And it’s mainly spread between people in close contact through respiratory droplets when someone coughs or sneezes.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 large size , cell diameter 400-500 micrometers . For reason , mask prevent entry .
Explanation: The cell diameter is around 120 nanometers. The surgical mask can protect the wearer from sprays and large-particle droplets, but not against infection with coronavirus. People are recommended to wear a mask if taking care of a person with suspected COVID-19 infection.

What fact-check ?: A video showing man infected coronavirus touching pieces bread supermarket Europe .
Explanation: It's a set up video, published by a humouristic American Facebook page, called "The Philly offensive". The author of this page explained having filmed this scene, explaining he hates when people touch bread in supermarkets, but without mentioning coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Graphics information COVID-19 containing Unicef branding inaccurate information .
Explanation: A series of infographics with Unicef branding making claims about COVID-19 are not from the UN agency.

What fact-check ?: A situation update allegedly Kenya 's Citizen TV stating number COVID-19 cases .
Explanation: A post is with an update about COVID-19 in Kenya containing a screenshot of a Facebook post by Citizen TV is fake.

What fact-check ?: A meme shared Facebook Twitter claims show image fully stocked shelves toilet paper , purportedly 2009 H1N1 outbreak , another barren shelves ongoing COVID-19 pandemic .
Explanation: The post is misleading; the image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from US news footage shot this year, not in 2009.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed 2.4 million times Facebook urges people inhale steam “ kill ” novel coronavirus .
Explanation: But experts say that doing so will not treat or cure the viral infection, and could in fact be harmful.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed thousands times multiple posts Facebook , Twitter YouTube claim shows Chinese police arresting people infected novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video shows police arresting pro-democracy protesters at a subway station in Hong Kong in August 2019.

What fact-check ?: Research made scientists University Queensland Australia proven bananas improve immune system help prevent COVID-19 .
Explanation: The University of Queensland dismissed the claim as false. In an email to Rappler, the university’s communication team said: “The video is fake and we would strongly discourage people from sharing this information. We would suggest you share your concerns with the social media platforms.”

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo transformed hotels hospitals fight COVID-19 .
Explanation: Cristiano Ronaldo refuted those claims.

What fact-check ?: A large crowd Paris protested lockdown .
Explanation: It was an anti-Government demonstration conducted by yellow-vest activities. As the protest took place on March 14, the French government had not implemented the national lockdown.

What fact-check ?: The spread new coronavirus planned Rockefellers years ago .
Explanation: Scenarios are widely used as analytical methods in simulations. Scenario, which elaborates on the pandemic threat, has nothing to do with the global conspiracy. It is about futurology and possible crisis response management.

What fact-check ?: The World Health Organization offered testing kits available give us . We refused . We want buy . ”
Explanation: The WHO never offered to sell test kits to the United States. The CDC opted to develop its own coronavirus test and did not use the WHO’s protocol for the test.

What fact-check ?: Says Donald Trump “ cut funding CDC , ” “ fired Pandemic Response Team , ” “ refused WHO tests ” “ wasted two weeks calling outbreak ‘ Democrat hoax . ’ ”
Explanation: Trump did attempt to cut the CDC’s funding, but Congress prevented it from happening. While officials in charge of the U.S. response to pandemics did leave in 2018, it’s unclear if they were “fired.” The U.S. was not on a list of countries receiving COVID-19 tests from the WHO. But the U.S. doesn’t usually rely on the agency for diagnostic tests, and the testing delay was due mainly to an error with the CDC’s protocol. While Trump has called the Democratic response to the coronavirus a “hoax,” he has not used the term to describe the virus itself.

What fact-check ?: The claim cure new coronavirus . The name drug decametoxine .
Explanation: There is no proof that the drug in question can be used in the treatment of coronavirus-infected.

What fact-check ?: Pandemics happen every 100 years .
Explanation: Global pandemics do not occur every 100 years as God's or nature's scourge. The authors of this fake have selected only those pandemics, which fit into their explanation.

What fact-check ?: Quarantine may last several years .
Explanation: The information has no support from the official's side. It is posted to spread panic.

What fact-check ?: `` COVID-19 started eat animals . ''
Explanation: Scientists think COVID-19 originated in bats and then jumped to another animal host, possibly pangolins, before spreading to humans. As of now, there is no evidence that eating meat is the source of the coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: `` George Soros owns WuXi PHARMA LAB located Wuhan , China COVID-19 developed conveniently Broke Out . ''
Explanation: George Soros has invested in WuXi in the past, but he does not own it. Research shows the genetic makeup of COVID-19 precludes it from being man-made.

What fact-check ?: Says coronavirus “ damn flu . ”
Explanation: Coronavirus and the flu do have similarities in spread and symptoms, but there are huge differences in the death rate and ability to treat coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: “ So Oscar Health , company tapped Trump profit covid tests , Kushner company . Imagine , profits national safety . ”
Explanation: Oscar Health does have ties to the Kushner family through Jared Kushner and more directly through Jared’s brother, Joshua Kushner. Oscar Health created a website for finding coronavirus testing locations. The project was launched on the same day that Trump announced a similar partnership with Google.

What fact-check ?: Says businesses give free baby formula coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: Several formula producers have released statements saying the rumor is a hoax.

What fact-check ?: Drug `` ibuprofen '' aggravating factor , one use `` paracetamol '' instead .
Who said/posted it?: Media citing the French Ministry of Health
Explanation: Based on currently available information, WHO does not recommend against the use of of ibuprofen.

What fact-check ?: Actor Tom Hanks died due coronavirus .
Explanation: This is a hoax. Tom hanks and his wife is recovering from coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: The Italian Medical Sector Is Angry At Ronaldo .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The first claim deals with attributing a tweet to a Spanish biology researcher who blames her government for the poor salary biologists receive, while the second claim deals with the content of the tweet itself that Cristiano Ronaldo receives one million euros, unlike doctors who receive 1,300 euros per month. The news is misleading.

What fact-check ?: Ronaldo Bought Island To Isolate Himself coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the news and confirmed its falsity, as Cristiano Ronaldo did not buy an island to isolate him with his family, and the fact is that after suspending the Serie A matches due to the outbreak of COVID-19, he returned to the Portuguese island of Madeira, his hometown in the Atlantic Ocean.

What fact-check ?: Bahraini Women Escape From Quarantine .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: A video depicts Bahraini women escape quarantine and the police are chasing them. The video depicts part of the clashes that occurred between protesters and the Bahraini police during the protests that broke out in 2012.

What fact-check ?: Guatemalan Ministry Health hiding COVID-19 case hospital city Amatitlán .
Explanation: There wasn´t any hidden cases in Amatitlán.

What fact-check ?: Supermarkets Germany open two days week . A screenshot shows report media outlet Focus .
Explanation: Supermarkets are open like usual. The screenshot is doctored; Focus did not report this.

What fact-check ?: The photo porn actor used pass health professional .
Explanation: Several publications on Facebook and Twitter, some with up to 24 thousand interactions, present Ángel Muñoz, popularly known as "Jordi el Niño Polla", as part of various teams to deal with the pandemic due to the new coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Study Queensland Australia says banana day prevents COVID19 vitB6 .
Explanation: The university mentioned in the claim refuted this claim. there is no scientific research till now says that banana or vitB6 prevent COVID-19 infection.

What fact-check ?: President Vucic claimed according EU decisions , Serbia import medicial equipment EU countries .
