Explanation: Exports of medical equipment outside of the EU are subject to an export authorisation by Member States. Serbia can import such equimpment but it requires an authorization.

What fact-check ?: `` Amoxi '' Capsule , made US , medicine completely cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: Amoxillin has nothing to do with COVID-19. It's an antibiotic drug for killing bacteria, not a virus.

What fact-check ?: Drugs used malaria ( Hydroxychloroquine , Azithromycin ) cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: The medicines used by medical doctor to cure the desease, but people shouldn't find for curing themselves because it could be a life-threat by its side-effect.

What fact-check ?: You test quality reusable mask blowing lighter wear .
Explanation: Blowing lighter is not a way to test mask quality. Blowing power are vary. Beware buring your mask.

What fact-check ?: Footballer Ronaldo turning hotels Covid-19 hospitals .
Explanation: No evidence Ronaldo's luxury hotels in Portugal are being turned into hospitals.

What fact-check ?: No coronavirus Nigeria yet , according pastor .
Explanation: The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control reported the country’s first case of coronavirus on 27 February – more than two weeks before pastor's video was posted on YouTube. A second case was confirmed on 9 March.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo going transform hotels hospitals .
Explanation: It’s not true that the Portuguese football player is doing this. Observador spoke with sources close to the Hotels and the player and found out that it was false.

What fact-check ?: Having patent virus means created virus .
Explanation: Other fact-checkers before us showed that this and that patent were not related to this coronavirus, but we realized that much of the claims are coming from a misunderstanding of what the word "patent" means in 2020, and especially in life sciences.

What fact-check ?: This video shows Italian People greetings clapping China Covid-19 emergency .
Explanation: The video has been edited by adding the Chinese National anthem and a voice saying "Thank you China". However, the video is not related at all to China. On the contrary, people clapping in the video are supporting Italian healthcare personel during an organized flash mob.

What fact-check ?: Nostradamus , predicted current COVID-19 pandemic .
Explanation: The text attributed to Nostradamus does not exist in his book.

What fact-check ?: The word `` coronavirus '' used various sanitary products suggest outbreak COVID-19 planned operation .
Explanation: Term coronavirus describes a group of viruses known to man for decades.

What fact-check ?: Gargling warm water salt and-or vinegar kills SARS-CoV-2 .
Explanation: No proof that salt and/or vinegar can kill the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Clinics Philippines turning away people COVID-19 symptoms , advisory department health .
Explanation: The claim is false; the Philippine Department of Health denied issuing the advisory.

What fact-check ?: Red soap white handkerchiefs good coronavirus .
Explanation: But the recommended practices are misleading; health experts told AFP there is no scientific basis for many of the claims, which include using red-coloured soap and white handkerchiefs, as well as obtaining specific light bulbs.

What fact-check ?: Israel allegedly developed COVID-19 vaccine
Explanation: The claim is misleading; the image used to illustrate a vial of the new drug is originally a stock picture while the MIGAL Research Institute in Israel, despite having a head start, continues to work on a vaccine for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed tens thousands times Facebook YouTube purports show billionaire businessman Jack Ma praising China ’ response outbreak novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: But the video has been doctored; the original video shows Jack Ma at a meeting of former Alibaba employees in 2018, at least one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan; the voiceover in the clip has been taken from another clip which shows a different man speaking.

What fact-check ?: A photo showing two military vehicles transported truck highway , near Paris , used French population 's confinement .
Explanation: The vehicle transporter and the army told AFP that it was a routine trip, unrelated to the COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: On March 16th , Macron already announced quarantine every cities France announce later day passage `` stage 4 '' epidemic .
Who said/posted it?: Screenshots of an article published by actuainfo.info
Explanation: Stage 4 means back to normal and Emmanuel Macron has not made announces yet about quarantine. The website appears to be a clickbait website.

What fact-check ?: A legal decree France , published March 15th , sets ground use army fight novel coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: Twitter users (such as lawyers) but also the website Reporterre.net
Explanation: If using the army in the fight against the novel coronavirus is possible, it has nothing to do with the legal decree published on March 15th, according to the Ministry of the Armed Forces. This legal decree only simplifies the management of soldiers deployed to work for other organizations, according to the Ministry.

What fact-check ?: Claim coronavirus stays throat 4 days reaching lungs gargling lukewarm water vinegar salt kill .
Explanation: Neither water temperature, salt, nor vinegar has any impact on the coronavirus, according to experts interviewed by the AFP and recommendations from WHO and health authorities in several countries.

What fact-check ?: You self-diagnose COVID-19 holding breath ten seconds , avoid COVID-19 drinking water constantly . Also , COVID-19 causes fibrosis lungs .
Explanation: None of this is true. COVID-19 does not cause lung fibrosis, which renders the "hold your breath" argument senseless. Also, drinking water constantly does not help you to avoid it.

What fact-check ?: Drinking water gargling salt vinegar eliminate novel coronavirus
Explanation: According to the brazilian Ministry of Health and experts consulted by Aos Fatos, this information is untrue and may even worsen the patient's condition. Publications circulating on social media with misleading content also omit that there is still no drug or treatment to cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Israel found cure vaccine coronavirus .
Explanation: The video report shared with these posts actually shows the process of developing a vaccine that, according to the scientists in charge, may be available in May. At no time does the video claim that the drug already exists or that a cure for the infection with the new coronavirus has been found.

What fact-check ?: Indian industrialist tweets specific mask kill viruses .
Explanation: The mask is an anti-pollution mask and its effect on COVID-19 is not scientifically explained.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo 's hotels turned quarantine centres Portugal .
Explanation: Footballer's hotel chains denied any such claims.

What fact-check ?: Chinese Police crackdown suspected coronavirus patients .
Explanation: Video is originally from the Hong Kong protests.

What fact-check ?: A video supposedly shows Italians French people singing Madonna , Katy Perry , Britney Spears Aya Nakamura balcony lockdown measure France Italy .
Who said/posted it?: Madonna official Twitter account, Katy Perry official Twitter account etc.
Explanation: The video was shot in Torino (Italy) and people are singing and dancing La Macarana.

What fact-check ?: The ice skating rink Mulhouse requisitioned used morgue .
Explanation: The rink is not used to stock dead bodies.

What fact-check ?: An official decree taken government says military help hospitals .
Who said/posted it?: French community on Twitter and Facebook
Explanation: The text is just a transposition of an old law into a decree - and has nothing to do with the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: President Donald Trump next 48 72 hours impose nationwide “ mandatory quarantine . ”
Explanation: The White House’s National Security Council addressed the claim in a statement on Twitter, saying: “Text message rumors of a national #quarantine are FAKE. There is no national lockdown.”

What fact-check ?: Gargling water salt vinegar “ eliminates ” coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no known treatment for the new coronavirus,according to WHO.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus pneumonia similar dry cough & Hot Weather , Garlic And Hot Water Are Remedies COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is no scientific proof that hot and humid weather conditions or drinking warm water and consumption of garlic, onions and other spices can prevent the spread of novel coronavirus infection.

What fact-check ?: Claims Of Cures For COVID-19 From Multiple Countries .
Explanation: While some drugs have provided symptomatic improvement, there is no confirmation that any of the medication currently being tested across different parts of the world is a definitive cure for COVID-19. WHO officially confirms there has not been any definitive vaccine or antiviral drug developed to prevent or treat COVID-19 to date, hence all above claims are misleading.

What fact-check ?: Photo Meat ( mutton ) affected coronavirus .
Explanation: It is a photoshopped image. No proof so far that coronavirus is present in mutton.

What fact-check ?: Office Memorandum Indian Ministry Health & Family Welfare declaring holidays states Maharashtra , Gujarat , Uttar Pradesh Sikkim wake COVID-19 .
Explanation: No, the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare hasn’t declared holidays to the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Sikkim. The Office Memorandum with such information is ‘fake’.

What fact-check ?: 35 Italians tourists n't want leave Ethiopia go back Italy coronavirus .
Explanation: Testimonies seems to be invented and the characters quoted does not exist. The website is well known for clickbait content and false stories.

What fact-check ?: All baby formula providers shipping formula free coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: Enfamil and Gerber issued statements clarifying this is a hoax.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus Outbreak Prompted Gun And Ammunition Policy Changes At Walmart .
Explanation: Walmart had already changed its ammo sales policy on September 3, 2019, a month after a gunman killed 22 people at one of its stores in El Paso, Texas.

What fact-check ?: Dallas student celebrating spring break collapses coronavirus .
Explanation: Came from fake news generator website.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus least deadly virus .
Explanation: The chart, published by Business Insider, issued a correction on the chart exaggerating its figures. But the false info still spreads.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo turning hotels hospitals fight coronavirus .
Explanation: Ronaldo's management company denied the claim.

What fact-check ?: WalMart reducing hours operation .
Explanation: WalMart website confirms

What fact-check ?: Tanker train marked 'COVID-9 ' side .
Explanation: Photo was digitally manipulated

What fact-check ?: CDC warning people morel mushroom increases coronavirus risk 200 % .
Explanation: User who published made clear this was a hoax.

What fact-check ?: Italian doctors recommend taking shoes get home .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Christine Lagarde says elderly living long .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Ecuadorean President Lenin Moreno family quarantined luxury Galapagos home .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Ibuprofen worsen coronavirus infection .
Explanation: Ibuprofen could worsen some conditions but there are not proof it could include COVID-19. Spanish health authorities has communicated that ibuprofen is not contraindicated to treat first or mild cases.

What fact-check ?: 30 cases new coranvirus city Barranquilla , Colombia .
Explanation: At the time of this publicaction, the Health ministry hadn´t confirmed any cases of coronavirus in Barranquilla.

What fact-check ?: Saline water kills new coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no solid scientific evidence to indicate that mouthwash and saline water kills coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Police issued `` domiciliation order '' Madrid stay home fine 1000€ .
Explanation: The National Police has denied on its Twitter account this document that forces the citizens of Madrid to remain at home from 9 p.m. to 9 a.m

What fact-check ?: EFE news agency published tweet announcing Government impose fines 300,000 euros people travel regions .
Explanation: EFE news agency denies it published that tuit. Also, Newtral could not find any proof that the agency published the tweet.

What fact-check ?: `` A looting '' supermarket due coronavirus .
Explanation: The images were recorded three years ago in an establishment of the supermarket chain HiperDino.

What fact-check ?: Irene Montero caughing someone 8M women protest .
Explanation: The subtitles are manipulated. irene Montero and the concerned person deny the false claim.

What fact-check ?: Egypt Health Minister given China vaccine coronavirus .
Explanation: World Health Organization (WHO) states that to date, there is no vaccine or drug to prevent or treat COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Insurance companies Spain cease cover traffic accidents due coronavirus .
Explanation: The Insurance Business Association UNESPA, which includes 200 companies in the sector, has debunked the hoax.

What fact-check ?: Insurance companies stop covering traffic accidents coronavirus .
Explanation: The UNESPA Business Insurance Association deneid it.

What fact-check ?: EFE published move one Spanish region another state alarm fined 300,000 euros .
Explanation: It is false both the application of that measure and that EFE has published it.

What fact-check ?: Insurance companies stop covering auto accident policies alarm state .
Explanation: Auto insurance coverage to third parties and to all risks will continue to be assumed by insurers as before the declaration of the state of alarm.

What fact-check ?: Helicopters spray Spanish cities disinfect coronaviruses .
Explanation: It's a hoax. The Spanish Government has no plans of spraying cities.

What fact-check ?: President Giammattei said economic activity would limited didn´t mention call centers maquilas .
Explanation: Maquilas and call centers continue operating and there are many complains of COVID-19 risks from their workers.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo decided turn hotels free hospitals .
Explanation: Cristiano Ronaldo has never decide to turn his hotels in to free hospitals.

What fact-check ?: Italy space flash mob March 2020 .
Explanation: The picture has been taken 2014.

What fact-check ?: Turkish Ministry Health issued document shows radical measures COVID-19 .
Explanation: The document is fake and the signature in the document belongs to famous boxer Vitali Klitschko.

What fact-check ?: Women 's inhouse gatherings banned due outbreak .
Explanation: The ministry of family did not issue an order bans women's gatherings.

What fact-check ?: New virus stays throat level four days .
Explanation: The virus attaches human cells and does not wait to replicate itself. It is not possible to push the virus into stomach by drinking water.

What fact-check ?: Turmeric And Lemon Help Fight Against coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no evidence to prove that turmeric and lemon help fight against coronavirus. The viral post is fake.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus patient arrested Punjab
Explanation: Mock drill video of Mansa, Punjab viral with false claim

What fact-check ?: Corona Virus Detection Can Be Done Holding Your Breath 10 Seconds
Explanation: Whether someone is positive or not is infected with the coronavirus can only be known through laboratory tests. In addition, no health organization, such as the US CDC and WHO, and also the Ministry of Health have included fibrosis as a symptom of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Drinking Alcohol Can Kill Corona COVID-19 Virus
Explanation: According to WHO, when the virus has entered a person's body, spraying alcohol or even drinking it will not be able to kill the virus.

What fact-check ?: Viral WhatsApp message suggested Uber services Ghana suspended consequent pandemic .
Explanation: Uber Services are still available in Accra and other parts of the country.

What fact-check ?: Says military Humvee labeled “ COVID-19 quarantine team ” Interstate 696 Michigan .
Explanation: The same image has been shared and described as a vehicle spotted in Ohio and London in the Unied Kingdom.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed tens thousands times Facebook YouTube purports show billionaire businessman Jack Ma praising China ’ response outbreak novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: But the video has been doctored; the original video shows Jack Ma at a meeting of former Alibaba employees in 2018, at least one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan; the voiceover in the clip has been taken from another clip which shows a different man speaking.

What fact-check ?: Donald Trump “ announcing tomorrow US going quarantine next 14 days . ”
Explanation: There was no evidence by March 16 that the federal government was set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said he was not considering it. Trump said the government is thinking about additional measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in some hotspots around the country.

What fact-check ?: President Donald Trump “ evoke ( sic ) called Stafford act ” “ order two week mandatory quarantine nation . ”
Explanation: There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said March 16 that he was not considering it. The Stafford Act authorizes aid to state and local governments and is commonly used during hurricanes. It does not mandate a nationwide lockdown.

What fact-check ?: “ Now , stands , health care system adequate ventilators , ICU beds , medical professionals . ”
Explanation: Experts said all evidence points to the U.S. being short on hospital beds, ICUs and ventilators, assuming COVID-19 continues to spread. The U.S. could take any number of actions to increase the number of hospital beds, supplies and medical staff available.

What fact-check ?: Says Anthony Fauci ’ statement coronavirus death rate 10 times seasonal flu “ claim without scientific basis . ''
Explanation: It’s not yet known what the death rate from the current coronavirus, COVID-19, will be. But early data indicate it is more than 10 times higher than the death rate for the flu.

What fact-check ?: “ Sunlight actually kill [ novel coronavirus ] . ”
Explanation: This is a common theory because sunlight contains ultraviolet rays, which can kill bacteria. However, experts say the sun's UV light isn't intense enough to rely on as a disinfectant.

What fact-check ?: Video shows problems faced Chinese police catching coronavirus-infected people .
Explanation: The video has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic. It was shot last year in September during Hong Kong's ongoing pro-democracy protest.

What fact-check ?: Flu vaccine increases coronavirus risk 36 % , says military study .
Explanation: More research is needed to provide a conclusive answer to the question of whether the flu shot increases the risk of non-influenza viral respiratory infections. It is important to keep in mind that while the flu vaccine cannot prevent COVID-19, it still provides several indirect benefits. For example, it reduces cases of flu and flu complications that require hospitalization, in turn reducing the burden on the healthcare system, which has become strained during the COVID-19 pandemic.

What fact-check ?: Details three Coronavirus positive cases reported Kothapet ( Hyderabad , India ) .
Explanation: Dr G Srinivasa Rao (Director of Public Health, Telangana) has told FACTLY that the viral message is not true. Also, Rachakonda Police has tweeted that a FIR has been filed in the Chaitanyapuri PS (Kothapet area) on the person who spread the fake news.

What fact-check ?: One get free masks government fight coronavirus filling form web link .
Explanation: These are dubious web links. The government is not making any such offer.

What fact-check ?: Does Israeli Minister Health Provide Information On coronavirus Palestinians .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the claim and found that it is misleading; despite the existence of information on the Israeli minister of health website in Arabic, but all of it are preliminary in comparison with what it is published in Hebrew.

What fact-check ?: Trump : Swiss Company Roche Discovered A Cure coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: US President states that the Swiss company Roche have discovered a cure for COVID-19. The video is out of context and the claim is fake.

What fact-check ?: Video shows arrest first coronavirus case Jordan .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: A video shows arresting of Tamer, the first Jordanian tested positive for COVID-19, after he escaped his quarantine. The spokesperson of the General Security Forces told Misbar that the video is fake, despite that they actually arrested Tamer in the 15th of March.

What fact-check ?: Photo Shows The Solidarity Italian People Against coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the photo and found that it is old, dating back to 2013.

What fact-check ?: Photo shows Palestinians Solidarity With Italy
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar found that the photo showed Israel's solidarity, not Palestine.

What fact-check ?: A post shared tens thousands times Facebook Twitter claim official advisory issued Singapore ’ Ministry Health first symptoms novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; a spokesperson for the Singaporean health body told AFP it had not issued the purported advisory.

Countries: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
What fact-check ?: The new coronavirus COVID-19 US biological weapon China Italy ; Milorad Dodik , Serb member BiH presidency , infected COVID-19 .
Explanation: Considering the impact of novel coronavirus on the US people, such a claim doesn't make any sense. It's also completely unfounded. Radovan Kovačević debunked the false news about Milorad Dodik being infected with COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Does stage 4 epidemic mean `` quarantine cities France '' ?
Explanation: Stage 4 of an epidemic in France doesn't imply general quarantine, on the contrary. The fourth and last stage of an epidemic means a gradual return to normal situation. France is still in stage 3, according to the authorities and to medical experts.

What fact-check ?: The covid-19 test kits Korean company deemed suspicious U.S. Congress .
Explanation: Not true. Some Korean media reported this because of a translation error.

What fact-check ?: Misleading headline closure ofthe airport Skopje : `` THE AIRPORT ALSO CLOSED : 26 passengers Skopje Airport returned , foreign nationals '' .
Explanation: Because the measure of complete closure applies to Ohrid Airport, it is quite possible that the reader will be misinformed and think that this has happened to Skopje Airport as well. The ban on entering the territory of the country according to the government decision that is in force at the time of publishing the reviewed text refers to the countries exclusively at high risk for Covid-19. Therefore, it is not true that the airport is closed to everyone, as the title suggests, but only to these passengers.

What fact-check ?: Untrue report entire large group citizens Republic North Macedonia , i.e . every member party named Social Democratic Union Macedonia ( SDSM ) , quarantined , allegedly contact director Skin Clinic Skopje , infected Covid-19 .
Explanation: There is no official information that a decision has been made by any competent state body to guarantee that the entire party membership of the SDSM were quarantined.

What fact-check ?: A sensationalist headline : `` CHAOS IN DEBAR : Roadblocks , fires , apocalyptic scenes Macedonia '' .
Explanation: Of course, the entrance and exit from the city are strictly controlled and only citizens with proper documentation can leave the city - in case they need urgent medical care that they cannot get from the local health care. But there are no barricades, which can be seen in the photos, nor any apocalyptic scenes.

What fact-check ?: Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro declared national holiday due coronavirus .
Explanation: The "national holiday" was a prank shared by users on WhatsApp..

What fact-check ?: Nostradamus predicted coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: There is no reference to such prophecy in Nostradamus' works.

What fact-check ?: Brazilian beverage company Ambev stops beer production .
Explanation: Ambev denied any stop in its production.

What fact-check ?: A man touching push-cart tongue spread virus outside Lidl Lithuania .
Explanation: The video is most likely shot in Lebanon and definately not in Lithuania.

What fact-check ?: A train marked `` COVID-19 '' spotted US .
Explanation: The photo was doctored.

What fact-check ?: A graphic shared multiple posts Facebook alongside claim contains quote Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo bats `` enemy '' novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: The indian government distributing free face masks .
Explanation: However, the claim is false; the Indian government said there is no such scheme in place and the linked website is not an official government site.

What fact-check ?: The Australian Prime minister announce national lockdown .
Explanation: The claim is misleading; the Australian Prime Minister’s Office refuted the details of the post; Australia's government told its citizens on March 18 not to travel abroad and warned those already overseas to come home but did not order a "lockdown"; AFP found the wording of the misleading posts was identical to Malaysia’s announcement of a nationwide lockdown.

What fact-check ?: This photo shows Sri Lankan airline pilot tested positive novel coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim is false; the local health authority told AFP the pilot is not pictured in the photo; the man wrongly identified in the posts denied the claim.

What fact-check ?: Claim Russian supermarkets imposing pre-filled trolleys basic food midst coronavirus crisis .
Explanation: Auchan Russia told AFP photos had been taken during a special event earlier in the week and that there is no pre-filled trolleys for customers because of coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Claim 35 people infected coronavirus treated Ivory Coast within military station , quoting document French investigation website Mediapart .
Explanation: French embassy in Ivory Coast and the Ivory Coast government denied this claim to AFP. Mediapart told AFP it has "no information" about this.

What fact-check ?: Photo showing bad accommodations conditions people recently arrived country quarantined novel coronavirus .
Explanation: The photo was first published in February 2017 on TripAdvisor to denounce the bad accommodations of an hostel in South Africa.

What fact-check ?: Water boiled garlic cures coronavirus .
Explanation: There's no scientific evidence of that.

What fact-check ?: Israel already developed vaccine COVID-19
Explanation: Migal Galilee Research Institute, in Israel, is currently one of many labs trying to develop a vaccine agaisnt COVID-19. They claim their vaccine might be ready for tests in 8-10 weeks.

What fact-check ?: Avoid drinking cold water pandemic ; exposed sunlight .
Explanation: Neither is proven to have any effect on the disease.

What fact-check ?: Universal Church Kingdom God selling 500 brazilian reals `` blessed '' hand-sanitizer bottles .
Explanation: The image was digitally altered to include fake information and the Universal church logo.

What fact-check ?: Brazilian singer Preta Gil singing carnival `` bloco '' infected coronavirus .
Explanation: She very likely caught the coronavirus seven days after her last public concert, while singing at a wedding that has become a major hub of COVID-19 dissemination. On March 1st, date of her last public concert, there were still only two cases confirmed in the country.

What fact-check ?: Staff two Mumbai hotels COVID positive cases .
Explanation: Both the hotels denied having any such cases.

What fact-check ?: Donald Trump announced vaccine Roche Diagnostics .
Explanation: Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for testing kits, not a vaccine.

What fact-check ?: Narendra Modi giving free masks India .
Explanation: A fake phishing website was set up in the name of Narendra Modi.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus patients arrested Punjab , India .
Explanation: The video is of a mock drill which is being passed off as real.

What fact-check ?: The military coming Paris virus .
Explanation: Normal military movements ; nothing to do with the covid.

What fact-check ?: Another rumor claims military coming Paris virus .
Explanation: Normal military movements ; nothing to do with the covid.

What fact-check ?: Although Germany closes borders refugees migrants may still come medically checked coronavirus .
Explanation: Asylum seekers may under certain circumstances still come to Germany, but they are not the only persons allowed to cross the border. And there will be medical checks if they are infected.

What fact-check ?: Medical University Vienna published study regarding ibuprofen coronavirus .
Explanation: There was no such study, Medical University of Vienna denied it and rated is as fake news. Relation between ibuprofen treatment and worsening conditions of patients with COVID-19 is still researched but unproven at the moment.

What fact-check ?: An image shows `` Spanish biologist '' claimed footballers earn millions euros research cure coronavirus .
Explanation: This is not the Spanish Biologist. Her name is Isabel García Tejerina and she is former Spanish Minister of Agriculture.

What fact-check ?: WHO approves anti-Malarial drug Chloroquine COVID-19 .
Explanation: Fact Crescendo found the details mentioned in the news published by Economic Times to be False. WHO has not declared, approved or recommended anti-malarial drug Chloroquine as a treatment medicine for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Thailand CDC announces green chiretta cure coronavirus .
Explanation: No such evidence for curing COVID-19 with green chiretta is recommended by WHO or Thailand CDC.

What fact-check ?: Traditional Cures And Self-Checks For coronavirus .
Explanation: Our fact check reveals that there is no scientific evidence to prove that drinking water washes down COVID-19 and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar eliminates the coronavirus. Similarly the self-check breath test for coronavirus is absolutely baseless.

What fact-check ?: Video Police China taking control suspected COVID-19 patients country .
Explanation: The video shows Police in Hong Kong taking into control demonstrators who were protesting against the introduction of a controversial bill that would have allowed extraditions to mainland China.

What fact-check ?: After husband tested positive coronavirus , wife fled Bangalore Agra India .
Explanation: The woman went to her parents place in Agra on 9 March, while her husband was confirmed positive for coronavirus on 12 March. Also, she didn’t enter Bangalore city. Karnataka government has also clarified that the woman didn’t flee to her parents’ place.

What fact-check ?: 5000 million Rupees fund allocated Telangana CM KCR coronavirus prevention entirely funded Central Government .
Explanation: No, the entire fund is not given by the Central Government.

What fact-check ?: Video American President Donald Trump announcing Roche Medical Company launch vaccine COVID-19 next Sunday .
Explanation: In the video, American President Donald Trump hasn’t said that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. He announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’ developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

What fact-check ?: 2000 people died COVID-19 one day ( March 15 ) France .
Explanation: As per WHO, 36 people died of COVID-19 in France on March 15, not 2000 people.

What fact-check ?: Oman releasing pesticides air helicopters eliminate coronavirus .
Explanation: Oman's Health Minsitry has clarified that they are not conducting any such operation with helicopters.

What fact-check ?: Drinking water every 15 mins protect people coronavirus .
Explanation: WHO has clarified that drinking water is important for overall health but it does not prevent coronavirus infection.

What fact-check ?: Gargling lukewarm water mixed salt/vinegar remove coronavirus .
Explanation: Press Information Bureau (India) has clarified that coronavirus cannot be treated by gargling with warm water mixed with salt and vinegar.

What fact-check ?: A dog vaccine used coronavirus people .
Explanation: There is still no approved vaccine for coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: 15 minutes sauna kill coronavirus .
Explanation: Infectious disease epidemiologist debunked this

What fact-check ?: Eating bananas prevents coronavirus .
Explanation: The video splices together clips to make incorrect and misleading information.

What fact-check ?: Italy mandated treatment elderly patients coronavirus .
Explanation: The guidelines to ration care to those with higher survivability are only suggestions at this point.

What fact-check ?: All U.S. Citizens Are Entitled To $ 700 Per Week To Stay At Home To Avoid Spread Of coronavirus
Explanation: U.S. citizens may get some economic relief from Congress at some point, but that could still be a few weeks away.

What fact-check ?: List comparing diseases coronavirus .
Explanation: The comparison of the outbreaks is extremely misleading as it doesn't take into account the rate of infections, timeframes of the outbreaks and the rapid rise in the number of COVID-19 cases.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 A Scripted Narrative To Justify Closed Borders Or Force Residents To Remain Home
Explanation: Debunked as a conspiracy theory.

What fact-check ?: Football player Cristiano Ronaldo turned hotels hospitals help coronavirus patients paying doctors staff .
Explanation: A spokesperson for the hotel denied the claim stating "We are a hotel. We are not going to be a hospital. It is a day like everyone else, we are and will remain a hotel." The news was also denied by HRT, Gol, Haber, Pogled, Flash and Hayat, while the Sport and Magazine plus portals deleted their articles.

What fact-check ?: A mixture vinegar fabric softener better desinfectant alcohol .
Explanation: Even when vinegar and quaternary ammonium included in some fabric softeners do have some antibacterial properties, its mixture is not more effective than alcohol in innactivating viruses and killing bacteria. This mixture is not included in the official reccomendations to fight COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Ibuprofen enhances coronavirus .
Explanation:
The World Health Organization assured that there is no proven evidence that the use of ibuprofen can aggravate the health of patients with this virus.
Initially, he recommended the use of acetaminophen (paracetamol) to treat symptoms, but later clarified that he was "not aware of reports of any negative effects" of ibuprofen.

What fact-check ?: Nostradamus predicted coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation:
In the book Prophecies of Nostradamus it doen´t say any of the words that are now being spread.
The prophecies that record the words "plague" and "dust" are different from the one that circulates in the image that went viral.

What fact-check ?: This viral image people lying street related coronavirus .
Explanation: The image was taken in Germany during an event commemorating the victims of the Nazi concentration camp in Katzbach.

What fact-check ?: Gargling warm water salt removes coronavirus .
Explanation: The World Health Organization says there is no evidence that rinsing your mouth with saline "provides protection against this disease."

What fact-check ?: Cuba discovered serum cures COVID-19 .
Explanation: This supposed discovery was denied by an Egyptian official, whose last name is the same as that attributed to the Cuban Minister of Health in the disinformation, who is actually called Portal Miranda.

What fact-check ?: There study establishes relationship ibuprofen severity virus infection . . . apparently Ibuprofen facilitate reproduction virus .
Explanation: There is no solid scientific evidence to indicate that Ibuprofen worsens the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: `` 17 6:00 , state emergency begins throughout national territory '' accordance `` article 116 Constitution '' , Colombia .
Explanation: WhatsApp chain that alerts state of emergency by COVID-19 is from Spain.

What fact-check ?: Three thousand Ecuadorians infected coronavirus .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus covered private health insurance Ecuador .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Helicopters going spread chemicals coronavirus .
Explanation: False information circulating in many Spanish-speaking countries, from Spain to Honduras.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus patients develop lung fibrosis diagnose holding breath .
Explanation: Fibrosis has many other symptons and it is harder to diagnose than holding your breath for 10 seconds.

What fact-check ?: Tips new coronavirus : holding breath drinking water .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence to indicate that holding breath and drinking water every 15 minutes kills coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: China finds vaccine new coronavirus .
Explanation: Chine didn't find a vaccine for coronavirus..

What fact-check ?: Madrid enabled phone number 915038030 request prescriptions .
Explanation: The region of Madrid says it is a hoax.

What fact-check ?: Niño Jesús hospital `` clean '' coronavirus take care children young people Madrid .
Explanation: The Hospital and the health ministry explain it is false.

What fact-check ?: Here measures Mercadona implement due coronavirus crisis .
Explanation: Mercadona's Communication department explains that nearly all the points of the message are false.

What fact-check ?: Police `` free entry houses buildings '' Malaga identify possible coronavirus infections .
Explanation: Malaga and Police authorities debunk the hoax on their official twitter accounts.

What fact-check ?: Javier Orthega Smith , VOX , said prefers coronavirus `` homosexualism '' .
Explanation: The claim is from a satire website.

What fact-check ?: Spanish politician Ortega Smith said `` I prefer get COVID-19 gay '' .
Explanation: It was posted by a satirical website, but it viralized as real.

What fact-check ?: Police `` free entry houses buildings '' Malaga identify possible coronavirus infected people .
Explanation: Police denied it on its Twitter account.

What fact-check ?: Niño Jesús hospital left without COVID-19 care children young people Madrid .
Explanation: The hospital denied it to newtral.es.

What fact-check ?: Madrid enables 915038030 request prescription drugs .
Explanation: The government denied it.

What fact-check ?: They discovered whole floor main Peruvian hospital infected COVID-19 decided close place .
Explanation: It is false that Peruvian government decided to close a floor at the main national hospital due a general contagion of COVID-19

What fact-check ?: It advisable leave outside shoes used street prevent coronavirus .
Explanation: It is an unnecessary preventive measure because it is excessive.

What fact-check ?: There sanitary technicians going inspect houses seize cash .
Explanation: It is false that technicians and police agents have "free entry" in the homes

What fact-check ?: Jeanine Áñez , actual president Bolivia , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The team of Bolivia Verifica, checked the image and verified that was not real. Also, in a communication with the Coordination Director of the Ministry of the Presidency, Marco Julio, he ensured that the president’s health condition is good.

What fact-check ?: Italy official Giulio Gallera : China lies us . The date China provided false . Italy become Wuhan medical system breakdown .
Explanation: The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.

What fact-check ?: The photo shows aid crew Cuba Italy .
Explanation: Cuba has sent aid to Italy but the photo is not new. Taken in 2015.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo donated hotel turned hospital .
Explanation: Ronaldo did not announce this and his partners denied.

What fact-check ?: Coronil drops help cure coronavirus .
Explanation: Leading homeopaths say that very little is known about the composition of this medicine and it will be careless to recommend this medicine for coronavirus

What fact-check ?: Police asked shops selling alcohol restrict opening hours St Patrick 's Day lower risk house parties coronavirus could spread .
Explanation: Police make an annual request of shops not to sell alcohol before 4pm on St Patrick's Day - but it has nothing to do with coronavirus

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo Turns Hotel Hospital Corona
Explanation: The manager of the hotel owned by Ronaldo has denied the rumors and stated that the hotel was and will remain a hotel.

What fact-check ?: Video shows Chinese police crackdown coronavirus patients .
Explanation: The video actually dates back to August 2019 when anti-government protests were happening in Hong Kong. The visuals pertain to an incident of police crackdown at Prince Edward station in Kowloon where the police personnel and riot police arrived after reports of a tussle between pro-government and anti-government protesters.

What fact-check ?: A graphic shared multiple posts Facebook alongside claim contains quote Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo bats `` enemy '' novel coronavirus pandemic . The graphic attributed Inquirer.net , Philippine media outlet .
Explanation: The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: A flyer said offer official advice novel coronavirus Veterans Affairs ( VA ) healthcare system US state Oregon shared Facebook .
Explanation: The flyer is fake, it was not issued by the Roseburg VA and health experts told AFP the advice it contains is misleading.

What fact-check ?: A photo room lined coffins shared thousands times multiple Facebook posts claim shows Italian nationals killed novel coronavirus pandemic 2020 .
Explanation: The claim is false; the photo actually shows coffins for a group of dead migrants at an Italian airport in October 2013 after their boat sank off the coast of Italy.

What fact-check ?: A `` Spanish biological researcher '' saying `` You give footballer €1 million euros month & biological researcher €1,800 per month , looking Coronavirus treatment . Go Cristiano Ronaldo Messi & get cure . '' A quote published photo so-called `` spanish biological researcher '' .
Explanation: The woman on the photograph is not a Spanish biologist researcher, but Isabel Garcia Tejerina, an ex Spanish minister. The photo was taken during an interview, in 2018, long before the outbreak of coronavirus. There is no clue of this Spanish biologist researcher, whose name is never given in the publications.

What fact-check ?: 14 University Nairobi students tested positive COVID-19 .
Explanation: An article by Times Live claiming that 14 students from the University of Nairobi are infected with coronavirus cites a non-existent news story by KTN News.

What fact-check ?: A fake quote Senator Philippines Risa Hontiveros saying `` ready get coughed , '' `` police military frightening dying virus , '' according graphic circulated Facebook .
Explanation: The senator did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. She dismissed the graphic as "fake news" on her social media accounts.

What fact-check ?: A fake quote Philippines ' Vice President Leni Robredo saying “ bats , virus , enemy . ”
Explanation: The Vice President did not say what was attributed to her. Robredo’s camp said it is a fake quote, and the Facebook accounts that posted the fake quote the earliest on Facebook failed to give Rappler their source.

What fact-check ?: A photo showing coffins describing coffins people died coronavirus .
Explanation: We found this picture within our AFP archives. Those coffins are those of dead migrants in the Mediterranean sea in 2013.

What fact-check ?: The WHO coronavirus test “ bad test . ”
Explanation: A review found the World Health Organization’s test did not give false positives when similar viruses were present. The White House provided no evidence that the WHO test fell short.

What fact-check ?: Sweden stopped fighting new coronavirus .
Explanation: Manipulative headline that Sweden has stopped fighting against the new coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: “ All US citizens entitled $ 700 USD per week stay home avoid spread COVID-19 novel coronavirus , starting March 17 . ”
Explanation: Americans could receive a check for $1,000 or more as part of an economic stimulus package amid the coronavirus. A Facebook post about weekly $700 checks is a hoax.

What fact-check ?: “ I 've always known real , pandemic . I 've felt pandemic long called pandemic . ”
Explanation: In January, Trump said there were no worries about a pandemic. In late February, he said the virus was “very much under control.” Trump did activate federal measures to contain the spread in late January.

What fact-check ?: “ People going door door Colorado Springs stating COVID testing rob people ! ! ! ! ”
Explanation: Colorado Springs police said they’ve received no reports of robbers pretending to offer coronavirus testing.

What fact-check ?: `` U.S. deaths since 1/22 ( 2020 ) : COVID-19 : 27 , flu , 4,700 ; abortion : 118,000 . ''
Explanation: The post’s numbers are inaccurate, but abortions do far outnumber deaths from COVID-19 and flu. The COVID-19 number is likely too low, and the flu number is too high. The number of abortions is roughly accurate.

What fact-check ?: Says “ unquestionably ” within “ legal authority ” postpone Illinois ’ primary election changing date shifting vote-by-mail .
Explanation: It’s difficult to know for sure that Pritzker could not have done anything to delay the March 17 election. But experts told us the governor spoke correctly in describing the limits of his powers under existing law.

What fact-check ?: Novel coronavirus eliminated drinking lots water gargling warm water mixed salt vinegar .
Explanation: At present, there is no study or evidence to support the claim.

What fact-check ?: Video police China taking control suspected COVID-19 patients country .
Explanation: The video shows Police in Hong Kong taking into control demonstrators who were protesting against the introduction of a controversial bill that would have allowed extraditions to mainland China.

What fact-check ?: The new coronavirus biological weapon .
Who said/posted it?: ex-General Prosecutor of Ukraine Svyatoslav Piskun
Explanation: There is no evidence this claim is correct.

What fact-check ?: Syrians Are Gathering Regardless coronavirus Outbreak .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar found that the photo is old, dating back to 2019.

What fact-check ?: Ethiopian Plane Carries People Infected With coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the video and found that it is misleading; it has nothing to do with COVID-19, and the plane in the video belongs to the Senegal Air, not Ethiopian.

What fact-check ?: Emirati singer Ahlam 's Mask Is Crowned With Diamonds .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the claim and found that it is just a joke from a fan called Mannol, who shared a photoshopped photo of a mask crowned with diamonds.

What fact-check ?: In United States , WIC receivers still get one type food pandemic ?
Explanation: While this post is true in that individuals qualifying for WIC cannot swap out food items, the specific rules differ state by state, especially during a crisis like COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Nancy Pelosi tried secure taxpayer funds abortion coronavirus bill .
Explanation: Pelosi never inserted abortion funding in a coronavirus bill. However, some conservatives said by failing to specifically say money couldn’t be used for abortions, that would leave open the possibility that federal money could be used for abortions.

What fact-check ?: If hold breath 10 seconds without coughing chest pain , good , n't COVID-19 , If nose clogged runny , 's cold .
Explanation: Dr Robert Legar Atmar told CNN that these are not accurate because someone with an acute viral infection breathes with difficulty because the airways are irritated, but being able to hold his/her breath for 10 seconds does not mean he/she is not infected with coronavirus. Similarly, the expert rejected other claims on the list, calling them myths.

Countries: North Macedonia, Greece, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
What fact-check ?: If infected new coronavirus , high fever take ibuprofen ( Brufen ) paracetamol ; Adults drink strong black coffee every hours .
Explanation: There are no clinical trials or practice data that would suggest that brufen should not be taken with COVID-19 infection. The Specialist pneumophysiologist and family medicine doctor, Dobrinka Granzov - Kozlina. debunked the fake news about drinking coffee against coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Harvard scientists explain : Here 's cure coronavirus vaccine comes WhatsApp message stating : `` The Ministry Health approved immediate 350 euro reward staying home . '' The first child lost life coronavirus .
Explanation: The "information" contained in the WhatsApp message was denied by the Minister of Health and Social Affairs. The link didn't bring to an existing page. The British media article was about an infected child, not a child who lost his life. There is no exact data so far, but according to WHO, children are less at risk of coronary heart disease when they catch the novel coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Army trucks deployed Paris big French cities coronavirus epidemic
Explanation: Photos shared thousands of times on social media show military vehicles transported by truck on the highway near Paris. But the French Ministry of Armed Forces denies any link with the coronavirus epidemic and explains that it is a routine logistical operation.

What fact-check ?: If hold breath 10 seconds , infected coronavirus .
Explanation: By holding your breath for 10 seconds, you cannot confirm whether you are infected with coronavirus or not.

What fact-check ?: Water Venice begins become crystalline , thanks ban Italy COVID-19 .
Explanation: The event happened in Cagliari, Sardinia, 874 kilometers from Venice

What fact-check ?: The executive order restrict worship South Korea prevention epidemics religious oppression .
Explanation: It is possible to forbid by Korean infectious disease prevention law.

What fact-check ?: Is censorship use chloroquine treatment .
Who said/posted it?: FB, YT, etc. after a Didier Raoult video
Explanation: French scientst promoting chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine have created not only enthusiasm for this "treatment", but also acusations that the French government or the Big Pharma, are hiding this cure.

What fact-check ?: Facebook posts shared tens thousands times claim US President Donald Trump presidential candidate Joe Biden referred novel coronavirus virus pandemic time “ people dying never died . ”
Explanation: This is false; there is no record of either man saying this, and letters from Ernest Hemingway show the phrase can be traced to the famed US author.

What fact-check ?: Information complete quarantine Guatemala .
Explanation: Those were mesures taken by the president of Bolivia, not the president of Guatemala.

What fact-check ?: Trump use data deaths swine flu seasonal flu .
Explanation: Trump is comparing apples and oranges. The figures he cites for the swine flu and seasonal influenza are after-the-fact estimates that try to account for all excess deaths that could be, in some way, attributed to a flu infection. Studies indicate that the official lab counts may be missing as many as 9 in 10 deaths.

What fact-check ?: Having beard increase chances getting coronavirus .
Explanation: The CDC never told anyone to shave their beards, a 2017 graphic circulating the web from the CDC was put out to show the effectiveness of masks with facial hair. The work-place graphic is unrelated to the current coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Sweden refused fight coronavirus .
Explanation: Sweden has not abandoned the fight against coronavirus, although it has taken less stringent measures than other countries. Some of the statements in the checked article are completely made up.

What fact-check ?: Taking hot bath , breathing hot steam using hand dryer blow hot air nose effective ways prevent Covid-19 , according lecturer health sciences faculty Ghanaian university .
Explanation: No evidence for claims, which go counter to WHO recommendations.

What fact-check ?: An image shows train transporting Covid-19 virus .
Explanation: The dark wagons on the image are the ones used to transport oil and they have to obey the 4 letters and 6 digits rules. That’s not what happens with the word “COVID-19” that appears in the image. Also, the name of the virus is Sars-Cov-2 and not COVID-19 (that’s the name of the disease). If the train was transporting the virus it would mention “Sars-Cov-2” and not “COVID-19”.

What fact-check ?: A post says warm water salt prevent new coronavirus infection , killing throat .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Several experts had already explained that there’s no connection between the act of drinking water and the virus.

What fact-check ?: A hospital Debar ( North Macedonia ) left without epidemiologist .
Explanation: The information was denied by the Ministry of Health. They pointed out that there is an epidemiologist in the Debar hospital and there is no shortage of staff.

What fact-check ?: Some portals published photo claim taken buses Public Transport Company Skopje . The photo shows person protective equipment public transport . And enough someone claim buses Skopje disinfected coronavirus presence passengers .
Explanation: A simple Google photo search shows that this photo was not taken in Skopje, but in Poland.

What fact-check ?: Fiocruz ( brazilian health organization ) share text informing coronavirus bigger virus ; virus dies temperatures 26ºC 27ºC ; warm water salt kills coronavirus amygdala ; hot plates best kill virus
Explanation: Fiocruz denied sharing such informations.

What fact-check ?: Brazilian government releases R $ 470 people Bolsa Família ( poverty adressing program ) buy masks hygiene products .
Explanation: Ministry of Economy promissed a increase of R$ 3 billions on the social program, but there was no help to buy masks and cleaning products.

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus created Institut Pasteur France patented 2004 .
Explanation: The patent was for 2003 SARS vaccine.

What fact-check ?: The UNHCR said 'migrants illegals ' malaysia resisting COVID-19 testing .
Explanation: The claim is false; UNHCR officials in Malaysia said the alleged statement is fake and condemned the erroneous claim for stoking “unnecessary fear and distrust”.

What fact-check ?: A message shared WhatsApp Facebook claims 15 coronavirus cases linked Burnaby ’ Metrotown mall , western Canadian province British Columbia .
Explanation: This is false; provincial health officials and the mall administrator told AFP that no cases are connected to the mall to date.

What fact-check ?: This video shows brawl week took place supermarket Aubervilliers , France , coronavirus .
Explanation: This scene actually took place in May 2019, according to a police source.

What fact-check ?: This photo shows French nurses holding sign denounce police violence .
Explanation: It's a photomontage.

What fact-check ?: Facebook post claiming French animal shelters `` overwhelmed abandonment dogs cats due coronavirus '' .
Explanation: SPA president told AFP the claim was false. However, he fears a saturation of shelters, closed to the public because of containment measures.

What fact-check ?: Claim coronavirus created patented French institute ( Institut Pasteur ) .
Explanation: The video author refers to a patent filed in 2004 but this patent concerns another type of coronavirus. Moreover, filing a patent for a virus does not mean that it was created.

What fact-check ?: Rodrigo Maia , president lower house Congress Brazil , voted law forbids president close borders .
Explanation: The law doesn't turn difficult to close borders, because it is about migrants rights. And Maia didn't vote "yes" for it.

What fact-check ?: `` coronavirus victims buried morning Wednesday Italy . Rest peace '' .
Explanation: The image was taken in 2013 by Tullio M. Puglia, for Getty Images. The coffins were used for the bodies of african refugees that died on a shipwreck near Lampedusa, south Italy.

What fact-check ?: Goats Ajmer , Rajasthan found COVID-19 positive .
Explanation: The video is old and unrelated to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar asked meat shops banned lieu COVID-19 .
Explanation: Claim was falsely attributed to the cricketer.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 passengers disembarked Senegal airport .
Explanation: Video was of a mock drill for dealing with hostage like situations.

What fact-check ?: The COVID-19 invented big French public medical institute ( Institut Pasteur ) .
Who said/posted it?: Viral video of an unknown man
Explanation: Big confusion between the 2003 coronavirus and the COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A photo shows coffins people died coronavirus Italy - shows virus dangerous stay inside .
Explanation: The photo is old and shows coffins of migrants who drowned at a boat accident at Lampedusa in 2013. But the appeal to stay inside to avoid infection with coronavirus is correct.

What fact-check ?: Jobcenters ( unemployed people ) close today Germany .
Explanation: The jobcenters are not completely closed, they offer personal contact in emergency cases.

What fact-check ?: Stopping breathing 10 seconds help detect coronavirus .
Explanation: It won't help you in detecting coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 worse outbreaks occurred “ every election year , ” suggesting new coronavirus “ hyped ” hurt President Donald Trump .
Explanation: Most of the dates cited to defend those conclusions about previous outbreaks are misleading or incorrect.

What fact-check ?: Australian researchers found bananas help prevent infection COVID-19 .
Explanation: We found the post to be False. There is no proof that banana can boost one’s immune system and prevent the disease caused by coronavirus. At present there are no medicines to cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Kitchen foods plus morning sunshine prevent cure coronavirus .
Explanation: At present there is no evidence to prove that eating kitchen foods like onion, garlic and lemondoes prevent or cure COVID-19 and the same is not recommended by WHO.

What fact-check ?: Man contracts COVID-19 eating mutton .
Explanation: It's a fake news card and the news channel has denied publishing any such news.

What fact-check ?: A video shows Chinese police crackdown suspected COVID-19 patients .
Explanation: We found the video to be False because this is an old video A from Hong Kong showing riot police storm a metro station to crack down on political protesters in the city.

What fact-check ?: Image coffins Italy showing carnage due recent COVID-19 outbreak .
Explanation: The image is 7 years old and is of the dead bodies of African immigrants who died while entering Italy.

What fact-check ?: Wash throat salted water apple vineger cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: WHO and other medical institutions say this is not a cure.

What fact-check ?: Spanish scientist says go Ronaldo Messi cure , better paid .
Explanation: The former Spanish minister for agriculture never said this.

What fact-check ?: A train carrying vaccines inscription COVID-19 .
Explanation: Content seems to be digitally edited, and there is no inscription on that location on such trains.

What fact-check ?: Evidence Shows The WHO Director-General Overstated COVID-19 Fatality Rate
Explanation: All evidence says the WHO director-general was on point. This is a ultra-conservative false spin on what the director-general said, getting many facts and medical numbers wrong.

What fact-check ?: Trump Is Promising To Send Americans Checks - Only After Checking People 's Social Media History .
Explanation: This is a false tweet, though there have been real suggestions to have a stimulus package.

What fact-check ?: 5G Technology Believed To Have Caused coronavirus
Explanation: The claim is false, not backed by scientific research, and many dates given to back up the theory are wrong or misleading.

What fact-check ?: `` Ministry Health ITALY released small video , HOW virus spreads ! ! ! ... BEST VIDEO . Please see .. innocently spread . SOAP remedy CLEAN/ WASH ur Hands always ''
Explanation: The viral video is not released by the health ministry of Italy in the wake of coronavirus but it is long-existing on YouTube, we reached the conclusion that the viral claim is ‘Misleading’.

What fact-check ?: The viral video claims show visuals china police personnel trying control patients allegedly suffering pandemic .
Explanation: The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak and is related to police storming the metro in the wake of Hong Kong protests.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus cured sniffing clove camphor drinking water , virus go stomach acid stomach kill virus .
Explanation: Dr. Mohammad Imran, an Ayurveda doctor, said, “It is merely a rumor which has gone viral on social media .There is no scientific evidence which backs the claim that sniffing clove and camphor can cure coronavirus. However, natural camphor and clove does have certain health benefits as it can cure fungus and bacteria”.

What fact-check ?: As coronavirus outbreak surges , PM Narendra Modi decided facilitate fellow countrymen free masks ‘ Swacch Bharat ’ scheme .
Explanation: The government has not announced any such scheme under which it is aimed to provide free masks. The viral webpage may be a part of the decade-old phishing technique or it may be an attempt to collect the data. However, the intent behind creating this webpage is not yet clear but it is crystal clear that the webpage doesn’t belong to Indian govt and might be a venture of some fraudulent organization.

What fact-check ?: Chinese intelligence officer terms Novel coronavirus biological weapon invented China .
Explanation: The viral post also claims that the damage caused by the pandemic is being normalized by the Chinese officials. The website which has published the alleged testimony of the said Chinese intelligence officer has published the report with the headline, “CORONA UNMASKED: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals True Magnitude of China’s Fake “Coronavirus” Crisis – 包含中文字符版本”. The story published by the Reddit community No Sleep is just a horror story and does not have anything to do with reality. the community itself terms it as a storytelling platform and not a true story publisher.

What fact-check ?: Helicopters Argentine Air Force spray disinfectant coronavirus .
Explanation:
The alleged measure was denied by the Argentine Ministry of Defense.
The same message circulates, and was denied, in different countries.

What fact-check ?: Christine Lagarde said : `` The elderly live long risk global economy '' .
Explanation:
There are no written or audiovisual records of the former IMF director saying the statements attributed to her.
In addition, the European Central Bank -inquired by Maldita- assured that Lagarde had not said that phrase.
Part of the phrase attributed to the president of the European Central Bank (ECB) comes from a 2012 report by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in whose presentation Lagarde was not present.

What fact-check ?: Cali Colombia going quarantined , say 14 days commerce , supermarkets , shopping malls closed , one enter leave land plane .
Explanation: At the time of this publication, there had been no quarantine or trade closure in the Valle del Cauca capital, as a viral audio claimed.

What fact-check ?: In Ecuador , Maritza Frías , former director Teófilo Dávila Hospital Machala , Mauro Calle , former manager health center , concealed official figures infected .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus phase 4 involves war code .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: People A-blood type prone get coronavirus .
Explanation: Study is not peer-reviewed and should not be published as established information

What fact-check ?: Egyptian doctor invented fluid treat coronavirus .
Explanation: WHO hasn´t informed about any cure or treatment specific to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Maracaibo Venezuela safest city avoid coronavirus it´s hot , said Unicef .
Explanation: Unicef communicates it hasn´t publish that kind of information.

What fact-check ?: France pay rent , light gas quarantine citizens .
Explanation: France is only paying for small company's that are not earning enough.

What fact-check ?: Helicopters military aircraft spraying disinfecting streets 11 p.m .
Explanation: Air Force and Ministry of Defense sources deny it.

What fact-check ?: France suspended payment rent taxes citizens due coronavirus crisis .
Explanation: The measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron are for SMEs in difficulty and include both payment deferrals and cancellations.

What fact-check ?: Some Madrid hospitals close `` full '' coronavirus .
Explanation: Madrid's health ministry says it is not true. Hospitals still working and accepting people.

What fact-check ?: The exams access university Valencia region delayed August 10 , 11 12 .
Explanation: The Valencian Government debunks the hoax on its official social medio accounts.

What fact-check ?: The Army requisitioning coronavirus protection material Catalonia .
Who said/posted it?: The president of the chamber of commerce of Catalunia presidente de la Cámara de Comercio de Barcelona, Joan Canadell
Explanation: The Defense ministry denies the claim.

What fact-check ?: La Paz , Gregorio Marañon 12 de octubre hospitals closing capacity .
Explanation: Madrid government denied it.

What fact-check ?: Helicopters going spread 'medicines ' againts coronavirus .
Explanation: Defense ministry denied it.

What fact-check ?: Peru nationalized hospitals clinics .
Who said/posted it?: Gustavo Petro, former mayor of Bogotá
Explanation: Peruvian government gave a temporary order for centralizing all the medical resources under the Ministry of Health authority during the emergency, but it's does not include the property of clinics and private services.

What fact-check ?: China successfully tested anti-coronavirus serum made Egypt presented Beijing Egyptian Minister Health .
Explanation: It's false. Neither Egypt has delivered a COVID-19 serum to China, nor has any treatment been released against those infected with the virus in either country.

What fact-check ?: The spread COVID-19 prevented `` home-made vaccine '' based fruits ingredients .
Explanation: This is a hoax for citizens to open a potentially dangerous attachment.

What fact-check ?: A hospital Murcia Spain made citizen appeal make surgical masks .
Explanation: That has not happened.

What fact-check ?: There Russian medicine could use Sars-Cov-2 .
Explanation: It is not the case.

What fact-check ?: This picture showing lots coffins taken Bergamo 2020 .
Explanation: The picture has been taken in Lampedusa in 2013.

What fact-check ?: List first COVID-19 patients Guatemala personal information .
Explanation: The list was authentic (as confirmed later on by the Ministry of Health) but we explained that to share private information is not only risky for those in the list but illegal.

What fact-check ?: New coronavirus spread via Coca-Cola .
Explanation: No evidence shows the virus transmission via food. Coca-Cola products are inspected.

What fact-check ?: New coronavirus survive 9 days road ; keep shoes , doctor Milan says .
Explanation: No Milanese doctor says that. No evidence shows the exact survival time of the virus on the road.

What fact-check ?: Worst affected countries coronavirus along latitude .
Explanation:
1. The fact that large countries cannot be represented by a single latitude is conveniently ignored.
2. Further, all of the aforementioned cities and countries are not situated along Latitude 40 degrees.

What fact-check ?: Clorox Already Knew About coronavirus And coronavirus Isn ’ New Virus .
Explanation: The post claiming that the new coronavirus was known beforehand as Clorox label shows that it kills human coronavirus’ is misleading.

What fact-check ?: Indonesian President Joko Widodo locked 10 cities
Explanation: the Indonesian President Joko Widodo has not yet chosen the option to quarantine or lockdwon as a way to deal with the Corona COVID-19 virus pandemic.

What fact-check ?: The People In This Video Are Falling Because Of Infection With Corona Virus
Explanation: The people in the three videos fainted due to other causes, such as epilepsy and fatigue. Two of the four videos also did not occur in Jakarta, but in Bali and Singapore.

What fact-check ?: Novel The Eye Darkness Predicts Corona Biological Weapon China
Explanation: There is only one similarity about the virus in this novel with the Corona COVID-19 virus, namely the name Wuhan, where the Corona COVID-19 virus was first reported in Wuhan, China. The rest, regarding the incubation period, death rates, and so on, is very different from the pandemic that is happening now.

What fact-check ?: If want protect coronavirus , must back away climate change efforts 've making .
Explanation: Some preliminary scientific publications report that SARS-CoV-2 may be less prevalent or less contagious in warm and humid climates. However global warming does not occur at a pace or magnitude that would prevent further SARS-CoV-2 propagation. In addition, scientists emphasize that virus propagation primarily depends on other factors such as existing immunity and there is currently no way to reliably predict the spread of COVID-19 on a warmer Earth.

What fact-check ?: A video fire erupting inside vehicle viewed hundreds times Facebook , Twitter messaging app Line March 2020 alongside claim shows explosion sparked alcohol-based disinfectant used novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video has circulated in media reports about a car explosion in Saudi Arabia since at least 2015, almost five years before the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December 2019.

What fact-check ?: A claim fruit vegetable markets Indian city Chennai across state Tamil Nadu ordered close effort curb spread novel coronavirus shared multiple posts Facebook , WhatsApp Twitter .
Explanation: The claim is false; Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake”, and Tamil Nadu’s chief minister said that stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.

What fact-check ?: Claim American soldier intentionally spreading novel coronavirus Wuhan seventh CISM Military World Games October 2019 video clip man purportedly smearing saliva handrail train .
Explanation: The video is authentic but it was taken in Brussels, Belgium, on March 10, 2020. The man is not an American. According to media reports, the man was arrested by the police on the same day.

What fact-check ?: As US government moved approve $ 2 trillion stimulus package address impact novel coronavirus outbreak , short block text outlining Canada ’ alleged response outbreak flourished social media .
Explanation: The claims about school closings and economic support are misleading; no province has officially closed schools through the end of the year, only individuals directly impacted by COVID-19 are eligible for financial aid, and mortgage relief is granted by banks on a case by case basis.

What fact-check ?: The Social Security System ( SSS ) Philippines `` approved financial aid worth P20,000 every member , '' assist affected novel coronavirus pandemic .
Who said/posted it?: Websites dohnotice.ml, randomnames.club, gmanetworkupdates.ml, and sssupdates.ml
Explanation: The SSS has not announced such financial aid for every member. On its official Facebook page, the SSS denied the claim, saying it was "fake news."

What fact-check ?: “ China blame culture people eat bats snakes dogs things like , viruses transmitted animal people 's China source lot viruses like SARS , like MERS , Swine Flu coronavirus . ”
Explanation: Experts said Cornyn's assertion that Chinese culture is at fault is inaccurate, as the threat of viral transmission from animal to human is not unique to China, and the risk of this kind of spillover is growing globally as humans come into closer contact with animals.

What fact-check ?: Five Helicopters spray disinfectants air eradicate coronaviruses .
Explanation: Similar rumors have circulated in multiple languages in many countries, including South Africa, India, USA. The version circulating in Taiwan connected to America. New York City Emergency Management Department has tweeted that the rumor is false.

What fact-check ?: Says Donald Trump tweeted , “ I ordered Treasury secretary send checks Americans ! First however , go social media history last 4 years search post # NotMyPresident . I ’ think offending check I ’ president ! # MAGA ”
Explanation: Americans could receive a $1,000 check as part of an economic stimulus package that isn’t yet finalized. Donald Trump didn’t tweet that he would vet who gets the checks based on whether they support him.

What fact-check ?: Says President Donald Trump said , “ People dying never died . ”
Explanation: We searched a number of databases and found no evidence that Trump, on March 18, said, “People are dying who have never died before.”

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus `` snuck us , ” adding “ unforeseen thing . ”
Explanation: Members of the Trump administration have been sounding the alarm for months. Public health experts have been warning for years about the threat of a pandemic.

What fact-check ?: 2019 coronavirus live `` 3 hours air , 4 hours copper , 24 hours cardboard 3 days plastic stainless steel . ”
Explanation: Preliminary research indicates that COVID-19 can live for up to three hours in the air, four hours on copper, 24 hours on cardboard and three days on plastic and stainless steel.

What fact-check ?: Chennai municipal corporation asked vegetable fruit markets shut .
Explanation: No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.

What fact-check ?: Oman releasing special chemical sky eradicate coronavirus military helicopters .
Explanation: The Oman health minister said that they had never conducted such operations with military helicopters. When the same message went viral in India, the Press Information Bureau has said that it is a fake message.

What fact-check ?: Video American President Donald Trump announcing Roche Medical Company launch vaccine COVID-19 .
Explanation: In the video, American President Donald Trump hasn’t said that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. He announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’ developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus found meat ( mutton ) .
Explanation: The photo in the post was edited. Also, the photo was taken five or six years ago. WHO and FSSAI have also mentioned that properly cooked meat can be consumed.

What fact-check ?: With self-checkup find infected coronavirus .
Explanation: Neither the World Health Organization (WHO) nor the government of India has stated anywhere that the coronavirus infection can be evaluated by the breath test as mentioned in the post. Some doctors have also mentioned that breath test cannot help in finding out if the person is infected with coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Drinking alcohol helps new coronavirus
Explanation: The fact that drinking alcohol can protect from new coronavirus has no clinical support.

What fact-check ?: Hot air application hairdryer beat coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no proven evidence that hot air application through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Donald Trump announced Roche launch vaccine coronavirus next Sunday .
Explanation: Donald Trump never said this. Roche has only got emergency approval from FDA for coronavirus tests.

What fact-check ?: Military Helicopters Sprays Pesticides For coronavirus In Egypt .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the claim and found it is fake; no such decision has been made by the Egyptian military forces

What fact-check ?: A Video Shows Chinese Celebrating Overthrowing coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the video and found it is old, dating back to 2019, and showing martial arts tournaments during the spring festival in China.

What fact-check ?: Egyptian Sterilization Team Dances To The Beats Bent Aljeeran .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the video and found that it is misleading; the video was shot in Iraq, not Egypt.

What fact-check ?: Due fear Coronavirus , Muslims China offereing Namaz open street .
Explanation: The viral video is four years ols and has no relation with coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Several home-made cures coronavirus , ; garlic / vodka / vitamin C treats corona virus ; children transmit coronavirus `` Serbs lion genes '' .
Explanation: There is no evidence as of now that ibuprofen (also commercially named Brufen or Advil) worsens symptoms, there is also no proof that vitamin C, vodka and garlic treat coronavirus. Epidemiologist Predrag Con states that children can spread the virus.

What fact-check ?: Old `` Martinelli '' `` Whatsapp Gold '' hoaxes surface Belgium wake Corona infodemic .
