Explanation: Messages circulating on Whatsapp of people sharing "insider"-information (self-declared government officials) on the virus percolate quickly. A localized version of the Martinelli & Whatsapp Gold hoaxes surface in Belgium as well, adding further confusion and unrest.

What fact-check ?: Hot air hair dryers kill Coronavirus .
Explanation: Blowing hot air from hair dryer is not a cure nor a preventive measure against coronavirus. There is no cure for coronavirus as of now.

What fact-check ?: A boy called COVID-19 Monterrey , Mexico .
Explanation: Until March 18 we do not have records of people bearing that name in Monterrey, México.

What fact-check ?: There Russian medicine could use Sars-Cov-2 .
Explanation: It is not the case.

What fact-check ?: This poem describes people applying social distancing plauge outbreak 19th century .
Explanation: The poem has been written by an American woman on her blog on the 16th of March.

What fact-check ?: This text critically observes behavior religious communities Macedonia towards Government 's recommendations reduce risk spreading coronavirus limiting contacts movement .
Explanation: The religious communities do not respect Goverment's recomendations. Last Friday, both the Islamic Religious Community and the Macedonian Orthodox Church did not take any steps to close the doors of religious buildings for the mass gathering of their believers.

What fact-check ?: A sensationalist headline , mislieading readers : `` Disturbing video : A proof today 349 dead Italy , stay home . ''
Explanation: This text operates with outdated data.The figures published in the text are from 14 March. The article was published on 16 March at 11.12 pm, which means that at the time of publication on the Internet, the data from 15 March were available, i.e. 1,809 dead and 24,747 infected in total.

What fact-check ?: Author Chen Ming-Fang , daughter-in-law renowned doctor medical professor Dong Da-Cheng , shared experience recovering COVID-19 .
Explanation: The content was originally from a Facebook post by a Seattle coronavirus survivor, Elizabeth Schneider. Chen Ming-Fang said in an interview with TFC that she didn't write that post.

What fact-check ?: Audio allegedly CEO major hospital São Paulo , Brazil , increases number deaths coronavirus .
Explanation: The CEO denied the audio was his.

What fact-check ?: China planned coronavirus .
Explanation: This fake news boasts the conspiracy theory that China made coronavirus in order to have economic benefits.

What fact-check ?: São Paulo city hall schedule coronavirus tests phone .
Explanation: City hall says fake news came from misinterpretation of a town law adressing coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Giant hornets migrated Europe due outbreak coronavirus .
Explanation: The authors of the article stole older material on hornets and climate change and wrote headline about coronavirus

What fact-check ?: A row coffins Italy . Claims Bergamo Italy deals dead virus .
Explanation: The photo was taken in 2013, amidst the migration crisis.

What fact-check ?: Video showing police beating people China , linked outbreak .
Explanation: The video shows police beating people in Hongkong. The video was shot on the last day of August 2019.

What fact-check ?: Breathing air hair dryer sauna prevent cure COVID-19
Explanation: This is false; an expert in coronaviruses said these methods would not be effective, while a cell biologist said there is no evidence the virus can be treated via heat.

What fact-check ?: A purported advisory shared repeatedly multiple Facebook , Twitter WhatsApp posts claims disinfectant sprayed air overnight India effort kill novel coronavirus , COVID-19 . The posts urge residents remain indoors spraying .
Explanation: The claim is false; Indian authorities said the advisory was "fake" and that no such measure had been announced.

What fact-check ?: In France , Mulhouse 's rink converted morgue .
Explanation: Mulhouse city hall and a hockey club, which is used to practising on this rink, had denied the claim.

What fact-check ?: People replied government text texts saying wo n't respect confinement measures facing justice .
Explanation: The Nanterre Court denied having received any instruction to prosecute senders of these messages, and the messages present many inconsistencies.

What fact-check ?: The RDC government canceled every future exams pupils , coronavirus .
Explanation: The minister of Education, Willy Bakonga, denied this claim to AFP.

What fact-check ?: Netflix offering free access anyone Brazil coronavirus crisis .
Explanation: Netflix is not offering free services during the pandemic. The URL used is not a Netflix domain.

What fact-check ?: Petrobras ( Brazil 's largest oil company ) closing refineries March 24th onwards .
Explanation: The alledged press release did not come from Petrobras. Refinaries are not going to be shut down for now.

What fact-check ?: A man claims dog vaccinated coronavirus , thus SARS-Cov-2 really new virus .
Explanation: Canine coronavirus (CCov) and the novel coronavirus are not the same virus.

What fact-check ?: Uber suspend operations 10 days Brazil due pandemic .
Explanation: The alledged announcement did not come from Uber, and the company will not stop working during the crisis.

What fact-check ?: Popular Cardiologist Devi Shetty talking symptoms COVID-19 .
Explanation: The person in question is a different doctor and not the famous cardiologist.

What fact-check ?: India asked restriction movement .
Explanation: The notification is from Malaysia and not India.

What fact-check ?: India spraying pesticides night prevent COVID-19 .
Explanation: Officials stated that no pesticides were being sprayed.

What fact-check ?: Image claims show dozens coffins containing Italians died COVID-19 .
Explanation: The photo actually shows the caskets of African migrants who died in a 2013 shipwreck off the coast of Italy.

What fact-check ?: Polish charity organisation WOSP withdrawn donation coronavirus fight Poland .
Explanation: There was no decision of backing down whatsoever. WOSP couldn't possibly donate the money it collected during public gathering as there was clearly stated goal for that gathering that can't be changed afterwards. WOSP is involved in many activities supporting coronavirus fight.

What fact-check ?: Donald Trump said coronavirus , “ People dying never died . ”
Explanation: Ernest Hemingway said it.

What fact-check ?: IDH Hospital , main center Sri Lanka treating COVID-19 patients , shortage number assentials .
Explanation: We contacted both doctors and health officials and confirmed that there is no shortage of goods at the hospital as of yet and the messages were fabricated.

What fact-check ?: You leave shoes outside , carry virus .
Explanation: Official sources say this is not true.

What fact-check ?: These images show coffins COVID-19 victims Italy .
Explanation: Images in question were actually taken in 2013.

What fact-check ?: Chinese claim virus created 2015 US .
Explanation: There's no evidence that supports this claim.

What fact-check ?: 5G technology caused coronavirus .
Explanation: Historical events were conflated, and did not back up claims with real evidence.

What fact-check ?: WHO director overstated COVID-19 fatality rate flu .
Explanation: CDC data and doctors said that coronavirus has much higher mortality rate than flu.

What fact-check ?: Walmart closing hundreds stores .
Explanation: This story is several years old, and there has been no recent announcement.

What fact-check ?: Cristiano Ronaldo bought private island escape coronavirus .
Explanation: Ronaldo's management company confirmed it was false.

What fact-check ?: Trump said `` people dying never died '' .
Explanation: Searches in databases of the phrase never show up. Other fact checks confirm fabrication.

What fact-check ?: Obama family flown private island escape coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: Website has visible disclaimers saying it is purely satire.

What fact-check ?: Link takes viewers application FEMA assistance US .
Explanation: Link just takes you to a meme picture.

What fact-check ?: Katy Perry , Madonna Black Sabbath shared videos Italy 's flash mob fake audio .
Explanation: All the videos have real images but fake audios. In the first case – Katy Perry – Italians are singing the song Roar instead of the national anthem (real video). In the second case – Madonna and Black Sabbath – Italians are singing I rise or War pigs instead of Macarena (real video).

What fact-check ?: In video Putin said : `` Powerful world , I aware diabolical plans reduce population '' .
Explanation:
The captions were changed to make people believe that the Russian president said things he did not say at the time.
The video was recorded at an event commemorating World War II.

What fact-check ?: Spaniards violating quarantine rules .
Explanation: The video was recorded in October 2019 days before the exhumation of the remains of the dictator Francisco Franco.

What fact-check ?: The recommendations coronavirus viral WhatsApp audio made owner Swiss Medical ( private health insurence company ) .
Explanation:
A report by the Conicet Sensory Research Laboratory indicates that, although it is limited, there is evidence that the audio does not belong to the businessman.
The company denied that the audio was recorded by the president of the company.

What fact-check ?: The WHO recommended countries go quarantine combat COVID-19 .
Explanation: In networks and the media, it has been stated that the World Health Organization, WHO, "recommended that all countries declare themselves in quarantine to combat COVID-19". However, the WHO itself denied it.

What fact-check ?: A video shows Russian leader Vladimir Putin , giving speech captions make believe rebuking world leaders .
Explanation: A video is being moved on Facebook and Twitter in which Vladimir Putin, the President of Russia, is seen giving a speech in front of a crowd. The video is accompanied by Spanish subtitles that make it appear that you are criticizing the leaders of other countries for their recent actions. Some social network users even shared the video as if this were Putin's response to the handling that other countries have given to the coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus created biological laboratory Wuhan .
Explanation: There is no evidence that 'the coronavirus comes from a biological laboratory in Wuhan,' as claimed by Mexican youtuber Alexander Backman.

What fact-check ?: You longer need contact someone get coronavirus .
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: Ibuprofen aggravates patients new coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence that conclusively proves ibuprofen aggravates coronavirus patients.

What fact-check ?: Cuba vaccine coronavirus called Interferón .
Explanation: The interferon is a drug used in certain countries to mitigate the spread of COVID-19, but it is not a vaccine.

What fact-check ?: Cuba 's health ministry , Dr. Hala , given vaccine China .
Explanation: For the moment, there is no vaccine against COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus stays throat four days arriving lungs . Gargling salt water vinegar kills coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no evidence that rinsing the mouth with slaty water or vinegr can prevent COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A magic remedy prevent COVID-19 : mix brown sugar , ginger , garlic , Chinese leek , boil drink .
Explanation: There is no evidence that the recipe can prevent or cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Remedy recipe : ( 1 ) boil tea Bitter melon . ( 2 ) Lemon juice salt Chinese Mesona
Explanation: There is no evidence that the recipe can prevent or cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Video shows American soldiers spread coronavirus 7th CISM Military World Game Wuhan .
Explanation: The video happened in Bruxelles on march. It is not happened in Wuhan or Taipei.

What fact-check ?: Italians played Chinese national anthem thank China . People yelled `` Grazie Cina '' .
Explanation: It's a video of Italian expressing gratitude to medical staff. The soundtrack of "Grazie Cina" and the Chinese national anthem was edited into the original video

What fact-check ?: A dog Hong Kong died COVID-19 .
Explanation: Vets shared the test results with Teyit. Dog's tests were negative for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Video shows balcony party Turkish capital Ankara due quarantine .
Explanation: The video is originally from Spain and manipulated with a Turkish song on top of it.

What fact-check ?: Korean series My Secret Terrius predicted outbreak advance .
Explanation: The series was about an international conspiracy, not a outbreak. The fictional virus was quite different from the current one.

What fact-check ?: Sitting sunlight help cure coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: Minister of State, Health, Ashwini Choubey
Explanation: The answer to this statement, according to doctors, is more than just true or false. Professor Ramanan Laxminarayan, Director of Centre for Disease Dynamics, Economics and Policy (CDDEP) said that, “We do not know how heat will affect this coronavirus as of yet. Usually, respiratory pathogens disappear in the summer and in the heat, but we have seen many cases in tropical countries too.”

What fact-check ?: China recognizes Palestinian doctor discoverer Corona COVID-19 virus vaccine
Explanation: Not a single report was discovered about the discovery of the Corona vaccine by Palestinian doctors. Even the doctor who claimed to be the inventor of the vaccine, Manar Saadi Al-Sheenawi, was not found in the Google search engine. In addition, until now, the WHO has not announced the discovery of any vaccine that can treat COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: The parks Adra , Spain , fumigated poison .
Explanation: Local and national police explain to Newtral.es that it is not true.

What fact-check ?: Drink water every 15 minutes avoid cononavirus .
Explanation: It is false that drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid COVID-19 by "cleaning" your throat.

What fact-check ?: Drinking water every 15 minutes helps avoid contagion cononavirus .
Explanation: It is false that drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid COVID-19 by "cleaning" your throat.

What fact-check ?: An audio shared WhatsApp indicates coronavirus `` psychosocial '' `` political war '' .
Explanation: Coronavirus is not a "psychosocial" caused by a "political war". To date, the COVID-19 virus has caused nearly 21,000 deaths in 187 countries where nearly 462,000 cases have been confirmed, according to the latest report released on Wednesday, March 26 by the World Health Organization (WHO). This was one of the audios that circulated on WhatsApp the day that Peruvian President Martín Vizcarra declared the national emergency and ordered the closure of the borders.

What fact-check ?: An audio broadcast Whatsapp indicates garlic helps overcome diseases coronavirus .
Explanation: According to the World Health Organization (WHO), garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. However, no evidence has been obtained that eating it protects against COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: An audio message shared Whatsapp users affirms COVID-19 dies 27° Celsius .
Explanation: It is still unknown whether weather and temperature will affect the spread of COVID-19. According to the United States Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is currently unknown whether the spread of COVID-19 is reduced in hot seasons.

What fact-check ?: A private lab denied authorization perform COVID-19 test .
Explanation: The governement only authorizes the National Lab to perform COVID-19 tests.

What fact-check ?: According Art . 116 , `` state emergency '' implemented Mexico limit free movement people combat # COVID-19 epidemic .
Explanation: This is FALSE, the mentioned article is in the Spanish Constitution, not in the Mexican. Article 116 of the Spanish Constitution speaks of the state of alarm. And to avoid leaving you in doubt, constitutional 116 (the one in Mexico) talks about the division of powers, not "states of emergency."

What fact-check ?: Video broadcast networks allegedly shows ‘ first killed COVID-19 Ibagué ’ , Columbia .
Explanation: The images were taken out of context. It is actually the first coronavirus patient in this city to be discharged from the hospital.

What fact-check ?: Beverages like ‘ akpeteshie ’ , local brewed spirit made sugarcane palm wine , used substitute hand sanitizers .
Explanation: Herbal and local gin bitters often do not meet the required alcohol content for an effective hand rub. Thus, they may not be good substitutes for hand sanitizers against the COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Allegations , garlic cold shower helps avoid COVID19 .
Explanation: Doctors say garlic, coal and cold shower don't prevent COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Martial law imminent United States .
Explanation: U.S. governments are not planning to implement martial law; National Guard is providing aid and support for communities.

What fact-check ?: A video US President Donald Trump top US pharmaceutical executive speaking press conference viewed thousands times multiple Facebook , Twitter YouTube posts alongside claim shows announcing vaccine novel coronavirus , COVID-19 , `` ready '' administered .
Explanation: The claim is false; neither Trump nor the pharmaceutical executive make any reference to a vaccine being "ready" for distribution; as of March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) states there is not yet a vaccine for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A screenshot purported internal email disclosing bank Pakistani city Rawalpindi closed employee tested positive novel coronavirus , COVID-19 , shared Facebook , Twitter WhatsApp .
Explanation: The claim is false; the bank said in a statement that “no employee at any” branch had tested positive for COVID-19, and that all branches remained “open and fully operative.”

What fact-check ?: Homemade recipes alcohol gel .
Explanation: Making alcohol gel at home is not recommended by medical authorities; it can be ineffective and dangerous.

What fact-check ?: Netflix offering free access quarantine .
Explanation: Netflix has not announced free access; message on WhatsApp is a phishing scam.

What fact-check ?: A purported advisory shared repeatedly multiple Facebook , Twitter WhatsApp posts claims disinfectant sprayed air overnight India effort kill novel coronavirus , COVID-19 . The posts urge residents remain indoors spraying .
Explanation: The claim is false; Indian authorities said the advisory was "fake" and that no such measure had been announced.

What fact-check ?: Posts circulating social media claim Ugandan Kenyan authorities instructed landlords stop collecting rent due novel coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim is false; the countries have issued public guidance amid the pandemic, but there has been no official communication on rent payments and government officials dismissed the reports.

What fact-check ?: Crocodiles spotted swimming canals Venice without bustle tourists .
Explanation: The photo is a composite image making up of two photographs.

What fact-check ?: The canals Venice become cleaner shutdown , attracting schools fish dolphins .
Explanation: The video was filmed in Cagliari, Italy, a harbor city 743 kilometers away from Venice.

What fact-check ?: Four men tested positive COVID-19 Cameroon ran away hospital .
Explanation: These four men published many videos on Facebook to debunk this claim. They also told AFP they lived in Italy. Cameroon's Health ministry also told AFP those four men don't belong to the group of people who are in quarantine in Cameroon.

What fact-check ?: Gargling salt water protect COVID-19 washing virus gut .
Explanation: Gargling salt water is not a recommended protective measure against COVID-19, and has been debunked by the World Health Organization.

What fact-check ?: Tanzanian club spokesman Haji S. Manara infected COVID-19 tour The Netherlands .
Explanation: Tanzania's Simba Sports Club spokesman Haji S. Manara does not have COVID-19 as claimed, and he was tested after leaving Spain and when he entered the Netherlands.

What fact-check ?: The World Health Organization offering free internet public access information COVID-19 .
Explanation: A link circulating on WhatsApp claiming that the World Health Organization is offering free internet to help people access information on COVID-19 is a hoax.

What fact-check ?: Fake quote Senator Philippines Francis “ Kiko ” Pangilinan saying wants children exempted lockdown .
Explanation: Pangilinan did not say the quote attributed to him. News5 also said the graphic did not come from any of their official social media accounts.

What fact-check ?: Agnès Buzyn , former french minister Health , took chloroquine list drugs could sold counter coronavirus started spread .
Explanation: The decision was taken before the COVID-19 crisis began.

What fact-check ?: Says `` '' COVID-19 virus .
Explanation: The coronavirus is real and infecting thousands of people around the world. As of March 19, COVID-19 had infected more than 191,000 people around the world and resulted in 7,807 deaths.

What fact-check ?: The federal government “ preparing mobilize national guard , ” “ dispatch across US military ” “ announce nationwide 1 week quarantine citizens . ”
Explanation: There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a lockdown. White House officials have repeatedly said it’s not something they’re considering at this time.

What fact-check ?: For coronavirus cases “ U.S. 38 % hospitalized 35 . ”
Explanation: The CDC reported that between mid-February and mid-March, 20% of the hospitalizations for coronavirus were for patients age 20-44 and 18% were age 45-54.

What fact-check ?: `` Huge ! Results From Breaking Chloroquine Study Show 100 % Cure Rate For Patients Infected With The Coronavirus . ''
Explanation: A French study of 20 COVID-19 patients indicates the drug might help treat the coronavirus. But it is no “100% cure.”

What fact-check ?: Video passengers infected Coronavirus Ethiopian Airlines flight Italy reached Addis Ababa airport .
Explanation: The video is of an ‘Emergency Exercise’ at Blaise Diagne International Airport (Senegal) in November 2019. So, the video is of a drill that was conducted a month earlier before the first coronavirus case was detected in China.

What fact-check ?: Press Release movement restriction COVID-19 outbreak National Security Council , PMO ( India ) .
Explanation: The press release in the post was issued by the Malaysian Government, not by the Indian Government.

What fact-check ?: BBMP ( Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike ) spraying medicine air 10 PM tonight order kill COVID-19 .
Explanation: The BBMP Commissioner and the Mayor have clarified that the message is just a rumor and the BBMP has no such plans to spray any medicine for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Scientists found drinking bitter gourd juice cure Coronavirus .
Explanation: The World Health Organization (WHO) or the Ministry for Health & Family Welfare (India) hasn’t announced that drinking bitter gourd juice will cure coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

What fact-check ?: Video goats affected Coronavirus .
Explanation: The video is an old one. It was taken before the recent coronavirus outbreak. Also, the Minister for Animal Husbandry, Dairying and Fisheries has clarified that there is no evidence to show that eating mutton can transmit coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Gargling warm water either salt vinegar eliminate coronavirus .
Explanation: The World Health Organisation (WHO) or Indian government has not mentioned anywhere that the gargling of warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate coronavirus. Indian government’s Press Information Bureau (PIB) has also said that the message that was circulating on social media is fake.

What fact-check ?: The quarantine last end May Ukraine .
Explanation: The official sources on the day when the news appeared have not published such information. The authors of the article confused the end date of the tax holidays and the end day of the quarantine.

What fact-check ?: An audio clip claiming renowned heart surgeon Dr Devi Shetty going viral Facebook , Twitter , WhatsApp .
Explanation: The viral clip has been falsely attributed to Dr Devi Shetty.

What fact-check ?: Government spray medicine air overnight kill coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no such government order for residents of Chandigarh, Bengaluru, or any other city that government would spread medicine in air to destroy coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Passengers Delhi airport got agitated Wednesday morning passports withheld airport authorities .
Explanation: This incident took place a few days back at IGIA in relation to mandatory coronavirus screening

What fact-check ?: Leader North Korea Kim Jong-Un Visits Infected Woman Without Wearing Mask .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the picture which accompanied the claim, and it turned out to be old, dating back to April 2018.

What fact-check ?: French Company Produces The First coronavirus Drug .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the claim and found that there no cure for COVID-19 until this moment, and the proposed drug has dangerous side effects when used without doctor consultation.

What fact-check ?: A Photo Coffins In Italy Relates To coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the photo and found that it belongs to dead people in an unauthorized migration boat accident.

What fact-check ?: Qatari Deputy Minister Health leaves Interview Because coronavirus
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The claim isn't true. While in an interview, the host broke his chair which made the interviewee stand and helps him.

What fact-check ?: Videos showing police raids army raids people n't respect confinement measures Algeria Morrocco .
Explanation: The video was shot on March 7th, 2020. It shows the dispersal of an antigovernmental demonstration by the security forces, with no link with confinement measures or coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Most passengers Ethiopian airlines flight Italy infected Coronavirus .
Explanation: The viral video is of a mockdrill from Senegal.

What fact-check ?: Says imposters hazmat suits going door door Stockton , California , saying checking residents fever COVID-19 , “ enter home physically attempt robbery . ”
Explanation: Posts around the nation warn people not to open their doors to imposters who say they are doing coronavirus testing but actually want to rob the residents. Like other such claims, this one about an alleged scam in Stockton, Calif., is false, according to police.

What fact-check ?: Drinking bitter gourd juice cures Coronavirus
Explanation: There is no proven evidenvce from any research so far which establishes that bitter gourd juice cures coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A photo making rounds social media claims show people died coronavirus Italy .
Explanation: The coffins in the photo are those of the victims of the Lampedusa maritime tragedy in 2013.

Countries: North Macedonia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
What fact-check ?: A Russian drug called Arbidol , cures coronavirus ; recipe mainly fruit-based drink claimed help prevent new coronavirus infections .
Explanation: The claim for medical advice has been invented, the analysis says, and the WHO is definitely not putting the drink on its list of recommendations.Although there have been some clinical trials showing that Arbidol has anti-influenza and some other viral infections, both the WHO and the US Food and Drug Administration have not put it on their lists of drugs to treat viral illnesses.

What fact-check ?: Venezuela El Salvador buy Interferon , despite fact proven effective treating coronavirus .
Explanation: Before they even registered cases of people infected with COVID-19, the Venezuelan and Salvadoran governments went ahead and bought the antiviral called Interferon to "cure" possible future patients. But there is still little scientific evidence in regards to the efficacy of this medicine, and it cannot be used for all infected patients.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 invented patented years ago Institut Pasteur , French medical research center
Explanation: The patent, filed in 2004, relates to vaccinal research on SARS-CoV-1, responsible for the SARS epidemic in 2002 and 2003, and not the SARS-CoV-2, that causes the current COVID-19 epidemic.

What fact-check ?: During pandemic , Macedonian citizens bread .
Explanation: The information was sharply denied by the Minister of Economy Kreshnik Bekteshi, who assured there is enough flour and wheat and imports from Serbia, Bulgaria and Hungary are also allowed.

What fact-check ?: Indian City Bangalore Muncipal Corp. requested people stay home lock houses spraying medicine kill Coronavirus .
Explanation: Municipal commissioner of the city has no such plans of spraying medicines to kill COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Vladimir Putin says world leaders trying reduce population .
Explanation: The Spanish subtitles are manipulated and the video is from 2016.

What fact-check ?: List UNICEF recommendations COVID-19 includes drinking hot water .
Explanation: All the recommendations issued by Unicef are focused on the care of children and families during the pandemic. None of those included in the viral chain belong to or were cited by Unicef.

What fact-check ?: North Carolina `` hospital beds typically 85 % full across state . ”
Explanation: Records show that NC hospitals are, on average throughout the year, between 60-to-75% full. However, medical professionals say Jackson is right that hospitals operate at maximum capacity during certain parts of the year, such as flu season.

What fact-check ?: Video shows Italy turns Islam giving Italian authoritis
Explanation: The video is from Hamburg protest in Germany in solidarity with Uyghurs, which was held 18 january 2020.

What fact-check ?: Clean throat salt water vinegar cure coronavirus .
Explanation: Experts confirmed this is a false claim.

What fact-check ?: Spanish minister agriculture called football players earning much showing lack solidarity .
Explanation: The minister never made the statement attributed to her.

What fact-check ?: Biden claims Trump eliminated White House pandemic office .
Explanation: One can see the dueling narratives here, neither entirely incorrect. The office — as set up by Obama — was folded into another office. Thus, one could claim the office was eliminated. But the staff slots did not disappear and at least initially the key mission of team remained a priority. So one can also claim nothing changed and thus Biden’s criticism is overstated.

What fact-check ?: WHO offering free data coronavirus info .
Explanation: Links in post lead to external website, potentially with harmful malware. Post is false, clickbait.

What fact-check ?: Prime Minister Conte foregone 20 % salary due Covid-19 .
Explanation: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte decided to cut his salary on October 2018, months before the outbreak of COVID-19 in Italy.

What fact-check ?: The Italian National Guard declared apply stricter sect rules , called BLS-4 , Covid-19 contained April 15th .
Explanation: The authorities have officially denied this fact.

What fact-check ?: Utility companies Manila Electric Company ( Meralco ) Maynilad Water Services Inc waiving billings March 2020 due coronavirus crisis .
Explanation: The graphic did not come from the official channels of Meralco and Maynilad. The two utility services are only offering an extension for payments, not cancellation of fees.

What fact-check ?: Study proves wrong conspiracy theory China created coronavirus economic purposes .
Explanation: Scientists have shown that SARS-CoV-2 characteristics indicate a natural origin.

What fact-check ?: Claim outbreak COVID-19 real .
Explanation: WHO, CDC, ECDC, Ministry of Health as well as multiple other agencies claim the outbreak is real.

What fact-check ?: Claim outbreak virus caused 5G .
Explanation: No proof to link 5G network with the outbreak of the virus.

What fact-check ?: Elderly people caught wandering outside Brazil pensions cancelled government .
Explanation: INSS (government body responsible for paying the pensions to retirees) says no such measure has been considered.

What fact-check ?: Photos show Maju Coutinho ( well known Brazilian journalist ) walking around Leblon beach boyfriend , even though urging people stay inside pandemic .
Explanation: Pictures are from 2019.

What fact-check ?: Burglars disguising health agents invade rob apartment buildings Belo Horizonte Goiânia .
Explanation: Police forces from Goiás and Minas Gerais deny these occurrences.

What fact-check ?: Atacadão ( supermarket chain ) distributing goods free . You might get leave comment post .
Explanation: This is a scam used for acquiring Facebook logins and passwords.

What fact-check ?: `` The chloroquine stock Paris hospitals robbed '' .
Who said/posted it?: Dr Perronne speech have been used by a well-known far-right Twitter account
Explanation: The chloroquine stocks had lowered drastically, but there have been no robbery.

What fact-check ?: Romania changed law break quarantine face 15 years prison .
Who said/posted it?: Various Fb posts, article on a website
Explanation: 15 years is maximum potential punishment (from 7 up to 15 years of imprisonment) but not for those who break the quarantine but for those infected who willingly spread contagious disease and it will be proven to result in death of other people.

What fact-check ?: Recording conversation one claims friend WHO ’ India Director ’ brother- Saurabh , gave information India go complete lockdown mode 15th April 15th June 2020 .
Explanation: WHO’s official in SEARO confirmed to us that the viral audio on social media is “Fake”.

What fact-check ?: Viral Post claiming COVID-19 infected patient found Hsipaw township hospital Mynamar .
Explanation: Both ministry of health and sports and Sipaw township medical superintendent have issued patient had not contracted the COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: `` Gale wind '' `` Neem Tree '' leaves good medicine protect coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: Crime news Srilanka and number of Tamil FB Users
Explanation: As stated by WHO still there is no official remedy or cure for COVID-19, while some of the traditional methods have symptomatic improvements.

What fact-check ?: Pope Francis ran away public meeting due coronavirus fear .
Explanation: This video dates back to 2019 and is not related to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Bitter gourd juice cure coronavirus two hours .
Explanation: PIB India clarified that this viral message is Fake. According to WHO there is no cure medicine discovered or recommended to cure coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: After COVID-19 outbreak europe Muslims non-Muslims come streets shouting praises Allah reading Kalma .
Explanation: Fact Crescendo found the viral video to be unrelated. The video dates back before the outbreak of COVID-19 in Europe. This is a demonstration march by the citizens in Hamburg, Germany in solidarity with Uyghur Muslims.

What fact-check ?: Saddam Hussein predicted coronavirus outbreak 40 years ago .
Explanation: The video is edited and was shot before the Iraq war. In the video Saddam Hussein can be seen discussing prospects of war with his military advisors and son Qusay. There's no mention of CoronaVirus in the actual video.

What fact-check ?: 8 coronavirus patients Ghana recovered .
Explanation: Please read the full article

What fact-check ?: There 's definitive proof chloroquine , hydroxychloroquine , effective COVID-19 .
Explanation: Studies have shown some early promise, but it's not entirely solid to say the treatments work against coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Fox News Pulitzer coronavirus coverage .
Explanation: Claim made on website that is clearly labeled as satire.

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp forward rounds claims Prime Minister Narendra Modi called 14-hour long ‘ Janta Curfew ’ 22 March 7 9 pm lifespan coronavirus one place 12 hours follow Janta Curfew religiously chain broken
Explanation: There is no clear information on the lifespan of the novel coronavirus. However, various study reports have suggested a similar lifespan as that of other coronaviruses. PM Modi’s motive behind calling for a ‘Janta Curfew’ was just to curb the spreading of novel coronavirus and the Government has not claimed that the Janta Curfew is called to kill the virus hence the claim turned out to ‘Misleading’ in our fact-check.

What fact-check ?: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Reddy claimed ‘ Paracetamol ’ medication coronavirus .
Explanation: It is evident from our findings and Dr. Pandey’s testimony that Paracetamol can help with the coronavirus symptoms but it cannot entirely cure coronavirus. We also found that Paracetamol is not the only medication that can help with coronavirus symptoms as there are many medications.

What fact-check ?: The United States America threatened Iraq coronavirus 1990 .
Explanation: According to the AP Archive description, Saddam Hussein said, “If God wills it and we have to run after the enemy, then we will do it.” Also, in AP’s description, we found that Saddam Hussein did not refer to the word ‘Coronavirus’ in the original video.

What fact-check ?: A Facebok post suggests China created new coronavirus order kill 1 % population .
Explanation: There is no evidence that supports this claim.

What fact-check ?: Do n't take NSAIDs . This medicine worsens symptom .
Explanation: The French health minister has made a similar statement while the health authorities of EU, UK, Taiwan said there is no enough evidence to support that claim.

What fact-check ?: If see person wearing white wristband , leave alone . He quarantine .
Explanation: The measure of the electronic wristband is implemented in Hong Kong, not Taiwan. The picture is miscaptioned.

What fact-check ?: The symptoms first nine days one catches COVID-19 .
Explanation: COVID-19 patients don't have the exact same symptoms. The most common symptoms are fever, tiredness, and dry cough. Some patients may have aches and pains, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat or diarrhea.

What fact-check ?: Many foreigners wiped saliva onto handle Taipei 's metro spread COVID-19 .
Explanation: The videos were filmed in Hong Kong and Brussels, not in Taiwan.

What fact-check ?: The spokesman Chinese Foreign Ministry Zhao Lijian : American CDC admitted COVID-19 patients misdiagnosed flu . US Army responsible outbreak Wuhan .
Explanation: China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian tweeted and commanded.

What fact-check ?: Ibuprofen good possible COVID-19 treatment .
Explanation: University of Vienna denied the research. The relation between Ibuprofen and COVID-19 is not clear yet.

What fact-check ?: Dr. Yavuz Dizdar 's multiple allegations around COVID-19 .
Explanation: Dr. Dizdar is an oncologist, not an expert in the field. The allegations are based on the interpretation, not scientific evidence.

What fact-check ?: An audio clip suggests WHO advised lockdown .
Explanation: A source in WHO confirmed that the organisation has not put out any such information as heard in the viral audio clip.

What fact-check ?: The Ethiopian Airlines flight Italy evening Addis Ababa airport . Most passengers infected virus , strength except God .
Explanation: The visuals actually pertain to a mock rescue drill that took place at Blaise Diagne Airport near the town of Diass, Senegal. The incident dates back to 28 November 2019 and was a simple simulation aimed at evaluating the capacity to respond to various crises that may arise during airport operations.

What fact-check ?: Saddam Hussein 90s talking coronavirus cabinet army America threatened spread virus n't follow command .
Explanation: The viral video is a doctored version of the original video shared by Associated Press in 2015. The audios of both the videos are different not only in terms of their content but voice as well. In the original AP video, Saddam Hussein does not mention the word ‘virus’ or ‘coronavirus.’

What fact-check ?: Curfew Janta , India help break chain transmission .
Explanation: The World Health Organisation has maintained that it is not certain how long the virus that causes COVID-19 survives on surfaces, but it seems to behave like other coronaviruses.

What fact-check ?: Hospitals advising people wear gloves petrol pumps .
Explanation: The hospital named in the message confirmed that it did not issue this advice, and health authorities, including the Chief Medical Officer, said that the public is not being advised to do this.

What fact-check ?: Gargling With Warm Salt Water Can Save From coronavirus .
Explanation: Post claiming gargling with warm salt water can save from coronavirus is fake as per health organizations and experts.

What fact-check ?: The original form Corona COVID-19 virus enlarged 2,600 times
Explanation: The small creature in the photo is a weevil, a beetle that comes from the Curculionoidea family.

What fact-check ?: The video American Army Distributes Corona China
Explanation: The man in the first video is a train passenger in Belgium who is drunk. While the man in the second video is a company manager in Hong Kong who intentionally made a parody video. The narrative that contains the conspiracy theory "the American army is the spreader of the Corona COVID-19 virus to China" comes from one Chinese official who has not been able to prove the truth.

What fact-check ?: This graph compares coronavirus deaths diseases .
Explanation: Specialists emphasize that the comparison is misleading because it is a new virus that is still spreading and has not reached its "maximum circulation" like the other diseases mentioned.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 created lab used biological weapon .
Who said/posted it?: ZeroHegde, Urn Review, HispanTV, RT, Whatsapp users
Explanation: Nature Medicine magazine published on 17th March that scientists have found Sars-CoV-2 is very different from other coronaviruses and hasn´t evidence of being manipulated or created in lab but it is product of "natural selection". A the the other hands, sources are all-Moscow related and alt-right, conspiracy theories and antisemitism approaches

What fact-check ?: A photo coffins dead people result new coronavirus .
Explanation: The images were taken in October 2013.

What fact-check ?: People type A blood prone get new coronavirus .
Explanation: The study is preliminary and there is no scientific evidence that supports the relation between type blood and COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: WhatsApp chain sent doctor Vall d'Hebron Hospital ( Barcelona ) coronavirus
Explanation: That doctor didn't write chain. The chain also makes some inaccurate claims.

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp message resembling Nigerian CDC circular says Nigeria placed travel ban provided quarantine measures travellers countries coronavirus cases .
Explanation: As at when the message was received, Nigeria was yet to establish travel restrictions; it has since so imposed said restrictions on 13 high-risk countries. Also, contrary to the claim, there are and have always been quarantine measures for migrants into the country.

What fact-check ?: University Vienna declares Ibuprofen makes COVID-19 disease worse .
Explanation: University of Vienna denied the research. The relation between ibuprofen intake and COVID-19 is still under investigaion.

What fact-check ?: Video recorded Muslim resident Spain accumulates supplies chronavirus
Explanation: The product brands shown in the video are Dutch.

What fact-check ?: El País ' publishes Renfe proposing ERTE employees due measures taken coronavirus
Explanation: El Pais' has not published the article and Renfe denies that they are considering apply an ERTE.

What fact-check ?: These remarks made Spanish Health official Fernando Simón 9 days ago
Explanation: These remarks were made on January 31, not 9 days ago.

What fact-check ?: MIlitary planes going fumigate region Comunidad Valenciana disinfect coronavirus
Explanation: Minsitry of Defense said there is not going to be such action.

What fact-check ?: Speech spanish King Felipe VI coronavirus plagiarism book `` Palmeras en la nieve '' `` Las Palmeras ''
Explanation: It is not king's speech about coronavirus, but from years ago about Catalonien. This speech was afterwards included in the book "Las Palmeras". Ther is no plagiarism.

What fact-check ?: Education Ministry aprove exams every student Spain .
Explanation: The ministry of educations debunks this claim.

What fact-check ?: Vladimir Putin accused `` rest leaders '' plan `` reduce world population '' .
Explanation: The subtitles are manipulated.

What fact-check ?: People committing suicide due quarantine Spain .
Explanation: National Police of Valencia confirms that the images that are shared these days are from last year.

What fact-check ?: Gargling warm water salt vinegar kill coronavirus .
Explanation: An image was shared on WhatsApp claiming that gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar can kill COVID-19. There is no evidence that asserts the claims. The WHO reminds that there is still no medicine or household remedy to treat coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Donald Trump tried buy vaccine developed Germany .
Explanation: In an audio a woman said that Trump tried to buy a vaccine that was developed in Germany. However, the german CureVac laboratory denied the allegations on March 16.

What fact-check ?: Spain European country coronavirus lethal .
Explanation: Spain is not the European country where the coronavirus is most lethal, it is Italy.

What fact-check ?: Spaniards need carry work certificate purchase receipts justify Security Forces reason taken streets state alarm .
Explanation: It is not mandatory, but it helps to facilitate police controls.

What fact-check ?: An audio circulating WhatsApp says way end COVID-19 pandemic `` creating herd immunity groups . '' Supposedly , group people , thanks `` positive thoughts diet '' manage `` alkalize body '' , prevent virus spreading .
Explanation: Immunity is not achieved through food or the mind.

What fact-check ?: Deputy Movement Socialism ( MAS ) Bolivia , Juana Quispe Ari : USA created anthrax disease .
Explanation: Actual medicine Information of the disease explain why this is not true.

What fact-check ?: Bolivian Government Minister , Arturo Murillo , said COVID-19 “ type cold ” .
Who said/posted it?: Arturo Murillo, Government Minister of Bolivia
Link to the original piece: https://www.redpat.tv/ministro-murillo-nos-visito-en-no-mentiras/ [23:48- 24:00]; The video was edited and publish by the facebook account Lloque Sinchi Kuntur.
Explanation: The bolivian former minister of Health, Guillermo Cuentas Yañez tells about: “In no way it is a cold”.

What fact-check ?: The Whatsapp audio states absolute quarantine Bolivia Andrés Rojas , CEO Bolivia TV .
Explanation: Bolivia Verfica contacted the deputy of Movement of Socialism (MAS), Franklin Flores, who denied that the audio is from Bolivia. He also explained that when it (The state of Bolivia) comes to emergency, no law projects are carried out.

What fact-check ?: Persons blood type A prone coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence to show that people with blood type A are more likely to get ‘COVID-19’.

What fact-check ?: An image coffins Italy .
Explanation: The image was taken in 2013.

What fact-check ?: In audio , warn arrival COVID-19 Suba hospital .
Explanation: Health entities in the capital confirmed that this is misinformation. So far, there are no cases of coronavirus in the Suba hospital.

What fact-check ?: Chloroquine cures COVID-19 .
Explanation: Studies with chloroquine are ongoing and are not conclusive.

What fact-check ?: A post shared tens thousands times Facebook Twitter claims factory Australian city Melbourne hoarding essential supplies including baby formula , toilet paper hand sanitiser export China novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; police said the accusation was "false". The company cited in the misleading posts also refuted the claim.

What fact-check ?: Chloroquine forbidden French government decree January .
Who said/posted it?: Online article with a screenshot of a legal decree
Explanation: The legal decree did not forbid chloroquine, but sets up a new requirement to be allowed to be given this medicine: people need to have a prescription. This change followed a recommendation of the national agence of medicine (ANSM), made on December 13, 2019, so before the outbreak of coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A post giving nurse 's advice infected coronavirus . The nurse called Claire Magne works hospitals Toulouse , Marseille , depending publications .
Explanation: Quoted hospitals in the publications both denied to AFP having a Claire Magne working for them.

What fact-check ?: Ugandan landlords asked government stop collecting rent citizens stay home fight COVID-19 .
Explanation: A letter allegedly from State House Uganda directing landlords in the country to stop collecting rent as Ugandans stay home to fight COVID-19 is not authentic.

What fact-check ?: An article claiming Kenyan died COVID-19 20 March .
Explanation: An article claiming that a Kenyan had died from COVID-19 on 20 March is false.

What fact-check ?: An image coffins showing victims COVID-19 Italy .
Explanation: A Facebook post with an image claiming to show the victims of COVID-19 in Italy uses a photo of the coffins of African immigrants who drowned off the coast near Lampedusa in 2013.

What fact-check ?: President Rodrigo Duterte said COVID-19 , disease caused novel coronavirus , transmitted contact people .
Explanation: The novel coronavirus is known to spread mainly from person to person, but it can also spread through infected surfaces or objects.

What fact-check ?: US President Donald Trump said White House briefing Friday , March 20 , chloroquine hydroxychloroquine , often used treat malaria , approved Food Drug Administration ( FDA ) treatment COVID-19 .
Explanation: Chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine is FDA-approved for treating malaria, lupus, and rheumatoid arthritis, but not COVID-19. There is no official cure for the disease as of March 25.

What fact-check ?: Says truck drivers turned away fast-food restaurants COVID-19 pandemic .
Explanation: Truck drivers are having issues getting meals at some fast-food chains with shuttered dining rooms. Their rigs can’t fit in drive-thru lanes and they aren’t allowed to walk up and order at the window.

What fact-check ?: This picture show dozens coffins Italy coronavirus .
Explanation: This pictures has been taken in 2013, it has no links with the current pandemia.

What fact-check ?: It forbidden one car France confinement .
Explanation: You have to follow some rules, but it is not always forbidden.

What fact-check ?: 1720 , 1919 , 2020 ... Every hundred years , pandemia `` cleans '' Earth .
Explanation: Multiples pandemia occured outside of this timeframe.

What fact-check ?: The French Education Minister postponed summer holidays coronavirus oubreak .
Explanation: The minister said the measure was not considered for the moment.

What fact-check ?: “ Wisconsin state Republicans voted protecting citizens . ”
Explanation: Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”

What fact-check ?: “ Fish tank additive may treat coronavirus . ”
Explanation: Fish-tank cleaners containing chloroquine cannot be substituted for prescription drugs used to treat malaria. The FDA says you should not take chloroquine unless it has been prescribed by a doctor and obtained from a legitimate source.

What fact-check ?: Romania introducing new law penalize breaking quarantine 15 years imprisonment .
Explanation: 15 years of imprisonment is maximum length of punishment for those who knowingly spread the contagious disease and their action resulted in death of others. Breaking the quarantine will be punishable up to 3 years of imprisonment or fine.

What fact-check ?: Italian doctor saying one died coronavirus .
Explanation: The interviewed mentioned as a source is from late February when the coronavirus outbreak in Italy wasn't that significant. At the moment, this doctor has changed his position on coronavirus and casualties.

What fact-check ?: Audio clip conversation claiming Government India announce shutdown country coming days 15 April 15 June wake Coronavirus outbreak
Explanation: PIB termed the audio clip of the phone conversation discussing ‘complete lockdown’ of the country from 15 April to 15 June as ‘fake’. WHO India has also confirmed that the audio is fake.

What fact-check ?: People shouting ‘ Allahu Akbar ’ Europe Coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: The video is not related to COVID-19 outbreak in Europe. The video was found to be on the internet since 13 January 2020, whereas the first COVID-19 case in Europe was reported on 24 January 2020. The video was taken in Germany, where the first COVID-19 case was reported on 28 January 2020.

What fact-check ?: Government India announced ‘ National Lockdown ’ country 20 March 2020 .
Explanation: No, the Government of India hasn’t announced a ‘National Lockdown’ in the country from 20 March. PM Modi, in his recent address to the nation about the coronavirus outbreak, has asked people to practice ‘social distancing’ and to stay home as much as possible for the coming few weeks to combat COVID-19. Also, the Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

What fact-check ?: Indian PM Modi providing free masks people ‘ Swachh Bharat Mission ’ keep protected Coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: The website in the post is a dubious one and there is no government scheme of PM Modi under which free masks are being provided to people. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has also clarified that there is no Central government scheme that provides free masks to people to keep them protected from coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: Recently , Petrol companies reduced Rs . 6.40 petrol Diesel Rs . 6.80 .
Explanation: Recently, the petrol and diesel price has not reduced by Rs.6:40 and Rs.6.80 respectively. Petrol and diesel prices have come down by about Rs.2 in the last three weeks.

What fact-check ?: Saudi English-language Magazine Sayidaty Addresses Novel coronavirus Since 2013
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: The magazine addressed the middle east respiratory coronavirus back then, which means that the claim is misleading.

What fact-check ?: Brazillian President Declares `` Gaza Only coronavirus Free City '' .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the claim and found that the Arabic translation with the video is fake.

What fact-check ?: Italian prime minister Conte : We Lost Control Over coronavirus , Everything Hands God .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the claim and found that it is fake; no such statement had been released from the PM on any official record.

What fact-check ?: Video Shows A Woman falling Jeddah .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the video and found that the woman is mentally unstable, which caused her to fall, according to Saudi authorities.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus fears Germany result large crowds outside supermarket .
Explanation: The viral video is 9 years old and has nothing to do with COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Donald Trump said , “ People dying never died ”
Explanation: The quote has been on the internet for over a decade attributing it to different people at different times.

What fact-check ?: Not single Muslim died Coronavirus China .
Explanation: There is no such claim made by China so far that not a single Muslim has died of coronavirus. China has not released any list of people who have died in coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: You n't open windows .
Explanation:
A study published in the New England Journal of Medicine warned that the novel coronavirus remains viable for up to: three hours floating in the air, four hours on copper coins, a whole day on cardboard surfaces and as long as two or three days on plastic surfaces or stainless steel faucets. This scientific data went viral on social media as an oversimplified, false message: “The virus no longer spreads simply by being in contact with infected people or in places where the infected have been. The virus is now in the air. We have entered a new phase, ” reads an audio message sent around on Whatsapp. 

However, research by the United States National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases published in the New England Journal of Medicine mentions no such new phase. To date, the World Health Organization (WHO) reports that the viability of the novel coronavirus in the air does not imply that the contagion is like measles, which can live up to two hours in the air where an infected person has coughed or sneezed.

What fact-check ?: Says Coronavirus Aid , Relief , Economic Security Act gives members Congress pay increase .
Explanation: No version of the coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act grant pay raises for members of Congress.

What fact-check ?: Because COVID-19 epidemic , ice rink turned morgue Mulhouse ( France )
Explanation: The rumor which spread on social networks was denied by the city, the president of the hockey team and by a witness with photos. Besides, an ice rink wouldn't be an efficient morgue.

What fact-check ?: India go lockdown 15 April 15 June 2020 .
Explanation: Goverement Of India has clarified that this audio is fake and has no authenticity.

What fact-check ?: Five helicopters spraying desinfectants German cities .
Explanation: There are no helicopters spraying desinfectants over Germany and also no plans to do so.

What fact-check ?: Favipiravir miracle cure Covid-19 .
Explanation: Favipiravir is among the drugs being tested to see if it can help in treating COVID-19 but there's no proof it can cure the disease.

What fact-check ?: Arbido miracle cure Covid-19 .
Explanation: Arbidol is among the drugs being tested to see if it can help in treating COVID-19 but there's no proof it can cure the disease.

What fact-check ?: A post claims cases new coronavirus Russia .
Explanation: In the day that the post was published there were already 147 people infected with COVID-19, according to the national authorities.

What fact-check ?: Using hot air hair dryer sinuses prevent treat COVID19
Explanation: No evidence supports this theory. Directing hot air to sinuses will make it dry which cause tiny tears that may increase the risk of getting COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A runny nose COVID-19 's symptom .
Explanation: Even the fever and dry cough are the most symptom for COVID-19, runny nose also one of its. In Thailand, 25% of patients has runny nose.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed thousands times Facebook , Twitter , Instagram YouTube March 2020 alongside claim shows police Spain detaining people lockdown due coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video has circulated in reports about an anti-government protest in Azerbaijan in October 2019.

What fact-check ?: A photo showing hundreds people Montparnasse train station Paris , despite confinement measures due novel coronavirus .
Explanation: The photo was taken on May 26, 2019.

What fact-check ?: A letter ministry Education saying summer holidays postponed coronavirus outbreak .
Who said/posted it?: Screenshot of the letter published on Facebook
Explanation: Clues in the letter shows it is a fake (for instance, the signature) and Jean-Michel Blanquer, minister of Education, denied on Twitter having published such a letter. He also denied any change in the holidays' schedule.

What fact-check ?: Sophie Trudeau sharing COVID-19 experience .
Explanation: Video is of a woman from London and not Sophie Trudeau.

What fact-check ?: A positive COVID-19 patient recently met Narendra Modi .
Explanation: A 2018 picture is being shared with a false narrative.

What fact-check ?: A line coffins suggesting Italy currently .
Explanation: Old image of 2013 of migrants dying in a shipwreck shared as recent.

What fact-check ?: Cow urine helpful fight coronavirus .
Explanation: No scientific evidence backs the use of cow urine to tackle viruses.

What fact-check ?: Banglore Municipal body ( BBMP ) spraying medicine air kill coronavirus .
Explanation: The BBMP Commissioner, the Mayor and PIB Fact Check India have clarified that the viral message is just a rumor and the BBMP has no such plans to spray any medicine for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Sick COVID-19 patients airport runway Senegal .
Explanation: Video is old and not from Italy. It actually shows mock drill carried out on 28 November 2019 at Blaise Diagne Airport in Dakar, the capital of Senegal. It has nothing to do with coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Image claims death bodies Italy kept room .
Explanation: The image is from a Cairo Mosque which was turned into a makeshift morgue in 2013.

What fact-check ?: Consuming alcoholic beverages may help reduce risk infection novel coronavirus ; COVID-19 .
Explanation: Drinking alcohol does not protect you from coronavirus infection, according to WHO.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus cured 14 hours curfew .
Explanation: Novel coronavirus have differnt life spans on differnt objects however it can live upto 2 to 3 days.

What fact-check ?: `` Only India resist CoronaVirus . `` - Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Salman .
Explanation: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Salman has not made any such statement.

What fact-check ?: Bill Gates Vatican plan depopulate world coronavirus vaccine .
Explanation: Video clip taken out of context from 2010 Gates TedTalk.

What fact-check ?: Homeland Security mobilizing national guard combat coronavirus .
Explanation: National Guard refuted claims.

What fact-check ?: Joe Biden tested positive coronavirus .
Explanation: Another news publication refuted the false claim.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus cases linked 5G rollout .
Explanation: Overlaps in the map between 5G and cases can be explained by population density.

What fact-check ?: Photo shows coffins coronavirus outbreak Italy .
Explanation: Old photo from African migrants who died from shipwreck in 2013.

What fact-check ?: Seeing rise novel coronavirus India , World Health Organization ( WHO ) recommended government India lockdown country April 15 June 15 .
Explanation: We reached out to one of the representatives in India, who rubbished the claim and clarified that WHO has not made any such recommendation.

What fact-check ?: A video rounds already flooded WhatsApp groups . It claimed lady shown video wife Canada ’ PM Justin Trudeau . In viral video , lady seen describing improved condition medication also warns take chances .
Explanation: The lady in the viral video is not Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife Sophie Grégoire Trudeau but a British national namely Tara Jane Langston.

What fact-check ?: A video posted Twitter shows group chinese people converting islamism argument islamics imune COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false. Islamic people are not imune to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Doctors giving 'rescue packs ' people pre-existing respiratory conditions .
Explanation: There is no evidence that doctors in Ireland are giving out packs containing steroids and antibiotics to people with pre-existing respiratory conditions, such as asthma or COPD. On the contrary, doctors have advised that such a move would not be safe, given the different needs that each patient would have.

What fact-check ?: `` If Las Vegas get knock door NV Power , 2020 Census CVD-19 testers , open door . They robbing people gunpoint . ''
Explanation: Las Vegas police said they have received no such reports. Similar rumors are being spread around the country.

What fact-check ?: If people violate quarantine measures Ukraine , imprisoned .
Explanation: According to the law on coronavirus in Ukraine, there is no such measure.

What fact-check ?: There 6 000 coronavirus-infected Ukraine . The government hides read numbers .
Explanation: The real numbers in any country are unknown. The aim of such publications is to spread panic.

What fact-check ?: Pets transmit new coronavirus .
Explanation: The is no proof that pets can transmit the new coronavirus, although the droplets with the virus can stay on pets and, then, get into the human organism.

What fact-check ?: Fill 2020 US Census form receive economic stimulus payment .
Explanation: U.S. government relief payments for coronavirus relief will be determined by tax returns, not census information.

What fact-check ?: Rinsing throat nose warm salt water save getting new coronavirus .
Explanation: Rinsing the throat and washing the nose with salty water may slightly alleviate the cold. However, it does not help with respiratory diseases, including COVID-19. The effectiveness of such treatment or prevention of the new coronavirus is not proven.

What fact-check ?: A photo circulating Facebook Nigeria appears show President Muhammadu Buhari shaking hands nation ’ Code Conduct Bureau Chairman Mohammed Isa men wearing face masks — seeming flouting precautions novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The image was doctored using an old photo, taken long before the pandemic.

What fact-check ?: The death Kobe Bryant overshadowed news American drugmaker hustling make vaccine coronavirus , 200 people died COVID-19 August 2019 USA .
Explanation: There was an article about American drugmakers working on a new vaccine to counter the rapidly spreading respiratory virus publishing on the American daily newspaper, USA Today, on January 24. But the feature didn't mention a death toll of 200 in August 2019.

What fact-check ?: The Colombian government made official citizens receive 350,000 pesos week staying home prevent proliferation '' new coronavirus COVID-19 .
Explanation: It is false that the Columbian government is giving 350,000 pesos to stay at home.

What fact-check ?: Elderly COVID-19 patients wo n't access respirators
Explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

What fact-check ?: The King Spain plagiarized COVID-19 speech book .
Explanation: A picture shows a fragment of the King's speech and the image of a book as if the king had plagiarized his words from a writer.

What fact-check ?: The schools Bizkaia Spain close September .
Explanation: The Education ministry of The Basque Country denies it to Newtral.es.

What fact-check ?: Chroloquine could cure coronavirus
Explanation: There are not enough conclusive evidence to point out chloroquine as a cure treatment

What fact-check ?: `` 19 Tigers fans got infected COVID-19 NY ''
Explanation: Although it is true that members of the group “Libres y Lokos”, a bar of a Monterrey soccer team, made a trip to New York, in the United States, to witness the game of Tigres vs New York City FC, it is false that even the March 20, 2020, it has been confirmed that 19 people from the blue-blue bar have contracted the new coronavirus as indicated by an audio circulating on WhatsApp.

What fact-check ?: People type O blood resistant COVID-19 .
Explanation: "It circulates on social networks and in various media portals, a note that ensures that a study establishes that certain blood groups are more resistant (or even immune) to the COVID-19 virus. This information is DECEPTIVE. Although this clinical trial was carried out, this is a preliminary study published on the medRxiv portal, a free online archive and distribution server for complete (unpublished) manuscripts from the medical, clinical and health-related sciences."

What fact-check ?: Worshipers beaten policemen gathered church .
Explanation: We found the same video published on Twitter on November 2019, so before the outbreak of coronavirus. The caption was : "Zimbabwe riot police attacked opposition party MDC Alliance supporters today who had gathered to hear leader, Nelson Chamisa, give his Hope of the Nation Address." Other pictures on Twitter and within AFP archives allow us to match the video with this anti riot police operation.

What fact-check ?: A Chinese woman Mombasa attacked killed showing flu-like symptoms refusing go hospital .
Explanation: The article uses an image from the 2013 Westgate terror attack in Kenya, and police in the area also had not received any information about the attack.

What fact-check ?: 22 travellers Uganda EU-Uganda Business Summit scheduled early March refused go quarantine .
Explanation: The 22 travellers had refused to go into quarantine and opted to travel back to their home countries, but they were not in Uganda for the conference as claimed.

What fact-check ?: It recommanded disinfect everything buy bleach prevent infected coronavirus .
Explanation: It is not really recommanded. Experts say it is better to focus on washing your hands and to follow the official recommandations.

What fact-check ?: Stocks `` medical masks '' made Woippy , Moselle , company blocked lack `` agreement government '' , inspite shortage masks France .
Explanation: Facebook users did not answer to AFP. Their publications mention a place that does not exist. Woippy's mayor told AFP he does not know about a company that is making masks in his city.

What fact-check ?: Quotes Joe Biden saying “ people never died dying coronavirus . ”
Explanation: The quote was first misattributed to President Donald Trump. Joe Biden didn’t say it either.

What fact-check ?: Says Russia unleashed 500 lions streets ensure people staying indoors pandemic outbreak .
Explanation: Russian President Vladimir Putin hasn’t resorted to releasing lions in order to keep people inside during the COVID-19 pandemic.

What fact-check ?: A purported warning Australian hospitals shared thousands times multiple posts Facebook using petrol pumps enable spread novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health said it did not issue the purported advisory; scientists say the virus is unlikely to survive on petrol pumps outside as sunlight and lack of moisture generally kill it; motorists are advised to regularly wash their hands to avoid infection.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus live 12 hours surface
Explanation: According to a scientific study, coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) was stable on some surfaces (like plastic and stainless steel) for up to 72 hours (3 days). Also, on the WHO website, it can be read that virus ‘may persist on surfaces for a few hours or up to several days’.

What fact-check ?: Video Canadian PM Justin Trudeau 's wife suffering COVID-19 .
Explanation: Woman seen in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London.

What fact-check ?: Auto-hemotherapy cures COVID-19 .
Explanation: Auto-hemotherapy it's not among the prevention or treatment measures for the new coronavirus recommended by national and international health authorities. In addition, documents from medical entities and Anvisa (Brazilian National Health Surveillance Agency) published before the COVID-19 pandemic already warned of the risks of the practice, which has no scientific backing and may offer health risks.

What fact-check ?: Brazilian government iniciated registration process coronavirus financial aid WhatsApp .
Explanation: The message has been accompanied by links that can be used to steal personal data and redirect users to suspicious websites. The false information was denied by the brazilian government and Ministries of Citizenship and Economy.

What fact-check ?: Putin Declares `` Comply With Quarantine Face Prison Five Years ''
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Exaggerated sanctions to be on anyone who refuse to comply with the quarantine in Russia.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus Nothing But Sarin Gas .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Coronavirus outbreak is nothing but a cover for Sarin gas leaks from an American lab in Afghanistan, but this claim is false according to the WHO.

What fact-check ?: US Army Sells Food Just Like Egyptian Army
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: US army sells food with discounted fares just like the Egyptian army. A misleading photo, which shows the US army distributing free food in New York.

What fact-check ?: Did Pollution Rate Decreased Aftermath coronavirus Outbreak ?
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar found that the claim is misleading; the pollution rate did decrease in some cities.

What fact-check ?: Janta curfew nation wide 14 hours break chain coronavirus spread see reduction 40 per cent cases .
Explanation: There is no scientific proof to the claim as yet, that 14 hours curfew will break the chain of coronavirus spread and see reduction of 40 per cent cases.

Countries: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
What fact-check ?: A drug called Favipiravir cure coronavirus , advice people go inside homes shoes bring infection home .
Explanation: Favipiravir may help treat those who have mild symptoms of COVID-19 but not those who are more severely ill. The director of the Spanish Center for Emergency Coordination Fernando Simon said on 16 March that there was no need to leave shoes out of the home. The same opinion holds the head of the Italian Institute of Health, Silvio Brusafero, and Fabrizio Preljasko, a virologist at the University of Milan.

What fact-check ?: A chart comparing infected killed coronavirus Argentina Spain .
Explanation: The data on the chart was incorrect and it is not advised to compare and make projections with information from different countries, that are experiencing the pandemic in different stages.

What fact-check ?: Lukewarm water lemon water lemon bicarbonate preventive measures COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence that hot water or vitamin C prevents COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Bitter gourd juice cure Coronavirus .
Explanation: Bitter gourd juice cannot cure coronavirus, there is no cure to coronavirus as of this date.

What fact-check ?: Croatia put `` total quarantine '' due secret deal authorities Red Cross .
Explanation: Red Cross doesn't have anything to do with implementing quarantine rules, nor did they attend a secret meeting with the Croatian government.

What fact-check ?: Biden campaign ’ claim top CDC official ‘ silenced ’ .
Explanation: Messonnier’s remarks on Feb. 25 may have caught the attention of Wall Street and caused angst in the White House. But we cannot find evidence of her being immediately silenced, as Klain claims in the video.

What fact-check ?: Denmark passed 200 new cases Covid-19 one day 26 cases .
Explanation: These numbers are not in line with the national authorities, it was never reported 200 or 26 news cases in one day in Denmark. On March 19, there were 75 new cases in the country.

What fact-check ?: Korean drama predicted occurence COVID19 2018 ..
Explanation: The korean series didn't talk about COVID-19 but used SARS as a reference in creating a highly lethal coronavirus that have very different death rates, symptoms and incubation period .

What fact-check ?: The quarantine Italy showed clean waters Venice fishes dolphin .
Explanation: It is not true, the image of a dolphin was taken in another Italian city, Cagliari, in the Sardinia island, and not in Venice. It was not dued to the quarantine.

What fact-check ?: US military brought virus Wuhan October 2019 .
Who said/posted it?: Spokesperson of the Chinese Foreign Affairs ministry
Explanation: The US CDC director says that the flue has started in October in the US, and that some apparently flue-related deaths were in fact due to the COVID-19. He does not say that the COVID-19 has sarted in october in the US.

What fact-check ?: One Polish telecomunications company used quarantine cover put 100 5G antennas Gdynia .
Explanation: They were installed long before coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: Russian president using lions ensure people stayed indoors Russia .
Explanation: Lion roaming in Johannesburg street as part of a film production in 2016.

What fact-check ?: Channel4 's Jon Snow infected coronavirus .
Explanation: Jon Snow was on a self-isolation after an Iran assignment in late February and has reported to work after 14day period, and continues to be part of the Channel4 News and to-date has not contracted COVID-19, verified from his Twitter account and verified News sourced.

What fact-check ?: Initial Lack Of Evidence For Human-To-Human COVID-19 Transmission Unusual .
Explanation: We lined up the tweets from WHO and showed there was a progression from not know to the transmission being human-to-human

What fact-check ?: Tom Hanks died , confessed admiration Trump .
Explanation: Story published by clear death-hoax website.

What fact-check ?: Helicopters Are Spraying Disinfectants To Try To Eradicate coronavirus .
Explanation: False information being spread on Facebook. Completely made up, but post is spreading across countries.

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp forward gone viral claimed vaccine coronavirus discovered . The viral forward also claims treatment coronavirus mentioned Intermediate Zoology book .
Explanation: The viral forward reads, “It is not a new disease as it is already mentioned in the Intermediate zoology book along with its treatment. It happens sometimes that many great scientists and doctors do not focus on lesser-known books as they are mostly busy with famous books. Book name: Zoology, Writer: Dr. Ramesh Gupta, Page No. 1072.) Friends, this is not fake news so I request you to kindly share it maximum so all coronavirus patients are treated in time.”The treatments mentioned in the viral page of the book are first of all not a treatment for coronavirus but a treatment for common cold caused by a coronavirus which is negated partially by various research reports so the viral claim that there is pre-existing medication for coronavirus, is ‘Misleading’.

What fact-check ?: Riots London due unavailability food items . The United Kingdom locked tonight . Army soldiers take UK streets .
Explanation: This video is of riots that happened in Peckham, London. With the help of Google search, we found several global media reports on the London riots. It was clear from these reports that the video viral on social media is the London riots that happened in 2011.

What fact-check ?: Photographs Army Dublin city centre show country go lockdown .
Explanation: The photographs show the Army setting up mobile testing centres in Dublin city centre, not preparing for the country to go into lockdown

What fact-check ?: Riots London due unavailability food items . The United Kingdom locked tonight . Army soldiers take UK streets .
Explanation: The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011.
