The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.

What fact-check ?: Poison Spray Corona Malaysia Singapore Air ?
Explanation: Indonesian Minister of Communication and Information Johnny G. Plate, Malaysian Army, and Head of Batam City Health Office Didi Kusmaryadi have denied the rumors.

What fact-check ?: Drauzio Varella , one Brazil 's famous doctors , stated video March 22 : 's coronavirus crisis , strong cold , 's reason changing routine unless infected .
Who said/posted it?: Ricardo Salles, Brazilian Minister for the Environment, and Flavio Bolsonaro, Brazilian Senator and son of Jair Bolsonaro
Explanation: The video was actually published on January 30, when Brazil had no confirmed cases of COVID-19. Varella himself said, in a video published a month later, that the situation had changed and the previous video did not represent his current opinion on the matter.

What fact-check ?: Social media posts suggest Zimbabwean police flogged churches gathered defiance warnings encouraging social distancing .
Explanation: The video is neither related to the coronavirus nor church activities. It is a November 2019 video of Zimbabwean police dispersing supporters of the main opposition political party.

What fact-check ?: “ Boil orange peels wit cayenne pepper stand pot breathe steam mucus release yo nasal… MUCUS problem THE VIRUS LIVES ! ! ! ” .
Explanation: Orange peels and cayenne are not proven to treat COVID-19, and neither is boiling them.

What fact-check ?: The photo shows funeral Turkish deceased general Aytac Yalman due COVID-19 .
Explanation: The photo was taken in 2006 in someone's funeral who died of hemorrhagic fever.

What fact-check ?: Riots London due unavailability food items . The United Kingdom locked tonight . Army soldiers take UK streets .
Explanation: The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.

What fact-check ?: A recent video Coronavirus patients airport China gauge serious situation .
Explanation: The video is not of the coronavirus infected patients of China or Italy, but of the mock drill conducted at Blas Dian Airport in Decar, Senegal last year.

What fact-check ?: A drug made cow urine pigeon membrane cure coronavirus .
Explanation: No evidence found which can prove that the pigeon membrane can cure the coronavirus. WHO has not mention this too.

What fact-check ?: Five helicopters desinfect Netherlands extinguish coronavirus . Citizens stay inside .
Explanation: Different versions of this message have been circulating all over the world since March 10th. The Dutch police force has confirmed no such measures have been or will be taken.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus infectious air 8 hours everyone must wear face mask .
Explanation: Coronavirus may remain in the air 1-3 hours, and face masks are not required for everyone, just healthcare workers.

What fact-check ?: An image shared thousands times multiple posts Facebook alongside claim shows medicine created US scientists cure novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; the photo in fact shows a COVID-19 test kit developed by a South Korean company; as of March 2020, international health experts have said there is no "cure" or vaccine for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A photo shared hundreds times multiple Facebook , Twitter Instagram posts alongside claim shows Italy ’ president crying novel coronavirus epidemic claimed thousands lives country .
Explanation: The claim is false; the photo shows Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro getting emotional during a Thanksgiving speech in December 2019.

What fact-check ?: A video shared thousands times Facebook claims show police Zimbabwe beating churchgoers place worship refused close prevent spread COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claims are false; the video was filmed before the virus outbreak. It shows opposition supporters being dispersed after gathering to hear their leader.

What fact-check ?: A purported emergency notice Australian authorities shared hundreds times multiple posts Facebook Twitter . It states people receive free home visits doctors novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; Australian health authorities denied issuing the notice, adding the hoax had prompted “unnecessary phone calls” that had overwhelmed public health units.

What fact-check ?: A viral WhatsApp voice note Nigeria claims coronavirus could kill 45 million Nigerians .
Explanation: This is misleading, as data from the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) shows. The message makes several other false claims, which we debunk here.

What fact-check ?: Russian President Vladimir Putin released 800 lions tigers across Russia stop people leaving home .
Explanation: The original photo was taken on April 11., 2016, in Johannesburg, South Africa, in a movie shooting locale.

What fact-check ?: A tent set next Viamed de Calahorra hospital ( La Rioja ) carry rapid tests coronavirus .
Explanation: No, a tent will not be enabled next to the Calahorra hospital for rapid coronavirus tests.

What fact-check ?: The government Spain going declare state emergency .
Explanation: There is no proof that Spain would enter a state of emergency starting March 23, when the viral audio was spread.

What fact-check ?: Aspirating boiling water vapor five minutes desactivates coronavirus .
Explanation: Doctors say it does not desactivate the virus. The WHO also says there is no vaccine yet.

What fact-check ?: Lemon bicarbonate kill virus .
Explanation: Official sanitary authorities debunk that claim

What fact-check ?: The Peruvian Social Security offering monetary help people included list endure quarantine .
Explanation: The government is offering an excepcional monetary help for people in extreme poverty, but that message is a fraud, according the Social Security authorities.

What fact-check ?: Science Minister Pedro Duque hospitalized due coronavirus Denia
Explanation: Pedro Duque itself denied it in El Objetivo while de chaintext was viralizing

What fact-check ?: Vladimir Putin , `` released 500 lions monitor quarantine . ''
Explanation: This is false. It is a meme that has already gotten out of control.

What fact-check ?: One photograph meeting Bolivian health minister , Anibal Cruz delegates , hints hiding current figures infections COVID-19 population
Explanation: The photo hints that in Bolivia are one thousand people infected with COVID-19. But in Bolivia are registred 61 one cases today (3/27/2020).

What fact-check ?: DRC president , Felix Tshisekedi , suspended payment rents water electricity bills coronavirus .
Explanation: AFP dug into governmental speeches and announcements since the outbreak of coronavirus, and there is no mention of suspension of bills. Plus, the team of the DRC's president denied to AFP having announced such economic measures.

What fact-check ?: A photo showing nurses raising middle fingers French government , caption French President
Who said/posted it?: Instagram users, like the ex football player Vikash Dhorasoo, Facebook users
Explanation: The woman who took the picture explained to AFP having posted such photo to raise her finger to the coronavirus, not to the French government. Analysis of the medatada allowed AFP to confirm she was the one who took the picture.

What fact-check ?: President Giammattei said country 10.000 COVID-19 test .
Explanation: Guatemala had received 1.000 test from WHO-PAHO and now has 622.

What fact-check ?: Three photos showing coffins lined enclosed space released social media message coronavirus pandemic Italy . `` This Italy , '' said .
Explanation: The images correspond to migrants killed in shipwrecks in the Mediterranean in 2013.

What fact-check ?: Photo `` crying president Italy '' caption arguing Italy prepared deal coronavirus outbreak despite adequate health facilities .
Explanation: The world leader in the photo on these posts is not the president of Italy. He is Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro.

What fact-check ?: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced 14 hour curfew virus lives 12 hours surfaces .
Explanation: Research studies show that The study found the new coronavirus can live in the air for several hours and on some surfaces for as long as 2 -3 days. These studies are not peer reviewed.

What fact-check ?: Celebrities spreading misinformation coronavirus Janata curfew India .
Explanation: The celebrities shared posts that were already debunked about the 12 hour curfew on March 22 in India.

What fact-check ?: Yves Levy , husband former french health minister Agnès Buzyn , inaugurated P4 laboratory Wuhan China , coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 created .
Explanation: The virus wasn't created in Wuhan's P4 laboratory.

What fact-check ?: “ Go 2020census.gov fill census form get stimulus check . ”
Explanation: Your response to the U.S. Census won’t affect whether you get a federal stimulus check.

What fact-check ?: A screenshot Nigerian television station showing breakdown `` 472 confirmed cases '' shared Facebook , Twitter , WhatsApp alongside claims shows novel coronavirus cases across country .
Explanation: But the image is being shared out of context: It shows figures for Lassa fever, not coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed hundreds thousands times Facebook , Twitter YouTube alongside claim shows drone launching fireworks people breached curfew Malaysia nationwide coronavirus lockdown .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video's audio has been manipulated to include a man speaking in Malaysian; the original clip actually shows a prank that was staged by a Brazilian influencer in Brazil in July 2019.

What fact-check ?: Polish telecommunications provider PLAY installed 5G antennas quarantine .
Explanation: The were installed before quarantine was introduced.

What fact-check ?: Belgium Health Minister banned group sex due coronavirus outbreak associated orgy .
Explanation: This information is based on a satire article.

What fact-check ?: There science behind Indian Prime minister Modi ’ 5 PM clapping initiative : Clapping generates vibration kill Coronavirus . Also , 22 March 2020 Amavasya .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence to prove that vibration from clapping hands can kill coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau of India has clarified that the message is fake. Also, Amavasya is not on 22 March 2020.

What fact-check ?: Picture coffins coronavirus patients died single day Italy .
Explanation: The picture is indeed from Italy but is seven years old and has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: Dolphins swans return Italy waterways COVID-19 lockdown .
Explanation: Dolphins and swans are spotted on Italy's waterways and this has nothing to do with the coronavirus lockdown.

What fact-check ?: Clapping together 5 pm create vibration destroy coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no proven evidence that vibration created by collectively clapping can destroy coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: The brazilian doctor Drauzio Varella defends population n't need lockout .
Explanation: The video brings outdated information about the COVID-19 crisis and creates confusion by mixing real recommendations, how not to create panic, with others now ineffective, how to maintain normal life. Sites also amplify misinformation and use false titles to disorient. In a note on its website, the team that works with the doctor classified this type of disclosure as "disservice", which, according to them, is "confusing the population".

What fact-check ?: After coronavirus pandemic , Chinese president said 's China 's time lead world .
Explanation: The excerpt highlighted today on social media, in fact, is from a speech by Xi on October 18, 2017 at the opening of the 19th Congress of the Chinese Communist Party, which takes place every five years. In the speech, Xi Jinping spoke about the achievements of his first government and said that he wanted to further strengthen China's role on the international stage.

What fact-check ?: Egyptian Health Minister Arrives Italy Secret coronavirus Cure .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Egyptian ministry of health denied any intention to visit Italy, and Misbar could not find any report published in the Foreign Policy regarding the claim.

What fact-check ?: Trump faints , infected coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: A video shows a sudden fainting of US President Donald Trump while making a speech before a group of people. It turns out to be an old video dates back to 2016.

What fact-check ?: A Video Shows Chaos London While coronavirus Spread .
Who said/posted it?: FaceBook accounts and Pages and Twitter Accounts
Explanation: Misbar investigated the video and it turned out to be old and dating back to August 2011.

What fact-check ?: People rioting streets London due economic crisis wake coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: The viral video is almost nine years old and from the London riots in 2011.

What fact-check ?: A video police arresting man viewed thousands times Facebook Twitter alongside claim shows police Italy detaining man flouted national lockdown novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the footage in fact shows police arresting a knife-wielding man in the Brazilian city of Sao Paulo.

What fact-check ?: Two malaria medications work treat COVID-19 .
Explanation: President Donald Trump announced that the FDA already has a treatment for COVID-19. In his announcement, he mentioned two drugs used to treat malaria as well as an antibiotic. However, a comprehensive review of available scientific evidence shows hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine have not yet shown sufficient efficacy for treating respiratory disease caused by the novel coronavirus. These medications are still in early-phase clinical trials for treating the disease.

What fact-check ?: Voice message called ombudsman says internet may collapse Argentina .
Explanation: The official ombudsman denied that the message came from his office and the national institute of communication advised for a rational use of internet but did not recommend to stop sending videos via Whatsapp.

What fact-check ?: Turkey helped Italy 200.000 masks equipment nobody took notice .
Explanation: Important context is missing. It was not a humanitarian aid delivery. Italy bought 200.000 masks from a company in Turkey and they were blocked at the customs for more than two weeks before Turkey decided to let them be exported.

What fact-check ?: Russian government unleashed lions streets inpose public curfew .
Explanation: The viral bulletin is digitally edited and the lion in the image was a part of a movie shoot from South Africa.

What fact-check ?: Doctors nurses Italy dying lying dead ground due Coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: The image does not depict dead doctors and nurses in Italy. It is a part of a demonstration by youngsters to spread awareness about coronavirus in Bogota.

What fact-check ?: Chancellor Angela Merkel knew pandemia since 2013 ; virus laboratory .
Explanation: A risk analysis was published by the German government in 2013 about a fictional coronavirus named „Modi-SARS“. It didn't foretell this pandemic. Scientists say the virus originated in nature.

What fact-check ?: Drinking alcohol beverages help prevent COVID-19 .
Explanation: Photo being spread online is of is a fake hospital news release saying alcoholic beverages would help reduce risk of getting coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said , “ We lost control , killed epidemic physically mentally . Can ’ understand , solutions exhausted ground . Our hope remains Sky , God rescue people . ”
Explanation: The quote attributed to Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte is fabricated. The image accompanying the post shows the president of Brazil, not the Italian prime minister.

What fact-check ?: A photo group people holding banner bears Chinese Malaysian flags shared thousands times Facebook Twitter alongside claim shows Chinese doctors arriving Malaysia combat novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is misleading; the photo actually shows medical supplies donated by China that were delivered to a hospital in Malaysia.

What fact-check ?: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke amid Covid19 deaths country .
Explanation: The image in question is old. The man in the image is not Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte but shows Brazil’s President Jair Bolsonaro who was overwhelmed while speaking about an attack on him

What fact-check ?: A Facebook post Australia claims sufferers respiratory conditions access `` rescue pack '' medication asking General Practitioner .
Explanation: AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be misleading. “Rescue packs” containing steroids and antibiotics are a UK scheme available only to certain people. The federal Department of Health confirmed that people in Australia with pre-existing COPD conditions can only access a “rescue pack” of medication if it has been previously prescribed.

What fact-check ?: Multiple Facebook Twitter posts shared thousands times Australian social media users claim people pre-existing respiratory conditions given “ rescue pack ” medication general practitioners novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health dismissed the rumour as “misinformation”, adding that patients will not receive “rescue packs” from their doctors unless previously prescribed.

What fact-check ?: A photo man woman embracing shared hundreds times Facebook Twitter alongside claim shows two Italian doctors died novel coronavirus , COVID-19 , contracting disease patients treated .
Explanation: The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.

What fact-check ?: Multiple Facebook Twitter posts shared thousands times Australian social media users claim people pre-existing respiratory conditions given “ rescue pack ” medication general practitioners novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health dismissed the rumour as “misinformation”, adding that patients will not receive “rescue packs” from their doctors unless previously prescribed.

What fact-check ?: A photo man woman embracing shared hundreds times Facebook Twitter alongside claim shows two Italian doctors died novel coronavirus , COVID-19 , contracting disease patients treated .
Explanation: The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.

What fact-check ?: A Twitter user claimed Russia released 500 tigers keep people inside lockdown .
Explanation: While this particular image shared by the claim-source was generated from a meme maker website, the original image of the lion was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa in 2016, not recently as we have been led to believe by the publisher.

What fact-check ?: Video made Dr. Mario Pesaresi recomends water steam deactivite coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no evidence of the impact of water steam in coronavirus. The WHO and CDC indicate there is no conclusive evidence to determine whether heat is impacting the virus.

What fact-check ?: An image shows Spanish scientist asking Cristiano Ronaldo Messi find cure Covid-19 .
Explanation: The woman in the picture is not a scientist, but an ex-member of previouses Spanish governments and it was taken in April 2008. It was never related to the new coronavirus or to the football players.

What fact-check ?: WHO confirmed COVID-19 airborne .
Explanation: WHO insisted that COVID-19 is not spread as airborne in everyday life.

What fact-check ?: Second-hand clothes blankets sold cheaply African markets infected coronavirus .
Explanation: The photo is at least ten years old. China imports mostly new clothes to Africa, but WHO, Harvard Medical School and other experts advise it is safe to receive goods from COVID-19 affected areas.

What fact-check ?: A statue Virgin Mary Loreto carried plane Italy ask pandemic Covid-19 stop .
Explanation: The picture was taken in January and is related to a specific event that has nothing to do with COVID-19. The Loreto chatedral has denied that such an event will take place.

What fact-check ?: Army deployed respond COVID-19 pandemic .
Explanation: Army explained the vehicles were returning from a canceled military exercise.

What fact-check ?: Russia unleashed 500 lions ensure people stay inside homes amid coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: The image of a bulletin viral on social media has nothing to do with Russia or Russian President. The image is from South Africa’s Johannesburg, and the lion seen in the viral image was brought for film shooting by a production crew.

What fact-check ?: Russia allegedly unleashed 500 lions order ensure people stay inside houses .
Explanation: The bulletin has been created using a template caled 'Break your own news'. Secondly, the image of the lion dates back to 2016 and was taken in South Africa’s Johannesburg

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp forward gone viral claimed vaccine coronavirus discovered . The viral forward also claims treatment coronavirus mentioned India 's Intermediate Zoology book . The viral forward reads , “ It new disease already mentioned Intermediate zoology book along treatment . It happens sometimes many great scientists doctors focus lesser-known books mostly busy famous books . Book name : Zoology , Writer : Dr. Ramesh Gupta , Page No . 1072 . ) Friends , fake news I request kindly share maximum coronavirus patients treated time . ”
Explanation: The virus being talked about in the viral claim is not the novel coronavirus(COVID-19) but SARS. WHO has clearly negated the discovery of any vaccine that can cure COVID-19. In an answer to the question, “Are there any medicines or therapies that can prevent or cure COVID-19?”, the WHO replies, “While some western, traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease.

What fact-check ?: Russia unleashed 500 lions ensure people stay inside homes amid coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: the image of a bulletin viral on social media has nothing to do with Russia or Russian President. The image is from South Africa’s Johannesburg, and the lion seen in the viral image was brought for film shooting by the production crew.

What fact-check ?: Inhaling Water Into The Nose Can Prevent Corona Transmission
Explanation: Numerous studies show that water alone is not enough to kill the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Vladimir Putin Released 800 Tigers Lions Forced Residents Stay Home
Explanation: Photos of the lion have been circulating on the internet since April 2016, long before the Corona COVID-19 virus first appeared in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. The lion in the photo is named Columbus, released on the streets of Johannesburg, South Africa, for the purpose of filmmaking.

What fact-check ?: WHO Call Ibuprofen Drugs Can Make Corona Live Longer
Explanation: WHO does not mention that the ibuprofen drug can make the Corona COVID-19 virus live longer. In fact, WHO does not recommend against using ibuprofen based on information available so far. The reason, WHO did not find reports about the negative effects of ibuprofen on COVID-19 patients, beyond the known side effects that limit their use in certain populations. The WHO also did not find any clinical or population-based data published on the claim.

What fact-check ?: Picture `` baile funk '' ( type Brazilian popular party ) São Paulo coronavirus , despite restrictions mass gatherings due COVID-19 .
Explanation: The picture was taken in September 2019, thus before the COVID-19 was first detected

What fact-check ?: A recipe home-made alcohol : mix 3 parts ethanol 1 part water .
Explanation: The ethanol sold in gas stations as fuel has toxic substances which should not to be used as disinfectant at home

What fact-check ?: A vaccine cures COVID-19 three hours released next Sunday , according Donald Trump . Roche already produced millions vaccines .
Explanation: Vaccines do not cure diseases, they prevent diseases. Roche is starting clinical trials on a proprietary drug that might be efficient for treating COVID-19, but the tests will only start in April and no promise of "3 hour cure" has ever been made. Donald Trump did not say anything like it.

What fact-check ?: There thousand open vacancies nurses , doctors health professionals work temporary hospital São Paulo , use treat COVID-19 cases .
Explanation: There are 509 temporary jobs available at the Pacaembu temporary hospital.

What fact-check ?: An audio message lists five ways people prevent novel coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no evidence that sipping water every 20 minutes or exposing your clothing to the sun can help prevent the coronavirus. Officials advise people to wash their hands, but not every 20 minutes, as the message claims. There’s also no evidence that consuming cold things makes you more susceptible to the virus. There’s no proof that the coronavirus can live for up to nine days on metallic surfaces. A preliminary study suggests it can remain viable on stainless steel for up to three days.

What fact-check ?: Auto-hemotherapy cures COVID-19 .
Explanation: WHO says there is still no cure for COVID-19; Brazilian Ministry of Health does not approve auto-hemotherapy.

What fact-check ?: WHO confirms COVID-19 airborne remains air 8 hours .
Explanation: WHO explained that COVID-19 may be aerosol-borne and not airborne, that is it may linger in the air when healthcare workers are performing aerosol-generating procedures. Further, Infectious Disease Epidemiologist at the WHO, Dr Maria Van Kerkhove clarified that disease is spread through “liquid droplets through people’s noses or mouths when they sneeze or cough”.

What fact-check ?: Favipiravir cures COVID-19 .
Explanation: Favipiravir is still on trial both in Japan and Korea. The treatment benefits are not certain yet.

What fact-check ?: Europe rationing food due outbreak .
Explanation: There is no ration stamp practice in Europe in general. Some markets put purchise restrictions; but that does not mean ration stamp.

What fact-check ?: An whole onion located indoor absorb viruses air .
Explanation: Bacteria can breed in onions in room temperature. Viruses only survive in certain kind of cells.

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp forward gone viral claimed vaccine coronavirus discovered . The viral forward also claims treatment coronavirus mentioned India 's Intermediate Zoology book .
Explanation: The viral forward reads, “It is not a new disease as it is already mentioned in the Intermediate zoology book along with its treatment. It happens sometimes that many great scientists and doctors do not focus on lesser-known books as they are mostly busy with famous books. Book name: Zoology, Writer: Dr. Ramesh Gupta, Page No. 1072.) Friends, this is not fake news so I request you to kindly share it maximum so all coronavirus patients are treated in time.” The virus being talked about in the viral claim is not the novel coronavirus(COVID-19) but SARS. WHO has clearly negated the discovery of any vaccine that can cure COVID-19. In an answer to the question, “Are there any medicines or therapies that can prevent or cure COVID-19?”, the WHO replies, “While some western, traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease.

What fact-check ?: Russia unleashed 500 lions ensure people stay inside homes amid coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: The image of a bulletin viral on social media has nothing to do with Russia or Russian President. The image is from South Africa’s Johannesburg, and the lion seen in the viral image was brought for film shooting by a production crew.

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp forward rounds claiming COVID-19 vaccine ready announced US President Donald Trump , launched next Sunday . It also claims vaccine discovered US scientists cure COVID-19 infected patient within 3 hours . With WhatsApp forward , alleged image vaccine also shared .
Explanation: The image being forwarded is an image of a COVID-19 test kit and not of any vaccine that can cure the virus. As per the viral forward, US President Donald Trump has announced that the vaccine will be launched next Sunday, we checked President Trump’s Twitter handle, Facebook Page and Instagram profile but we didn’t find any such announcement by the US president.

What fact-check ?: Italy ’ Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke publicly due ongoing coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The image viral on social media is of Brazilian President Bolsonaro and not of Italy's PM Giuseppe Conte. The claim shared by several Social media users and media outlets is hence false.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus cured within 2 hours drinking bitter gourd juice .
Explanation: Neither WHO nor the Indian Ministry of Health has mentioned any such remedy for coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau of India has also marked it fake.

What fact-check ?: A Facebook post asserts US developed COVID-19 vaccine plans release Sunday .
Explanation: Currently, there are still no definitive and institutionalised vaccines for COVID-19; nonetheless, research persists and holds potential solutions.

What fact-check ?: Offers buy special device , `` clean '' water drinking .
Explanation: Tha claim is false; there is no evidence that this device is effective; in the US it's even considered dangerous.

What fact-check ?: A lengthy text post shared hundreds times Facebook purportedly contains advice prevent infection novel coronavirus , COVID-19 . The post claims advice issued UK hospital medical staff .
Explanation: The claim is false; the hospital named in the misleading Facebook posts denied issuing the guidelines; the posts also contained several false claims previously debunked by AFP Fact Check.

What fact-check ?: Governmental economic measures allow `` unemployed people earn 100 % wage , workers 70 % craftsmen 0 % ''
Explanation: In France, unemployed people can receive money from the state, and in general the amount of money represents 72% of the last wage (very few cases can receive 100% or more, there are exceptions). "Workers" is a very vague term. If it means people still working inspite of confinement, it's false: wages will be the same. If it means workers forced to be half unemployed, the government will give them up to 84% of their wage. "Craftsmen" don't have wage, but earn money for themselves. The government said it will help them too, case by case, thanks to a new national grant.

What fact-check ?: False offer free Internet 60 days due quarantine .
Explanation: Please read the full article

What fact-check ?: The Spanish Government declare imminently state emergency one able leave house supermarkets wil close .
Explanation: It is not true. There is no evidence that the Government is planning to enact a state of emergency, only the extension of the alarm state with the current restrictions.

What fact-check ?: Vox going donate money receive representation institutions public health .
Explanation: The political party denied it.

What fact-check ?: Netflix gives away free accounts coronavirus quarantine .
Explanation: It was phising and the company recomended not to clic on the link that was spreading.

What fact-check ?: Pablo Iglesias announces social benefits suspended three months .
Explanation: The image of the headline shared was manipulated from an actual media.

What fact-check ?: This video , links Family Bonus Payment established Government Bolivia due COVID-19 crisis electoral campaign proposal Juntos .
Explanation: The video announcing the Family Bonus Payment links the political party “Juntos”. Nevertheless, the official page Juntos in facebook denies the creation of this video explaining that they suffered an “cyberattack”.

What fact-check ?: The video shows group Bolivian army making people respect quarantine stay home using violence , Punata Chimbobo .
Who said/posted it?: La Razón El Deber - Facebook Accounts
Explanation: The team of Bolivia Verifica, confirms that the images were recorded in Chimboco zone, (municipality of Sacaba – Cochabamba), 55 km away from Punata.

What fact-check ?: `` People´s scientist '' found coronavirus bioweapon mixing Sars HIV .
Explanation: This "scientist" has no publications, academic records or any institutional support.

What fact-check ?: The mayor Guayaquil Ecuador lied health condition
Explanation: The official data dont reveal the name of people that has COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: The Health Minister Ecuador quit job forced lie statistics COVID-19 related cases .
Explanation: Her reasons to resign the Health Minister are unknown.

What fact-check ?: The president Ecuador n't ask help China IMF
Explanation: The government of China is already sending help to Ecuador because of COVID-19 spread.

What fact-check ?: Whatsapp audio ensuring 24 hour curfew 5 days Ecuador .
Explanation: The audio is fake the curfew in Ecuador nationwide is from 14:00 to 05:00.

What fact-check ?: Fake Twitter account Ecuadorean Health Ministry .
Explanation: The only official account of the Health Ministry is @DrJuanCZevallos.

What fact-check ?: People still shopping malls eventhough curfew mobility restrictions Ecuador .
Explanation: The date doesn't match the images. It was taken before march 22nd.

What fact-check ?: The vaccine China testing COVID19 bad humans .
Explanation: The information was published in a fake account.

What fact-check ?: An image encourage people stay home go terraces balconies .
Explanation: Its not offical information.

What fact-check ?: Because global quarantine , WHO Ecuadorean government given weekly bonus family food medicine .
Explanation: The government is studying the possibility to apply a welfare amount for poor people during quarentine.

What fact-check ?: Ecuadorean government gives money people Venezuela .
Explanation: The government doesn't give money to Venezuelans.

What fact-check ?: Holding breath let test whether may COVID-19 .
Explanation: Holding your breath for 10 seconds is not a valid way to test if you may have COVID-19, and the World Health Organization recommends testing by qualified health professionals.

What fact-check ?: Roche developed COVID-19 vaccine .
Explanation: A video claiming that the pharmaceutical company has developed a vaccine for COVID-19 contains false information.

What fact-check ?: A photo showing Uganda 's first case COVID-19 .
Explanation: The photo of a man wearing a mask does not show Uganda's first COVID-19 case, but was actually taken at the John F Kennedy International Airport in February 2020.

What fact-check ?: Russian President Vladimir Putin releases 800 tigers 500 lions amid coronavirus outbreak keep people home .
Explanation: The photos used were taken in 2016 and 2019 respectively, both in South Africa.

What fact-check ?: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte quoted various posts graphics Facebook saying `` lost control '' coronavirus pandemic greatly affecting Italy .
Explanation: No official statements or reports from credible news organizations carry this supposed quote by Conte. The graphics and screenshots also did not point to the source of the quote.

What fact-check ?: A new vaccine cure COVID-19 patients 3 hours ready .
Explanation: As of March 27, there is still no vaccine or drug approved by the World Health Organization (WHO) or any Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in the world to cure or prevent COVID-19. Moreover, the image used in the post is not a photo of vaccines from Roche Medical Company, but is a photo of rapid test kits from South Korean company Sugentech.

What fact-check ?: Image attributed Italian Prime Minister suggesting Italy lost control .
Explanation: Image of Brazilian Prime Minister Bolsanaro crying at an event falsely shared as Italian President.

What fact-check ?: Says CDC says coronavirus survive surfaces 17 days .
Explanation: A CNBC story touted a misleading headline that said the CDC reported that the coronavirus survived on cruise ship cabins for up to 17 days. A recent CDC report found that traces of the virus were found on the ship for that long, not a live sample.

What fact-check ?: “ Donald Trump would receive $ 17 million three hotels closed four days Republican bill ! How hell right ? ! ”
Explanation: The Senate-approved bill prohibits Trump family hotels from getting coronavirus aid from a $500 billion fund that would be set up to help businesses that incurred losses from the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Vladimir Putin let lions loose streets Russia keep indoors COVID-19
Explanation: The image is from Johannesburg, South Africa, where a lion was released for a video shooting.

What fact-check ?: Italy registered 4200 new recovering cases coronavirus 24h .
Explanation: According to the Italian Health ministry's daily reports, Italy recorded 408 new recovering cases on the period mentioned by the publication. Moreover, its most highest number of new recovering cases since the beginning of the outbreak is 1084 cases (not 4200).

What fact-check ?: Tests results , theft , ban : three false reports chloroquine
Explanation: Facebook messages claim that the former French Health Minister Agnès Buzyn chose to forbid chloroquine and that the efficiency of this treatment against COVID-19 was proved. It's incorrect.

What fact-check ?: Will lockdown cause shortage banknotes ATM ?
Explanation: Cash withdrawals had increased slightly before the start of lockdown but have declined sharply since. The Bank of France as well as bank union representatives say that ATM are full and that no shortage is to be feared.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus gripped Italy nobody willing carry corpses Italy 's streets .
Explanation: The photo was taken on March 24, 2014 in Frankfurt, Germany. People lay down on a pedestrian area to remember victims who lost their lives in a Nazi concentration camp.

What fact-check ?: Italian police brutal people following lockdowns , India follow .
Explanation: The police apprehended a man who was brandishing a gun in Sao Paolo, Brazil.

What fact-check ?: Says `` special military helicopters spray pesticide Corona virus skies country . ''
Explanation: There is no evidence the United States military is using helicopters to spray pesticide in an effort to kill the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: “ Putin stated : Russian citizens ( ) 2 options : Stay home 15 days jail 5 years . ”
Explanation: Russian President Vladimir Putin has implemented some policies to cancel large gatherings and keep people at home during the coronavirus pandemic. But we could not find any evidence that he has threatened jail time for people who don’t comply.

What fact-check ?: `` Slices lemon cup hot water save life . The hot lemon kill proliferation '' novel coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence that lemon can treat or prevent the coronavirus. Health officials have debunked the claim. The video comes from a man who promotes alternative health information on YouTube.

What fact-check ?: Study suggests Malaria drug treat coronavirus .
Explanation: Despite Trump stating that chloroquine had been approved for use to treat COVID-19, the FDA released a statement saying it had not approved the drug for use against COVID-19 and is still studying its effectiveness against the disease.

What fact-check ?: Footage purportedly showing looting spree Mexico prompted panic novel coronavirus aired multiple Facebook live streams viewed tens thousands people week March 23 , 2020 . Posts sharing streams claimed chaotic scene happening real-time .
Explanation: The claim is false; the streams showed old footage from a 2017 looting incident in Mexico that was being played on a loop.

What fact-check ?: Photographs shared hundreds times online purport show coffins Italian victims novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the pictures date back to October 2013 when hundreds drowned in a boat tragedy in the Mediterranean.

What fact-check ?: A video former Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein shared repeatedly Facebook , Twitter Instagram alongside claim shows stating US threatened spread novel coronavirus , COVID-19 , Iraq meeting 1990s .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video's audio has been doctored; the original Associated Press archive footage does not include any reference to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Photo showing crowd illegal - due quarantine -Way Cross prayers Wejherowo .
Explanation: This image is from 2018.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 patients show symptoms first 14 days .
Explanation: On the WHO website, it can be read that the incubation period for COVID-19 range from 1-14 days. But, most commonly COVID-19 patients show symptoms in around five days.

What fact-check ?: Video current situation Italy due coronavirus .
Explanation: The video is of an ‘Emergency Exercise’ at Blaise Diagne International Airport (Senegal) in November 2019. The mock drill was conducted to ensure if the crew can handle emergency situation at the airport.

What fact-check ?: Video Canada PM Justin Trudeau ’ wife pleading people take COVID-19 seriously .
Explanation: The woman in the video is not Canada Prime Minister’s wife (Sophie Grégoire Trudeau). She is Tara Jane Langston, a waitress who contracted COVID-19 and undergoing treatment at Hillingdon Hospital in London.

What fact-check ?: The Russian president , Putin , left 800 lions outside make people stay homes .
Explanation: The photo in the post has no connection to Russia. It is a photo of a movie shooting in South Africa. Putin did not leave 800 lions outside to make people stay in their homes.

What fact-check ?: Image people died Coronavirus Italy .
Explanation: The photo is not related to recent coronavirus deaths in Italy. It was taken in Frankfurt (Germany) in 2014 as part of an ‘art project’ in remembrance of 528 Katzbach victims of the Nazi concentration camp.

What fact-check ?: Photo prime minister Italy crying expressing helplessness ’ save coronavirus patients Italy .
Explanation: The person in the photo is not the PM of Italy. He is Jair Bolsonaro, the President of Brazil. The photo was taken when he cried at an ‘Evangelical Thanksgiving Service’. The PM of Italy has not expressed helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus affected patients in Italy.

What fact-check ?: Photo vaccine developed US scientists COVID-19 .
Explanation: The photo shows a COVID-19 diagnostic test kit developed by Sugentech, a South Korean based company. It is not a vaccine. As on 23 March 2020, there is no vaccine for COVID-19. Also, Trump announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’, not a vaccine, developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

What fact-check ?: Hold breath 10 seconds check coronavirus .
Explanation: The fact is that most young COVID-19 patients will be able to hold their breaths for much longer than 10 seconds, while on the other hand, many elderly without the virus won’t be able to do it.

What fact-check ?: Dr Naresh Trehan said Indian government going declare national emergency .
Explanation: This is a hoax. Dr Trehan's office has not issued any such message.

What fact-check ?: Italian PM broke coronavirus deaths country .
Explanation: The man seen crying in the picture is Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro and the incident has nothing to do with the COVID-19 outbreak.

What fact-check ?: Vaccine made Roche Medical Company cures COVID-19 3 hours .
Explanation: It is not true that a vaccine against the coronavirus was discovered that cures the patient in three hours, as stated by publications circulating on the networks. The photo that accompanies the text is actually a quick test for the detection of COVID-19 produced by the South Korean pharmaceutical company Sugentech. There are no approved vaccines against the new coronavirus yet.

What fact-check ?: H1N1 lethal COVID-19 Brazil .
Explanation: The pieces of misinformation are misleading when comparing the number of cases in the first weeks of COVID-19 in Brazil with the accumulated eight months of swine flu. In the 28 days since its arrival in the country, the new coronavirus infected 1,891 people and killed 34; H1N1 infected 627 people and killed one in its first month.

What fact-check ?: China released movie called 'Coronavirus ' 2013 .
Explanation: The image circulating in social media publications is an adulterated version of the South Korean production poster The Flu, whose name treats a fictional H5N1 epidemic, an avian complaint, not a virus that causes COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Brazilian government apply fees everyone gets caught street March 24 .
Explanation: Although the brazilian Ministry of Health recommends that the population avoid agglomerations so as not to stimulate the spread of the new coronavirus, no legislation or regulation that prohibits the movement of people on the streets is contained in the Official Gazette of the brazilian Union, where all acts of the are published.

What fact-check ?: Graphic shows COVID-19 killed less people daily diseases .
Explanation: In addition to bringing old data (February 11), the graphic ignores that the number of daily deaths caused by the pandemic has been growing rapidly - the average daily mortality jumped from 78.7 in the first month of infection to 419.7 in the second. Experts consulted by Aos Fatos claim that the comparison with other diseases masks the severity of the current situation, because, even if the mortality of the new coronavirus is not the highest, it spreads very quickly and overloads health systems.

What fact-check ?: Vaccines cure COVID-19 ready .
Explanation: Viral image is of a COVID-19 testing kit. A cure is still being researched.

What fact-check ?: Lions released Russian streets Vladimir Putin force people inside .
Explanation: This viral picture is from Johannesburg in South Africa and about four years old.

What fact-check ?: WHO said , eat Cabbage increase chance Coronavirus infection .
Explanation: WHO has not said anything that shows cabbage has any relation to coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: In seemingly careless message sent e-mail , recipients Greek warned company ( shop ) shut new coronavirus staff illness reason , sender must notify sender message termination employment employee .
Explanation: This message contains an "attachment" that carries a high risk of being a malicious software, such as a virus, a Trojan, or other form of malware. The e-mail address is @gmail.com. No legitimate public institution (even a private company) will write to you from a gmail address or any other free service.

What fact-check ?: A web publication shared hundreds times Facebook , Twitter WhatsApp Nigeria claims government pay citizen 8,500 naira ( $ 23.60 ) monthly encourage Nigerians stay home bid slow spread novel coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim is false; officials have dismissed the claim, and the author of the viral publication admitted it was incorrect.

What fact-check ?: Multiple posts social media claim schools South Africa reopen months September , result increase COVID-19 cases .
Explanation: The claims are false; the Department of Basic Education has not made any such announcement and refuted the claims.

What fact-check ?: The text claims mass media owners , called `` Satanists '' text , forcing public voluntarily look coronavirus vaccine . It also describes vaccine ( still exist ) : `` A vaccine beast 's mark present liquid form nano-technology , completely control world people '' .
Explanation: Regardless of their religious feelings, believers, and everyone else, should remain rational, sober, and informed for their own good only from relevant sources. Postings on social networks, if not from officials, no matter where they come from, should be taken with great care and checked before they can be trusted.

What fact-check ?: After 23:30 , city disinfected helicopter doors windows closed .
Explanation: This has not been announced by authorities. This hoax has spread in many other countries.

What fact-check ?: If people get infected CoVid-19 , may able fully recover .
Explanation: It is quite understandable that people with chronic illnesses and the elderly are at greater risk of this virus and this is repeatedly stated by the relevant institutions so that they can be more careful. But whether they will have, if they heal, lasting consequences, have not been confirmed, at least not by a single relevant global health institution.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed tens thousands times multiple Facebook posts claim shows man wiping sweat buttons lift residential block Hong Kong .
Explanation: The claim is false; the footage has circulated in media reports about an incident in Thailand.

What fact-check ?: A photo shared hundreds times multiple posts Facebook Twitter alongside claim shows bodies people died Italy became infected novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; the photo actually shows people participating in a 2014 art project in the German city of Frankfurt.

What fact-check ?: You take high doses vitamin D COVID-19 ; children n't get sick lack receptors virus bond ; coronavirus unnatural mutation ; susceptible temperatures , infections sink summer ; oldest patients treated left die ; 5G harms immune system .
Explanation: There is no evidence that vitamin D can cure or prevent COVID-19; children can get sick but it is unknown why they usually suffer less than adults; experts are convinced the virus originated in nature; the warmer weather will probably make the infection rate sink but not stop the virus; no patients are sorted out only because of their age and electromagnetic fields like 5G can't harm the human body.

What fact-check ?: American scientists developed cure Coronavirus .
Explanation: The viral image on social media is not a vaccine for coronavirus but it is a COVID-19 test kit recently developed by South Korea.

What fact-check ?: People allowed organise funeral family members die COVID-19 . Instead , State take care disposal body .
Explanation: The rules around funerals have changed as gatherings are currently not allowed, but families are still allowed to look after funeral services for their loved ones without the involvement of the State.

What fact-check ?: We 're battle virus air .
Explanation: The congressman said it in the context of the study on the stability of SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV-1 in aerosols and on various surfaces. But it was refered to the experimental circumstances tested and not in open spaces.

What fact-check ?: “ We ’ got give American public rough estimate long think going take , based mostly South Korean model , seems trajectory , thankfully , Italian model . ”
Explanation: The U.S. and South Korea have similar case fatality rates – Italy’s is higher – but all three countries have age-specific mortality rates that are about the same. Public health experts say the fatality rate wouldn’t be the only or the most important metric used to determine when businesses may reopen.The growth in cases and hospitals’ capacity to treat new patients is the most important factor.

What fact-check ?: Swiss newspaper says president México `` worst example '' COVID-19 handled .
Explanation: They manipulated the translation. It really says "Where the coronavirus is most dangerous"

What fact-check ?: Russia released 500 lions ensure people would stay inside houses .
Explanation: This photo was is from 2016, South Africa, part of a movie production.

What fact-check ?: The video shows Muslims licking plates spoons spread coronavirus .
Explanation: The video has been on the internet at least since July 2018. It was there even before the registration of first coronavirus case in the world.

What fact-check ?: Antibiotic invented Croatia cures coronavirus .
Explanation: There's no proof that the antibiotic in question has any effect against COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Putin press conference gave people choice 15 days isolation 5 years prison .
Explanation: Putin never held a press conference where he made such a statement.

What fact-check ?: Multiple posts Facebook Twitter claim World Health Organization ( WHO ) warned eating cabbage novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the WHO said it did not issue any such advisory against consuming cabbage; the US-based Centre of Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) says there is "no evidence to support transmission of COVID-19 associated with food".

What fact-check ?: A video food packets deposited street viewed millions times Facebook , Twitter YouTube alongside claim shows food donations people Turkey novel coronavirus lockdown .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video shows donations for victims of a deadly earthquake that struck eastern Turkey in January 2020, almost two months before Turkey recorded its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Multiple posts Facebook Twitter claim World Health Organization ( WHO ) warned eating cabbage novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the WHO said it did not issue any such advisory against consuming cabbage; the US-based Centre of Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) says there is "no evidence to support transmission of COVID-19 associated with food".

What fact-check ?: A video food packets deposited street viewed millions times Facebook , Twitter YouTube alongside claim shows food donations people Turkey novel coronavirus lockdown .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video shows donations for victims of a deadly earthquake that struck eastern Turkey in January 2020, almost two months before Turkey recorded its first case of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: The french state gives benefit people unemployed COVID-19 people partially unenmployed due coronavirus .
Explanation: The French state helps more people who are partially unenmployed due to the COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Washington admits responsible COVID19 .
Explanation: Washington didn't admit its responsibility for COVID-19. according to research COVID-19 virus is highly unlikely to be humanly made. The video used in the claim is from the ministry of justice announcement that it was charging a Harvard professor who took funds from China.

What fact-check ?: A vaccine coronavirus developed .
Explanation: In fact, the photo shows a test to detect antibodies to the virus in the body. This test is used along with others to diagnose coronavirus, not to treat it. The vaccine for COVID-19 has not yet been developed and Donald trump has not announced anything like this.

What fact-check ?: George Soros one people responsible new coronavirus , born laboratory .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence that the new coronavirus was made in a laboratory. A study published in “Nature” says that the virus came from an animal that infected an human being.

What fact-check ?: italian mimcks muslim prayers fear COVID19 .
Explanation: The original video is from a muslim protest in front of airports and public squares against Trump decisions to ban 7 muslim countries from entering america in 2017.

What fact-check ?: Photo shows dozens wooden coffins people dead coronavirus Italy .
Explanation: Photo is of the coffins of African migrants who drowned off Italian island in 2013.

What fact-check ?: South African mayor claimed Interferon alpha-2b vaccine new coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: Mzwandile Masina, mayor of the City of Ekurhuleni, South Africa
Explanation: Interferon alpha-2b has been used to treat some earlier strains of coronavirus, but it’s not a vaccine that would prevent people from getting COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: You n't take Ibuprofen appears drug would enhance accelerate effects Covid-19 .
Explanation: According to EMA (the European Medicine Agency), there is no scientific evidence on this.

What fact-check ?: Russia released 500 lions enforce quarantine Covid-19 .
Explanation: There is no evidence that Russia has employed lions to enforce quarantine measures. Also, the picture comes from a South African movie.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed tens thousands times Facebook , Twitter YouTube alongside claim shows Italian nationals expressing gratitude China providing aid novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video shows a Belarusian band singing a Chinese song several months before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

What fact-check ?: An Image shared social media claiming ; italian doctor couple picture worked day night saved lives 134 patients , eighth day , caught coronavirus died hour .
Explanation: The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.

What fact-check ?: Peeled Onions Can Suck Corona Virus
Explanation: The chain message is a modification of an old myth that developed in society that is not supported by scientific research.

What fact-check ?: Videos Passenger Plane Italy Ethiopia All Positive Corona
Explanation: The video is a video of a terrorist hostage-taking at the Blaise Diagne International Airport, Senegal, on November 28, 2019.

What fact-check ?: Picture Copacabana beach full sunbathers , even though Rio quarantine due COVID-19 ( photo March 22 ) .
Explanation: The picture was not from 2020, but from 2009.

What fact-check ?: Viral WhatsApp message advises purchasing used clothing expose buyers COVID-19 .
Explanation: While health experts have not ascertained the exact length of time COVID-19 stays active on fabrics, the WHO suggests a low probability of infection via package delivery. This rationale holds as studies show environmental changes and time affect the activeness of COVID-19; all of which are present in shipping clothing from another country. Furthermore, the assertion is not feasible as most countries with index cases have placed forms of travel and trade restriction.

What fact-check ?: Controversies surrounding chloroquine suggest health authorities approved cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: Foremost health authorities, WHO, FDA and CDC and the likes have not approved Chloroquine as a treatment for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Says N.Y. Gov . Andrew Cuomo “ rejected buying recommended 16,000 ventilators 2015 pandemic , pandemic , established death panels lotteries instead . So , chance buy , 2015 , 16,000 ventilators low price , turned . ”
Explanation: A 2015 New York state report said that in the case of a “severe” pandemic, the state would be short about 16,000 ventilators during the peak week. But the report did not recommend buying 16,000 ventilators, and did not indicate whether the state was at a fiscal position to purchase them. The state did not plan to increase its ventilator stockpile because it anticipated that in the event of a severe crisis, there would be shortage of trained staff to operate them and demand would outweigh any emergency stockpile. The report said the state had to balance the likely ventilator shortage with the need for adequate funding for current and ongoing health care expenses.

What fact-check ?: Wisconsin Gov . Tony Evers “ pushing firearm confiscation orders ” .
Explanation: A Facebook post finding new life amid the coronavirus outbreak says Evers is pushing gun confiscation, but the linked article is from April 2019. At that time, Evers hadn’t proposed any such thing, and the article only details a call for red flag laws from the attorney general. So what was wrong in 2019 is now both wrong and ridiculous.

What fact-check ?: Indian Army set-up 1000 bed quarantine facility Rajasthan 's Barmer .
Explanation: The Indian Army clarified that no such facility has been set-up in Rajastahn's Barmer. Also, we found out that the pictures were old and unrelated.

What fact-check ?: Justin Trudeau 's wife released video hospital bed .
Explanation: The woman in the video is not Sophie Trudeau but Tara Jane Langston, a 39-year-old who was diagnosed with pneumonia at the Hillingdon Hospital in west London. She recorded this video for her work colleagues and the public, to make them aware about the seriousness of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: President Italy crying coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: Firstly, the man in the picture, Jair Bolsonaro, is not the President of Italy but that of Brazil. Further, the image is not recent and was taken at the thanksgiving speech at the Palacio do Planalto in December 2019.

What fact-check ?: The man video science board member says gincer milk remedies COVID-19 .
Explanation: The man in the video is not a member; not even an MD. The advices he gives are not evidence-based.

What fact-check ?: Hair drier kill coronavirusus nose , Iranian artist Golshifteh Farahani says .
Explanation: Golshifteh Farahani denied the allegation. There is no evidence that hairdrier can kill the viruses. It can harm the mucus layer in nose.

What fact-check ?: Video shows looting Mexico .
Explanation: The video dates back to 2017. There is no reported looting in Mexico currently.

What fact-check ?: China granted test kits Turkey return Mustafa Kemal 's cholera vaccine aid China 1940 .
Explanation: Turkey's help to China in 1938 can be seen in official documents; but the test kits were paid.

What fact-check ?: There ‘ coronavirus ’ . The Chinese secretly working biological agent supposed make protesters docile obedient .
Explanation: The claim that the coronavirus which causes COVID-19 does not exist is based on a work of horror fiction posted on Reddit. COVID-19 has infected individuals in more than 150 countries, most of which have laboratories that have independently confirmed the existence and non-man-made nature of the virus.

What fact-check ?: An Image shared social media claiming ; italian doctor couple picture worked day night saved lives 134 patients , eighth day , caught coronavirus died hour .
Explanation: The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.

What fact-check ?: The new hantavirus new deadly problem emerging China . There cure .
Explanation: Hantavirus is not new. The is no special cure, the disease is treated as any other respiratory disease.

What fact-check ?: According report WHO , coronavirus lives longest cabbage layer . In rest place virus staying 9-12 hours , whereas cabbage , virus staying 30 hours . People cities requested eat cabbage .
Explanation: WHO has not mentioned anything about cabbage being dangerous as coronavirus can stay longer on it than any other surface.

What fact-check ?: The bodies people infected coronavirus lying road Italy . No one carrying due risk infection .
Explanation: The Image is from Germany, where people lay down in a pedestrian zone as part of an art project in remembrance of 528 victims of the Katzbach Nazi concentration camp in Frankfurt.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus fear Germany results large crowds outside supermarket . People pushing get store first get necessary supplies .
Explanation: This video was uploaded on 30 Janaury 2011 on youtube. When people in huge number came for shopping at ALDI mall.

What fact-check ?: Tea cure coronavirus .
Explanation: Doctors and experts say that there is no scientific evidence to prove that tea can be used to cure coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: New vaccine help cure coronavirus three hours .
Explanation: No vaccine has been found yet that can cure coronavirus. Moreover the image which is doing the rounds is that of a diagnosis kit and not vaccine.

What fact-check ?: Hot water gargle prevent coronavirus .
Explanation: Experts and doctors say that there is no evidence to support this claim. Dr Suranjit Chatterjee, Senior Consultant, Indraprastha Apollo Hospitals said that drinking hot water can be beneficial for a sore throat but it generally helps with fighting certain symptoms and is not a medical treatment.

What fact-check ?: A video shared thousands times multiple posts Facebook claim shows woman detained police Australia tested positive novel coronavirus , COVID-19 , filmed spitting supermarket Sydney suburb .
Explanation: The claim is misleading; the video has been created from two clips of separate incidents involving different women; police in Australia said the first clip shows a woman who was questioned and released after a disturbance at a store in a Sydney suburb; the Australian supermarket chain cited in the misleading posts said the second clip was not filmed in its stores.

What fact-check ?: A screenshot purported news broadcast showing lion street reporting Russia deployed hundreds lions maintain order novel coronavirus lockdown shared tens thousands times Facebook Twitter .
Explanation: The claim is false; the photo used in the image was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa in 2016; Russia has also not announced any major coronavirus lockdown.

What fact-check ?: A purported news report shared multiple Facebook pages claims Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte approved release P20,000 ( USD $ 400 ) recipients Philippines ’ Social Security System ( SSS ) help novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the SSS said the report was “fake news"; the website that published the claim is also not a reputable news source.

What fact-check ?: A video allegedly showing Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau ’ wife hospital bed urging people stay home avoid ending seriously ill novel coronavirus shared thousands times Facebook Twitter .
Explanation: The woman in the video is not Sophie Trudeau, but a British waitress who has been infected with COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Iceland tested whole population .
Who said/posted it?: Al Jazeera on Twitter and Twitter users
Explanation: According to health authorities in Iceland, 3.5% of the population has been tested, and not 100% as claimed by the publications on Twitter.

What fact-check ?: France found vaccine coronavirus .
Explanation: Screenshots show people applausing for medical workers, like every night in Spain and in France, not applausing for a vaccine. The picture of the "vaccine" is in fact a picture of a South Korean test kit. On March 24th, when we wrote this fact check, France had not found any vaccine.

What fact-check ?: Paraguayans go `` even buy bread '' incubation period positive cases coronavirus raise .
Explanation: A WhatsApp message says that doctors warned people to not got out at all because the incubation period of coronavirus in Paraguay was at bay. The message was also shared in Spain and had no grounds to be true.

What fact-check ?: Stopping breath ten seconds way test person coronavirus .
Explanation: In a video, a woman showed how to supposedly test if one has coronavirus by holding her breath for ten seconds. WHO expert denied it.

What fact-check ?: Netflix providing free access platform due quarantine .
Explanation: A WhatsApp message with a link stated that the platform would provide free access due to the coronavirus quarantine. As Maldita.es pointed out, it's a hoax.

What fact-check ?: CDC said coronavirus survived 17 days surface cruise ship .
Explanation: CDC found RNA 17 days after but this doesn't mean that the virus survived.

What fact-check ?: 23 new COVID-19 cases confirmed Mombasa .
Explanation: The cases were not confirmed by Kenya's Ministry of Health.

What fact-check ?: A photo showing bodies Italian COVID-19 victims street .
Explanation: The 2014 photo shows participants in an art project to remember victims of the Nazi Katzbac concentration camp in Frankfurt, Germany.

What fact-check ?: Tens thousands people victims coronavirus died China , proven maps Wuhan released online show massive burning corpses .
Explanation: The maps are based on unreal data and do not prove that China is massively burning bodies in Wuhan.

What fact-check ?: Hospitals Madrid removing artificial respirators admitted coronaviruses older 65 years use younger patients .
Explanation: It is not true. And until Tuesday, March 24, Madrid Health department had the capacity to increase ICU income due to coronaviruses with respirators for all.

What fact-check ?: `` A tank '' circulates streets Tudela , Navarre , Spain , combat COVID-19 .
Explanation: It was an old image taken in another village.

What fact-check ?: A new law prohibits `` leaving home '' 3 pm Spain .
Explanation: It was not an official document.

What fact-check ?: On March 22nd Coronavirus 'contagion rate ' decreased 'for two consecutive days ' .
Explanation: The numbers of cases of contagion in Spain went from an increase of 16.52% on Friday to an increase of 24.75% on Saturday and 14.6% on Sunday.

What fact-check ?: Andalusia proposes students must repeat classes ( march 26th ) .
Explanation: The image of the headline shared was manipulated from an actual media.

What fact-check ?: ONU provide food voucher coronavirus quarantine .
Explanation: ONUas already clarified that everything is a fraud.

What fact-check ?: Pakistani doctor , Usman Riaz speaks coronavirus death .
Explanation: The man in the video is not Pakistani Dr Riaz but a UK resident named Mubashir Ahmed, who was admitted to a hospital after testing positive for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Purported advisories urging residents stay indoors national air force helicopters spray disinfectant homes kill novel coronavirus , COVID-19 , circulated online Sri Lanka Philippines .
Explanation: But the claim is false; both the Sri Lankan and Philippine governments said their air forces were not involved in any such operations.

What fact-check ?: Globe Telecom giving every subscriber free mobile load worth P500 help donation amid coronavirus crisis .
Explanation: In a message sent to Rappler, Globe said the free P500 load to each user is not a legitimate offer from them.

What fact-check ?: In Costa Rica , dead bodies returned families .
Explanation: There are procedures in place, but the bodies are returned.

What fact-check ?: In Costa Rica , Red Cross Walmart giving emergency funds COVID-19 .
Explanation: It's a scam to steal personal data.

What fact-check ?: False OMS grants food medicine vouchers
Explanation: Neither the World Health Organization (OMS), the United Nations (UN) and the "Government" are giving out vouchers for food or medicine in support of the family economy due to the COVID-19 pandemic, as messages that share on social networks.

What fact-check ?: On WhatsApp video circulating Rabbi Dan Ben Avraham , International President Netzarita AMI Alliance , according Twitter . In video , rabbi says `` Israeli Minister Health officially declared Israel coronavirus vaccine . '' And sentence , `` Israel vaccine already . '' But true . Although Israel working vaccine , ready yet .
Explanation: According to the WHO, the necessary safety approvals to bring a viable vaccine to market could take up to 18 months.

What fact-check ?: Five person healed Morocco chloroquine .
Explanation: The website mixed two distinct pieces of information to create this false claim.

What fact-check ?: Mosques synagogues holy places opened French confinement .
Who said/posted it?: Facebook user in a video ; an extreme-right wing Twitter account
Explanation: According to a French legal decree published on March 23rd, mosques, churches and synagogues can be opened but meetings of more than 20 people are forbidden. Besides, authorities from the Jewish communities and from the Muslim communities decided to close some synagogues and mosques.

What fact-check ?: This photo shows nurses insulting French president Emmanuel Macron .
Explanation: The picture has been modified. The original photo was a message to French citizens who didn't respect the lockdown rules.

What fact-check ?: No , wo n't charged 135 euro fine 're driving several persons car lockdown .
Explanation: Several people are authorized in the same vehicle. It is not prohibited to use your car with passengers to go to the doctor or to the supermarket, for example.

What fact-check ?: An alarming text message signed `` Claire Magne , friend , nurse '' .
Explanation: Hospitals of Montpellier and Toulouse denied this alarmist message.

What fact-check ?: Video shows Malaysian police sanction people violated lockdown stipulation hitting foot sole .
Explanation: The video was filmed in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, not a recent shoot in Malasia. The Malaysian government has released a series measure towards the COVIS-19 on March 18. But hitting violater on the foot sole is not part of it.

What fact-check ?: Gargling hot water cures Coronavirus says doctor Mumbai 's COVID-19 hospital .
Explanation: Gargling with water does not cure or prevent coronavirus, and this is not the doctor from the Mumbai hospital but a Tiktok video with a pre-recorded video clip.

What fact-check ?: A police commissioner Mumbai asked essential services available certain hours .
Explanation: The Mumbai Police did not put out any such notification and all essential services are available in the city.

What fact-check ?: Says order Gov . Tony Evers , eight children ’ legally dinner together anymore .
Explanation: The key here is what Stroebel’s tweet didn’t say – that five of the children he referenced were adults living on their own. Evers’ order does indeed ban gatherings of immediate family members in different households.

What fact-check ?: Says Nancy Pelosi ’ coronavirus bill includes “ tax credits solar wind energy … retirement plans community newspaper employees … $ 300 million PBS … climate change studies ” .
Explanation: The House version of a coronavirus relief bill does include several requirements for airline companies that take federal assistance from the bill. The House bill also includes provisions related to community newspaper pension plans and a $300 million funding boost for the Corporation for Public Broadcasting.

What fact-check ?: Gargling warm water salt vinegar eliminates virus [ SARS-CoV-2 ] .
Explanation: There is no evidence to suggest that gargling salt water or vinegar, or partaking in many other home remedies, fight SARS-CoV-2 infection. Upon entering the body, the virus attaches to and enters cells in the airway where it takes over the cells’ machinery, producing more viral particles that spread to other cells. Because the virus hides out in the body’s own cells, it can not be targeted without also killing healthy, uninfected cells. Therefore, fighting viral infections relies on the body’s immune response.

What fact-check ?: [ SARS-CoV-2 ] spreading quickly gas pumps . Shopping carts well .
Explanation: People may become infected by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which causes COVID-19, when they touch contaminated surfaces and transfer the virus to their eyes, nose, or mouth. However, it is not known how often this is likely to occur and there is no evidence that it is spreading quickly in this manner. Therefore, proper handwashing and cleaning surfaces with soap or other common disinfectants are effective ways to reduce the risk of contracting the virus from surfaces.

What fact-check ?: Iranian girl Anahita Hashemzadeh contracted Coronavirus .
Explanation: Anahita Hashemzadeh hasn’t contracted coronavirus. In the comments section of her Instagram videos, her mother has clarified multiple times that she is ‘safe and healthy’ and the news regarding Anahita getting infected with coronavirus is ‘fake'.

What fact-check ?: Photos Italian man committing suicide lost entire family COVID-19 .
Explanation: The video was taken in Spain and is found to be in circulation on the internet at least since the last week of December 2019. But, the first COVID-19 death was reported only in the second week of January 2019 in China.

What fact-check ?: Image people died coronavirus Italy .
Explanation: The photo is not related to recent coronavirus deaths in Italy. It was taken in Frankfurt (Germany) in 2014 as part of an ‘art project’ in remembrance of 528 Katzbach victims of the Nazi concentration camp.

What fact-check ?: Photo prime minister Italy crying expressing helplessness ’ save coronavirus patients Italy .
Explanation: The person in the photo is not the PM of Italy. He is Jair Bolsonaro, the President of Brazil. The photo was taken when he cried at an ‘Evangelical Thanksgiving Service’. The PM of Italy has not expressed helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus affected patients in Italy.

What fact-check ?: Video Italian police taking man come streets despite lockdown country .
Explanation: The video is from Brazil and it shows Police taking down an alleged knife-wielding-man in Sao Paulo on 19 March.

What fact-check ?: Kerala asked NABARD loan Rs 20,000 crore deal COVID-19 .
Explanation: While it is true that the Kerala Government has announced a financial package of Rs. 20,000 crore to fight the pandemic, they have not asked NABARD for a loan of Rs 20,000 crore. They have requested for a special line of credit of Rs 2000 crore from NABARD under RIDF.

What fact-check ?: Look condition Karimnagar person affected coronavirus .
Explanation: The video in the post is not related to India. A doctor from Equador has posted in her twitter account that the video was taken in Equador.

What fact-check ?: In video , woman asking take coronavirus seriously wife Prime Minister Canada .
Explanation: The woman in the video is not Canada Prime Minister’s wife (Sophie Grégoire Trudeau). She is Tara Jane Langston, a waitress who contracted COVID-19 and undergoing treatment at Hillingdon Hospital in London. She took the video to tell people in her country that the coronavirus is serious.

What fact-check ?: Reserve Bank India ( RBI ) extended year closing till 30 June 2020 .
Explanation: The normal financial year in India followed by the government & all other institutions including for taxation purpose is 01 April to 31 March. However, RBI’s accounting/financial year is from 1 July to 30 June. There is no change in the normal financial year.

What fact-check ?: Woman burned hands putting stove due high alcohol content hand sanitiser .
Explanation: It is a hoax. Alcohol in hand sanitisers evaporate completely once applied on the hands.

What fact-check ?: Tokyo Olympics logo redesigned theme social distancing .
Explanation: The Tokyo Olympics logo has not been redesigned.

What fact-check ?: The viral image doctor couple Italy gave lives treating coronavirus patients .
Explanation: This photograph was taken in Barcelona airport, Spain. No such news report of the Italian doctor couple found.

What fact-check ?: 232 kids died COVID-19 Italy one day .
Explanation: According to the data from the ISS (Istituto Superiore di Sanità), an Italian government agency, until March 24 (most recent data), the country had not registered a child death due to the new coronavirus. In fact, the youngest victims in the country were in the 30 to 39 age group.
