What fact-check ?: People looted supermarket São Vicente ( city Sao Paulo state ) lockout .
Explanation: It is old news that stores and supermarkets in the city of São Vicente, on the coast of São Paulo, were looted. The misinformation stems from a June 2013 brazilian TV Tribuna report.

What fact-check ?: Israel fighting coronavirus without lockouts economy impacts .
Explanation: Two emergency regulations have already been approved by Israel government that restrict the movement of people of all ages. It is also false that the country's economy and health system are not being harmed by the pandemic. The government estimated that, because of the disease, the country's GDP will not grow this year and warned of the lack of respirators in hospitals.

What fact-check ?: A list ten claims coronavirus , allegedly doctor worked hospital Shenzhen .
Explanation: Most of the claims in the message are false and many are misleading. Drinking warm water will not protect you from getting the coronavirus, for example, and there is no evidence that the virus is killed by a temperature of 26/27 degrees either.

What fact-check ?: Tea cure COVID-19 patients suggested China ’ whistleblower doctor Li Wenliang , news published CNN .
Explanation: No scientific proof as of yet to suggest that tea can cure COVID-19 patients , CNN didn’t publish this news.

What fact-check ?: Timings sale milk , newspapers , grocery medical stores issued Mumbai Police commissioner .
Explanation: It is a hoax. The Mumbai Police commissioner has not issued any such order.

What fact-check ?: A claim shared thousands times multiple posts Facebook Twitter emergency decree issued Thailand due novel coronavirus pandemic included strict curfew .
Explanation: The claim is false; the emergency decree declared on March 25, 2020 by Thailand’s prime minister did not include a curfew.

What fact-check ?: In Philippines , Senator Manny Pacquiao senator responded coronavirus crisis .
Who said/posted it?: Facebook user Michael John Gocela Sabio
Explanation: Other senators, and not just Pacquiao, also responded to the outbreak by providing aid to frontliners and those affected by the enhanced community quarantine, among others.

What fact-check ?: The ex-Health Minister Nikola Todorov , otherwise lawyer profession , consultant current Minister Health expert advice expertise field epidemiology .
Explanation: Denial about this information came from the Minister of Health himself, who explained that the expert epidemiologist and former VMRO-DPMNE minister is actually a doctor, Dragan Danilovski.

What fact-check ?: In China also outbreak hantavirus , first recorded death .
Explanation: There is no "outbreak“, the hantavirus is an endemic disease in China with about 100 deaths every year. It is usually not transmitted from human to human.

What fact-check ?: In India 24th March 2020 lockdown grocery , milk , chemist , vegetable shops open 9.00 11.30 morning 4.30 pm 7.00 pm evening . Anybody found moving around opening kind outlet strictly detained police . It also claims home deliveries available .
Explanation: Delhi Police has clarified that the viral message on social media is Fake.

What fact-check ?: In Hong Kong people destroyed 5G pole coronavirus .
Explanation: The video is from September 2019, it shows protesters tearing down a smart lamp because they fear surveillance.

What fact-check ?: The number new cases COVID-19 decreasing since 19th March Peru .
Who said/posted it?: María isabel León, President of the National Association of Private Business Institutions of Peru
Explanation: Mrs. León used wrong figures according to official information and explanations by specialists of the Ministry of Health.

What fact-check ?: President Donald Trump announce scientist `` finally found vaccine cure corona virus . ''
Explanation: Trump has not announced a vaccine to prevent COVID-19. As of now, there is no specific treatment for the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Italy 's prime minister cries declared country `` lost battle '' coronavirus .
Explanation: The Italian government has not made such a statement. In addition, the person who appears in the photograph is a representative from another country.

What fact-check ?: A claim trolley collector supermarket Australian state New South Wales tested positive novel coronavirus , COVID-19 , March 2020 shared hundreds times multiple posts Facebook .
Explanation: The claim is false; the shopping centre where the supermarket is located said that it had no confirmed COVID-19 cases in March 2020; local health officials in New South Wales also did not report any confirmed cases in the suburb cited in the misleading Facebook posts in the final days of March.

What fact-check ?: Multiple articles widely shared Facebook claim 59 church members died drinking household disinfectant pastor said would prevent coronavirus infections .
Explanation: The claims, although based on an old story, are false -- South African police denied any current investigations on their part.

What fact-check ?: A claim circulated multiple Facebook , Twitter YouTube `` new virus '' named hantavirus emerged China March 2020 . The posts viewed hundreds thousands times world battled spread novel coronavirus , causes disease COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; scientists say hantavirus is not a new virus and was first detected during the Korean War in the 1950s; the US-based Centre for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) says the virus has almost exclusively been found to pass from rodents to humans, rather than from person to person.

What fact-check ?: Muammar Gaddafi predicted `` '' create viruses sell us cures .
Explanation: Gaddafi has not made the claim that's being attributed to him.

What fact-check ?: Italian Prime Minister admits Italy lost .
Explanation: The quote is made up and illustrated with the picture of president of Brazil Bolsonaro.

What fact-check ?: Homemade masks prevent spread coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim is false; the photos actually show the aftermath of a strong earthquake that hit the Croatian capital of Zagreb in March 2020.

What fact-check ?: Posts shared thousands times Facebook claim provide emergency food stamp hotline .
Explanation: This is false; the phone number is not for the US Department of Agriculture, which is responsible for food stamps, and instead is a disconnected number formerly belonging to rapper Mike Jones.

What fact-check ?: Homemade masks prevent spread coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim is false; the photos actually show the aftermath of a strong earthquake that hit the Croatian capital of Zagreb in March 2020.

What fact-check ?: Posts shared thousands times Facebook claim provide emergency food stamp hotline .
Explanation: This is false; the phone number is not for the US Department of Agriculture, which is responsible for food stamps, and instead is a disconnected number formerly belonging to rapper Mike Jones.

What fact-check ?: Trump web ad usings misleading edits create false picture .
Explanation: These are actual quotes but in the video they are so truncated and mixed together that overall it leaves a misleading impression.

What fact-check ?: A post says , March 22 , 793 people died Italy including 232 kids .
Explanation: In that day, 651 people died in Italy due to the new coronavirus and there were no mention to children. None of the deaths were related to child infections.

What fact-check ?: A post says vaccine new coronavirus available days .
Explanation: The image that is shown on the post is a South Korean COVID-19 test from the laboratory Sugentech. There is not a vaccine available on the market yet.

What fact-check ?: Facebook posts featuring photo ventilators US state New York claim devices “ stuck warehouse . ”
Explanation: This is misleading; New York is stockpiling supplies because of the novel coronavirus pandemic, but emergency response staff say those in the photo were sent to hospitals within 24 hours of their receipt.

What fact-check ?: President National Assembly Serbia Maja Gojkovic claimed according Constitution , Parliament session State emergency .
Who said/posted it?: Official webiste of the rulling party
Explanation: According to the Serbian Constitution, during the state of emergency, the National Assembly shall convene without any special call for assembly and it may not be dismissed.

What fact-check ?: Photo people medical scrubs lying floor operating theatre shows 200 Italian doctors died Covid-19 one day ( 23 March 2020 ) .
Explanation: Photo is a still from an episode of US TV drama, Grey's Anatomy. And there is no evidence to show that 200 Italian doctors died on 23 March 2020.

What fact-check ?: The vaccine Covid-19 finally ready .
Explanation: There is no vaccine against COVID-19 at this point in time.

What fact-check ?: Former French Health minister prevented use chloroquine heal dying people Covid-19 harm infectiologist Didier Raoult .
Explanation: The author of the video doesn't have any reliable sources : all of his claims about a "political scandal" are based on conspiracy theories, exagerated or misleading affirmations.

What fact-check ?: Malaysia Dismiss Residents Outside Home Drones Shoot Fireworks
Explanation: The events in the video are part of the action carried out by a Brazilian influencer, Lucas Albert. The video was uploaded on Instagram on July 14, 2019, before the Corona COVID-19 virus was first reported in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. Even in the original video, there was no Malay-speaking male voice asking people to disperse.

What fact-check ?: Photo Italian PM Giuseppe Conte cried regretting late lockdown
Explanation: The photo is a photo of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro who gave a speech during an evangelical service at the Planalto Palace on December 17, 2019.

What fact-check ?: Ireland first phase lockdown sequence .
Explanation: Ireland has introduced measures to restrict the spread of COVID-19 but it is not a lockdown and there is no evidence to suggest that the government is considering a lockdown. The Irish PM has said that Ireland is following the South Korea model of social distancing, social isoloation and contact tracing, and this does not include the locking down of the country.

What fact-check ?: In March 25 , French scientists succesfully tested vaccine COVID-19 .
Explanation: Although the title said vaccines, the story was about a French research (published on March 17) on hydroxychloroquine, which is not a vaccine.

What fact-check ?: Health authorities recommend shaving beard COVID-19 crisis .
Explanation: Only people who need to use respirators should shave. That's because the beard can alter the positioning of the mask, which allows air to reach the mouth and the nose directly (thus, making the respirator itself useless)

What fact-check ?: A publication Pearls news says 15 Nigerian senators tested positive COVID-19 .
Explanation: No Nigerian senator has tested positive for coronavirus, not according to the NCDC or any credible news platform. The Nigerian Centre for Disease Control remains the number one source on all updates to confirmed COVID-19 cases in the country.

What fact-check ?: A blog site claimed Kogi State Governor Nigeria , Yahaya Bello , tested positive COVID-19 .
Explanation: There are no reports by the Nigerian Centre for Disease Control to corroborate the claim. Not to mention, Yahaya Bello, himself released a video debunking the claim. Moreover, the report format lacks credibility with no discernable details or source present.

What fact-check ?: Image TV reporter hazmat suit proof media 'fabricating ' panic .
Explanation: Reporter was using hazmat suit to illustrate a report about local production of suits.

What fact-check ?: 232 children died COVID-19 Italy one day .
Explanation: Italian Ministry of Health didn't report any cases of deaths of people under 30 years old.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 read tank car picture taken 2019 .
Explanation: Field Guide for Tank Cars does not let the arbitrary titling. The owner of the cars also denied.

What fact-check ?: CDC announces SARS-CoV-2 survive surfaces 17 days .
Explanation: The report on CDC's website was not about the survival period of SARS-CoV-2. Researhers wrote they found RNA traces of the virus, not infectious viral load.

What fact-check ?: Turkey map Wikipedia shows provinces COVID-19 cases diagnosed .
Explanation: Metadata of the map shows that the data collected from unverified local media news. Turkey does not announce the cases by provinces so far.

What fact-check ?: Video shows Italians drinking chrism together outbreak .
Explanation: The video is recorded in Romania not in Italy. It can be detected the flag and the statue in the video.

What fact-check ?: Video shows Turkish citizens leave food packets road poor outbreak .
Explanation: The video recorded on 25th of Jan, 2020 and the aid for the earthquake victims in Elazığ. There was no cases in Turkey in that time.

What fact-check ?: Spanish doctor says give ventilators younger people .
Explanation: The man in the video is not a doctor. Triage in Spain is not just based on age but the probability of survival.

What fact-check ?: Viral WhatsApp message claims Netflix ​giving free passes platform period isolation .
Explanation: It is customary for a streaming service such as Netflix to give a free trial of 30 days, after which the subscriber is billed. The streaming giant, however, is not hosting any such bonanza. More so, the service is planning to actually reduce video quality owing to the internet spike in a bid to prevent downtime. It hence would be counterproductive to open the service to a host of more users. Also, the site in question was flagged by a security module as a “deceptive site”.

What fact-check ?: Image police punishing people Indian state Assam violating curfew .
Explanation: While there are reports which suggest that the police is taking action against people in India for violating the orders, this picture is from Pakistan and not Assam.

What fact-check ?: Pakistan 's leading scholar Mufti Naeem suffers coronavirus . A days ago , refused close madrasas mosques .
Explanation: According to Pakistani media outlets Mufti Naeem was admitted to the hospital due to heart disease.

What fact-check ?: Indian Singer Kanika Kapoor met Prince Charles tested positive coronavirus .
Explanation: Contrary to the claim, the viral image is not recent but from 2015, when the singer attended the Elephant Family charity ‘Travels to my Elephants’, hosted by Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall.

What fact-check ?: Italian doctor couple disgnosed coronavirus .
Explanation: The couple was spotted and clicked by an Associated Press (AP) photographer Emilio Morenatti nearly two weeks ago.

What fact-check ?: An open letter Bill Gates : Microsoft founder believes spiritual purpose behind disease .
Explanation: Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation has denied publishing that letter. The sun, the media which ran a story about the story of Gates'' letter, had removed the story and apologized for the incident.

What fact-check ?: Uber suspends night services Kenya .
Explanation: Uber has responded to the post online saying that its services were still available to users after 7pm in Kenya, and had not been suspended as claimed.

What fact-check ?: Compounds tea help cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: Methylxanthine, theobromine and theophylline, which are found in tea, are good for health and airway management, but cannot cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A treatment COVID-19 manufactured Uganda .
Explanation: The treatment is actually conventional sanitizer, and will be produced by a company already producing hand and surface sanitizer.

What fact-check ?: A picture showing dead Italian doctors operating theater succumbing COVID-19 .
Explanation: The picture showing doctors on the floor of an operating room is actually from an episode of Grey's Anatomy.

What fact-check ?: Nairobi Governor Mike Sonko donated 58 million shillings COVID-19 response .
Explanation: The governor has not made any such donation, and the County Government has also stated that the claim is false.

What fact-check ?: The UN providing food aid South American countries due coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The UN office at Colombia has warned that a WhatsApp hoax claiming the UN would be providing food aid is false. A version of the same hoax was debunked by the UN office at Paraguay.

What fact-check ?: China got prepared contain virus let whole population got infected .
Explanation: An audio claimed that China’s strategy was to infect the whole population with COVID-19. However, one of China’s main measures was to keep quarantined almost half of its population, according to New York Times estimates, in order to control and stop the spread of infections. The WHO praised the measure.

What fact-check ?: Paraguay ’ Ministry Health following people related confirmed cases coronavirus .
Explanation: An audio claimed that the Ministry of Health does not follow up people who have been related to confirmed cases of coronavirus. The Ministry does have a public plan that lays out that they have to keep a eye on those people. The plan states that their records should be kept and that they should be monitored. If a person show symptoms, they must be tested. If not, he has to remain quarantined.

What fact-check ?: Countries use nivaquine ( chloroquine ) malaria affected coronavirus .
Explanation: Nivaquine is prescribed in other countries, including France where there is coronavirus, and COVID-19 affects many more states than those indicated on the maps.

What fact-check ?: In France , state pays 46 billions year army , 1 billion inhabitants ' health .
Explanation: It's the opposite : the state spends much more on health than on its army.

What fact-check ?: A US railroad carried `` COVID-19 ''
Explanation: The image was manipulated.

What fact-check ?: The University Barcelona approve students classes suspended month .
Explanation: The image shared was a screenshot of the university official webpage that was manipulated.

What fact-check ?: “ Food contribution ” campaign using UN logo .
Explanation: The UN has denied this information through its headquarters in Colombia.

What fact-check ?: Chlorine dioxide cures coronavirus .
Explanation: Its consumption is dangerous and it is an illegal medicine in Spain.

What fact-check ?: Prime Minister Mexico tears eyes says people : We lost battle coronavirus .
Explanation: Although the situation in Italy itself is serious, the government has not made such a statement. In addition, the person who appears in the photograph is Bolsorano.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus remains asphalt 9 days .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence to show that the coronavirus remains on the floor for 9 days.

What fact-check ?: Cigarette smoke spreads coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence that proves the cigarette smoke can spread coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Did American die self-administered chloroquine ?
Explanation: In Arizona a man died after ingesting chloroquine phosphate on self-medication. He had the idea after listening to a speech by Donald Trump about chloroquine efficiency against COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: The internet crash lockdown .
Explanation: Experts and internet companies assure that the network can handle an increasing traffic. However, extending the lockdown as well as closing the borders could make it more difficult to maintain and to repair the network.

What fact-check ?: Mosquitoes spread coronavirus ?
Explanation: The World Health Organization (WHO) and the French Ministry of Health have been very clear : no, the mosquito does not transmit the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: After dealing 134 patients , Italien doctor couple took masks stared bottom hearts . Both died later .
Explanation: The photo is a couple kissing at Barcelona airport on March 12.

What fact-check ?: A new outbreak pandemy hantavirus coming China .
Explanation: Hantavirus is not a new virus, and is not transmitted from person to person. In Europe it usually causes a disease that has less than 0.5% case fatality.

What fact-check ?: Purchases health products health councils taking advantage `` hook '' COVID-19 disease sell online cures endorsed official organization .
Explanation: A recopilation of "miracle" products that are being announced in social media to cure COVID-19 and are not aprobbed by any medical or gubernamental institutions. Most of them are scams.

What fact-check ?: An audio states worst coronavirus crisis Spain start Sunday March 29 .
Explanation: We consulted experts to find out if the audio was real, although there were versions with different dates. Doctors say it is impossible to know when there will be a peak and they are confident in current containment measures.

What fact-check ?: A publication Facebook assures confirmed `` [ Spanish ] President 3 Vice Presidents ill COVID-19 assures King must close Parliament , dissolve Cortes take political military control country .
Explanation: The only Spanish vice president who has tested positive for COVID-19 is Nadia Calviño and the Constitution does not grant the King the power to dissolve the Spanish government in the face of this catastrophe.

What fact-check ?: You get coronavirus makeup creams .
Explanation: No proofs about it in the new WHO Q&A.

What fact-check ?: A video circulating WhatsApp COVID-19 patient escaping hospital Costa Rica .
Explanation: The patient didn't have COVID-19 and didn't escape.

What fact-check ?: A publication claiming city San José Costa Rica created mass graves COVID-19 victims .
Explanation: Authorities denied such a construction work.

What fact-check ?: Indian Government snooping messages social media social media platforms wll monitored COVID-19 messages
Explanation: The message mentions a fake ministry of internal regulation that does not exist in the country.

What fact-check ?: A Pakistani doctor , Dr Osama Riaz 's last message ( taking last breath ) .
Explanation: The video is not of the Pakistani doctor who died but of another doctor from the UK who tested positive and is going to be discharged soon.

What fact-check ?: WHO offering monetary help buy medicines food emergency .
Explanation: It's not true that WHO is offering monetary help. It's a technical institution, said representatives contacted for this verification.

What fact-check ?: Last Photo Indonesian doctor , Hadio Ali standing away family passed away due COVID-19
Explanation: The picture is of a Malaysian doctor not infected by COVID-19 but who is treating COVID-19 patients in Malaysia and this was him before he left for duty.

What fact-check ?: Says leave objects sun avoid contracting coronavirus .
Explanation: There’s no evidence that sunlight can kill the coronavirus. Experts say ultraviolet light in the sun isn’t strong enough.

What fact-check ?: Streaming apps Netflix Amazon Prime give free subscriptions COVID-19 outbreak India
Explanation: The websites were phising and spamming websites while the streaming apps have not declared any such free plans. A parody account portraying to be Indian news wire agency, ANI shared the sites stating free plans till April 31 while April has only 30 days.

What fact-check ?: Indian Army built 1000 Bed quarantine facility COVID-19
Explanation: The Indian army called out this claim to be false and BOOM also found that all the three images were unrelated to each other.

What fact-check ?: An image couple claimed doctors lost lives due Coronavirus
Explanation: The picture is an AFP picture of a couple at the Barcelona airport after US President Donald Trump informed that USA was banning travel from the EU.

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp chain cites real research survival different coronaviruses various materials air .
Explanation: SARS-CoV-2 does last hours or days on some surfaces, others need to be studied. One of the studies cited found that the SARS-CoV-2 virus survives: Three hours dispersed in air, Four hours in copper, 24 hours in cardboard and Two to three days in plastic or stainless steel.

What fact-check ?: Claims Columbian President Iván Duque approved collective dismissals workers due emergency COVID-19 . Some messages attach proof screenshots Resolution 0803 2020 Ministry Labor .
Explanation: Government has not approved collective dismissals for coronavirus. Resolution 0803 of 2020 of the Ministry of Labor does not authorize collective dismissals. Other measures require the employee to agree.

What fact-check ?: An image accompanies text : The Italian Prime Minister wept recognized losing battle Coronavirus .
Explanation: Message assures that the Italian leader cried over the situation of COVID-19 in his country, but the image that supposedly proves it is of Jair Bolsonaro from Brazil at a religious ceremony in 2019.

What fact-check ?: Photo Deer Ooty-Coimbatore road current lockdown ( COVID-19 ) .
Explanation: It is an old photo. The photo is on the internet at least since 2014. It was taken in Japan, not in India.

What fact-check ?: Brazilian government iniciated registration Social Security withdraws fight pandemic WhatsApp .
Explanation: Besides such a fund does not exist, the link that accompanies the text on social networks leads to a suspicious address that can not only steal users' personal data, but also leave cell phones vulnerable to invasions.

What fact-check ?: Drinking tea help cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is no evidence that drinking tea can help mitigate the effects of the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Says Nevada Governor Steve Sisolak `` banned use anti-malaria drug might help cure coronavirus . ”
Explanation: A Nevada emergency regulation restricts the prescription of chloroquine for COVID-19 patients in outpatient settings, but not in hospitals and emergency rooms. Gov. Steve Sisolak signed the order on the recommendation of state health officials, who said there is the potential for stockpiling the drug.

What fact-check ?: “ COVID literally stands Chinese Originated Viral Infectious Disease . ”
Explanation: COVID-19 is an abbreviation of “coronavirus disease 2019.” “CO” stands for “corona,” “VI” stands for “virus” and “D” stands for “disease.” The number 19 reflects the year the disease was identified — 2019.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus patients Italy streets hospitals longer able accommodate .
Explanation: The photos were taken in the aftermath of the 5.4-magnitude earthquake that struck Croatia on March 22.

Countries: North Macedonia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia
What fact-check ?: Garlic protect virus vulnerable group new coronavirus people blood type A .
Explanation: Garlic can really help boost immunity, but it can neither protect nor cure because although it has antibacterial properties, the World Health Organization (WHO) has not confirmed that it can cure the new virus and also statistics show that 38 percent of those infected in the city of Wuhan in China had blood type A, but also that as much as 31 percent of the city's population is with that blood type.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 secret American weapon aimed depopulation purposes .
Explanation: Article is based on debunked conspiracy theories.

What fact-check ?: According DW , Venezuela country took advance measures againtst outbreak .
Explanation: DW didn´t publish or broadcast that.

What fact-check ?: A claim Facebook began circulate around Wednesday , March 25 , says putting peeled onion room remove `` viruses bacteria including coronavirus . ''
Explanation: Putting peeled onions in a room will not prevent COVID-19 or a coronavirus infection, according to the National Onion Association (NOA) in the US. There are no official cures or vaccines for COVID-19, according to the World Health Organization (WHO) as of Tuesday, March 31, though there are cures and vaccines in testing.

What fact-check ?: Kids allowed say goodbye parents hospitalized COVID-19 .
Explanation: Kids are allowed to say googbye to their families. If they die, 5 to 10 people are allowed at the funeral.

What fact-check ?: The video unprecedented stone rain Rome suggests fate pro-communist Italy .
Explanation: The video shows hail filmed in Zalau, Romania, on May 28. 2019.

What fact-check ?: There coronavirus Africa money get debt International Monetary Fund .
Explanation: African countries are also being affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, and the IMF is already preparing some financial instruments to support these countries.

What fact-check ?: Last picture Indonesian doctor Hadio Alo bidding farewell family .
Explanation: This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.

What fact-check ?: High death rate Italy due people taking Ibuprofen .
Explanation: Both universities cited as the source termed it fake news, while the WHO has said there isn’t enough evidence against using ibuprofen in the treatment of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed thousands times multiple posts Facebook claim shows bodies novel coronavirus victims thrown ditch Italy .
Explanation: The claim is false; the footage was taken from the 2007 US television programme Pandemic.

What fact-check ?: Covid-19 test Germany 37 times cheaper Croatia .
Explanation: The test costs approximately the same in both countries.

What fact-check ?: People older 60 given medical help Italy anymore .
Explanation: Italian doctors are treating as many patients as they can manage, regardless of their age.

What fact-check ?: “ child gets virus going hospital alone van people ’ know ... people ’ know… home without time need . ”
Explanation: It’s illegal to treat a minor without parental consent in the U.S. Even as hospitals are limiting visitors, minors will always be allowed to have one guardian present.

What fact-check ?: The application menthol ointment nostrils helps prevent virus
Explanation: There's no evidence that menthol ointment could prevent the contagion with coronavirus, according the physicians consulted and information spread by WHO and FDA on the prevention of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: WhatsApp chain workers Argentina´s important lab testing coronavirus . They advised leave house next 2 weeks infection peak .
Explanation: The lab workers denied the message came from them. Many of the claims included in the chain were denied by specialists.

What fact-check ?: A message sent WhatsApp states Ministry Defense China announced 'successfully ' developed vaccine new coronavirus , causes Covid-19 disease . Portugal would receive first doses days .
Explanation: It is a fraudulent message that is being sent on behalf of the National Health Service, full of false information, especially regarding vaccines that are due to arrive in Portugal

What fact-check ?: The Italians accept Islam en masse .
Explanation: In fact, the video used in the fake was taken during a protest in Germany, in the center of Hamburg, held on January 11, 2020. The action was aimed at the oppression of the Muslim Uighur minority in China.

What fact-check ?: The brasilian singer Preta Gile infected Covid-19 performed 320 thousand people .
Explanation: When the singer performed to 320 thousand people, on March 1, she was not infected with the new coronavirus. She started feeling ill on March 11 and tested positive on March 13. Since then, she has been in quarantine.

What fact-check ?: Several photographs published Facebook claim portray coffins victims new coronavirus Italy .
Explanation: The pictures were taken in april 2009, after an earthquake in L’Aquila, that killed 308 people.

What fact-check ?: A message image claims drinking coffee help prevent new coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Health authorities have never made this connection an it.

What fact-check ?: Over 200 doctors Italy die every day due coronavirus .
Explanation: The total number of doctors in Italy who died due to the coronavirus is 66 as of Thursday, April 2.

What fact-check ?: italian people streets surerendering farewelling world COVID19 .
Explanation: The original video is from an Italian protest against the far-right on Nov 18 2019.

What fact-check ?: A photo fleet blue lorries bearing image Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa shared repeatedly Facebook Twitter alongside claim lorries distributing food novel coronavirus curfew
Explanation: The claim is misleading; the photo in fact shows lorries that were used in a political initiative in 2014, more than five years before the coronavirus pandemic. Rajapaksa’s office also denied the claim, saying that authorities are pursuing legal action against those spreading the “false information”.

What fact-check ?: Images patients treated open Italy run hospital beds .
Explanation: The images are from Croatia after it was hit by an earthquake on March 22.

What fact-check ?: While coronavirus tests countries conducted free nominal charges , India , costs Rs 4,500
Explanation:
In India, coronavirus tests are free in government labs. Private labs charge more in India, as well as in other countries
.

What fact-check ?: Thanks halt imposed government travel boats Covid-19 , crocodile shown Venice 's canals .
Explanation: The picture has been manipulated. There has never been a crocodile swimming in Venice.

What fact-check ?: The government mandated decree salary cut high public officials .
Explanation: The government has never approved such a measure.

What fact-check ?: This news bullettin 2015 proves Covid-19 created laboratory Wuhan .
Explanation: The news bullettin from 2015 was reporting on an experiment regarding a coronavirus created in a laboratory. However, this virus has nothing to do with COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Chinese Government Accuses Indonesia Spreading Corona COVID-19 Virus
Explanation: In its official statement, the Shaanxi Health Commission, China, only announced that there was one case of COVID-19 in its territory which was an import from Indonesia. No sentence was found from the Shaanxi government accusing Indonesia of spreading the coronavirus in the statement.

What fact-check ?: Doctor Li Wenliang Hospital China Suggest Drinking Tea Corona Patients
Explanation: There is no evidence to suggest that doctor Li Wenliang examined the effects of chemicals in tea, such as methylxanthine, on Corona patients. Li Wenliang was an ophthalmologist, not a virus expert. In addition, an article from Zhejiang CDC that claims that drinking tea can help prevent COVID-19 has been removed.

What fact-check ?: Dr. Li Wenliang recommends tea treatment . Doctors Wuhan cure COVID-19 tea .
Explanation: The doctor in question was an optometrist. Did not recommend a remedy for COVID-19. No scientific evidence shows tea can cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Netflix Amazon offering free subscription amid coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: Contrary to the claims, the website does not belong to Netflix. The streaming platform is available only on netflix.com. The tab thumbnail, however, is identical to the genuine site and bears the red ‘N’ symbol.

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp forward rounds groups attributed CNN . claiming Dr. ‘ Li Wenliang ’ whistleblower Chinese government ’ propaganda COVID-19 , documented research report . According report , chemicals like ‘ Methylxanthine , Theobromine Theophylline ’ stimulate compounds ward virus human body least averagely performing immune system .
Explanation: WHO has mentioned that to date, there is no vaccine or treatment to prevent or cure COVID-19. Also, the Chinese doctor Li Wenliang did not mention any medication or vaccination to cure COVID-19 in his findings.

What fact-check ?: Prince Charles tested positive COVID-19 meeting Bollywood singer Kanika Kapoor .
Explanation: The viral picture is old and was taken in 2015, during a charity event by UK royalty Prince Charles and Camilla; hence it is proved that the viral claim is ‘Misleading.’

What fact-check ?: Finally India got Coronavirus Dashboard . This official website CORONA updates . This website updated every 4 hrs . You scroll details , know coronavirus outbreak state placing finger state map .
Explanation: The said website is not official and the tweet made by Bollywood superstar is misleading.

What fact-check ?: Indian Government Has Issued A Guideline To Monitor Citizens Activity , call social media handles surveillance .
Explanation: A Twitter user has shared the same claim on November 24, 2017. The viral forward is ‘Fake’ and the Indian government has not issued any guidelines to monitor the activities of its citizens on various social media and messaging platforms.

What fact-check ?: France canceled fees electricity , gas , water rent .
Explanation: The person even doesn't mention the source. Just says that France will cancel all these fees, whih is not true. It will be implemented only for certain categories of businesses.

What fact-check ?: There space hospitals Italy people crowding outside .
Explanation: The claim with the pictures is false. While these photos are both real and recent, they are actually from Croatia’s capital Zagreb, which was rocked by a powerful earthquake on 22 March.

What fact-check ?: An Indian politician claimed strain coronavirus India less virulent mutation .
Explanation: Experts and doctors have denied this claim and said that there is no such study which corroborates the information provided by the politician in his tweet.

What fact-check ?: Viral WhatsApp audio message claims President Buhari Chief Staff flew country coronavirus treatment .
Explanation: Credible sources from the presidency clarify that Abba Kyari who tested positive for COVID-19 is in Lagos for treatment. As regarding the President, no credible reports suggest he is infected with the novel coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Video post claiming inhaling traditional appetizer salt limestone cure COVID-19 infection .
Explanation: Currently there is no medicine/Vaccine to cure or prevent COVID-19 as per WHO, also Dr. Myo Thant-deputy director general of Yangon region’ public confirms the mentioned claims on COVID-19 cure to be false.

What fact-check ?: Image mother unable feed suckling battles COVID-19 .
Explanation: The image is of a 35 year old woman comforting her daughter at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center in Seattle, Washington.

What fact-check ?: Image COVID19 infected Indonesian doctor Hadio Ali watching daughters distance bids final goodbye , image said posted wife .
Explanation: The Image posted is of a Malaysian doctor posted by one of his relatives, and the doctor is alive and healthy.

What fact-check ?: Italian President said Italy surrendered Coronavirus .
Explanation: Neither the Italian Prime Minister nor President have stated that Italy has surrendered to the virus. We even crosschecked with Italian fact checkers.

What fact-check ?: An image poster stating Indian religious leader Mata Amritanandamayi hidden foreigners hermitage allowed tested .
Explanation: FactCrescendo contacted the relevent officials who have dismissed the allegations calling it a motivated campaign against the Hermitage.

What fact-check ?: Images medical facility shared claim Indian Army set 1000-bed hospital Rajasthan amidst Coronavirus Pandemic .
Explanation: Upon investigation, we found out that all the images were old and two of them were not even from India. One is from the US and another is from Germany. Even the Indian Army clarified on Twitter that such claims are baseless.

What fact-check ?: Demon creature flying Church Italy .
Explanation: This is an old video created digitally using VFX created by an Animation studios.

What fact-check ?: In Sri Lanka , Sathosa Supermarket trucks bearing image former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa used distribute food current COVID-19 curfew . And text condemning act mentioning ethical carry acts difficult times gain political advantange .
Explanation: 2014 Images of Sathosa Lorries with PM Mahinda Rajapaksha portrayed as recent vehicles used to distribute food during curfew. Newspaper which carried original image published a disclaimer.

What fact-check ?: An audio clip circulating Whatsapp claiming Nagpur ( Second Capital Indian state Maharashtra ) tested 59 positive coronavirus cases including 3 doctors .
Explanation: We found that there are only 4 positive coronavirus cases in Nagpur. The district administration and Nagpur Municipal Corporation have denied such rumors. Divisional Commissioner of Nagpur said the administration would take stern action against such rumor mongers. We also spoke with Deputy Commissioner who informed the same.

What fact-check ?: A post photo claiming Italian mother , suffering COVID-19 , hugs baby
Explanation: The viral image is an old image, The mother is suffering from cancer and was clicked post her radiotherapy when she could not hug her child.

What fact-check ?: Photo posts claiming person committing suicide jumping building Italy , Doctor couple Italian hospital hours death chaos Italian hospital amid COVID19
Explanation: The first image is from Spain where a woman commited suicide in December 2019, The second image is of a couple at the Barcelona airport and the third image is from recent earthquake in Croatia.

What fact-check ?: No , Vladimir Putin drop lions streets force Russians stay home .
Explanation: A picture of a lion in the street went vira, but the animal has nothing to do with coronavirus or Russia.

What fact-check ?: Are Decathlon 's snorkeling masks used hospitals help patients breathing ?
Explanation: The idea came from Italy where a doctor contacted a 3D printer and the sports brand to adapt masks to the respirators. The company shared the 3D plans of her masks, but remains very cautious about the outcome of such an innovation.

What fact-check ?: No , photos patients medical beds street show situation Italian hospitals .
Explanation: These viral photos of medical beds and patients on the streets do not show Italy suffering from coronavirus, but Croatia, after the earthquake on March 22.

What fact-check ?: Why take seriously card efficacy chloroquine .
Explanation: Datas of the card are not accurate. Some are obsolete for days and some for years.

What fact-check ?: A message CHU Mans ( hospital France ) presenting alarmist arguments encourage French people stay home .
Explanation: CHU Le Mans denied having written such a message. Arguments in the message are false or unfounded.

What fact-check ?: Pictures people stranded hospital beds claimed Italy coping pressure COVID-19 cases India learn Italy 's mistakes step house 21 days lockdown
Explanation: The images were from the earthquake that hit Croatia on March 22, 2020 and were falsely shared as Italy.

What fact-check ?: A picture claiming Italian man committed suicide whole family succumbed COVID-19
Explanation: The image is of a woman committing suicide in Spain in December 2019. BOOM could not establish what drove the woman to take such a step.

What fact-check ?: Reliance Jio , one biggest telecom networks India providing Internet free COVID-19
Explanation: A spokesperson from the company denied any such schemes and the link in the messages were linked to scamming websites.

What fact-check ?: Videos showing police detaining COVID-19 patients India
Explanation: These were mock drills that were conducted by the UP Police to determine the preparedness of the public with regards to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: An image Indian Home Minister Amit Shah visiting COVID-19 patients .
Explanation: A 2015 picture of the then BJP president visiting hospitals in Madhya Pradesh shared with a false narrative.

What fact-check ?: An image human body figurines bowl claims China serving human baby soup restaurants .
Explanation: The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.

What fact-check ?: A herd deer shared flocking Tamil Nadu , India due lockdown Coronavirus
Explanation: The image is originally from Japan and was taken in 2014. It shows the Nara deers that are considered to be auspicious flanking the streets of Nara.

What fact-check ?: A 48 year-old man , unemployed due COVID-19 crisis , attempted suicide São Paulo .
Explanation: São Paulo state officers reported that no such case occured. Photo was from 2017.

What fact-check ?: Augusto Heleno , Brazilian general , cured COVID-19 infection using chloroquine .
Explanation: Augusto Heleno denied he had taken chloroquine for his COVID-19. He tested positive last week, but returned to work only seven days later.

What fact-check ?: Hospitals n't allow parents visit children COVID-19 hospital .
Explanation: Hospital policies have become generally more restrictive, but pediatric patients are still allowed visits by at least one parent.

What fact-check ?: The WHO decreed `` suspension medical activities ''
Explanation: It is a false headline, accompanied by a text explaining that it is the Portuguese Government that has taken this measure in relation to dentistry and stomatology.

What fact-check ?: Puerta de Hierro hospital Madrid uses whole floor president 's family .
Explanation: The hospital denied it.

What fact-check ?: A councilor Podemos Canary Islands tweeted `` useless elderly dead '' `` left street '' .
Explanation: That person is not a member of the political party and the Political party in the Canary Islands denied on its twitter account.

What fact-check ?: First death coronavirus Barranquilla , Columbia .
Explanation: The death has not been confirmed.

What fact-check ?: A false image statement Prime Minister Italy .
Explanation: The person who appears in the image is Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro, not the prime minister of Italy.

What fact-check ?: A vaccine coronavirus found .
Explanation: Is not a vaccine, is a test of antibodies.

What fact-check ?: An audio says MMS sodium chlorite cures coronavirus 24 hours .
Explanation: An audio by Isidro Fuentes García, alleged biologist, and a video by Josep Pamiès, fined by the Generalitat of Cataluña for promoting pseudotherapies to cure diseases, is going viral. In it he advises the MMS or sodium chlorite as a solution in 24 hours against the coronavirus. There is no evidence that works against COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A letter supposedly written Bill Gates says coronavirus corrector humanity .
Explanation: The letter supposedly written by Bill Gates in which he says that the coronavirus has a "spiritual purpose", that it is "the great corrector" and that "it is here to teach us some lessons that it seems we have forgotten". There is no evidence that Bill Gates is the author of this letter: he has not said anything similar in the latest public statements and the people who claim this provide no evidence of it.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) ‘ mix SARS , HIV , tuberculosis malaria ’ .
Explanation: A WhatsApp audio assures this, but neither that statement, nor several others that he mentions, have scientific support.

What fact-check ?: This chart shows current cases Turkey .
Explanation: The chart shows the quarantined people coming from abroad.

What fact-check ?: The outbreak discussed German Bundestag back 2012 .
Explanation: The report discussed in the Bundestag was about a possible outbreak and how Germany can be prepared. The possible coronavirus outbreak was also foreseen by scientists.

What fact-check ?: Putin sent lions streets discourage people going .
Explanation: The photo dates back to 2016 and taken in Johannesburg during a movie shooting.

What fact-check ?: In statement , Russian President Valdimir Putin said Russian citizens choose quarantine prison .
Explanation: Putin has not enacted this, although it is a possible punishment in Moscow and there is a bill that could send those who break the quarantine and cause infections to jail.

What fact-check ?: Photo Indonesian doctor , Hideo Ali , looking children pregnant wife last time .
Explanation: The one in the photo is not Indonesian doctor, Hideo Ali. He is a doctor from Malaysia. A Malaysian man posted this picture on Facebook saying that the doctor is his cousin and because of the spread of COVID-19 across the country, he had to leave his family and work constantly. Since, he doesn't have time he is looking at his family from a distance, and the photo is related to that instance.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 known humans outbreak 2020 .
Explanation: The new SAR-CoV-2 virus (which cause COVID-19) was first reported in December 2019. All the old images and videos being shared on social media refer to the virus as coronavirus, not as SAR-CoV-2 (or COVID-19). coronaviruses were known to human decades ago. All the references made on social media were about the coronaviruses, a general term for various viruses which cause diseases ranging from the common cold to Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).

What fact-check ?: Image dead bodies coronavirus victims Italy .
Explanation: The image shows coffins containing the dead bodies of Lampedusa shipwreck victims. In 2013, a boat packed with around 500 African migrants caught fire and sank around half a mile from the Italian island Lampedusa leading to the death of more than 300 people.

What fact-check ?: Photos coronavirus patients treated road Italy .
Explanation: The photos in the post are related to the earthquake in Croatia on 22 March. Patients at the hospital were evacuated because of the earthquake.

What fact-check ?: Another new disease called 'Hanta virus ' China .
Explanation: Hanta virus' has infected people in different countries for many years. That's not a new virus. In the US, between 1993 and 2017, approximately 728 people were infected with the virus which can be seen on the CDC website.

What fact-check ?: A video policeman taking man wandering 'lockdown Italy ' .
Explanation: The video is from Brazil and it shows Police taking down an alleged knife-wielding-man in Sao Paulo on 19 March.

What fact-check ?: A video showing pile corpses Italy .
Explanation: The video in the post is not real. It was a movie clip from a 2007 mini-series called 'Pandemic'.

What fact-check ?: Mustard oil prevents person getting infected COVID-19 .
Explanation: Neither World Health Organization (WHO) nor the Ministry for Health & Family Welfare (India) has announced that using mustard oil can prevent a person from getting infected with COVID-19. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus also spread newspapers .
Explanation: When a person with COVID-19 disease touches the newspaper coronavirus can be on the newspaper for some time, but the risk of coronavirus infection due to newspapers is very low, according to the World Health Organization (WHO).

What fact-check ?: Terrible conditions Ukrainian hospitals ordinary people photo .
Explanation: The photo of the hospital is not new. It was taken in Horlivka in 2014.

What fact-check ?: In city Lviv ( Vinnytsia ) coughing man thrown bus .
Explanation: The security service of Ukraine stated that the video is not related to the new coronavirus and was recorded well before the start of the pandemic or quarantine in Ukraine.

What fact-check ?: Israel 's Ministry Defense said best measure pandemic isolating elders .
Explanation: In the video, published on March 20, Naftali Bennett says that the most important thing to contain the COVID-19 crisis is that young and old do not live together. However, publications that disseminated the material omit that the minister himself corrected himself four days later, in a video published in his official account, and defended the massive lockout.

What fact-check ?: Speaking restriction travel China , Donald Trump claims : “ I ( Joe ) Biden calling xenophobic . … He called racist , fact felt racist thing stop people China coming . ”
Explanation: Biden has not directly said that the restrictions were xenophobic. Around the time the Trump administration announced the travel restriction,  Biden said that Trump had a “record of hysteria, xenophobia, and fear-mongering.”

What fact-check ?: Ibuprofen ramps coronavirus 10 times .
Explanation: There is no evidence that ibuprofen or other similar drugs exacerbate the disease. Instead, the notion is simply a hypothesis that has not been tested.

What fact-check ?: Lies spread Serbian authorities COVID-19 . For example : virus affect pregnant women , children young people , newborn infected corona virus virus last long objects , number respiratory machines Serbia posesses etc .
Explanation: There have been cases of infected and pregnant and newborns as well as people of different ages, their claim is untrue. When it comes to persistence of the virus on different surfaces, according to the latest research from the US National Institutes of Health, it has a stable presence in aerosols for a duration of three hours, on copper up to four hours, can remain on cardboard for 24 hours and two to three days of plastic and inox.

What fact-check ?: A post photos claiming COVID-19 infected patients Italy left street .
Explanation: The photos were from a hospital in Croatia after the earthquake struck the capital of Zagreb on March 22.

What fact-check ?: Drug coronavirus found .
Explanation: Article is misleading. Research is still ongoing and it's too early to say that drug for coronavirus was found.

What fact-check ?: Polish government confiscated coronavirus testing mashine originally bought local hospital Grodzisk Mazowiecki city .
Explanation: Article is misleading. Although hospital did indeed collect the money for buying the mashine, it didn't buy it eventually as the mashine was redirected to the city where it was much more needed. Polish government didn't take if forcefully or confiscated it as articles were suggesting.

What fact-check ?: Health care workers union `` suddenly finds stash 39 million face masks '' .
Explanation: Health care workers’ union launched a nationwide search on March 21 for face masks and other protective gear that have been in short supply since the COVID-19 pandemic swept across the U.S. On March 26, the union announced that it had found a supplier with 39 million masks.

What fact-check ?: 1 3 deaths coronavirus Spain lived nursing home .
Explanation: The media outlet added data on deaths in nursing homes by autonomous communities in recent weeks, but mixes deaths with coronavirus with other deceased elderly people, it is unknown if they had the virus.

What fact-check ?: `` Italians remove EU flag put flag PR China , '' headline says , suggesting phenomenon happening Italy - people removing flag European Union replacing Chinese flag .
Explanation: Those were individual cases in which citizens or companies, in a revolt from the EU's attitude towards their country in the most difficult moments of the epidemiological crisis, have taken the EU flag off. But this is not a general trend.

What fact-check ?: Guatemala Ombudsman wants citizens pay COVID-19 tests .
Explanation: He said he wants the Governement to allow testing also at private labs -currently only allowed at the National Public Lab- but he says as well that the Governement should provide free test for the citizens.

What fact-check ?: Should take Ibuprofen treat fever coronavirus ?
Explanation: World Health Organization does not recommend against the use of ibuprofen based on lack of medical reports showing any negative effects, and there is no published clinical or population-based data on this topic.

What fact-check ?: A post shared multiple times Facebook March 2020 claims China Japan “ free ” novel coronavirus , causes disease COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; data from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows new cases continue to be reported in both countries.

What fact-check ?: Photo Kanika Kapoor meeting Prince Charles recent visit United Kingdom . Prince Charles tested positive coronavirus meet .
Explanation: The photo was taken in 2015 when singer Kanika Kapoor attended the Elephant family charity, 'Travels to my Elephant', hosted by Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall.

What fact-check ?: Photo vaccine developed US scientists COVID-19 .
Explanation: The photo shows a COVID-19 diagnostic test kit developed by Sugentech, a South Korean based company. It is not a vaccine. As on 23 March 2020, there is no vaccine for COVID-19. Also, Trump announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’, not a vaccine, developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

What fact-check ?: WHO reported Coronavirus lasts upto 8 hours cabbages thus , cabbage consumption restricted .
Explanation: WHO did not publish any such report.

What fact-check ?: Viral message claiming disinfection conducted usage helicopters Poland .
Explanation: It was debunked by local authorities.

What fact-check ?: People got flu shot greater risk Covid-19 .
Explanation: There is no evidence that a flu vaccine makes things worse for COVID-19 patients.

What fact-check ?: 18 Italian people illegaly entering Ivory Coast flee coronavirus .
Explanation: Ivorian authorities denied: they are tourists coming from different European countries, and none of them are Italian. They entered Ivory Coast before actions were taken to slow down of the epidemic.

What fact-check ?: A claim police Thailand issue fines anyone wear face mask public novel coronavirus pandemic shared repeatedly Facebook , Twitter Line Messenger .
Explanation: The claim is false; Thai legal experts told AFP there is no law in the country that allows police to fine people for not wearing face masks; Thai police issued several statements calling the claims “fake news”.

What fact-check ?: A list ten tips combat coronavirus board member Stanford hospital : COVID-19 patients n't runny nose ; drinking hot water prevent infection COVID-19 .
Explanation: Stanford Health Care denied its board of directors had published this list. All the tips are typical misinformation around COVID-19 which was already debunked by fact-checkers.

What fact-check ?: Portuguese government spent much acceptable price ventilators .
Explanation: It´s false that the Portuguese government has spent much more than would be acceptable buying the ventilators. The prices are aligned with market prices.

What fact-check ?: Supposed quote Argentinian president alerting goverment aid going removed violeted quarantine .
Explanation: The quote is fake and the disinformation was created by a joke generator website.

What fact-check ?: Putin enter meeting ministries wearing full yellow suit used quarantine doctors protect catching COVID19 .
Explanation: The original photo is from Putin's visit to a quarantined hospital where COVID-19 patient are treated not from a meeting with his ministries.

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus reach Chinese cities Beijing Shanghai , well Russia North Korea .
Explanation: The virus spread to Beijing and Shanghai in January, Russia had its first cases in February, while North Korea's claim of being coronavirus-free is largely contested.

What fact-check ?: Dead bodies coronavirus patients discarded mass graves Italy , according 23-second video clip gone viral social media .
Explanation: The video clip was from the US miniseries Pandemic released in 2007.

What fact-check ?: Video shows bodies streets saying current situation Italy .
Explanation: The scenes in the video is from the 2007 movie Pandemic, which talks about the spread of birdflu in Los Angeles.

What fact-check ?: An image shared hundreds times multiple posts Facebook alongside claim shows poster issued activist group Extinction Rebellion states “ Corona cure , humans disease ” .
Explanation: The claim is false; Extinction Rebellion said that the image was published by an unaffiliated Twitter account and that the poster’s message in “no way” represents the global environmental movement’s “principles and values”.

What fact-check ?: Numerous conspiracy theories shared social media claim 5G mobile networks cause novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: This is false; experts told AFP that 5G is based on radio frequency and that this does not create viruses.

What fact-check ?: The viral video claims mass graves Italy .
Explanation: The viral video is part of a TV series called Pandemic. The viral scene is not from Italy.

What fact-check ?: There 59 positive Coronavirus cases Nagpur along 3 doctors one ventilator .
Explanation: There are 5 coronavirus cases in Nagpur as of March 26. None of them is a doctor.

What fact-check ?: Prince Charles infected coronavirus meeting Indian singer Kanika Kapoor .
Explanation: Viral pictures of Kanika Kapoor meeting Prince Charles are old.

What fact-check ?: North Korean president ordered shoot first Coronavirus pateint country .
Explanation: There is no credible media report which claims that Notrth korea has ordered to shoot its first coronavirus patient.

What fact-check ?: The Ministry Economic Development summoned Italians avoid sharing videos Whatsapp , due overcharging issues given working home Covid-19 emergency .
Explanation: There is no evidence of such a statement from the Italian authorities.

What fact-check ?: A beautiful Italian nurse died coronavirus .
Explanation: The fake-makers have used the picture of an actress (also, musician and writer) Sasha Grey. They claim her to be a nurse who died of exhaustion after three days of continuous work, which is false.

What fact-check ?: Italy surrendered Coronavirus pandemic measures control COVID-19 exhausted .
Explanation: The Prime Minister of Italy Giuseppe Conte in his recent statement said "We are giving up the most expensive habits, we do it because we love Italy, but we do not give up courage and hope in the future. United, we will do it". He did not talk about surrendering.

What fact-check ?: Amitabh Bachchan gave 500 million rupees Mumbai government fight coronavirus .
Explanation: A part of an old video of Amitabh Bachchan and Narendra Modi is being viral with false claim. Amitabh has not given a check of Rs. 500 crores to Bombay Municipal Corporation nor to Government of Maharashtra. He has not even met Indian  Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently.

What fact-check ?: Indian Army constructed advanced hospital capacity 1,000 beds Barmer , Rajasthan , cope COVID-19 .
Explanation: The images viral on social media claiming that the Indian Army has constructed an advanced hospital with the capacity of 1,000 beds in Barmer, Rajasthan, to cope up with COVID-19 are old and unrelated.

What fact-check ?: Indian State Kerala 's Opposition leader writes Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan adopt methods save stronger immunity COVID19 infection .
Explanation: FactCrescendo obtained the letter's copy, the opposition leader has suggested only mitigation measures to be adopted by the state to stop the spread of CoronaVirus. The Facebook user has misinterpreted the term 'mitigation methods' and built a false narrative around it. The opposition leader's office has comdemned the post saying no politician occupying the post of the leader of the opposition would suggest such drastic measures.

What fact-check ?: Indian prime minister Modi announced internet ban due spead misinformation regarding COVID19
Explanation: Fact Crescendo upon investigation found the viral claim to be False as the viral image is digitally edited from ABP News Hindi bulletin aired on 24 March 2020 when PM Narendra Modi had announced a nationwide 21 days lockdown due to the outbreak of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Video post showing conflict villagers police India COVID19 suspected corpse carried cemetery .
Explanation: This particular village had such kind of conflicts in the past three years for carrying pass a corpse through the village lane,local police cheif has confirmed that the death has nothing to do with COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Claim Saint Corona always patron saint epidemics .
Who said/posted it?: A Dutch pastor, after which Dutch mainstream media copied the claim.
Explanation: Saint Corona was never specifically worshiped as the patron saint against epidemics before March 2020.

What fact-check ?: A herd Deer reclaimed Ooty-Coimbatore road .
Explanation: The viral image is from Japan's Nara, taken in 2014.  It has no connection with India or lockdown.

What fact-check ?: In 30-sec viral video , man lifts shirt challenges police officer pointing gun . Another police officer kicks man behind , pins road makes arrest . The text overlaid video reads `` Italy says lockdown mean '' .
Explanation: Upon investigation, we found out that the video is from Brazil and it has nothing to do with lockdown or coronavirus. The man was drunk and was scaring people with knife in hand. The police of Sao Paulo has to use force to make the arrest.

What fact-check ?: Donald Trump attending recital Quran verses fight coronavirus .
Explanation: The video is from 2017, when Trump along with his wife Melania attended the inaugural prayer service after taking oath as the 45th President of the United States. Imam Mohammad Majid, executive director of the All Dulles Area Muslim Society recited verses from the Quran.

What fact-check ?: An emergency department closed Spanish hospital ?
Explanation: Videos are real. But the emergency department wasn't closed in Leganés. It was only full and a lot of patients had to wait in the corridor.

What fact-check ?: A video claiming bodies packed body bags dumped mass graves Italy Spain ' .
Explanation: The video is from a 2007 sci-fi mini series called Pandemic.

What fact-check ?: Images showing vaccines Coronavirus already discovered , patented readily available .
Explanation: Images of test kits and patents of other coronavirus strains are being falsely shared as COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Indian Home Minister Amit Shah claimed infected COVID-19 .
Explanation: The news graphic was created from a news generator and the news that the Home minister has COVID-19 is not true.

What fact-check ?: The Netflix Korean drama My secret terrius predicted Coronavirus outbreak 2018 .
Explanation: The show discusses coronavirus which is a family of viruses causing flu like symptoms, the symptoms mentioned are very different from COVID-19 and the fatality rate is much much higher.

What fact-check ?: Alleged images markets sacked angry mobs lockdown , São Paulo .
Explanation: Images were from 2013.

What fact-check ?: H1N1 far damaging Brazil COVID-19 : number cases deaths far higher .
Explanation: Although the figures are somewhat accurate, they correspond to different timeframes. Data for COVID-19 amounts for the first 24 days of epidemic. The figures for H1N1 are from July 2009 to December 2010. On the first 24 days of H1N1 epidemic in Brazil, there were only 16 confirmed cases, and no one had died.

What fact-check ?: Israel applied `` vertical lockdown '' ( younger , risk people allowed carry daily routines ) , lowest death rate COVID-19 world .
Explanation: Although Israel does have one of lowest death rates in the world, they did not restrict their lockdown policies to elderly people.

What fact-check ?: Bollywood superstar Aamir Khan donated Rs . 250 crore tackle novel coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: The image viral on social media claiming that Bollywood star Aamir Khan has donated Rs 250 Crore to fight with novel coronavirus is misleading as the actor has not donated anything yet. A British Boxer named Amir Khan has offered his retail outlet to the NHS to help the COVID-19 patients.

What fact-check ?: Indian Businessman , WIPRO Chairman , philanthropist Azim Prem donated 50,000 Crore fight COVID-19 outbreak India .
Explanation: Several media outlets used an old statement of Azim Premji to back their claim that Azim Premji has donated INR 50,000 crore to fight COVID-19 outbreak in India and then the same media reports were amplified by several verified Twitter handles including journalists, media personalities and politicians.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus found crab legs .
Explanation: The meme actually comes from a bogus news-generating app. Crab legs are safe, health experts confirm.

What fact-check ?: Some cities Turkey gon na disinfected helicopters .
Explanation: Both national and local authorities denied the measure.

What fact-check ?: Council Higher Education Turkey announced spring term alrealy .
Explanation: Spring semester is not over; higher education is going to continue remotely.

What fact-check ?: Netflix gives spoiler city screens discourage people going .
Explanation: Billboards were not prepared by Netflix but by a creative art group.

What fact-check ?: Two articles claiming iconic coffee chain Tim Hortons close Canada franchises March 30 , 2020 novel coronavirus shared 150,000 times Facebook .
Explanation: This is false; though locations are closed to dining-in, drive-throughs remain open, a spokeswoman for the chain told AFP.

What fact-check ?: A Matt Damon movie trailer predicts coronavirus pandemy
Explanation: A video of the trailer for the movie Contagion starring Matt Damon in 2011 is being used to say that it is a brand-new movie produced in 2019 that predicted the crisis of the coronavirus epidemic.

What fact-check ?: Hot tubes help prevent coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: Asked by our community and web publications
Explanation: Using WHO recommendations, we warn that the best way to prevent is hand washing and we warn of the risk of burns from extremely hot baths.

What fact-check ?: News ticker added image Sri Lankan Ada Derana TV channel give impression Dr Seetha Arambepoka stated secret medicine COVID19 TV interview
Explanation: We contacted Dr Seetha Arambepola and cross checked with the video interviews and image comparison and confirmed a statement she had made on a different TV interview had been misinterpreted.

What fact-check ?: A photo message doctor crying saying coronavirus stronger science .
Explanation: A photo of Pep Guardiola, Manchester City football team trainer, is being related to a message saying he is the head of the Madrid Hospital Department, Felipe Monterroso crying inconsolably and saying that the coronavirus "is stronger than science, but not stronger than God".

What fact-check ?: An image claiming Vladimir Putin said United States created coronavirus biological weapon .
Explanation: One image says Russia's President Vladimir Putin said that Donald Trump made the coronavirus as a biological weapon against China and that humanity is now paying for its mistake. There is no evidence that the Russian President has said this.

What fact-check ?: An online survey self-assess coronavirus symptoms .
Explanation: A questionnaire created in Google Forms circulates for people to do a self-assessment on the symptoms of the disease. It was created by a foundation, it is real, but it is not from any official institution.

What fact-check ?: A video claiming Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau ’ wife Sophie Grégoire Trudeau infected Coronavirus .
Explanation: The woman in the video is not Sophie Trudeau, but a British woman who has been infected with COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: False measures coronavirus Bogota .
Explanation: The image shows how this measure will be applied in the municipality of Apartadó, Antioquia.

What fact-check ?: An image elderly man death Italy .
Explanation: The image was taken in Wuhan, China.

What fact-check ?: Misleading telephone networks collapse Mexico .
Explanation: Several messages have circulated about the possibility of collapse in cell phone companies due to the high traffic that has occurred in recent weeks amid the contingency by the new coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: False COVID-19 destroyed `` hair dryer '' technique .
Explanation: False cure using a hair dryer to destroy virus.

What fact-check ?: This picture old city Hyderabad ( India ) today despite lockdown .
Explanation: The video is an old one. It was not taken during the current lockdown. Also, today’s Friday prayer at Mecca Masjid was conducted with only a few members.

What fact-check ?: A licensed guide Rome Vatican named Katya tells really going coronavirus epidemic Italy .
Explanation: Several statements do not correspond to scientific facts and official statements.

What fact-check ?: Italian PM said country surrendered COVID-19 pandemic .
Explanation: The quote attributed to Italian PM is made up.

What fact-check ?: A Facebook post suggests scientist United States found cure coronavirus .
Explanation: There is currently no cure for COVID-19. A breakthrough suggesting otherwise would warrant notice of international TV coverage; not a mere social media posting or blog site.

What fact-check ?: Inhaling steam boiled water dissolved salt effective cure COVID-19 , disease caused novel coronavirus .
Explanation: As of Tuesday, March 31, there is still no cure approved to treat the novel coronavirus, but there are treatments approved by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) that may help ease the symptoms. Inhaling salt water steam is not among them.

What fact-check ?: “ A hours ago , China officially announced success CUBAN serum Dr. Hala , CUBA 's Minister Health , presented Chinese Ministry Health treat Corona virus , turned 100 % effective 7 cases cured ''
Explanation: China has not announced anything of the sort.

What fact-check ?: Italian priest died , refusing use respirator sacrificed younger person .
Explanation: He didn't sacrifice the respirator. He didn't use it due to medical preconditions.

What fact-check ?: French professor Didier Raoult , director IHU Marseille , told Africans take `` Bill Gates ' vaccine '' coronavirus `` poisonous '' .
Explanation: The IHU Marseille has denied that its director made such comments, and there is currently no vaccine or approved treatment. If scientific research is underway, no vaccine should be released until at least next year.

What fact-check ?: Venezuelan youtuber Ruby Demestoy talked Event 201 , Bill Gates VIH + Sars conspiracies .
Explanation: Well-known conspiracies and many other lack of precise scentiftic information.

What fact-check ?: WHO admitted coronavirus airbone transmitted cause air 8 hours .
Explanation: Using a real CNBC link claimed the opposite of what WHO discovered and found.

What fact-check ?: Boil weed ginger COVID-19 victims , virus vanish .
Explanation: There is no evidence supporting the claim that marijuana and ginger can cure COVID-19. To date, there is no specific treatment available for COVID-19, although clinical trials evaluating certain existing drugs are underway.

What fact-check ?: A sensationalist headline claiming new virus China - Hantavirus .
Explanation: Passengers have been isolated and tested because of the suspicion that the coronavirus may be the cause of the deteriorating health of the passenger, not because of the danger of transmitting the hantavirus. The hantavirus first appeared in 1950, not nowadays.

What fact-check ?: A Chinese study definitive proof Chloroquine works .
Explanation: A widely shared video on social media claims that Chinese studies prove that chloroquine cures almost all of COVID-19 patients. Even though there have been some encouraging initial results, the researchers are in fact very cautious.

What fact-check ?: Video mass grave claiming Italy .
Explanation: This is from the movie Pandemic.

What fact-check ?: You take clothes shoes outside wash desinfectants , virus sticks floor 9 hours also spreads via wind .
Explanation: The claims lack context or are unproven. It is sufficient to wash your clothes normally. There are no studies regarding the lifespan of the virus on the floor.

What fact-check ?: By clicking italian Youtube song donate money hospital Bergamo
Explanation: Direct clicks are not giving out money, but the singer of the song on he video said he would donate proceeds.

What fact-check ?: Video waitress saying , `` I lost job . But I 'll sleep better knowing ” coronavirus relief bill included funding Kennedy Center , refugee resettlement , PBS , congressional salaries : “ Thanks , Democrats ”
Explanation: The post accurately cites several provisions that are in the coronavirus relief bill passed in late March. But it’s misleading to suggest the financial needs of a laid-off waitress aren’t addressed in the bill.

What fact-check ?: Seven photos shared repeatedly multiple posts Facebook Twitter , alongside claim show vegetables donated disadvantaged people curfew prompted novel coronavirus pandemic Sri Lanka .
Explanation: The photos have been shared in a misleading context; they actually show vegetables being donated at an event in southern Sri Lanka in August 2019, more than eight months before the curfew was implemented.

What fact-check ?: Photo Deer Ooty-Coimbatore road current lockdown ( COVID-19 ) .
Explanation: It is an old photo. The photo is on the internet atleast since 2014. It was taken in Japan, not in India.

What fact-check ?: `` Mainstream media '' used photo 2017 movie image Italy 's coronavirus morgue .
Explanation: The original photo is from a 2013 news report showing an airport hangar filled with coffins of African migrants who died in a shipwreck near an Italian island. It has not appeared in any recent media reports.

What fact-check ?: RAI TV news report 2015. proves SARS-CoV-2 made Chinese laboratory
Explanation: The news report in question was not related to SARS-CoV-2.

What fact-check ?: Covid-19 longer considered dangerous disease UK .
Explanation: The false claims misrepresents UK's system for disease classification.

What fact-check ?: 5G cause coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: Neither 5G nor other means of electromagnetic transmission are causing virus epidemics.

What fact-check ?: “ They ’ furloughing nurses hospitals western New York state . ”
Explanation: Hospitals in Buffalo and Rochester said they were preparing for a surge of patients, not furloughing nurses. Some health care workers have been furloughed elsewhere as elective surgeries have been canceled to stop the spread of the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A claim 500 body bags delivered ice skating rink outside Australian city Adelaide shared widely Facebook novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; South Australian health authorities said the claim is a “myth” and a spokesperson for the local ice rink said “the rumour is completely false”.

What fact-check ?: A claim 500 body bags delivered ice skating rink outside Australian city Adelaide shared widely Facebook novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; South Australian health authorities said the claim is a “myth” and a spokesperson for the local ice rink said “the rumour is completely false”.

What fact-check ?: Biden claim Trump try get medical experts China .
Explanation: Biden could make a case that Trump’s efforts to gain access for medical experts to China lacked vigor or were ineffectual; he cannot say there was no effort. As for being foresighted enough to make this case early on, Biden did not explicitly call for it until near the end of February, so that appears exaggerated.

What fact-check ?: Eight regions Perú plan manage coronavirus crisis .
Explanation: Four of the mentioned regions already had emergency plans for the coronavirus crisis and they published them before the Ombudsman claim.

What fact-check ?: The Argentinian vicepresident flew home state violeted quarantine .
Explanation: She was not on the flight indicated by the viral post. She is also exempt from the quarantine, as all high ranking government officials.

What fact-check ?: Series WhatsApp chains offering sums money `` national goverment WHO '' food packages Walmart . All shared Google forms sign .
