Explanation: The WHO isn´t offering finantial aid directly to people. Tha same desinformation circulated in other countries. Walmart isn´t giving away food packages.

What fact-check ?: Car insurance wo n't cover damage vehicle quarantine .
Explanation: This was denied by the state agency in charge of insurers.

What fact-check ?: A recipe involving full lemon ground cloves cured woman 's COVID19 symptoms . She n't sure maid actually COVID19 , still encourage people think take recipe .
Explanation: There is no evidence that full lemon and ground cloves can cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: 59 people Kenya die drinking Detol Prophet Rufus Phala AK Spiritual Christian Church told prevent COVID19 infection .
Explanation: The incident is correct but not related to COVID-19 as it happened in 2016. the priest defended himself that the Detol will transfer to water or juice with god's permission while they are drinking it.

What fact-check ?: Newborn Babies Call Boiled Eggs Can Treat Corona .
Explanation: The video used to complete the narration is an edited video. In addition, until now, there has been no vaccine or drug to prevent or treat COVID-19, including eggs. Eggs are recommended for consumption so that the immune system increases.

What fact-check ?: Italian President Mattarella : `` Italy declare life-long quarantine ''
Explanation: President Mattarella never said that, and never could. In addition, errors made in the distributed passage indicate that the text is likely to be the product of poor-quality automatic translation. This is the first sign that the authenticity of the message is in doubt, and it needs to be verified in detail.

What fact-check ?: Houses heated 23º celsius new coronavirus “ spread low temperatures ” .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. There’s no connection between the death of the virus and the temperature of the houses.

What fact-check ?: Video shows Italian people islamic prayer streets , asking God alleviate COVID19 epidemic .
Explanation: The video is from San Martin, Peru on the 7 december 2019. It's tied to a political crisis not to the COVID-19 epidemic.

What fact-check ?: According university University Turin : taking vitamin D reduce risk infection coronavirus .
Explanation: There is not a study from the University of Turin. University professors have written advice for patients with vitamin D deficiency. Professors don't say it reduces risk of infection.

What fact-check ?: Posts social media claim “ Spanish biological researcher ” called international soccer stars Cristiano Ronaldo Lionel Messi find cure COVID-19 since earn much money scientists .
Explanation: However, the accompanying photo shows a Spanish politician speaking in April 2018, well before the novel coronavirus outbreak

What fact-check ?: An article shared hundreds times Facebook claims Ethiopian government approved traditional medicine treatment COVID-19 successful clinical trials animals humans .
Explanation: However, the Ministry of Health denied the claims and Capital Ethiopia, which published the story, has corrected its Facebook post.

What fact-check ?: A post shared repeatedly multiple posts Facebook claim Singapore started enforcing spot fines people flout certain social distancing regulations novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the Singaporean government agency overseeing the enforcement of the social distancing order refuted the claim; there is no mention of spot fines for offenders in the recently announced government regulations.

What fact-check ?: Surin Province 's governor Thailand revealed 100000 people infected .
Explanation: The shared clip was trimmed from an original (about speculation and situation) to made people believe that actual patient is 100000.

What fact-check ?: If n't wear mask driving , police fine 200 baht .
Explanation: Police insisted that no such policy to fine people not wearing a mask.

What fact-check ?: Video clip shows people keep leaving Phuket .
Explanation: It's not in Phuket. It's actually a news from Thailand-Myanmar border in the north. And they are Myanmar labour who wanted to go to their home country.

What fact-check ?: Photo Kenyan crowds waiting coronavirus curfew start .
Explanation: Old photo from 2011; of crowds of Kenyans in Nairobi looking at collapsed building.

What fact-check ?: Drinking mix baking soda lemon hot tea cures Covid-19 . Claims `` cure '' meant cases Covid-19 Israel , drink popular .
Explanation: No scientific evidence for claim, confirmed by WHO and experts. Israel had nearly 5,000 cases of COVID-19 at time of publication.

What fact-check ?: Dr. Usman Riyaz Delhi died Coronavirus .
Explanation: Viral picture is of Dr. Riyaz Usman from UAE and he is alive.

What fact-check ?: Italian PM said country surrendered Covid-19 pandemic
Explanation: The quote attributed to Italian PM is made up.

What fact-check ?: Indian Telecom company Jio announced free recharge worth Rs 498 Indian citizens Coronavirus lockdown
Explanation: Telecom company Jio officially denied the claim on their official Twitter handle.

What fact-check ?: A post claiming Uganda recorded first Covid-19 death March 25 .
Explanation: Uganda had not recorded any deaths by the time the article was published.

What fact-check ?: `` Here ’ problem , testing people strain Coronavirus . Not specifically COVID-19 . There reliable tests specific COVID-19 virus . ''
Who said/posted it?: Julian Rose, GlobalResearch; Jerry Day, YouTube
Explanation: The PCR tests for COVID-19 are designed to be highly specific for the novel coronavirus—they can detect this virus unequivocally and differentiate it from other members of the coronavirus family. These PCR tests are also capable of measuring viral load (amount of virus) in patient samples, which is related to virus transmissibility and severity of infection.

What fact-check ?: WHO amended guideline : Coronavirus travel aerosols infectious air 8 hours . Everyone must wear face mask matter .
Explanation: WHO recommended medical personnel to wear N95 respirators to prevent the transmission through aerosols on March 29, but WHO didn't say that coronavirus is infectious in air for 8 hours, and didn't suggest everyone to wear a face mask.

What fact-check ?: Pakistan 's PM Imran Khan tested COVID-19 positive .
Explanation: Pakistan's Senator Faisal Javed Khan clearing the air, denied the claim, further asked the news network to correct the report. The Pakistani politician said, "News regarding PM Imran Khan tested positive for COVID-19 is NOT true. Please refrain from spreading fake news.

What fact-check ?: Pakistan 's Dr. Usama Riaz , contracted coronavirus treating patients left died .
Explanation: he various social media platforms claiming that the person in the video is Dr.Usama Riaz is misleading. He is Mubhasir Ahmed, who has been living in the United Kingdom.

What fact-check ?: Boiled sumac cures COVID-19 .
Explanation: The person makes the claim is a cleric, not a scientist. There is no evidence shows sumac cures the disease.

What fact-check ?: The current Coronavirus outbreak due movement towards 5G .
Explanation: The 5G connection has no scientific evidence to the outbreak of coronavirus

What fact-check ?: The viral text message claims chemical substances ( methylxanthines ) required cure COVID-19 found tea . Dr. Li Wenliang found cure researching coronavirus death .
Explanation: A veteran microbiologist of India Dr. Sharad Kale, dismissed such reports saying - though methylxanthines are found in tea, there is no scientific evidence it cures coronavirus. He termed it Hoax. WHO also states that no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease.

What fact-check ?: A viral video post claiming Myanmar people resistance coronavirus eat fishpaste vegetables . The video narration says Myanmar people eat rice , fishpaste vegetables- thus ’ need worry coronavirus infections immune system stronger people west .
Explanation: There is no evidence or recommendation from WHO for possible COVID-19 prevention by taking a certain food. An article in ABC news quoted two experts saying no single food is supercharger for immune system. Mohs has confirmed three COVID-19 confirmed cases two days after the viral video had such a claim.

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus stays 8 hours spreading air .
Explanation: COVID-19 seems to spread mainly through respiratory droplets and close contact. The droplets are too large to be transported by air for long periods of time

What fact-check ?: Huawei stopped donating masks Europe .
Explanation: Huawei denied that it has stopped sending masks to support Europe, and has not issued an official statement.

What fact-check ?: The co-founder Union , Progress Democracy ( UPyD ) party , Rosa Díe allegedly tweeted says `` time Army take ... '' handle emergency .
Explanation: There are no archive that show that this tweet ever existed.

What fact-check ?: An alleged tweet president Vox political party Spain , Santiago Abascal , someone answer infected including misspelling .
Explanation: There is no evidence that Santiago Abascal has tweeted this message or that he has deleted it. The tweet is neither published nor archived and the catch that circulates is always the same.

What fact-check ?: Bolivian former Health minister , Ariana Campero , use image twitter post criticize actual government .
Who said/posted it?: Ariana Campero, health former minister of Bolivia
Explanation: The image is from Ecuador.

What fact-check ?: A declaration director Center Coordination Health Alerts Emergencies Spain tests COVID-19 health personnel
Explanation: Fernando Simón, the director of the Center for Coordination of Health Alerts and Emergencies of Spain said that all the health personell in contact with a infected collegue with COVID-19 during a public speech, this was denied by the Health Ministery, the protocols and the personnel.

What fact-check ?: A viral post claiming French state scandal chloroquine , additioning 20 different claims .
Explanation: Most of the claims are false or out of context.

What fact-check ?: Photo shows man cured COVID-19 hydroxycloroquine .
Explanation: The image in question is from a 2019 brazilian RBS report, prior to the coronavirus pandemic and any case recorded worldwide. The man is Walter Hugo Balestra Pombo, a patient with pulmonary emphysema admitted to the ICU of the Moinhos de Vento hospital in Porto Alegre due to treatment for pulmonary emphysema.

What fact-check ?: The title article states : `` The first pregnant woman coronavirus Macedonia gave birth . `` .
Explanation: The assertion in the headline that the first pregnant woman with coronavirus gave birth in Macedonia is false. Actually it is an event that happened in Serbia.

What fact-check ?: News graphic saying Indian Prime Minister asked internet shut country .
Explanation: The news graphic is photoshopped and fake. The Prime Minister did not make this statement.

What fact-check ?: A news publication reports royal Palace confirms Queen Elizabeth tests positive coronavirus .
Explanation: While we cannot know if Queen Elizabeth does not have COVID-19, no evidence suggests she does. Besides, no notable publications corroborate this assertion. And, although she came in contact with Boris Johnson, Prime Minister of England who has a positive COVID-19 status, no reports definitively say she has undergone a test. Rather, credible intel suggests she is “following all the appropriate advice with regards to her welfare”.

What fact-check ?: A website claiming China confirmed patient zero sex bat .
Explanation: World News Daily is a website generating fake news and it is scientifically seen that the virus has emerged from an animal source.

What fact-check ?: Bombay High Court extending Maharashtra 's lockdown April 31 .
Explanation: The High Court had only extended its interim orders and not the lockdown.

What fact-check ?: Myanmar 's former military junta donated Ks 1000 Lakhs COVID-19 fund .
Explanation: The list of donors in The Mirror daily circulated on March 26 shows no name of former military junta or current army chief or former president.

What fact-check ?: Audio Secretary Risk Management Cali exponential growth coronavirus .
Explanation: The voice is not from politician Rodrigo Zamorano but from the doctor César Augusto Arias, interviewed on a radio program.

What fact-check ?: A Facebook publication ensures `` new generation genetic vaccines ready inoculated world population . ''
Explanation:
Genetic vaccines are being tested and the specific effects on DNA are unknown.
There is a North American company that is testing these vaccines for coronavirus, but it is not known if, specifically, for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: The following statement : `` There prisoners infected coronavirus , state hiding fact . ''
Explanation: This false information was denied by the Directorate for Execution of Sanctions and Minister of Health Venko Filipce, one day later.

What fact-check ?: A sensationalist headline : `` LATEST NEWS / SOMETHING BIG IS HAPENING IN EUROPE ''
Explanation: This is blank text, no information, no facts, no source of information and nothing that can serve the reader. The purpose of this article is only to cause panic and to collect as many clicks as possible. The text is no longer available.

What fact-check ?: Multiple news reports circulating Nigeria claim Buckingham Palace announced Britain ’ Queen Elizabeth tested positive COVID-19 .
Explanation: Although the Queen’s eldest son was diagnosed with the disease, the Palace said the monarch herself is “in good health”.

What fact-check ?: Neem leaves cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: WHO has iterated that while some traditional medicines, western medicines, and home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence of a single medicine that treats COVID-19 currently.

What fact-check ?: Putting eucalyptus ( Vicks VapoRub ) nose prevents COVID-19 .
Explanation: Eucalyptus has some antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties, but is not virucidal and there is no evidence that it fights SARScov-2.

What fact-check ?: Water vapor inactivates SARScov2 .
Explanation: There is no evidence supporting hot water as a preventive measure.

What fact-check ?: India TV telecasted news Bollywood Actor Shahrukh Khan donated 450 million ( 45 Crore ) Rupees Pakistan Oil tanker blast victims .
Explanation: The video is a clipped version of India TV’s fact-check video. In the original fact-check video, India TV has debunked the same claim and concluded that Shahrukh has not made any donation to Pakistan Oil tanker blast victims.

What fact-check ?: Video person infected coronavirus comitting suicide New York .
Explanation: The video was taken in 2015. It shows a pregnant woman jumping off a building top after finding that her husband was having an affair with her mother.

What fact-check ?: Recent photo PM Modi visiting Church offering prayers save country coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: It is an old photo. The photo was taken when Modi visited Sri Lanka in June 2019. He paid homage to those killed in the serial bombings at St Anthony's Shrine (Colombo, Sri Lanka).

What fact-check ?: Indian Army built 1,000-bed hospital Rajasthan eight days treatment COVID-19 .
Explanation: The Indian Army has mentioned that the news that it is building a thousand-bed hospital for the treatment of COVID-19 in Barmer (Rajasthan) is false. Also, the photos in the post are old.

What fact-check ?: A video man committing suicide jumping hotel Italy entire family died due coronavirus .
Explanation: The video has been on the internet since December 2019. But, the first death due to COVID-19 was reported in January, 2020. So, there is no relation between the video and COVID-19. Also, the hotel in the video is in Spain.

What fact-check ?: Video Police strictly implementing lockdown Spain .
Explanation: The video is not related to COVID-19 lockdown in any country. The video shows Azerbaizan Police (not Spain) dispersing a protest in October 2019.

What fact-check ?: “ Queen Elizabeth tests positive COVID-19 . ”
Explanation: No credible reports claim that Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for COVID-19. Buckingham Palace recently said she remains in good health.

What fact-check ?: Says COVID-19 remains air eight hours everyone required wear masks “ everywhere . ”
Explanation: There are different definitions of what is considered “airborne,” and while COVID-19 is spread through the air via droplets, it isn’t believed to be as transmissible as typical airborne illnesses, such as measles. There is no evidence that the virus stays in the air for eight hours and there is no requirement for “everyone” to wear masks everywhere.

What fact-check ?: Posts shared 20,000 times Facebook feature photo crying child two others showing woman man hospital beds , claiming boy ’ parents infected novel coronavirus
Explanation: This is false, the pictures do not depict a family and circulated online prior to the COVID-19 pandemic.

What fact-check ?: Audio clips doctor works Argentina´s important lab testing coronavirus .
Explanation: The lab denied the alleged doctor work there. Many of the advises given in the audio clip were denied by specialist.

What fact-check ?: A comparison evolution coronavirus Argentina Chile .
Explanation: Specialists indicated that the data in the post is not enough to compare objectively the evolution of the pandemic in each country.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 affects mainly people type A blood ( group II ) .
Explanation: The articles refer to the Medrxiv website, which can not serve as a reliable source of scientific knowledge, and the figures in the study itself are very controversial and it is impossible to draw a final conclusion from them.

What fact-check ?: Official statement Serbian Governement claiming experts recommended ban pet walks .
Who said/posted it?: Government of the Republic of Srrbia
Explanation: Experts involved in Crisis Headquoter Fighting against COVID-19 denied Government's claim.

What fact-check ?: Viral post along pictures claims civilian thrashing policeman lockdown .
Explanation: The viral photos are three years old and have nothing to do with the coronavirus lockdown.

What fact-check ?: CDC recommends people shave facial hair prevent coronavirus .
Explanation: No such recommendations have been made by CDC so far.

What fact-check ?: Inhaling steam sea salt orange peelings prevent coronavirus infection .
Explanation: There is no scientific proof of the claim; WHO does not mention this remedy.

What fact-check ?: `` These coffins people died Covid-19 . Would stay home idiots ? ''
Explanation: This picture is from 2013 and shows the coffins of migrants that died crossing the Mediterranean sea.

What fact-check ?: Screenshots messages showing emergency cash transfers Government Kenya response Covid-19 .
Explanation: The government of Kenya had not introduced any emergency cash transfers and had not announced cash transfers as a response to COVID-19 in the country.

What fact-check ?: A front page article Southern Times cautioning travel Kenya growing number cases Kenya .
Explanation: The Southern Times published a post denouncing the front page, and the image appears to be a doctored version of a previous edition of the paper.

What fact-check ?: Russia released lions streets people quarantine .
Explanation: The photo is originally from a lion that was used to record a movie in South Africa in 2016, while the fake headline was created in a meme generator.

What fact-check ?: A viral text based image post claiming 5000 Italy infected due mobile phone cover quoting findings research without specifying details name research . The post advises abandon phone cover use phone without phone cover
Explanation: There has been no research that proved that  5000 people from Italy are infected due to phone cover.

What fact-check ?: A post claiming Yangon region Myanmar locked within 48 hours saying announcement come officially .
Explanation: Yangon region minister for immigration and social welfare Daw Moe Moe Suu Kyi confirms that the news is false, and no plan to lockdown within 48 hours.

What fact-check ?: Image bakery items WHO logo message given impression WHO advised public consume bakery products amidst COVID19 concerns .
Explanation: WHO has not issued any statement against consumption of bakery products and FDA confirms that there is no evidence of food or food packaging being associated with transmission of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A video post related corona virus circulating social media saying China distributing Quran
Explanation: We found this video is related with Chinese Christians when Bible is seen for the first time and the video was originally shared in 2015.

What fact-check ?: A 20-second clip shows burqua clad woman difficulty breathing .
Explanation: The video is not from Islampur in India, but is from Pakistan. Also, the woman does not have the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Inhalation steam hot water kills COVID19
Explanation: Inhalation of steam from hot water does not kill coronavirus. There is no research conducted to support the same.

What fact-check ?: The Spanish government stopped counting dead COVID-19 6 9 March .
Explanation: Those days, minister of Health published data on social media and at press conference.

What fact-check ?: The Spanish president 's wife daughter went Cuenca quarantine .
Explanation: The presidency and town hall deny it.

What fact-check ?: Spanish authorities arresting people go attend mass .
Explanation: The video was fimed in octobre in the Valley of the Fallen.

What fact-check ?: Nike giving away free shoes coronavirus .
Explanation: Nike denys it and there is no official information about it.

What fact-check ?: Huawei stopped send masks article Spanish writer Josep Borrell .
Explanation: Huawei says it is not true.

What fact-check ?: Tire repairer died work accident included death figures COVID-19 .
Explanation: In a note to Aos Fatos, the Pernambuco's Department of Health reported that the death certificate of a 57-year-old man who circulates in social media publications is true, but the cause of death was rectified after further laboratory tests concluded that he died on account of another respiratory virus. The state agency also reported that the man's death was never included in state statistics as a result of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Donald Trump announced comercialization vaccine .
Explanation: The text refers to a press conference where Trump did not say that. There is no vaccine yet.

What fact-check ?: A video Italian TV predicted virus 2015 .
Explanation: The video does not refer to the actual virus and is not talking about that.

What fact-check ?: An image arms burned allegedly using gel alcohol disinfect .
Explanation: Alcohol based gels (ethanol and isopropyl alcohol) are highly flammable if we expose ourselves to heat sources after applying them, but alcohol evaporates quickly if applied correctly.

What fact-check ?: Pope Francis asked believers put white handkerchief doorstep plague go away .
Explanation: There is no reference to the Pope's alleged request in any of the Vatican's official news services.

What fact-check ?: The government supposedly buying evidence company related sister María Dolores Cospedal , former secretary Popular Party , ideological reasons .
Explanation: The government is buying tests for the coronavirus test from the company Genomica, of which the CEO is the sister of the former leader of the Popular Party.

What fact-check ?: Several photos coffins , allegedly , victims coronavirus police investigated
Explanation: Four photos with a large number of coffins are disseminated with messages such as "the photo by which dozens of police and health officials are being investigated" or "images of the Spain that Pedro Sánchez is leaving us". It is a hoax: the photos correspond to a shipwreck in front of the island of Lampedusa (Italy) in October 2013.

What fact-check ?: The king Spain supposedly dissolve congress appoint emergency government state alarm
Explanation: During the state of alarm, the Congress of Deputies cannot be dissolved. In addition, the acts of the king will always have to be approved and signed by the President of the Government or the Congress of Deputies and the dissolution of the Cortes can only occur in 3 specific cases, which do not contemplate the current situation.

What fact-check ?: A video alleged seer predicted coronavirus December 2019
Explanation: There is no evidence that the video published by the seer, called Nube de María, a few days ago was recorded and broadcast in December, as they claim.

What fact-check ?: Increase cases pneumonia Mexico .
Explanation:
In Mexico, what has been verified is that it is false that the cases of pneumonia and bronchopneumonia have registered an increase so far in 2020, according to the last report from the authority in mid-March.
Although the rumor of the data of some supposed 70 deaths linked to the new coronavirus has spread in networks, data that some businessmen from funeral homes in the Toluca Valley, State of Mexico, reportedly provided; This has been ruled out by some authorities and even by the same source to which the report was attributed.

What fact-check ?: Trump claims “ ’ say ” medical equipment governors requesting , n't actually need .
Explanation: During the interview with Hannity, Trump said, “I have a feeling that a lot of the numbers (for ventilators) that are being said in some areas are just bigger than they're going to be. I don't believe you need 40,000 or 30,000 ventilators.”

What fact-check ?: Pangolin proven 'responsible ' coronavirus .
Explanation:
No investigation to date has concluded or established with absolute certainty that the pangolin, a mammal under protection regime and that inhabits Asia and Africa, is part of the chain of species through which the sars-cov2 virus mutated and it happened to humans.
The publications (1) in which the “responsibility” of this species is reiterated are the result of the erroneous interpretation of investigations in which, through genetic analysis studies of pangolin-associated coronaviruses, some relationships between these infectious agents and sars-cov2, which causes COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A post shared repeatedly WhatsApp Facebook claims Chinese doctor discovered drinking tea effective curing relieving symptoms novel coronavirus , COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; health experts say there is insufficient scientific evidence to show that drinking tea is effective in preventing or curing COVID-19 infections; as of March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) has said there is no cure for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Videos patient gasping breath shown patient India .
Explanation: The video is not from India but Eucador where the person was suffering from acute respiratory distress syndrome.

What fact-check ?: pH level coronavirus varies 5.5 8.5 beat virus consume alkaline food .
Explanation: Speaking to The Quint, Dr Shaheed Jameel, a leading virologist said that viruses do not have pH values.

What fact-check ?: There COVID19 cure USA .
Explanation: It was a test kit from South Korea, that was shared as an American-made vaccine for COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Video police roughing civilians claimed Police Spain enforcing lockdown .
Explanation: The video is originally from Baku, Azerbaijan from a protest in October 2019.

What fact-check ?: The Indian Army called control seven areas Mumbai following 21 day lockdown Mumbai police 's control .
Explanation: The Mumbai police has not called in the army and the seven areas are duly following the lockdown prescribed by the government.

What fact-check ?: The Indian Home Ministry considers posting anything Coronavirus punishable offence .
Explanation: The message was attributed to a non existent Home Ministry official and the ministry has not passed any circular stating that any message about coronavirus should not be shared.

What fact-check ?: Says study projects Wisconsin ’ coronavirus cases peak April 26 , 2020 .
Explanation: The first iteration of a study estimating coronavirus peak dates for each state pegged Wisconsin at May 22, last in the nation by two weeks. But updates to the model used in the study changed the dates for almost all states, affecting Wisconsin the most. The organization now predicts an April 26 peak in Wisconsin.

What fact-check ?: Brazilian Ministry Health hinted relatives COVID-19 victims doubt death certificates .
Explanation: The recommendation, which circulates on social media as if it were official, was denied by the brazilian Ministry of Health's advisory and does not appear in the guidelines of the Brazilian government on the management of bodies in the context of the new coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A photo shared hundreds times multiple Facebook posts alongside claim shows hospital car park Singapore converted wards novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is misleading; the hospital clarified its car park would temporarily be used to test patients suspected to have been infected with the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, but it would not be converted into “wards”.

What fact-check ?: Video Muslims applying saliva plates spoons spread coronavirus disease .
Explanation: The first coronavirus case in the world was registered in December 2019. But the video is found to exist on social media at least since July 2018.

What fact-check ?: Video Police strictly implementing lockdown Spain .
Explanation: The video is not related to COVID-19 lockdown in any country. The video shows Azerbaizan Police (not Spain) dispersing a protest in October 2019.

What fact-check ?: Recent photo PM Modi visiting Church offering prayers save country Coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: It is an old photo. The photo was taken when Modi visited Sri Lanka in June 2019. He paid homage to those killed in the serial bombings at St Anthony's Shrine (Colombo, Sri Lanka).

What fact-check ?: A new born baby suffering birth defects predicted using Turmeric cure Coronavirus India .
Explanation: The baby was suffering from Anencephaly and was stillborn and has no connection with COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A photo Sri Lankan military hospital shared thousands times multiple Facebook posts alongside claim reserved exclusively use `` VIPs '' test positive COVID-19 , disease caused novel coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.

What fact-check ?: A photo Sri Lankan military hospital shared thousands times multiple Facebook posts alongside claim reserved exclusively use `` VIPs '' test positive COVID-19 , disease caused novel coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.

What fact-check ?: The french doctor Jean-Roger Hospital sent e-mail claim protect COVID-19 drinking water 15 minutes .
Explanation: M. Hospital says he has been hacked. It is also false to claim that you can be protected by drinking water.

What fact-check ?: Website offers rapid test COVID19 check seconds .
Explanation: The website depend mainly on fever to diagnose COVID-19 even you said you have all other symptoms including dry cough, dyspnea and fatigue. the algorism will still say you are ok and only having the common flu. the good part in the website is that it guide you when you have fever to go to hospital for treatment.

What fact-check ?: `` The Kaaba opened '' `` Hajj stopped '' .
Explanation: As such, the Kaaba did not close. On February 27, the official website of the Ministry of health of Saudi Arabia in connection with the spread of the coronavirus in the list of measures taken provides for a temporary suspension of the small pilgrimage. In addition, the Minister of Pilgrimage and Umrah of Saudi Arabia, Mohamed Saleh Benten, officially announced on his Twitter page that the small Hajj has been temporarily suspended. However, residents of the city can get into the mosque.

What fact-check ?: Multiple posts shared hundreds times Facebook Twitter March 2020 claim new vaccine new drug developed prevent treat novel coronavirus . The posts claim developments made scientists Japan Philippines respectively .
Explanation: The claims are misleading; the Japanese government announced in late March 2020 that Japanese scientists were testing a new drug, not a vaccine, to treat COVID-19; the Philippine Food and Drug Administration warned the other drug cited in the misleading posts was "unregistered" and not safe.

What fact-check ?: When complete registration 5000 Baht support fund , show green sign , blue sign .
Explanation: The correct one is a blue one.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed tens thousands times multiple Facebook , Instagram YouTube posts claim shows people China toppling 5G tower fears cause novel coronavirus
Explanation: The claim is false; the video shows pro-democracy protesters toppling a smart lamppost in Hong Kong in August 2019, several months before the novel coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: WHO advisory asks people consume bakery items get contaminated coronavirus easily .
Explanation: WHO has not issued any such advisory. Till now, there is no evidence that bakery items get easily contaminated by coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Official news : Naples people used Tocilizumab , drug cure Covid-19 .
Explanation: The Italian Healthcare Ministry have authorized experiment to understand whether this drug can be effective against COVID-19 pneumonia. However, this research has not proved anything yet.

What fact-check ?: Last week , Valle del Lili Foundation Cali summoned press conference speak 'Treatment infection Coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) ' . It “ treatment option two medications : Hydroxychloroquine Azithromycin , rapidly decrease growth expansion virus patient , decrease possibility serious illness respiratory failure , well possibility contagion others , ” according press release .
Explanation: Treatment released by Cali clinic for Covid-19 does not yet have conclusive scientific evidence.

What fact-check ?: Video heartbreaking story Italien/Greek couple : regardless risk getting infected , guy took protective suit kissed fiancee . They died March 25 .
Explanation: The video is an edited clip of a 2010 Mexican soap drama, Triunfo del amor.

What fact-check ?: Photo list open community dining rooms Bogotá .
Explanation: A list of community canteens in Bogotá is prowling on social networks, but it does not warn that these are not working in person and also omits the complete list.

What fact-check ?: A claim India ’ Ministry Home Affairs made “ punishable offence ” citizens publish posts social media novel coronavirus shared repeatedly Facebook , Twitter WhatsApp .
Explanation: The claim is false; India’s official Press Information Bureau said it had made no such law; an online search for the purported government minister who issued the alleged ban yielded no results.

What fact-check ?: Ministry Home Affairs India directed people post anything related coronavirus .
Explanation: The message has been undersigned by the Principal Secretary to the Home Minister but in reality there is no such post of person in the ministry.

What fact-check ?: The text Macedonian website , specifically headline says Leader French National Front , Marine Le Pen , first victim EU coronavirus .
Explanation: It is a bad translation from foreign media. Marin Le Pen has never stated that she is the first coronavirus victim in the EU. She said in an interview with the French edition of Russia Today that "the EU is a victim of coronavirus". This is very different from the text's claim that "Le Pen is a coronavirus victim".

What fact-check ?: French champion chloroquine Didier Raoult supposed said use Bill Gates ' vaccines .
Explanation: Raoult's team denies he made such a statement.

What fact-check ?: Governor Maranhão , Brazil , Flávio Dino , giving food baskets crowd poor people , spite reccomendations crowds COVID-19 crisis .
Explanation: The picture is from 2019. The man in the picture is not Flávio Dino, but Roberto do Posto, mayor of a small town in Maranhão.

What fact-check ?: The Brazilian Government handling 600 brazilian reais monthly COVID-19 emergency allowance poor citizens . To access , need fill oficial form ( link form ) .
Explanation: Although the COVID-19 emergency allowance itself is a real thing, it has not been formaly approved by the Senate yet (March 30, morning). The Brazilian government has not announced how it will be payed. The given URL directs to a non-governmental internet address, registered abroad, quite possibly a phishing scam.

What fact-check ?: A message Brazilian Workers ' Party ( PT ) , Gleisi Hoffmann , asking party affiliates boycott 600 reais monthly COVID-19 emergency allowance . Eligible PT voters reject denounce , since paid `` fascist government '' .
Explanation: PT, as all Brazilian parties with seating representatives, voted for the COVID-19 emergency allowance, not against it. Gleisi Hoffmann published a text on her Facebook account denying this request.

What fact-check ?: An audio file alledged state official Ceará , Brazil , named Ricardo Certi , asking directors local TV station criticize Bolsonaro praise Ceará 's government COVID-19 policies .
Explanation: Ricardo Certi, the man who allegedly recorded the message, does not exist. There's not a single person with this name working for the Ceará state government.

What fact-check ?: Luciano Hang , Roberto Justus ( Brazilian businessmen , pro-vertical isolation tactics ) Eduardo Costa ( singer , Bolsonaro supporter ) donated 4 million Brazilian reais 90 respirators SUS ( National Health Care system ) .
Explanation: Hang told us he donated 2 respirators to a hospital in his hometown, Brusque. Justus said he donated to "some iniciatives" against COVID-19, but did not disclose the amount. Costa said he's trying to gather some businessmen together to purchase some respirators for Minas Gerais hospitals, but nothing concrete has happened so far (March 30). Thus, none of the statements are correct.

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp chain claims Alert State , government begin record calls track social media publications citizens .
Explanation: A WhatsApp chain ensures that all communications will be recorded. This chain says that there will be a record and monitoring of calls and content distributed through social networks. It is a false string. It has been moving since 2017 in Mexico.

What fact-check ?: A link offering registration United States humanitarian aid countries coronavirus
Explanation: A web page called borrowed.xyz is faking CNN image with an alleged offer from the United States to give humanitarian aid vouchers to citizens of other countries. It is a case of phising.

What fact-check ?: The WHO allegedly announced face masks protect effective walking street .
Explanation: The WHO says that masks should be used rationally and appropriately due to the scarcity of this protection worldwide, not that it does not protect when going on the street.

What fact-check ?: Santiago Abascal , general secretary VOX ( political party ) , allegadly n't respect quarantine period tested positive COVID-19
Explanation: Santiago Abascal, secretary general of the VOX political party, respected the statutory quarantine periods after being positive by COVID-19 and did not skip the quarantine to go to the Congress of Deputies.

What fact-check ?: Supposedly according new decree issued Spanish government regulate non-essential activities confinement , customs officers must work therefore goods would enter Spain .
Explanation: The decree published by the Spanish government to regulate the performance of non-essential activities during confinement authorizes the work of customs agents, as an essential activity.

What fact-check ?: A photo Pablo Iglesias , vice president Spanish government , praying Catholic church beginning COVID-19 quarantine .
Explanation: the image where Pablo Iglesias, vicepresident of Spain,  appears praying in a catholic church is a montage putting his face on the body of another person. The original photograph was published years earlier on the internet.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus infections linked lack vitamin D .
Explanation: There is no evidence that vitamin D reduces the risk of coronavirus infection. Some preliminary studies suggest that it could prevent it, but drawing premature conclusions about studies or publications can be a risk for the general population.

What fact-check ?: Hospital La Paz Madrid , Spain requesting blankets patients admitted hospital .
Explanation: The authorities of the La Paz Hospital in Madrid, Spain deny having requested donations of blankets and bedspreads for patients admitted to their hospital.

What fact-check ?: Lemon bicarbonate cure coronavirus .
Explanation: Doctors and experts suggest that there is no medical evidence to corroborate the claim.

What fact-check ?: Actor Vijay 's father criticized government enforcing curfew abate COVID-19 .
Explanation: The newscard shared to make the claim is fake. The news channel has not published any such news.

What fact-check ?: Hydroxychloroquine ( HCQ ) prevent COVID-19 .
Explanation: The USFDA has however approved the drug for treatment of COVID-19 as this anti-malarial drug might ease some symptoms. However, it is not proven to build resistance and prevent COVID-19 and its use without Doctor's prescription is not recommended.

What fact-check ?: Tamil Nadu Govt ordered re-open TASMAC bars .
Explanation: A fake screenshot has been used to make the claim.

What fact-check ?: Italian President breaks surrenders front COVID-19 epidemic .
Explanation: An old image of Brasilian President Jair Mesaias Bolsonaro has been used to make the false claim.

What fact-check ?: Viral video shows man great difficulty breathing . Even medical team keeps safe distance man . These videos shared patient suffering COVID-19 .
Explanation: Upon investigation, we found out that all three clips are from Indian State of Gujrat. The man seen in the clips is mentally unstable. Health Authorities from the state confirmed that the man does not have coronavirus infection.

What fact-check ?: Chain message warns accepting immunisation coronavirus ; says rather implanting COVID-19 said vaccine .
Explanation: The whole plot screams foul play! First, no news platform has published anything close, besides this, WHO has said there’s no vaccine yet for the virus. Also, a reverse image search proved that the claim-author manipulated one of the many images shared by health workers to encourage people to stay home during this trying time.

What fact-check ?: As per Home Ministry India , sharing information related coronavirus punishable offense .
Explanation: We found that there is no official named Ravi Nayak in MHA, India as claimed in the viral message. Also, there was no official notice on the website on MHA. It is evident from our fact check that the message viral on social media claiming to be from the Home Ministry of India is false.

What fact-check ?: Johns Hopkins University says fatality coronavirus Colombia third lowest world .
Explanation:
Neither Johns Hopkins University said that the fatality of COVID-19 in Colombia is the third lowest in the world nor the data that
excongressman Alfredo Rangel gave in his tweet is correct.

What fact-check ?: French professor Didier Raoult , big defensor chloroquine treatment , insulted ex-European MP Daniel Cohn-Bendit , Cohn-Bendit criticized scientific work .
Who said/posted it?: Twitter parodic account of Didier Raoult
Explanation: Professor Didier Raoult denied having insulted Cohn-Bendit on his real Twitter account.

What fact-check ?: The brazilian Health Surveillance Agency approved chloroquine/hydroxychloroquine treatment COVID-19 .
Explanation: Unlike what publications on social networks suggest, the release of chloroquine for the treatment of COVID-19 did not occur unrestrictedly. Nor did the guarantee come from Anvisa (Brazil's National Health Surveillance Agency). In fact, an information note from the brazilian Ministry of Health published on March 27 authorized the use of the drug and indicated its dosage only for hospitalized patients in serious condition. In other words, the standard of the ministry does not allow the drug to be sold in pharmacies or prescribed by doctors for any treatment against the disease resulting from the new coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Marathi newspaper reports conspiracy theory Coronavirus bioweapon .
Explanation: The conspiracy theory is actually picked up from a Reddit thread which hosts contests for fictional stories that are inspired from real events.

What fact-check ?: An image baby born deformities claims baby suffering Coronavirus .
Explanation: This image is of a still born baby suffering from anencephaly wherein the baby is born without parts of the brain/skull.

What fact-check ?: Two audio clips stating Mumbai police commissioner going enforce strict actions 21 day lockdown India spike cases March 27 , 2020 .
Explanation: Mumbai Police officials denied that this audio was of the city police commissioner. The voices in both the videos were different.

What fact-check ?: Says certain states banning sale alcohol .
Explanation: Claims that states are banning alcohol sales appear to have originated on a prank page.

What fact-check ?: “ We inherited broken test ” COVID-19 .
Explanation: There was no inherited test because a test couldn’t be created until the new virus had emerged.

What fact-check ?: A satellite map Royal Dutch Meteorology Institute ( KNMI ) showed lowered nitrogen levels since coronavirus crisis , would supposedly indicate nitrogen levels Netherlands unrelated Dutch agricultural sector .
Explanation: The satellite images only show nitrogenoxide levels (NOₓ) and leave out ammonia levels (NH₃), the compound which is responsible for the lion's share of nitrogen emission and is emitted predominantly by the agricultural sector.

What fact-check ?: Video shows re-opened wet market China .
Explanation: The video dates back to 2017 and recorded in Indonesia. Wet markets are currently closed down in Hubei.

What fact-check ?: Prof. Shenme Minzi Zanjan University told lemon cure helpful COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is no Zanjan University in China (it's in Iran), and no researcher named Shenme Minzi at all. Lemon contains vitamin C which is helpful to enpower the immune system but does not cure the disease.

What fact-check ?: A headline alleges first pregnant woman coronavirus gave birth Macedonia .
Explanation: The event did not happen in Macedonia, but in Serbia.

What fact-check ?: Iceland testing entire population .
Explanation: In Iceland, 3,5% of the population has been tested so far, according to the government. Iceland is doing a massive testing, with an average of 582 tests every day since mid-March. But even at this rate, it would take more than a year and a half to test all of the residents.

What fact-check ?: France needs tests population however Paris sent tests Algeria .
Explanation: A thousand tests have been sent to Algeria to slow the spread of the coronavirus epidemic. But it was the Institut Pasteur which sent them to the other establishments in its international network, and not the French state.

What fact-check ?: A set claims passed instructions followed COVID-19 Pandemic period .
Explanation: Some of the claims about COVID-19 are true. However, it contains factually incorrect claims such as drinking hot beverages can kill the novel coronavirus and coronavirus remains in throat and can be digested by the stomach if we intake enough fluids.

What fact-check ?: Restrictions transit ID-number due coronavirus .
Explanation: Even there are some restrictions and schedules to transit and buy, there are not by ID-numbers in Venezuela. Text in Whatsapp mixes measures from Colombia, Bolivia and Ecuador.

What fact-check ?: Srilanka 's KDU hospital dedicated treat VIP COVID19 patients .
Explanation: Hospital director, Chief Epidemiologist and Defence Secretary all refuted the claim and said the hospital is ready to admit any patient.

What fact-check ?: Post claiming Myanmar found COVID-19 treatment medicine called “ chlorofos ” , medicine treat malaria . The post also claims “ chlorofos ” one selected medicine treat COVID-19 WHO
Explanation: There is no evidence or recommendation from WHO for possible COVID-19 treatment using “chlorofos” but we found that “chloroquine” is used as a potential medicine in some countries. WHO has reiterated that there is no single medicine effective for curing COVID-19 as yet.

What fact-check ?: Inhalation hot steam kill Novel Coronavirus .
Explanation: Inhalation of steam from hot water does not kill COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Video shows Italian government/ Brisbane police used zombie robots/ drones chase citizen make stay home .
Explanation: The video was a prank scene filmed in 2016 in Brazil.

What fact-check ?: Video shows supermarket Louisiana breakdown : people plundering goods armed soldiers onsite .
Explanation: The video documented that Mexican people were robbing a supermarket to protest against the raise to gasoline in January 2017.

What fact-check ?: COVID-19 removed blow dryer nose pot boiling water .
Explanation: Home remedies to remove COVID-19 with a hair dryer or a pot with boiling water are false, dangerous and without any scientific basis.

What fact-check ?: Ronaldo Caiado , governor Brazilian state Goiás , beaten due lockdown decrees . A gallery photos `` prove '' .
Explanation: Pictures that support the claim were taken in 2013, and the man being kicked is just a lookalike.

What fact-check ?: Video shows suicide American man affected coronavirus .
Explanation: The video is from a suicide from 2015 of a 37 year old American man at Center City’s Embassy Suites Hotel in Philadelphia.

What fact-check ?: Myanmar president state counselor 14 days quarantine meeting COVID-19 patient Switzerland .
Explanation: State counselor addressed about the COVID-19 updates few hours the post is published. President office spoke person U Zaw Htay has also confirmed to media that both president and state counselor is not in quarantine.

What fact-check ?: UN giving humanitarian aid coronavirus emergency .
Explanation: UN is not delivering food aid. The message is a phishing scam.

What fact-check ?: Rubbing mustard oil nostrils prevent Coronavirus .
Explanation: Rubbing mustard oil cannot prevent coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: PM Modi announced internet suspension due viral fake news related COVID-19 .
Explanation: The news bulletin image is digitally edited. No announcement of Internet ban was announced by PM Modi.

What fact-check ?: Indian state Madhya Pradesh 's Goverement issued order shoot sight due failure lockdown implementation .
Explanation: No shoot at sight order was issued by Madhya Pradesh Govt., the State goverement have issued a clarification regarding this.

What fact-check ?: Home Ministry India issued order sharing news related Coronavirus punishable offense IT Act .
Explanation: The viral order is fake and was not issued by the Home Ministry of India.

What fact-check ?: Iranian child celebrity Anahita sufferenig COVID-19 .
Explanation: The family of the girl denied the claim on the girl's instagram account. the girl also appeared on a video 30/3/2020 and is appearing healthy.

What fact-check ?: The Government getting test detect COVID-19 company Genomica run sister former opposition minister .
Explanation: The Ministry of Health has acquired the Genomica tests and also those of Cestest, another Spanish company cited in the viral messages. None produces quick tests, but kits to do PCR tests.

What fact-check ?: Castilla La-Mancha prohibits use adapted diving masks patients COVID-19 .
Explanation: The Castilla-La Mancha Health Service ensures that its use "is left to the professionals' discretion".

What fact-check ?: Alleged resignation ministry health Costa Rica .
Explanation: "It is absolutely false", confirmed the Minister of Communication, Nancy Marín, to La Nación.

What fact-check ?: Costa Rica peak stage virus .
Explanation: Health authorities and experts explain that it is impossible to determine exactly when the maximum point of infections of the novel coronavirus will appear.

What fact-check ?: Sneezing spreads droplets far 8 meters , droplets stay suspended air 24 hours . The velocity sneezing 35 meters per second .
Explanation: How long the coronavirus survives in the air depends on temperature, humidity, and the level of ventilation of the environment. Although droplets can travel and suspend in the air for a long time, the virus doesn't.

What fact-check ?: According Mexican Health secretary , president Andrés Manuel López Obrador COVID-19 .
Explanation: The health secretary did not confirm that the president has COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Chewing betel nut prevent covid-19 infection .
Explanation: WHO has iterated that while some traditional medicines, western medicines, and home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence of a single medicine to prevent COVID-19 currently. WHO has confirmed that betel nut is carcinogenic.

What fact-check ?: Image narration claim huge number Muslims roaming Beruwala City Sri Lanka curfew risking lives many amidst COVID19
Explanation: The image was from a large Muslim procession held in March 2019.

What fact-check ?: French summer hollidays rescheduled end July .
Explanation: The original dates haven't been changed.

What fact-check ?: People italy dropping money streets COVID19 crisis .
Explanation: The original photo belongs to an old non valuable currency that has been replaced with a new one in Venezuela. the money on the street is from robbers of a bank after they realized that what they have stolen is useless currency.

What fact-check ?: Azan ( islamic prayer call ) said old mosque Granada first time 500 years COVID19 .
Explanation: The mosque in the video is in Balakan in Azerbaijan not Granada and the voice on the video belongs to the Iranian Mahdy Yarahi.

What fact-check ?: Video Funeral Corona Patients Italy Died .
Explanation: The video is an excerpt from a scene in the television series titled "Pandemic" which aired in 2007.

What fact-check ?: Inhaling Hot Steam Can Kill Corona Covid-19 Virus .
Explanation: This virus is in the body cells even though the entry is indeed droplet through the respiratory system. so it can't be cured by breathing hot steam

What fact-check ?: Amid coronavirus crisis , Italy ’ streets filled discarded printed cash seen photos circulating social media .
Explanation: The photos were taken in Venezuela, not Italy. The discarded banknotes were Bolivar Fuerte, Venezuela’s old currency.

What fact-check ?: The electromagnetic waves 5G penetrate cells weaken immune system .
Explanation: The Italian STOP 5G committees connect electromagnetic waves with the coronavirus. They use a Thomas Cowan video on Youtube video as evidence, but there is no evidence to prove the theory.

What fact-check ?: Breathing steam boiling citrus peels prevents cures coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no way to increase your body temperature to kill the coronavirus, according to the WHO. Nigerian medical experts agreed that there was no evidence for the video's claims.

What fact-check ?: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra getting beaten police lockdown stepping home .
Explanation: The man getting beaten up by police is not filmmaker Sudhir Mishra.

What fact-check ?: Air India operating evacuation flights bring back stranded Indians London .
Explanation: The Indian High Commission in London has denied the claim. There is no such immediate plan of evacuation.

What fact-check ?: Here 's new certificate Ministry Interior requesting citizens order leave house .
Explanation: The Italian police has said that it's not the original version of the certificate, but a manipulated version of it.

What fact-check ?: President Uhuru Kenyatta Kenya ordered credit reference bureaus delist Kenyans defaulted loans protect Kenyans economic effects Covid-19 .
Explanation: President Kenyatta ordered the suspension of new listings for Kenyan citizens and businesses as one of the measures in response to Covid-19.

What fact-check ?: A new alcohol-free sanitizer developed Dedan Kimathi University Kenya .
Explanation: The hand sanitizer developed by the Dedan Kimathi University actually contains alcohol.

What fact-check ?: Dr. Li Wenliang discovered coffee cure coronavirus .
Explanation: Dr Wenliang didn´t treat patients with covid-19 and there is no evidence of benefits of coffee or the contrary.

What fact-check ?: In Colombia , former Uribista congressman Alfredo Rangel wrote Twitter data attributed Johns Hopkins University SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus , causing current Covid-19 pandemic . In particular , said lethality `` Colombia third lowest world , Chile Germany '' added `` less 10 times Italy , 8 times Spain , 6 Iran 5 France ``
Explanation: The first part of the sentence is false, because it does not correspond to the data of the mentioned American institution. The second is questionable because, in most cases, the comparison was close to the data available at the time, but the academic authorities in the field consider that this type of analysis is premature.

What fact-check ?: Announcement social media according markets North Macedonia ( Ramstore Capitol , Ramstore Center , Tinex Dramski , Tinex Prvomajska ) workers infected coronavirus . Citizens also urged avoid markets .
Explanation: This is fake news that was soon denied by companies whose stores were on the list - Tinex and Ramstore.

What fact-check ?: To defeat coronavirus , China built thousand bed hospital 10 days , India prepared modern hospital 6370 beds overnight , low cost .
Explanation: A close study on the viral claim revealed that a 6370-bed hospital has not been constructed overnight in the country. Isolation wards have been made in some bogies of the country's first medical train Jeevan Rekha which was run in the year 1991.

What fact-check ?: Police India lashed sticks filmmaker Sudhir Mishra following rules lockdown .
Explanation: The viral video has been falsified based on the tweet made by Sudhir Mishra himself on the viral clip.

What fact-check ?: Video clip massive stadium converted graveyard claimed scenes Italy related ongoing COVID19 outbreak .
Explanation: Scene from movie “Flu 2013” portrayed as scenes from Italy.

What fact-check ?: WhatsApp group admins detained sharing coronavirus messages Dadar , Mumbai .
Explanation: Mumbai Police spokesperson rubbished the claim that Mumbai police's cyber cell was registering cases against 52 WhatsApp group admins and called it fake.

What fact-check ?: The lockdown due Coronavirus led reemergence large flock birds riverfront Ahmedabad .
Explanation: These birds are a regular site at the riverfront in Ahmedabad and the video has been shared with a false narrative.

What fact-check ?: India decided extend financial year July 1 due current COVID-19 outbreak .
Explanation: The Income Tax department tweeted that the financial year has not been extended and that this gazette was for the collection of stamp duty on security market instruments through stock exchanges and clearing corporations.

What fact-check ?: People Italy threw away money lost family members coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim along with the images is false. The images are old and are not related to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic in any way.

What fact-check ?: A message claimed electric company Spain offering 25 % discount customers coronavirus .
Explanation: Iberdrola, an electrical company in Spain, carried out a 25% discount campaign to a sector of its customers. The campaign existed but not for all its clients.

What fact-check ?: Muslim azan recited Granada , Spain , first time 500 years due outbreak .
Explanation: The video is from Azerbaijan and the voice belongs to Persian artist Mehdi Yarrahi. The video is manipulated.

What fact-check ?: Video carrier allegedly moving medical supplies Spain France .
Explanation: In a video, a trucker shows a warehouse with boxes and ensures that they have medical supplies, such as gloves, masks, and that they will be transported to France. The boxes that the transporter shows inside a truck show brand of paper sheets, Fabriano. Not sanitary material.

What fact-check ?: An email Caixabank ask people change data related account .
Explanation: An email allegedly sent by CaixaBank requesting account verification through a link in less than 24 hours to prevent unauthorized access. It is a case of phishing.

What fact-check ?: A publication affirms coronavirus created United States kill elderly people stop 5G development .
Explanation: A content published by the Kit Radio Internacional blog ensures that COVID-19 was created in a laboratory in Fort Detrick (Maryland, USA) to slow down the development of 5G technology and to kill older people. It's just another conspiracy theory.

What fact-check ?: A image 24-year-old doctor coronavirus killed .
Explanation: An image that says that doctor Francisco 'Paco' Pérez of the Hospital de La Paz in Madrid died at the age of 24 from the coronavirus accompanied by a photo of the porn actor Jordi 'el niño polla'.

What fact-check ?: A photo vicepresident Spain hospital allegadly visiting father sick coronavirus .
Explanation: The vice president of Spain, Pablo Iglesias, did not visit his father at the Hospital Clinico Universitario de Salamanca, who is neither ill nor admitted. The photo is not current.

What fact-check ?: A document talks benefits wine prevent coronavirus .
Explanation: The Spanish Federation of Oenology published on March 23 a statement about the coronavirus that helps better oral hygiene and that the virus does not survive in wine. No substance prevents the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Usefulness homemade chlorine wipes
Explanation: Chlorine or bleach is a disinfecting substance that can be used on surfaces but can damage the skin.

What fact-check ?: Sanitary proteccion supplies retained La Paz Hospital Madrid
Explanation: The hospital denies that they are retaining sanitary supplies, but they have donanted material that they can't use until it's checked.

What fact-check ?: There connection COVID-19 outbreak 5G technology .
Explanation: There is no proven connection between the viral infections and radio waves.

What fact-check ?: The maps shows cases provinces Turkey .
Explanation: The data does not show the local cases but calculated on proportionality to population in every provinces. Turkish authorities do not announce the local figures yet.

What fact-check ?: Video shows Muslim prayers White House , Washington DC , due outbreak .
Explanation: The video goes back to 2017, inaguaration ceremony of Mr. Trump.

What fact-check ?: Doctored image Donald Trump shared claiming asked people chant Hare Krishna Hare Rama .
Explanation: The claim is fake and the image is doctored.

What fact-check ?: Indian Actor Kamal Hassan put quarantine .
Explanation: Kamal Hassan and his party has issued an official statement saying there was a misunderstanding between officials as his daughter has self-isolated herself. It was presumed that Hassan had met his daughter in Mumbai. However, he did not meet his daughter and later the officials were also convinced about it and they removed quarantine poster from his wall.

What fact-check ?: Indian Police personel beaten person enforcing lockdown . Claim made image .
Explanation: The image is old and shared out of context to make a false claim.

What fact-check ?: Hindu God Ganesha 's idol placed worshiped inside Italian Church .
Explanation: It is an old video of celebration of a Hindu Festival called Ganeshotsav in a Spanish church which is shared with misleading context.

What fact-check ?: No deaths reported Israel due COVID-19 found cure disease . A solution hot water , baking soda lemon cure COVID-19 .
Explanation: There have been 15 deaths in Israel due to COVID-19 plus the solution of lemon, hot water and bicarbonate is not proven to cure COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Post claiming national-wide committee prevent , control , treat COVID-19 led Myanmar state counselor dissolved .
Explanation: The committee dissolved by the announcement made on 31st March from the president office is the central committee for prevention and treatment of COVID-19 led by a union minister, not the committee led by Myanmar state counselors.

What fact-check ?: The army patrolling streets , towns villages Ireland .
Explanation: New and unprecedented measures have been introduced to help curb the spread of the coronavirus, but the post false describes that those rules actually are. Police are patrolling parts of the country, but not all of it, and there are no plans at present for the army to patrol the streets.

What fact-check ?: The Irish Prime Minister/Taoiseach Leo Varadkar urged people use Houseparty video messaging app due security concerns .
Explanation: Prime Minister Leo Varadkar never said this. The tweet was doctored and is false. He did not say anything publicly about using Houseparty.

What fact-check ?: WHO 's general director stepped back said social isolation measure fight coronavirus .
Who said/posted it?: Facebook posts, sites and the Bolsonaro family
Explanation: In the speech highlighted by the posts, the executive warns, in fact, that governments should consider the social and economic impacts of confinement on the poorest population, but does not advocate the end or relaxation of these measures. The statement was made by Ghebreyesus in a press conference in March 30 and, since then, it has been used by profiles aligned to "bolsonarism" as evidence of a supposed retreat from WHO towards a position close to Jair Bolsonaro's opinion against social isolation.

What fact-check ?: Video shows empty Brazilian market cause shortage social isolation measures .
Explanation: The video, which have already been deleted by the Brazilian president, shows an unidentified man in front of the empty market complaining about the effects of the quarantine. The market (named Ceasa), however, is functioning normally, according to a note published on its webstie. According to the regional Association of Merchants, the misleading video was recorded on March 31 at a time when Ceasa was closed for cleaning.

What fact-check ?: Ron Johnson said Americans go back work , `` death unavoidable part life . ''
Explanation: A summary of Johnson’s USA TODAY guest column implied he was calling for a widespread return to work. That’s an exaggeration, since Johnson supports continued social distancing and some business closures. But Johnson did refer to death being unavoidable while noting the impacts a prolonged shutdown could have on employment and mental health.

What fact-check ?: Students America repeat grade next year .
Explanation: Stories about students having to repeat their grade originated on hoax sites.

What fact-check ?: A PSOL ( Brazilian left-wing oppositon party ) state representative arrested , heavily intoxicated , attending party COVID-19 lockdown Niterói , Rio de Janeiro .
Explanation: The story itself is true, but the man is a member of PSL, Bolsonaro's party until late 2019.

What fact-check ?: World Health Organization condemned lockdown measures COVID-19 .
Explanation: WHO did not condemn lockdown. During an interview, Tedros Adhanom Gheybresus acknowledge lockdown measures have serious economic impact, especially on the poor, but he did not say countries with epidemic focuses should abandon it.

What fact-check ?: Two men identified `` owner Carrefour '' supermarkets Brazil videos criticized lockdown measures .
Explanation: The largest shareholder of Carrefour holds less than 10% of the shares, so the company does not have a single owner. The men in the videos have no relationship whatsoever with the company.

What fact-check ?: The COVID-19 epidemic almost finished Netherlands . The government close single shop . Tweeted initially former Bolsonaro minister , Osmar Terra , March 31 .
Explanation: The COVID-19 epidemic is not anywhere near the end in the Netherlands, and the government did impose lockdown measures, although lighter than in neighbouring countries.

What fact-check ?: Former MP Bimal Rathnayaka made comment stating deceased Muslims COVID19 buried per customs cremated .
Explanation: Manipulated image to give the impression that MP Bimal Rathnayaka made a comment stating that deceased Muslims from COVID-19 should be buried as per their customs and not cremated.

What fact-check ?: Italians throwing money streets amidst COVID19 .
Explanation: This is an incident when a bank was looted in Venezuelan city of Mérida and old money notes had been scattered on the streets.

What fact-check ?: A 9 minute viral video woman claims India entered stage-3 COVID-19 . She claims husband employed major news channel information passed Dr.Gyani heads Indian Covid team asks people stock food , medicines baby food one month . She also cautions people Army deployed enforce strict lockdown upcoming days .
Explanation: Our investigation revealed that the claims made in the video are false and baseless. Dr. Gyani, an expert mentioned in the video as a source of the information, denied the claims and deemed the video as completely false. Also, the Indian government has already clarified that messages about Army deployment during the lockdown are false.

What fact-check ?: A tweet stated former mayor Madrid , Manuela Carmena , received respirator home ill COVID-19 .
Explanation: The former mayor of Madrid, Manuela Carmena, and the company accused of tweeting of delivering a respirator to her home denied that this was the case. She is neither ill nor received a respirator.

What fact-check ?: The flight chartered Korean people Korean government served Chinese people ?
Explanation: It turned out to be a chartered flight for Chinese people by a Chinese travel agency.

What fact-check ?: Video Muslims gathered roads despite curfew curb spread Coronavirus .
Explanation: The video is from Ahmedabad (Gujarat) and was taken in December 2019. So, the video is of an incident that took place prior to the announcement of lockdown in Gujarat.

What fact-check ?: People Italy throwing money streets felt money could n't save COVID-19 .
Explanation: The photos are not related to the recent COVID-19 outbreak. They were taken in Venezeula, not in Italy. Some people threw the notes as they became valueless due to hyperinflation in the country.

What fact-check ?: There old undocumented man `` remember anything '' hospitalized `` La Paz Hospital '' .
Explanation: The image was viralized in 2017 related with the same history, is not from now.

What fact-check ?: The video says Italian elderly 65 taken custody ; Spanish elderly asked leave home , violators sent concentration camp .
Explanation: The video documents the violent arresting action toward protesters, which was conducted by the police in Baku, Azerbaijan, on October 19, 2019.

What fact-check ?: Posts social media claim US patent novel coronavirus European one vaccine , citing specific patent numbers .
Explanation: This is false; the US number relates to an application about a different coronavirus, and the European number is for a patent aimed at a disease that afflicts poultry.

What fact-check ?: Facebook posts shared thousands times recommend various practices prevent COVID-19 , including gargling salt water , drinking tea avoiding ice cream .
Explanation: Health experts told AFP there is no evidence to support these claims and say washing your hands regularly is the best way to stay healthy.

What fact-check ?: The Houseparty app hacked .
Explanation: The company denies the claim and is offering a $1,000,000 bounty for the first individual who can prove this.

What fact-check ?: Lemon juice bicarbonate mixture prevents cures COVID-19 Israel .
Explanation: Lemon juice and bicarbonate tea has not been proven to affect COVID-19, and the virus has killed more than 30 in Israel.

What fact-check ?: Bulgarian mystic Baba Vanga predicted coronavirus outbreak .
Explanation: She didn't foretold such a thing. Media reports about the prophecy she told to her acquaintance were debunked.

What fact-check ?: Italian people throwing money , useless Covid-19 , street .
Explanation: Those pictures were taken in Venezuela, in 2019, after a bank robbery in Mérida city

What fact-check ?: This Harvard Professor Arrested Because He Created The Corona Virus .
Explanation: The three were arrested in three different cases and were not related to the coronavirus. Lieber was charged with lying about his participation in a program from the Chinese government and his affiliation with Wuhan University of Technology (WUT). Lieber is not a virus expert, nor does WUT focus on viruses.

What fact-check ?: Used Clothing This Video Comes Corona Patients China Who Have Died .
Explanation: Photos of clothes in plastic bags have been circulating since January 30, 2013, long before the outbreak of the Corona COVID-19 virus since December 2019.

What fact-check ?: Lidl supermarkets offering 250 euros worth food due new coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: It's fake. This is a phishing scam designed to steal users personnal data.

What fact-check ?: Ginger , onion garlic help coronavirus .
Explanation: WHO has long debunked popular rumors about coronavirus — including about ginger. It doesn't help against the virus. In General, no food product can protect you from the virus (!). and for some people, ginger is simply harmful. The mailing list about onions was translated using an automatic translator, apparently from Chinese. In fact, the onion does not have such properties.

What fact-check ?: Queen Elizabeth II infected new coronavirus .
Explanation: Buckingham Palace has only confirmed that Prince Charles is infected with COVID-19. There has never been an official announcement about the Queen.

What fact-check ?: Italians throwing money streets useless time Coronavirus scare .
Explanation: These are old pictures from Venezuela and have nothing to do with the COVID-19 pandemic

What fact-check ?: UV rays sunlight kill coronavirus .
Explanation: A concentrated form of UVC might kill COVID-19 but it is extremely harmful for human skin. Sunlight cannot kill COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Covid-19 airborne disease .
Explanation: The World Health Organization has stated that the disease is primarily spread by contact with infected persons and contaminated surfaces where the virus has settled, rather than through the air.

What fact-check ?: A letter Kenya 's Ministry Interior planning food distribution stating country would go three-week lockdown .
Explanation: A letter from Kenya's Ministry of Interior stating that the country would go into a three week lockdown is not legitimate.

What fact-check ?: Covid-19 spread warm countries .
Explanation: The letter cites unknown individuals, and claims that the virus that causes Covid-19 can be fought off by eating chillis and ginger. The letter also claims that the virus can be destroyed at temperatures of 26 to 28 degrees.

What fact-check ?: A video viewed thousands times Facebook posts alongside claim shows Sri Lankan doctor invented rapid test kit novel coronavirus , causes disease COVID-19 .
Explanation: The claim is false; the doctor seen in the video was being interviewed by an Australian television channel to discuss the benefits of rapid COVID-19 testing; the doctor told AFP he was not involved in the development of testing kits.

What fact-check ?: Two photos showing notes scattered street shared hundreds times Facebook YouTube alongside claim taken Italy novel coronavirus pandemic . The posts claim Italians thrown money homes symbolic gesture highlight money futile pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the photos have circulated online since at least March 2019 in reports about two separate incidents in Venezuela.

What fact-check ?: Medical masks 2 ways wear depending purpose : sick , put white side mouth fear infection , wear oppisite way .
Explanation: There is only one correct way to wear the medical masks: colored side on the outside.

What fact-check ?: Video shows Muslim prayers chuch Switzerland due outbreak .
Explanation: The video goes back to 2017, an interfaith peace event in Switzerland, Olten.

What fact-check ?: Italians bidding goodbye world coronavirus .
Explanation: The video dates back to November 2019 and has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic. It is actually from an anti-fascist protest held in Italy.

What fact-check ?: A group Muslim boys licking utensils spread coronavirus .
Explanation: The people seen in the video are Dawoodi Bohras, who are licking the utensils in an attempt to follow their belief of zero wastage of food.

What fact-check ?: Muslims Intentionally Licking The Cutlery And Plates spread COVID-19 .
Explanation: People shown in the video are of Dawoodi Bohra religion and people of these community do not waste food. That is why after eating, he lick all the utensils such as plate, spoon and bowl to ensure no food wastage and then wash the vessels.

What fact-check ?: People Italy thrown money roads outside saying money useless save death .
Explanation: The images doing rounds on social media are not from Italy but from Venezuela when the country was facing economic collapse in 2018.

What fact-check ?: A video going viral WhatsApp Sharechat claiming man woman video doctors treated 75 coronavirus patients infected .
Explanation: The claim associated with the video is false and misleading. They are not Italian doctors who treated 75 coronavirus patients and got infected but are actors from a Mexican television series called ‘Triunfo del Amor’.

What fact-check ?: Confidential studies Universities New York , USA states patients infected COVID-19 healed eucalyptus .
Explanation: There is no studies with scientific support about the cure of COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Bolivian education , Minister Victor Hugo Cárdenas , said : “ Students repeat school year ” .
Explanation: The image is edited, Victor Hugo Cardenas actually said: “The COVID-19 is going to affect our school calendar, let's wait that this interruption will be short and the classes can resume normaly to make the readjustment to the scholar calendar.

What fact-check ?: A video man , standing fresh food distribution center Contagem , Brazil , claiming shortage food Minas Gerais caused lockdown measures . He claims video shot March 31 . ] The video tweeted Jair Bolsonaro , , later , deleted .
Explanation: The video was staged. It was shot while the place was being cleaned, so all the food stalls were taken away.

What fact-check ?: As April 1st , coronavirus patients Blumenau , Brazil , cured .
Explanation: As of April 1st, there were 33 people still sick with COVID-19 in Blumenau.

What fact-check ?: An inmate released prison COVID-19 `` humanitarian house arrests '' arrested Campo Bom . Police officers found 100 kg cocaine house , several guns .
