Explanation: Campo Bom police officers did arrest a former inmate with 100 kg of cocaine in his house. His prior release had nothing to do with COVID-19. Actually, he had finished serving his term.

What fact-check ?: A table comparing COVID-19 stats countries impose lockdown countries n't .
Explanation: Although the numbers are accurate, some of the countries marked as "not on lockdown" are actually on lockdown. Also, the comparison ignores all other factors, including initial response and current stage.

What fact-check ?: João Doria , governor São Paulo , forbade doctors give chloroquine COVID-19 patients .
Explanation: Authorization for medication use in Brazil is not under state jurisdiction, but federal jurisdiction. Doctors are allowed to prescribe chloroquine for patients with severe cases of COVID-19 in Brazil since March 27. It is not different in São Paulo.

What fact-check ?: Cuba sent 200.000 doctors across world help nations fighting COVID-19 Pandemic .
Explanation: According to WHO and Cuban State Media, nearly 400,000 Cuban healthcare professionals working in 164 countries, out of them are only 50,000 doctors. Cuban government made this achievement in the past 50 years, not in a single year.

What fact-check ?: Images money thrown streets helpless Italians .
Explanation: Old image from Venezuela shared with false context.

What fact-check ?: Shopping malls crowded Italy pandemic .
Explanation: Old video from Brazil shared with false context

What fact-check ?: Indian Home Secretary warning post Coronavirus Whatsapp prosecuted except government agencies .
Explanation: The Government has clarified that the Whatsapp forward is fake.

What fact-check ?: Over 500 years Adhan ( The Islamic Call Prayer ) ban lifted Spain amid coronavirus .
Explanation: The claim is false. There was no ban in Spain on Adhan (The Islamic Call to Prayer) for over 500 years.

What fact-check ?: Indian State Kerala 's government paying news channels telecast CM 's interview .
Explanation: All these claims are raised by using some screenshots of sponsored posts in Asianet News fb page & some pics of CM's press meet which is broadcasted in different tv channels with a sponsored tag. But the fact is the sponsored program is not CM's press meet. That's a program called 'Naam Munnottu' to give awareness about the government's different projects and also to interact with the CM. The last episode was about Kerala's hard work to eradicate corona & for that they used a one minute portion from CM's press meet video. That pics was used in the fb post claiming gov giving money to channels to retelecast the press meet.

What fact-check ?: Actor Vijay donated 3 billion ( 300 crore ) rupees coronavirus relief .
Explanation: It is fake news claimed using a fake news card of Dinamalar news channel. The channel has denied broadcasting such news.

What fact-check ?: Government Indian state Madhya Pradesh ordered shoot-at-sight enforce lockdown .
Explanation: Our research revealed that a screenshot of a news channel report is circulating without context. MP government has not given any such order. MP government and Jabalpur police clarified it on Twitter.

What fact-check ?: An image doctor goes viral claim Dr. Usman Riyaz died treating coronavirus patients Delhi , India .
Explanation: he photo that has been gone viral is of Dr. Riyaz Usman from Dubai. He is alive and healthy. He does not work in Delhi. He has put out a Facebook post rubbishing the rumors of his death. We also found that one Dr. Osman Riyaz has died in Pakistan due to COVID-19. We also confirmed with Delhi Health Department that no doctor has been died due to coronavirus in Delhi.

What fact-check ?: People Italy throwing money road saddened fact money world could save dear ones .
Explanation: Our investigation revealed that the photos are from Venezuela. Last year, bank robbers had thrown the old banknotes on the road to make the point that the currency of the country was worthless. It has nothing to do with coronavirus

What fact-check ?: A post said coronavirus `` released Chinese Communist Party '' mixture HIV tuberculosis .
Explanation: There is no evidence that the coronavirus was created in a laboratory and it is proven that its incubation period is 14 days and not 27, as the text states.

What fact-check ?: A message offers food assistance people risk social exclusion Spain .
Explanation: A WhatsApp chain says that due to the coronavirus quarantine they are "granting the new food card bonuses" with "initial benefits of 550.65 ₤". It is phishing.

What fact-check ?: A message warning home thefts Spain quarantine delivering subpoenas .
Explanation: There is no alert of this type of theft in the National Police of Spain and it is a hoax that has been recycling since 2011.

What fact-check ?: Turning severe person coronavirus upside help survive .
Explanation: Turning coronavirus sufferers upside down is being done in hospitals, and there are studies supporting its efficacy, but more scientific evidence is lacking.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus spread fruits vegetables .
Explanation: There is currently no evidence that food is a source or route of transmission of the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Governors across U.S. announcing current school year repeated due coronavirus school closings .
Explanation: The posts are April Fool's jokes, created using a prank-generating website to make fake headlines.

What fact-check ?: Spraying boilling water eliminates coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence that proves that boiling water eliminates the new coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Hydroxychloroquine Azithromycin cure Covid-19 .
Explanation: There are hopeful trials but they are small, early and have methodological issues raised by experts. There is no controlled clinical trial. Some trials are ongoing.

What fact-check ?: A trucker assures video transports material France arrive Spain Government pay .
Explanation: The material that was sent to France was not for hospitals but office supplies.

What fact-check ?: The father Pablo Iglesias , vice-president Spain , hospitalized Clinical Hospital Salamanca , ( photo 2016 ) .
Explanation: The image is from 2016.

What fact-check ?: The former mayor Madrid , Manuela Carmena , received respirator home order avoid `` going public hospital '' .
Explanation: The mayor and the company that supplies the respirators denied it.

What fact-check ?: All communications citizens recorded government France .
Explanation: It's a message that already existed in 2017. Spread in several languages, in 20+ countries.

What fact-check ?: Covid-19 harmful common cold .
Explanation: There is numerous evidence that COVID-19 is much more dangerous than the common cold.

What fact-check ?: Video empty hospitals proof pandemic real .
Explanation: Hosiptal in Bologna confirms that the claim is false.

What fact-check ?: Christine Lagarde admits something must done old people living long .
Explanation: C. Lagarde has never made the statment that is being attributed to her.

What fact-check ?: Someone asking people use airconditioning hot weather heat kill coronavirus 2019 .
Explanation: WHO debunked this claim and said that hot weather and exposing yourself to sun will not protect you against COVID-19. the true part in his claim is that he said isolation in home is good in fighting COVID-19

What fact-check ?: Guatemala Secretary Economy shared video NYT praises management Guatemalan Governement COVID-19 crisis .
Explanation: We talked with the NYT PR department and they denied any relation with that video. The video was completely false.

What fact-check ?: For every click Italian song Rinascerò rinascerai , YouTube donates money hospital Bergamo .
Explanation: YouTube's normal revenue model is in effect for the song; no extra donations are made per click. The singer did declare to donate the song's full returns to the hospital.

What fact-check ?: Prince Charles recovery COVID-19 suspicious , proof vaccine already exists .
Explanation: If there was a vaccine, Prince Charles wouldn't have been sick in the first place.

What fact-check ?: Because school weeks due COVID-19 , french summer hollidays shorter year .
Explanation: This is an april fools joke. The dates haven't been changed.

What fact-check ?: You cure coronavirus lemon , garlic avocado pH level .
Explanation: There are several mistakes in the pH scale of the ingredients and there is no known cure.

What fact-check ?: Missouri students repeat school year COVID-19 school closings .
Explanation: The posts use a fabricated letter with a state logo to claim all students much repeat a grade because of school closings. State officials have publicly debunked the claim.

What fact-check ?: Videos show Chinese people spreading coronavirus countries .
Explanation: In the recordings, people appear spitting and rubbing contaminated fluids on benches, walls and elevators. Of the five recordings, Aos Fatos identified that three have nothing to do with the current pandemic. The other two sections did not have their origin or context identified.

What fact-check ?: President Giammattei gave instructions contradictory published law regarding COVID-19 mesures .
Explanation: The President´s instructions were contradictory to the published law, but the written law prevails, as experts explained us.

What fact-check ?: Trump got Moroccan shiekh ( muslim priest ) put spell prevent COVID19 .
Explanation: The original video is from President Trump meeting with religious leaders on National Day of Prayer in 1 september 2017.

What fact-check ?: 59 Church Congregation Africa Killed After Drinking Dettol Prevent Corona .
Explanation: A priest in South Africa, Rufus Phala, had indeed told his followers to drink Dettol as a cure. However, the incident occurred in 2016, long before the emergence of the Corona COVID-19 virus in December 2019. Photos used to disseminate the narrative have also been circulating since 2016. In addition, no credible sources were found containing information on the existence of 59 church members in Africa Selatan who died from drinking Dettol because recently asked by Rufus.

What fact-check ?: Soaking Sea Can Treat Corona Covid-19 Virus Infection .
Explanation: As with the nature of other viruses, the novel coronavirus attacks cells in the body, not the surface of the body like the skin, so it cannot be cured simply by soaking in the sea. Until now, according to WHO, there is no drug or vaccine to cure or prevent COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: By e-mail sent major newsrooms , Portuguese government announces cancellation great projects airports , due finantial restrictions caused impact coronavirus .
Link to the original piece: There is no link. It is an e-mail
Explanation: I's a fraudulent email that was not issued by the Portuguese government.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus causes male infertility .
Explanation: The publications refer to the report published on March 12 on the official website of the Hubei government and the study posted on the platform MedRxiv.org. The published report was not clinically investigated. A few hours later, it was removed from the government's website. Resource MedRxiv.org publishes articles that have not yet been accepted and/or approved by the scientific and / or medical community, may contain errors or incomplete information. To claim that the COVID-19 virus leads to male infertility, based on research not confirmed by the international medical community, is premature and erroneous.

What fact-check ?: Facebook posts shared thousands times feature video US officials talking reporters , captions claiming announcing arrest Chinese sci
Explanation: However, the footage has nothing to do with COVID-19 and scientists have refuted allegations the virus was deliberately created.

What fact-check ?: Italians threw away currency streets due COVID-19 deaths .
Explanation: The images are from Venezuela where vandals robbed a bank and threw the demonetised money on the streets.

What fact-check ?: UK , USA asked Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi lead task force tackle Coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no such task force that the Indian prime Minister is heading. The Indian prime minister has been a part of the G20 and SAARC summits for their discussions on coronavirus. The WION's reporting was misinterpreted.

What fact-check ?: Muslims licking plates spread coronavirus infect people virus .
Explanation: The video is from three years ago depicting a Dawoodi Bohri practice of licking the plate clean so as to prevent any food from being wasted before washing and is not linked to the coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: Coronavirus cause runny nose ; killed temperatures 26 degrees ; causes lung fibrosis within days infection ; diagnosed holding breath 10 seconds ; cured early stages drinking plenty water .
Who said/posted it?: Steven Aitchison on Change Your Thoughts Change Your Life
Explanation: Numerous claims circulating on social media tout untested diagnostic methods, preventions, treatments, and cures for COVID-19. While many of these are not harmful by themselves, they could potentially induce a false sense of security that causes individuals to ignore basic, tested precautionary measures such as frequent handwashing, disinfecting surfaces, avoiding touching the face, social distancing, and self-isolation when sick, which have all proven effective in slowing the spread of the pandemic.

What fact-check ?: The coronavirus “ released ” China [ ... ] purposely propagated Chinese .
Explanation: All available data indicate that SARS-CoV-2, the virus responsible for COVID-19, is of natural origin. Comparisons of viral genome sequences show that it shares a strong identity with similar coronaviruses that infect pangolins and bats. And further investigations of the SARS-CoV-2 genome suggest that the virus was not artificially created or propagated in laboratories. In the absence of evidence proving otherwise, the claim that SARS-CoV-2 was lab-created and intentionally released is not only unsubstantiated but also implausible.

What fact-check ?: Video shows EU flag lowered France protests outbreak policies .
Explanation: The video dates back to May, 2019 before the outbreak. The politician who lower the flag had already a far-right anti-EU thoughts.

What fact-check ?: People sneezing purposefully spread coronavirus Hazrat Nizamuddin mosque Delhi .
Explanation: The video has been available on the internet since long. It has no connection to coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Bill Gates wrote letter says coronavirus “ spiritual purpose ” “ great corrector ” .
Explanation: The viral letter is a hoax and has been falsely attributed to Bill Gates.

What fact-check ?: A blog site publication stated President Nigeria fired Chief Staff , appointing Ajimobi replacement .
Explanation: Not only is there no media report to corroborate this claim, but the presidency also debunked it.

What fact-check ?: A Spanish presenter shows video Italian television `` five years ago '' journalists Italian public channel RAI tell experiment virus . According report , experiment created coronavirus bats mice investigate effect type virus humans .
Explanation: The RAI video from five years ago discussing an experiment with bats and a coronavirus does exist, but is unrelated to SARS-CoV-2, the cause of the current Covid-19 epidemic.

What fact-check ?: PM Modi 2nd April '20 announced extension nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020 .
Explanation: PM Modi has not made any announcement for extension of nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020. The image is digitally edited.

What fact-check ?: Iberdrola , Spanish electricity provider , offers discount “ coronavirus ” .
Explanation: The company explained it was a discount for its users before the crisis.

What fact-check ?: Coffins people died coronavirus .
Explanation: The images were from Lampedusa.

What fact-check ?: Covid-19 pandemic used excuse put microchips babies .
Explanation: It's an old false claim, in circulation since 2014.

What fact-check ?: The Disaster Management Act 2005 going implemented India , according citizen allowed post update share forward related COVID-19 .
Explanation: There is no such restriction on citizens to share any news or updates about the COVID-19 situation, as long as it is not false information.

What fact-check ?: The United States `` recruiting '' doctors confront COVID-19 .
Explanation: The U.S. Embassy in Havana wishes to clarify that the US it is not recruiting foreign medical professionals to assist in the response to COVID-19. The announcement only covers individuals already approved and notified by the Department of Homeland Security

What fact-check ?: Image piles money scattered street text saying `` Italian people throwing money streets reminder money ca n't buy everything , exemplified COVID-19 pandemic ''
Explanation: Actually, the pictures were taken in Venezuela in 2019, after a bank robbery. The currency had changed and those bills were worthless

What fact-check ?: A businessman Brazil killed firing 223 employees due current crisis .
Explanation: The story happened in 2016. A businessman commited suicide after firing 223 employees. It is not clear whether this was the actual reason, since he was also being prosecuted for massive tax evasion.

What fact-check ?: While China built hospital 1 thousand people 10 days everyone cheered , Brazilian Army built field hospitals 2 thousand COVID-19 patients 48 hours , nobody cared .
Explanation: Since the beginning of the crisis, the Brazilian Army helped to build one field hospital in Roraima with 80 beds, not 2 thousand. It took more than 48 hours to build and it is still not open. The Army also started working on adapting a hangar to serve as a hospital for COVID-19 patients, but the expected capacity is 70 patients.

What fact-check ?: Posting anything coronavirus punishable offence Disaster Management Act implemented .
Explanation: As per the Disaster Management Act, there is no provision that mentions that apart from government departments, no other citizen can be allowed to talk, update or share any news related to a disaster.

What fact-check ?: Image herd deer sitting street interpreted different locations Sri Lanka India .
Explanation: Original image of the herd of deer on streets belong to an old incident in Nara, Japan.

What fact-check ?: Video Al-Aqsa mosque Israel allows photography inside .
Explanation: The video is not of Al-Aqsa in Jerusalem but Cave of the Patriarchs in Hebron.

What fact-check ?: Video kids Italy yelling stars assuming dead mother .
Explanation: It's an old video from El Salvador and has no connection with recent events in Italy.

What fact-check ?: Indian Home ministry declares posting COVID-19 WhatsApp groups punishable offence .
Explanation: Indian Home ministry have not issued any such message.

What fact-check ?: Picture Sao Paulo graveyard , prepared secretly Covid 19 victims Brazil government .
Explanation: The image is an old image from Manaus in Brazil and is unrelated to recent events due to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A viral video showcasing emergency treatment COVID-19 patient Maharasthra , Indian State . The video shared names different cities Maharashtra .
Explanation: Our investigation revealed that the video is of a mock-drill conducted at Jabhua city of Madhya Pradesh (different State). It was neither a real patient nor from Maharashtra.

What fact-check ?: Trupti Desai , well known social activist India , arrested illegally buying liquor Covid19 lockdown .
Explanation: The video shown with the above claim is 7-months-old. Trupti Desai was detained by the Pune police after she threatened to offer a garland of liquor bottles to then CM Devendra Fadnavis.

What fact-check ?: 18 nations , including US UK , want Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi leader task force combat coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: While India is actively participating in global efforts to mitigate the damage being caused by the coronavirus, the claim that Indian Prime Minister has been chosen to head a global task force on the same is absolutely false.

What fact-check ?: Social activist Trupati Desai caught illegally buying liquor lockdown detained police .
Explanation: The video is being circulated with a fake claim. It is actually an old video of Desai from September 2019. It shows social activist Trupati Desai being detained by police officials in Pune, after she threatened to garland Fadnavis with a necklace of liquor bottles. The video has nothing whatsoever to do with the lockdown.

What fact-check ?: A video shows truck dropping bodies covered plastic ditch claiming situation Italy right .
Explanation: The video which is being widely circulated on social media is not from Italy. It is a movie scene that had been taken from a 2007 US television miniseries 'Pandemic'.

What fact-check ?: A Whatsapp message offering food families Spanish charity Caritás donate .
Explanation: It's false. Caritas will not give 800,000 food aid to families. It is a case of phishing.

What fact-check ?: Publications claim Italian kids go street lockdown .
Explanation: Children cannot go for a walk in Italy during confinement. If it is allowed to accompany one of their parents to do certain tasks, such as shopping.

What fact-check ?: 5,000 kilos masks delivered Zaragoza customs closes 3:00 p.m .
Explanation: A news item from the Spanish media, Okdiario, stated that 5000 kilos of masks that were to arrive in Zaragoza did not enter because customs are closed since 3 in the afternoon. It was denied by the authorities and the package was delivered.

What fact-check ?: A video dead bodies black bags allegadly hospitals Madrid , Barcelona New York .
Explanation: The video is real but it was not taken in Spain or the United States. It was recorded at the IESS Los Ceibos General Hospital in Guayaquil, Ecuador.

What fact-check ?: Spanish hospitals injecting MMS COVID-19 patients cure .
Explanation: The Spanish Ministry of Health denies that MMS is being used in Spanish hospitals by injecting it into the vein against the coronavirus. MMS does not cure any disease.

What fact-check ?: The Sanytol brand sending email give away disinfecting wipes .
Explanation: Sanytol is not offering free samples of disinfecting wipes by email, it is a hoax and it is phishing.

What fact-check ?: Mariano Rajoy , Esperanza Aguirre Christine Lagarde said pensioners died world would save money .
Explanation: Neither the former president of Spain, the former president of Madrid or the former director of the International Monetary Fund have said that if pensioners died it would be a saving for the world economy.

What fact-check ?: Eucalyptus vapor kills coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no evidence that vaporizing reduces the risk or cures coronavirus infection. This is a virus that loves humidity.

What fact-check ?: Homemade masks prevent spread coronavirus .
Explanation: All physical barriers that we interpose between the virus and the respiratory tract (nose and mouth), could reduce the risk of contagion. However, they are not a sufficient measure to guarantee that the virus does not reach our body.

What fact-check ?: Security issues Zoom video call app
Explanation: Compilation of the security problems of the application for video calls such as data leaks.

What fact-check ?: A Whatsapp message allegadly chinese doctor CNN says coffee prevent coronavirus
Explanation: It is false that Dr. Li Wenliang would have recommended drinking coffee to prevent the spread of the coronavirus before dying, and that this recommendation would have been broadcast by CNN. However, there is no evidence that coffee prevents the coronavirus or that the television network has echoed this.

What fact-check ?: Portuguese authorities decided citizen goes work offcial authorization leave home .
Explanation: That´s not true. Portuguese government didn´t implement that measure.

What fact-check ?: If Russian people obey mandatory isolation imprisoned 5 years .
Explanation: It is true that Vladimir Putin implemented this measure, but the prison sentence can be up to seven years.

What fact-check ?: Hit-run deaths counted Covid-19 deaths São Paulo , Brazil .
Explanation: The accident mentioned in the posts actually occurred on March 1 on a road in Mogi Guaçu, a Brazilian city that has not yet registered cases of the new coronavirus. In addition, the death certificate displayed in the checked posts shows the surname "de Carvalho", when the victim was named "de Cruz".

What fact-check ?: Video shows trucks Brazil discarding food lost due isolation .
Explanation: The images were recorded on February 11, when, due to a heavy rain that flooded Ceagesp (market in São Paulo), marketers had to discard much of the merchandise.

What fact-check ?: Post involves video shows donations charities street markets go poor people Bolivia .
Who said/posted it?: fb Account: EMPLEOS Y TRABAJOS EN COCHABAMBA
Explanation: Actually this video is from Colombia. It could be revealed by the license plate.

What fact-check ?: Former President Bolivia Evo Morales : `` If I donate would Argentina , country given , since health services place live . ''
Explanation: The photo of the post has been manipulated. Seals and labels were falsified. The real image is from “C5N” from an interview that took place on November 15th, 2019.

What fact-check ?: Minister Presidency Bolivia , Yerko Nuñez , said : Government use savings Bolivian State take care health Bolivians .
Explanation: In the video of the interview, Yerko Nuñez spoke about the social measures to attend COVID-19, however, he did not say what he would use, I have also announced the enactment of Laws 1293 and 1294.

What fact-check ?: People Riberalta , Bolivia punished demanding food .
Who said/posted it?: Fb account: Ariel Alberto Ayaviri Diaz
Explanation: The photo is from Cordova, Colombia. The President, Iván Duque announced a measure that will punish people who break the quarantine

What fact-check ?: A voice note says government apply total lockdown two months .
Explanation: The voice note is false and government has not taken the decision.

What fact-check ?: Colombia last country coronavirus test ranking .
Explanation: Colombia is not the last country and the tweet is misleading.

What fact-check ?: In New York “ every contaminated corpse belongs state ” incinerated without “ wakes memorial services pay last respects . ”
Explanation: New York state is allowing funeral services with limited visitors; cremation is not mandated.

What fact-check ?: Drinking warm water continously prevent COVID19 . This Saudi Arabia discussing forbidding Ramadan fast , supposed start late April .
Explanation: There is no discussion about forbidding Ramadan fasting and WHO said that drinking water doesn't prevent COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Corona virus killed consuming alkaline foods .
Explanation: This claim cites research published in 1991, long before the coronavirus appeared in December 2019. Viruses, including the coronavirus, also have no pH. Therefore, consumption of alkaline foods with higher pH cannot kill the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Malaysians eating soap way cure covid-19 .
Explanation: Studies indicate eating soap could lead to digestive problems as it causes inflammation and pain in the gums,also Benjamin Chapman, professor and food safety specialist at North Carolina University claims that soap has been known for toxicity for 60 years.

What fact-check ?: A video shows woman infected Covid-19 spitting fruit alley supermarket arrested .
Explanation: The images used belong to two different videos that were not shooted in the same supermarket. There is no evidence that it is the same woman in both and that she is infected with COVID-19. That was not the reason for the arrestment.

What fact-check ?: The government raided The Medical City private hospitals , taking away personal protective equipment ( PPE ) .
Explanation: The Medical City, Pasig City police, and the Office of Civil Defense all denied the claim.

What fact-check ?: New York hospitals treating coronavirus patients vitamin C .
Explanation: There is no evidence that assuming doses of vitamin C cures COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Indian actor Shah Rukh Khan donated money Pakistan fight Coronavirus help India .
Explanation: Old video of Indian news channel India Today debunking claims that about Shah Rukh Khan donating funds to Pakistan in 2017 shared with a false narrative.

What fact-check ?: Beware food delivery apps India blow food packaging .
Explanation: The video is a 2019 video from another South East Asian country and not India.

What fact-check ?: News channel graphic stating Indian lockdown extended May 4 .
Explanation: The news bulletin was photoshopped.

What fact-check ?: An Indian social activist arrested tried buy liquor lockdown period .
Explanation: An older video of the said social activist was shared with a false narrative.

What fact-check ?: Pope Francis kissed feet “ black people '' asked forgiveness novel coronavirus scare .
Explanation: The viral video is one-year-old and has no relation to novel coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A man Serbia broke curfew putting tree costume .
Explanation: The video dates back to 2016, Portland, US. The man in the video was an artist and arrested for interruğting the traffic.

What fact-check ?: An orangutan US started wash hands imitating keeper .
Explanation: The video dates back to November, 2019 before the outbreak. Primats can imitate humans.

What fact-check ?: This voice record circulating Turkey based Johns Hopkings University research .
Explanation: Johns Hopkings University denies the research and there is no such a paper in the database. The multiple allegations in the voice record are generally not based on scientific evidence nor the methodology.

What fact-check ?: Video shows demolished 5G stations Hong Kong , protestors held 5G responsible COVID-19 .
Explanation: The video dates back to summer 2019, the protests in Hong Kong. The protestors were demolishing face recognition cameras, not 5G stations.

What fact-check ?: The pandemic foreseen Madonna 's 2019 album cover .
Explanation: Corona is an classic typewriter brand and the version can be seen on the cover has been produced more than a century in the US. Nothing to do with the outbreak.

What fact-check ?: Photo shows last meeting Turkish doctor died due Covid-19 child Munich .
Explanation: The photo belongs to an American doctor with his son and he is still alive.

What fact-check ?: The viral post claims Aajtak news channel shows lockdown withdrawn places India Today news channel shows extended till May 4 .
Explanation: The lockdown is neither extended nor withdrawn at any location. News channel logos are used to create fake photos.

What fact-check ?: Disaster management act implemented , citizen allowed post update coronavirus .
Explanation: The message is misleading and the viral video two years old.

What fact-check ?: A video orangutan washing hands viewed millions times Facebook , Twitter YouTube posts claim animal imitating zookeepers novel coronavirus pandemic .
Explanation: The claim is false; the video of the orangutan has circulated in reports since at least November 2019, weeks before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December 2019.

What fact-check ?: This pictures shows two people seen going around pretending give protective masks people need . Be careful , 're thieves healthcare personnel .
Explanation: These two individuals have nothing to do with Italy or COVID-19. The pictures come from the police of Dusseldorf (Germany), and they've been taken on December 2019.

What fact-check ?: Ansa news reported former ECB Governor Mario Draghi lead Italian task-force Covid-19 .
Explanation: The Italian police has said that it's not the original version of the certificate, but a manipulated version of it.

What fact-check ?: The French governement authorised euthanasia old people suffering covid-19 new decree .
Explanation: The new decree changes the granting procedure of "Rivotril", a medicine which aim is to improve the palliative care of patients suffering in french nursing homes EHPAD. It is used to alleviate their pain - but not in any case to end up their lives.

What fact-check ?: `` Virus shut necklace '' effective prevention virus causes COVID19 infection .
Explanation: U.S EPA has announced that it is an unregistered product that safety and efficacy against virus has not been evaluated. Dr. Ariane Davison, a virologist and immunologist, has stated that the product will not be effective in preventing COVID-19 virus.

What fact-check ?: Myanmar health minister mentions vaccine covid-19 found .
Explanation: There is no evidence of the health minister saying a covid-19 vaccine was found. WHO has said that there is no single medicine effective to prevent or cure covid-19.

What fact-check ?: `` Dramatic : The infected Italy dying street . '' The publication accompanied photo .
Explanation: The image was not captured in Italy. It was taken on Thursday, March 30, on a street in the ground zero of the new Coronavirus, in Wuhan, China.

What fact-check ?: A social media network invites alleged aid groceries supply homes mandatory isolation seeks mitigate impact Covid-19 pandemic country .
Explanation: It really is a scam to steal personal data of those who fall for this disinformation.

What fact-check ?: `` President Duque uses State helicopter fly Colombia priest bless territory Virgin Mary Blessed Sacrament . Amen # GrandeMiPresidente ” .
Explanation: The experts we consulted concluded that the viral video aircraft is a civil helicopter.

What fact-check ?: Ghana 307 ambulances mobile ventilators .
Explanation: Despite the fact that the claim made by the Presdential advisor on health is rated Mostly True. Mobile/portable ventilators are supposed to be complemented by critical care ventilators and one cannot be spoken of in isolation.

What fact-check ?: Buring candles increase temperature turn kill coronavirus .
Explanation: First, it is not possible to gauge the rise in temperature because of lighting candles until we know the candles’ dimensions. Second, there is no evidence that heat can kill coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A Facebook user uploaded video showing man inside police van spitting cop . The post claimed video proof Tablighi community spreading coronavirus India .
Explanation: The video viral on social media in the backdrop of the Nizamuddin Markaz incident is misleading. The video has no connection with the ongoing novel coronavirus Pandemic.A 26-year-old undertrial allegedly attacked a few policemen for not allowing him to have home-cooked food brought by his family.

What fact-check ?: Google donated 59 billion ( 5900 crores ) rupees fight coronavirus India .
Explanation: Google has not donated directly anything to India but to US. Alphabet and Google CEO Sundar Pichai has announced the company will provide over $800 million to support small and medium businesses (SMBs), health organisations, governments and health workers on the frontline of global COVID-19 pandemic.

What fact-check ?: In Bolivia , street-selling child expelled selling spot ( street ) municipal guards . They threat take products away , quarantine times .
Explanation: This happened in La Paz, Bolivia, the story was covered by the newspaper Pagina Siete on February 6th 2019.

What fact-check ?: Ruth Mari Calderon Academy John Maxwell Bolivia shares information unknown cures Covid-19 .
Who said/posted it?: Fb account: Cherry News;  Ruth Mari Calderón
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence in the OMS to support the information about the cures she has been discussing.

What fact-check ?: Coffee cures coronavirus .
Explanation: There is not scientific evidence to prove that coffee cures coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A picture Tiago Leifert , host Big Brother Brazil , group Globo employees restaurant . The caption states Globo advocates lockdown , employees hanging fancy restaurants COVID-19 epidemic .
Explanation: The picture was published by Leifert on his Instagram account in 2019. There's a banner on the background that says BBB 19 (Big Brother Brazil 19).

What fact-check ?: “ Joe Exotic tests positive coronavirus prison . It ’ confirmed . ”
Explanation: Joe Maldonado-Passage, aka Joe Exotic, is on quarantine after transferring from a prison where other inmates tested positive for COVID-19. There has been no official confirmation that he has the disease.

What fact-check ?: Says “ 5G LAW PASSED everyone distracted ” coronavirus pandemic lists 20 symptoms associated 5G exposure .
Explanation: President Donald Trump signed a law March 23 that tasks the federal government with securing 5G data networks. It does not explicitly provide for the installation of more cell towers. Misinformation about the health effects of 5G can be traced to a 2019 propaganda campaign promoted by Russian state television.

What fact-check ?: The government Paraíba , state Brazil , received 11.6 million brazilian reais federal government spend healthcare COVID-19 crisis . Instead , money spent artistic performances .
Explanation: While Paraíba did receive the 11.6 million Brazilian reais, most the money has been transfered to municipal authorities for COVID-19 prevention measures. The rest, around 2% of the money, is being used by the state health department to fund its own COVID-19 related expenses. Meanwhile, two state funded cultural agencies started a project to support live artistic performances online during the lockdown. 160 thousand Brazilian reais will be spent with that. The government transfer and the cultural actions are not related.

What fact-check ?: Says otherwise healthy people “ experiencing mild moderate respiratory symptoms without COVID-19 diagnosis … high temperatures kill virus , let fever run high , ” 103 104 degrees .
Explanation: A fever makes it harder for some viruses to survive, but it’s not yet known whether that’s true for the novel coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Pictures reports “ empty hospitals ” prove COVID-19 spread “ fake crisis real government planned agendas . ”
Explanation: There are hospitals with significant numbers of empty beds — but not because of a conspiracy that exaggerates the coronavirus outbreak.

What fact-check ?: “ There effort ” get American experts China announced coronavirus , “ one person in-country ( Trump ) pulled country . ”
Explanation: Top Health and Human Services officials offered to send American experts to China within a week after China revealed a new virus was on the loose. China resisted American and World Health Organization teams, but eventually allowed a WHO team —that included some Americans — to enter the country.

What fact-check ?: Says Nancy Pelosi ’ “ daughter board Kennedy Center ’ important send money . ”
Explanation: None of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s children is on the Kennedy Center’s board. Pelosi is an ex-officio board member. So are several top Republican lawmakers.

What fact-check ?: “ In Chicago , Covid-19 actually LOWERED death rate . ”
Explanation: Deaths in Chicago increased in March 2020 compared to previous years, despite a decline in murders.

What fact-check ?: “ This lady applied sanitizer hands/forearms & went kitchen cook . The moment turned gas stove , hands caught fire due alcohol contained sanitizer . ”
Explanation: This Facebook post has the ingredients of a hoax. We could not find the original photo through reverse image searching, and we found no news reports about it. Hand sanitizer is flammable because of its alcohol content. But the fire risks are low when the product is applied properly and given time to dry.

What fact-check ?: “ We slow testing , quick travel ban . And 's much critical saving lives . ”
Explanation: Travel restrictions can buy a government some time in stopping viral spread. But with that time, research shows, authorities need to put a dent in local transmission – by testing robustly, and then quarantining people who are positive.

What fact-check ?: Says U.S. developing “ antivirus ” includes chip track movement .
Explanation: This is a hoax. There is no “antivirus” or vaccine being developed that includes a chip to track movements.

What fact-check ?: Photo Money Wasted Italians Middle Corona Pandemic .
Explanation: The photo was taken in Venezuela in March 2019 where there was a bank that was looted, then the perpetrators spread the old Venezuelan money, Bolivar Fuerte, on the streets and burn it.

What fact-check ?: Corona Virus Form Successfully Photographed Indian Scientists .
Explanation: The photo is an illustration of a virus and bacteria attached to the hand. The photo was posted on the Shutterstock website on June 15, 2015, long before the coronavirus first appeared in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.

What fact-check ?: In backdrop lockdown , videos wild animals taking roads surfacing internet . Among , set pictures herd Deers rounds social media claiming pictures Lake Club , Chandigarh .
Explanation: The viral images are not from Chandigarh but from Sanjay Gandhi National Park in Borivali, Mumbai.

What fact-check ?: There plenty mortuary bags Lenox Hills Hospital NY .
Who said/posted it?: El nuevo diario dominicano, and many Twitter accounts
Explanation: There are three parts in the video. Two were indeed filmed near/in Lenox Hill Hospital in Manhattan. But the main one, with dozens of mortuary bags, comes from Ecuador (Guayaquil).

What fact-check ?: Indian Social Activist Trupti Desai arrested buying liquor Covid 19 lockdown .
Explanation: The video is old and unrelated to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Tabligi Jamat members India licking plates spread COVID-19 .
Explanation: This is an old and unrelated video, People shown in the video are of Dawoodi Bohra religion and people of these community do not waste food. That is why after eating, he lick all the utensils such as plate, spoon and bowl to ensure no food wastage and then wash the vessels.

What fact-check ?: Indian State Gujarat 's government constructed hospital COVID-19 patients 2200 beds 6 days .
Explanation: Gujarat government has set up 2200 beds in 4 different hospitals in 4 cities as opposed to claim. The Gujarat state government has not constructed one hospital with capacity of 2200 beds in 6 days.

What fact-check ?: Lockdown India extended till May 8th .
Explanation: The screenshot shared to make the claim is edited. Government has confirmed that the news is fake.

What fact-check ?: Italians throw money streets .
Explanation: The photo has nothing to do with Italy. The photos were taken in Venezuela and published on March 11, 2019. Hooded men robbed the oldest Bank in Merida and scattered bolivars (the currency of Venezuela), which had lost value as a result of hyperinflation, through the streets.

What fact-check ?: Davao City Mayor Sara Duterte said local government units ( LGUs ) blamed P200-billion cash assistance reached constituents .
Explanation: The statement did not come from Sara Duterte nor did it reflect her views about federalism and the national government's response to the coronavirus crisis.

What fact-check ?: Man spitting police officer spread COVID-19 India .
Explanation: An older video of an under trial spitting on a cop as he was denied home cooked food was falsely shared as being related to COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Rotis hailing PM Modi shared Madhya Pradesh , India lockdown .
Explanation: The rotis were distributed in 2014 and are not related to the recent COVID-19 outbreak.

What fact-check ?: A video purporting attack doctors avenged police men .
Explanation: A set of doctors were attacked in India when they went about collecting samples for COVID-19. This video is not a revenge by policemen for the same and is not linked to coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Lemon bicarbonate tea green tea treat prevent coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no scientific evidence stating that any kind of tea impacts the spread or growth of the novel coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: People querantione singing Kurdish song balconies Diyarbakır .
Explanation: The video is from İtaly, Sicilia. The Kurdish song was added to the original video.

What fact-check ?: The text claims : `` Russian doctors Lombardy encountered mystery - people died coronavirus , strange way . ''
Explanation: In fact, they are elderly people in a nursing home in San Lorenzo, Gromo, who died in their sleep.

What fact-check ?: A video starring Andreas Ludwig Kalcher claims German scientist cure coronavirus denounces censorship .
Explanation: There is no evidence that MMS or CDS works against COVID-19. MMS is a toxic and corrosive product of which there are documented cases of serious kidney damage in case of overdose.

What fact-check ?: A blog published report claiming Nigerian President ’ Chief Staff dead ; naming source Dr Kemi Olunloye .
Explanation: No credible media platforms have published this news. More so, the author referenced a tweet by one Dr Kemi who made no mention of the President’s Chief of Staff. She rather suggested that a “high ranking member of the president’s cabinet” was dead.

What fact-check ?: A WhatsApp message claims Decree Law 6/2020 March 10 modified , allowing nature outings constitute agglomeration people .
Explanation: This is a joke. The content is accompanied by a link that, when opened, leads us to an image of a gorilla.

What fact-check ?: Adidas donating shoes campaign coronavirus .
Explanation: On the website that impersonates Adidas, the URL redirects you to a supposed Chrome extension that has nothing to do with donating shoes for the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A video Bill Ryan claiming China would attacked biological weapons .
Explanation: There is no evidence that the novel coronavirus was created by humans. The video was recorded in 2010.

What fact-check ?: Pedro Sánchez , President Spain , spies King rumor hits Moncloa : Don Felipe , King Spain , talks changing Government .
Explanation: The king could not "change the Government" without being endorsed by the Prime Minister or Congress.

What fact-check ?: A message broadcasts link allegedly request food aid coronavirus quarantine .
Explanation: The website that is accessed does not offer that possibility but they have sponsored searches with which they earn money if we click on them.

What fact-check ?: Bitcoin ads uses familiar faces scam people .
Explanation: The ads use photos of famous people with messages like "he has become so rich that he has stopped working. With this method you can also do it". Do not click on the ad.

What fact-check ?: Dozens dead bodies stacked Lenox Hill Hospital NYC , media n't want show tragic image pandemic .
Explanation: Even if you can see the outside of an hospital in NYC during the first seconds of the video, the second part with the bodies is recorded shows an hospital of Guyaquil, Ecuador.

What fact-check ?: Images bruised youth claimed marks got police beaten Colombo curfew violations
Explanation: Original image belongs to a domestic violence incident from July 2019 in West Bengal, India.

What fact-check ?: A video showing group people protesting `` government thieves '' throw bags food floor broadcast social media message Venezuelan migrants Colombia .
Explanation: The images are of a protest in the Dominican Republic against the markets delivered by the government of that country in the coronavirus crisis (Covid-19).

What fact-check ?: Pandemics occur every 100 years . It called new world order . They reduce world population . It happens every 100 years .
Explanation: This theory, in addition to being based on dates and wrong data, leaves out many other diseases that plagued the world.

What fact-check ?: A viral video purportedly Italy shows child crying mother died due Coronavirus .
Explanation: Our investigation revealed that the video is not from Italy. It is from El Salvador and the mother of the child had died in a bus accident.

What fact-check ?: Stones hurled police Gomatipur , Ahmedabad ( India ) went search suspects attended Nizamuddin Markaz event Delhi .
Explanation: The police commissioner of Ahmedabad has clarified that the police were attacked while they were enforcing lockdown. Police were not searching attendees of the Nizamuddin Markaz event.

What fact-check ?: A picture queue Bom Prato ( chain state run popular restaurants offers low cost meals poor people São Paulo ) . The caption states João Dória , São Paulo governor , opened restaurants allowed agglomeration , , time , forbade regular restaurant open .
Explanation: The picture was published on January 2019. While Doria did open the Bom Prato restaurants, people are only allowed to take away their food. The same rule applies to regular restaurants.

What fact-check ?: Two WhatsApp audio files claim gangs roughly 30 drug addicts looting shops terrorizing workers central São Paulo COVID-19 lockdown .
Explanation: These crimes have not been registered by São Paulo state police. Locals claim not to have seen anything that has been described in the audio file.

What fact-check ?: A video confrontation drug users `` crackland '' , run part central São Paulo , municipal guard . In caption , stated happening city lockdown
Explanation: The video is from November 2019, not related to the COVID-19 lockdown.

What fact-check ?: Image showing Indian Political party ( DMK ) workers demonstrating Go Corona Back balloon .
Explanation: The image of the balloon is edited to add "Corona" instead of "P.M Modi" and Its an old image.

What fact-check ?: Amid COVID19 Lockdown Food distributed Indian State Tamil Nadu .
Explanation: It's an old image from Gambia (West Africa)

What fact-check ?: A Whatsapp forward claiming calls recorded Indian government ..
Explanation: The message is not from the government, Assam police has clarified it via their Twitter handle.

What fact-check ?: Video man committed suicide US due COVID-19
Explanation: It's an old video from Ghana. It has got nothing to do with COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: Photo Italian doctor waving goodbye co-doctors die due coronavirus .
Explanation: The viral photo was taken at a hospital in China's Wuhan when the team of doctors was treating a COVID-19 patient.

What fact-check ?: A video shows dead bodies taken away convoy cars hospital Iran .
Explanation: The viral video doing rounds on social media claiming that this is a scene outside a hospital in Iran due to the novel coronavirus is false. The viral video is of a funeral procession for pilgrims who died during Hajj in 2019.

What fact-check ?: A video shared various social media platforms WhatsApp groups person allegedly infected COVID-19 seen lying unconscious ground shaking violently .
Explanation: According to the testimony of a doctor working in the hospital, the person shown in the video is not infected with the COVID-19 but epilepsy attack, it can be concluded that the video is being shared with a ‘Misleading’ claim.

What fact-check ?: Muslim youth spreading COVID-19 licking plates Nizzamuddin Markaz India .
Explanation: The video is 2 years old. and the people in the video belongs to Dawoodi Bohra society. In their tradition dishes are washed only after eating and licking the utensils. This is done so that no food grains are wasted.

What fact-check ?: `` WORLD HEALTH ORGANISATION PROTOCOL & PROCEDURE OF LOCKDOWN PERIODS FOR CONTROLLING ON MOST DANGEROUS VIRUS : STEP 1 - 1 DAY . STEP 2- 21 DAYS . AFTER 5 DAYS . STEP 3- 28 DAYS . AFTER 5 DAYS . STEP 4 - 15 DAYS . ''
Explanation: Nowhere has the WHO spoken of the process of phased lockdown to fight the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: An alleged newspaper publication claims Spanish far-right party , VOX , asks care homosexuals sick COVID-19 .
Explanation: The political party, Vox, has not made this proposal nor is it a real content from the newspaper El País: it is a montage, as its author has acknowledged.

What fact-check ?: The Spanish political party , Vox , assures government hiding images hundreds coffins parking lot .
Explanation: The government is not hiding the images of coffins. They were recorded by the news agency, EFE, and broadcast on Spanish national television.

What fact-check ?: Barack Obama urged Africans reject Covid-19 vaccine produced United States Europe .
Explanation: While there are posts on Barack Obama's social media profiles about Covid-19, he has not stated any of the claims posted alongside his image urging Africans to reject any vaccines against the disease.

What fact-check ?: Using drug ivermectin cures coronavirus within 48 hours .
Explanation: The finding has been made by Australian scientists. Although the results are promising, the research is in very preliminary stages, so it is not yet possible to draw solid conclusions.

What fact-check ?: A video woman identifies Isabel Bellostas Escudero , alleged `` doctor '' `` pediatric researcher '' recommends consumption vitamin C prevent coronavirus .
Explanation: There is no evidence that vitamin C prevents the coronavirus. The alleged doctor was disqualified by the Madrid Medical College for spreading that vaccines cause autism.

What fact-check ?: Sri Lankan President donates 7 months ’ salary COVID19 Fund .
Explanation: President Media refuted this claim. He had made arrangements to allocate LKR 100 million when the COVID19 fund was initiated.

What fact-check ?: Ten point bulletin message purported President Gotabaya followed COVID19 outbreak .
Explanation: Fake message circulated under the President Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s name via messenger platforms. President Media refuted the claim and published an advisory on official President social media channels stating not to believe in similar claims

What fact-check ?: After revision , São Paulo state registers 26 deaths COVID-19 .
Explanation: The posts are misleading in treating two different sets of data as if they were the same thing: the diagnosis of suspected deaths in April 3 and the total number of deaths from the novel coronavirus confirmed in the state.

What fact-check ?: A video shows man claiming Tablighi Jamaat ( Muslim group ) spitting police putting quarantine .
Explanation: The viral video is old and has nothing to with recent coronavirus pandemic. The alleged man was not a member of Tablighi Jamaat. It was being shared out of context to create communal disharmony.

What fact-check ?: A video showing playful deer beach claimed Indian village lockdown .
Explanation: Our investigation revealed that the video is 5-year-old and was taken in France.

What fact-check ?: A viral video showing men assaulting policeman shared claim Agripada , Mumbai ( INDIA ) .
Explanation: Our investigation revealed that the video is from Banglore, not Mumbai. Two men were arrested for attacking two constables after they were stopped for breaching a check post set up to implement the lockdown in Sanjay Nagar of Banglore.

What fact-check ?: A viral video apparently showing Muslim devotees sneezing circulated claim Nizamuddin mosque Delhi deliberately trying get infected order spread coronavirus India .
Explanation: The video shows an age-old Sufi ritual called Dhikr (Zikr). It is a kind of prayer/meditation in which followers of Sufism remember their god while breathing heavily. The video is available on the internet for the past few months. It has nothing to do with Nizamudding Mosque or coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Sri Lankan police made announcement stating citizens allowed post update share forward related Coronavirus punishable offence .
Explanation: All these messages are not authentic. Sri Lanka Police Media spokesman and President Media refused all these claims to be false.

What fact-check ?: A decree allows euthanisia dependant senior homes passed France .
Explanation: The decree approves the use of a sedative outside hospitals but euthanasia is still forbidden by law.

What fact-check ?: Ministry Health blocked respirators Seat producing Spain .
Explanation: Union sources in Seat explain that the Health Ministry requested some final tests to avoid interference of these products with other ICU devices before their mass production.

What fact-check ?: Government media hides death coffins parking Spain .
Explanation: The images were shown on national tv and talked about in the media.

What fact-check ?: A message claims need sterilize products hair dryer
Explanation: Several supermarkets deny having sent this message.

What fact-check ?: News COVID-19 shared seeking government 's permission .
Explanation: The Indian government had reached out to the Supreme Court that had turned down the government's appeal stating that media and news houses should be more focused and spread verified news about the virus.

What fact-check ?: The World Health Organization prescribed lockdown strategy tackle COVID-19 India following .
Explanation: The much shared protocol is from a Cambridge study that forecasts the best possible ways to tackle the coronavirus epidemic and is not shared by the World Health Organization.

What fact-check ?: Dr. Charles Lieber , Harvard professor , arrested creating coronavirus selling China .
Explanation: Dr Charles Lieber was arrested by US authorities for concealing Chinese funding. This arrest has no connection to coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: Brazilians observed Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi 's `` lights '' call .
Explanation: The viral video was available on Internet even days before PM Modi's April 3 speech. So the viral claim is misleading.

What fact-check ?: WHO released “ protocols procedures ” lockdown periods fight Covid-19 .
Explanation: WHO has not released any such protocol for lockdown periods.

What fact-check ?: This video Conress leaders Rahul Priyanka Gandhi breaking coronavirus lockdown stepping .
Explanation: The viral video is four months old and has no connection to coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: There cases infection Beijing . The epidemic create problems Chinese economy . This proves new coronavirus biological weapon Chinese destroy world .
Explanation: Official Chinese data show cases of infections in Beijing and other cities in China. The epidemic created problems for the Chinese economy. There is no evidence that the virus is a biological weapon.

What fact-check ?: Heineken beer giving four kegs beer free people stay home .
Explanation: It is a hoax: Heineken denies that it is a draw of its own and is not an official page of the company.

What fact-check ?: A screen capture cover The New York Times accompanied text assured said newspaper would branded Government Spain `` communist '' .
Explanation: There is no evidence that this is the case. The New York Times denied it, and we have not found any of its content in which that reference is made.

What fact-check ?: Images alleged fire New York 's Lebanon Hospital .
Explanation: The video is of a fire that razed the top floor of a Bronx, New York apartment building on March 31.

What fact-check ?: A video deer sea recorded state alarm decree Spain .
Explanation: The deer images were already uploaded to YouTube in 2015, so it is not true that they were recorded in Matalascañas, Spain during the state of alarm.

What fact-check ?: A Image shows virus air looks like advanced microscope .
Explanation: The electron microscope can only capture monochromatic, two-dimensions-images; thus, the COVID-19 can not be seen in 3D and colorful under the electron microscope as the image circulating online. Plus, the buildings and the viruses are not proportional to each other in the picture.

What fact-check ?: On WhatsApp , Facebook Twitter , text presented presented translation Spanish editorial The Washington Post Desmond Brown , states : 'EITHER WILD CAPITALISM DIES , OR HUMAN CIVILIZATION DIES ' .
Explanation: As we could verify, neither this text nor any similar text has been published by the Washington Post.

What fact-check ?: The principal access Guanacaste Province closed COVID-19 Holy Week .
Explanation: MOPT carries operations on Guanacaste roads but denies total closure of tempisque bridge

What fact-check ?: India 's Minister State AYUSH Shripad Naik held press conference claiming Prince Charles followed rules Ayurveda , due recovering soon .
Explanation: Ella Lynch, a spokesperson for the Royal House of England, told The India Express via Gmail that false claims were being made in the media about Prince Charles recovering from a coronavirus infection.

What fact-check ?: A message claims Dr. Charles Lieber arrested today manufacturing coronavirus .
Explanation: Dr. Charles Lieber is head of the department of chemistry and biology at Havard University, USA. He was arrested in January for charging from a Chinese university at the same time it was collecting from the United States government. Not for selling and manufacturing the coronavirus.

What fact-check ?: A Whatsapp chain says consuming alkaline foods helps fight coronavirus .
Explanation: Although it is true that the acidity or alkalinity levels of the environment can affect the virus, it is not that we can change the pH of our body with what we eat and thus combat coronavirus infection.

What fact-check ?: Whales spotted Bombay High - offshore rig Oil Natural Gas Corporation India . Nature reclaiming space .
Explanation: The viral video was uploaded by BBC News Indonesia in August 2019 on their Twitter handle. According to the caption, a group of humpback whales can be seen crossing the Karimunjawa Sea, which is an Indonesian archipelago in the Java Sea.

What fact-check ?: A report Georgia Institute Technology links 5G immune system coronavirus .
Explanation: The document is not from the Georgia Institute of Technology. The document is a collection of articles and studies that do not demonstrate the danger of 5G and Wireless in humans.

What fact-check ?: The new digital derogatory attestation allowing go used French state police order collect personnal data track population .
Explanation: Those datas are encoded with a QR code and therefore won't be collected nor stocked on the server of French ministery of internal affairs for further use.

What fact-check ?: Disaster Management Act implemented across India . As per act , apart government departments , citizen allowed post share forward related novel coronavirus .
Explanation: India's Ministry of Home Affairs, issued a notification on March 24, 2020, the day when the lockdown was announced. The notification issued stated that the Disaster Management Act, 2005, is being invoked to deal with the novel coronavirus. However, nowhere it was mentioned that no other citizen can post or share any forward related to the epidemic.

What fact-check ?: Amid COVID 19 lockdown Himalayan Mountain Range visible Puttalam area Sri Lanka .
Explanation: Himayalan mountain range was visible from Indian city Jalandhar's area in Punjab after decades, due to the improvement in air quality following national wide lockdown in India. Image was related to this news report.

What fact-check ?: Dr Anil Jasinghe appointed Vice Chairman WHO Executive Board .
Explanation: News reports of the appointment were published back in February 2020, Dr Anil Jasinghe is in fact the current vice chairman of the WHO executive board and his appointment is not an recent one as claimed by the social users.

What fact-check ?: Ghana ’ leading biomedical research institute , Noguchi approves COA FS , Ghana-made food nutritional supplement , fight coronavirus .
Explanation: Noguchi Memorial Institute for Medical Research and Ghana Food and Drugs Authority deny approving COA FS, the Ghana-made food supplement for treating COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: A video clip U.S. Television station , WCVB virtual channel 5 , shared messaging platform WhatsApp proof USA allegedly arrested “ man manufactured sold coronavirus China . ”
Explanation: Invid video verification and Google reverse image search showed the video clip had nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic.

What fact-check ?: This map France shows home confinment end ( date regions ) .
Explanation: Even if the map comes with formal state logos, official French sources (including Prime Minister's office) refuted its authenticity.

What fact-check ?: A photo dozens coffins allegedly sale coronavirus victims .
Explanation: The images are from the Collserola mortuary parking lot (Barcelona) and the coffins are full of people who died from COVID-19.

What fact-check ?: The image shows facade building terraces crowded people spreads message `` India everyone home avoid crowds street '' .
Explanation: It is a hoax: the photo has nothing to do with the coronavirus or India, it was taken in 2011 in Kenya.

What fact-check ?: A video alleged Peruvian `` pharmaceutical chemist '' Juan Panay claims gargling salt kills coronavirus altering pH throat .
Explanation: Salt, sodium chloride, does not change the pH.

What fact-check ?: Use ultraviolet lights disinfect areas contaminated coronavirus .
Explanation: Effective UV light to kill viruses (UV-C light) is too harmful for us. Therefore, its use must be restricted to expert personnel with the necessary security measures.

What fact-check ?: People burning candles top head PM Modi 's nationwide appeal light candle 5th April 2020 9pm minutes .
Explanation: The image used to make the claim is an old image from Nigeria.

What fact-check ?: Image deers roaming Pudukkottai , Tamil Nadu .
Explanation: The image is from Trincomalee, Sri Lanka.

What fact-check ?: Image Indian police officer beating street children abiding lockdown .
Explanation: The image is an old image from Bangladesh.

What fact-check ?: Image Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan following PM Modi 's appeal light lamp 5th April 2020 .
Explanation: It is an old image from 2018 shared as a recent one.

What fact-check ?: Images public beating police officers enforcing lock indian state U.P
Explanation: The images are of an old incident from Kanpur, totally unrelated with the current lockdown.

What fact-check ?: Steam Therapy kill Coronavirus .
Explanation: Even though steam can provide relief to certain symptoms of COVID-19 but it is not proven that it can cure it. Excessive exposure to heat or steam may erode the epithelial cells in the mucosa region making the body more vulnerable to various other infections like bacterial infections.

What fact-check ?: Video whales spotted near Bombay High
Explanation: The video is a part of a BBC documentary shot in Indonesia.

What fact-check ?: A video fire shared claim fire erupted Solapur Airport Maharashtra state due firecrackers 5 April 9 pm .
Explanation: Upon our investigation, we found that the viral video shows a two-months-old incident. It has nothing to do with PM's call for a nationwide candlelight vigil on 5 April at 9 pm.

What fact-check ?: A video showing police officer briefing cases registered WhatsApp group admins shared context coronavirus lockdown .
Explanation: Our research revealed that the viral video is of a 2-year-old press conference. It is being shared with a misleading claim.

What fact-check ?: Spain track location mobile phones control people lockdown .
Explanation: The government approved a mobility study to study sanitation capabilities. This will be done with completely anonymized data provided by the telephone companies to the government.
